name: Strato Tac-Tics
description:
Game of mobility and power with a beautiful acrylic board and playing pieces. The pieces attach to each other with pegs in many directions, creating a three-dimensional playing area.

The game also includes rules for Strato Checkers, which is played on the same board with a different set of pieces (not included).

name: Pointe du Hoc
description:
The Squads & Leaders module POINTE DU HOC depicts the actions of the 2nd Ranger Battalion during their famous assault on the most difficult and well-defended position in the German coastal defenses during D-Day. Includes one 24" x 30" historical game map, five scenarios, a PL-compatible campaign game, special rules section, play aids, and 132 die-cut counters.

Ownership of the ASLRB, PTPR and BV are necessary to play this game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Battle: Practical Wargaming
description: Charles Grant enjoys a great reputation as one of the earliest exponents of the fast-growing hobby of wargaming and has indeed played a large part in contributing to that expansion and popularity. This book comprises a series of monthly articles that appeared in our Meccano Magazine now offered for the first time in book form. It contains a number of suggested rules for wargaming, with tables of score values, designs for score valuation devices plus a sound appreciation of the special values of the various arms of a modern army. Unlike some other publications it is confined almost entirely to wargaming for the periods of World Wars I and II. Useful chapters are also included on valuation of morale in warfare. Whilst suited to the novice, this is really a book to be appreciated by the gamer with a little experience now ready for serious play.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Mystic Path: Nebel um Burg Tiefenkaastel
description:
The first game of the publisher, presented at the games fair in Essen in 2009.

The game combines the elements of roleplaying games and survival horror. It can be played by 2-5 players, who play 1 of 7 different fantasy heroes. When on the "world map" (a village inclding castle) the story is told via MP3-CD while the players progress from location to location. A lot of locations feature turn-based tactical combat on cardboard floorplans.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Emergency!
description:
“Paging Doctor Ward to the Emergency Clinic – Doctor Ward - Code Blue – STAT!”

It has been a tough shift so far, and the pressure is getting to you; so many patients, not enough time.

Doctor Sanjit needs a hand with pathology, Doctor Gruber is concerned about the patient in the waiting room whose condition may deteriorate rapidly if left untreated.

The patient in front of you needs urgent surgery, but the operating theatre is occupied and there is breakdown in radiology that requires attention.

Curse those budget cuts, we're left with no choice but to park patients in corridors and risk infections.

Both Ambulance docks are full and oh no! another critically injured patient arriving at the helipad, and to make matters worse you haven't even had your morning coffee yet.

-

You and your companions are highly respected doctors working in the high-pressure, environment of the Emergency Clinic, dealing with life and death decisions every day.

Working as a team, you each have to co-operate, using your medical expertise to diagnose and treat patients and manage scarce resources, all the while avoiding worsening conditions, infection outbreaks and crises that threaten the lives of your patients.

-
Emergency! is a co-operative crisis management and resource management game that also includes competitive elements.
Each player assumes the role of a doctor whose job is to work as part of a team to successfully treat sick patients who arrive at the Emergency Clinic and send them home.

Together you must make best use of your own specialist skills, to make life and death decisions affecting; treatment, transport and management of patients using the limited resources available to you, in a high-pressure environment.

As a team you must also deal with numerous infection outbreaks, equipment failures, and deteriorating patient conditions, many of which may lead to drastic situations.

Your Doctor already has a range of specialist skills upon which you may develop, researching new techniques or calling-in other specialists to assist.

To aid you throughout the game, specialised Treatment Rooms also offer additional equipment and bonuses toward treating your Patients. Making best use of these rooms is vital to your success as a team.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Lysistrata
description:
(translates from Greek as the army disbander)

In 411b.c. Aristophanes wrote his theatrical comedy Lysistrata. It is one of the oldest anti-war plays. The show is about the sexual strike which is declared by the women in order to convince their men to stop the peloponnesian war.This game is based on the theatrical plot and on how each side is trying to assert itself against the other.

Contents 86 cards, 1 board, 6 pawns, 1 rulebook.

Players alternate turns while trying to surpass their opponents
in four forms of conflict: voting, influence, charisma and memory.
Each conflict is dealt with, like in theatrical plays. The leader of the chorus has the initiative, or everyone starts appearing in order on the scene, or the appearance is apparently random.
There are two ways to win: By surpassing certain forms of conflict or by being the first to win 7 conflicts of any kind.

name: The Fall of the Titans
description:
"Fall of the Titans" is a 2-player asymmetrical card game, based on the video game "Shadow of the Colossus." In "Fall," one player takes on the role of Ronin, a human assigned with the task of defeating the great Titan...which is played by the other player.

Each player has a different process and actions that they perform. Essentially, the Titan player sets up a defense, the Ronin player determines a course of action against those defenses, results are determined, and the player then moves. But careful consideration must be taken into account with regards to planning, bluffing, and resources available in hand.

The game uses a standard deck of cards, a pawn, and some coins or some other markers, in addition to the Titan board.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Der Unbekannte Krieger
description:
Der Unbekannte Krieger (The Unknown Warrior) is a blank hero for Game: Legends of Andor. You may fill in its dice, rank, and special abilities. It differs from the first blank hero, Legends of Andor: The Stranger, by having four willpower rows (like the Tarus from Legends of Andor: New Heroes).

A standee (but no board) for this hero is included with Legends of Andor: Journey to the North; the board is available as a free PDF download here: https://legenden-von-andor.de/blankoheld-der-unbekannte-krie....

name: Space Infantry: Federation
description:
Space Infantry Federation, is a new game designed by Nathan Hansen in the Space Infantry Universe with you as the leader of the Space Infantry military. The Federation has achieved the technology necessary for interstellar travel, giving us the capability to expand the empire beyond the solar system. However, it turns out that we are not alone in the universe! Five rival alien races – the Cuthonians, Flesh Eaters, Cybers, and Mutants – are not too thrilled at the Federation's advancement into what they believe is their territory. Top that off with the lurking threat of a band of fearsome Mercenaries, a race to achieve the best technology, and the ever-shifting tides of diplomacy and war, and Space Infantry Federation is a game that – both literally and figuratively – takes place on a galactic scale.

Many things can go wrong on this journey. If an alien race starship is in Sol by the end of one's turn, the Earth is conquered and the Federation has fallen and will be lost to their new overlords. If Federation Stability drops to zero, anarchy will reign supreme. If all of the aliens achieve technology beyond what the Federation could ever dream of.

But even with all of these ways to fail, you are determined, and if you can lead the Federation to take over the exoplanets in the various enemy territories, we will have an established foothold in galactic affairs for millennia to come. However, to do this we must build starships and space stations, maneuver those starships to other worlds, research new technologies, spy on the advancements of our enemies, and keep up the morale on the homefront. Meanwhile, you must work our ways through the political tides with the alien races which are always in constant flux; There are many ways to win or lose our Federation, good luck Commander.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Grak and Crumbleberry – Star Player Duo
description: A Forge World event or Warhammer World exclusive Star Player ogre/halfling combo team, with a unique special move: Kick Team Mate.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Illuminati: New World Order – Assassins
description: The first Booster Pack expansion series for Illuminati: New World Order features a new Illuminati, The Society of Assassins, plus new game Plots, Groups and play features.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Heromaniacs: A 2-Bit Dungeon Adventure Card Game (third edition)
description:
Heromaniacs: A 2-Bit Dungeon Adventure Card Game (3rd Edition) is a standalone light-hearted fantasy themed dungeon crawling card game for 2-4 players. The goal is very simple: be the first player to get from Level 1 of the dungeon all the way up to and out of Level 5. To do that, players must gain enough Experience (EXP) to advance through the various levels. To gain EXP, players must defeat monsters. To defeat monsters, players need to recruit Heroes.

The game is played in turns. During a player's turn, that player takes one of the following actions: 1) Recruit a Hero, 2) Attack a monster, or 3) Level Up. RECRUIT: To recruit a Hero, the player chooses any number of Heroes from the available pool whose total Strength is 10 or less and adds them to his or her hand, OR a player may choose a Hero card, flip it to the opposite side, and recruit the Hero on the flipped side. ATTACK: To Attack a Monster, the player chooses a monster in play to attack, and then deploys at least one (1) Hero to that monster. If the total Strength all of the Heroes deployed to that monster is greater than the level of the monster, the monster is defeat and the player collects that monster. If the total Strength of the Heroes deployed to the monster is equal to the monster's level, the monster is defeated, the player collects it, and the player can take an additional action during the turn. LEVEL UP: To Level Up, a player must cash-in a monster in his collected pile whose level (which also serves as EXP once the monster had been collected) is greater than or equal to the EXP requirement of the Dungeon Level that player is currently on. After a player has taken all actions for the turn, play passes to the player on the left.

Play continues in this way until one player on Level 5 of the Dungeon gains enough EXP to escape. The first player to exit the dungeon, wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Stack-22
description:
Stack-22 is a tile-stacking game that uses polyhexes of 5 hexagons, called pentahexes. There are 22 different pentahexes (hence the name of the game).

Stack-22 is a new addition to the Pile-Omino family (SEVEN, Pent-Up and Counterplays) by the same designer. All of them play the same, but Stack-22 can be considered a step up from Seven.

Warning: this is not a game for the casual player. It is recommended that you at least master SEVEN, Pent-Up or Counterplays before playing Stack-22, as if you don’t know the tactics it can feel a bit cold at the start during the first games. Its depth can be overwhelming (22 opening moves and more than 3000 second moves; the branching factor is crazy), but it rewards those who dare to explore.

Summary of gameplay: Players alternate turns placing one of their tiles according to some simple rules, trying to get the most of their pieces on the topmost layers when the game ends.

a) The tile must be aligned with the hex grid.

b) The selected tile must be placed on the highest level on which it can be placed legally.

c) The tile must be placed either on the table and adjacent to a piece already on the table, or atop at least 2 tiles, regardless of their colour.

d) The tile must lie flat, with every hex directly supported, either by the table or by a lower tile.

—description from the publisher

name: Gardens of Enceladus
description:
Our beloved Martians from Gardens of Mars and Gardens of Io have travelled to Saturn’s moon Enceladus to harvest the flowers they planted last year.

Help your little Martian gardener harvest the flowers making sure he collects enough of each type.

RULES SUMMARY (please refer to the official rulebook for details)

MATERIAL

- A board representing both a garden on icy Enceladus (10×10 squares), and 10 special actions.
- 95 flowers in 5 different colours (19 each).
- A carrying case.
- 6 black Martians in 3 types (2 each).
- 4 white Martians in 2 types (2 each).
- 5 peaks (white pyramids).
- 9 black counters.
- 1 ‘silver’ counter (the wildflower).

GAMEPLAY

Players take turns moving their martians orthogonally, landing on a space with a flower and taking it. Then taking an adjacent flower. Finally taking all isolated flowers from the board (soliflowers; those that don't have orthogonally adjancent flowers).

Optionally, at the beginning of the turn, the players can execute special actions by 'purchasing' them with 3 flowers of the same colour. Each action can only be executed once during the game:

- Randomly pick 3 flowers from the game case (don’t look), if there are at least 3, and add them to your reserve1.

- Jump orthogonally (not diagonally) over a peak to a space not occupied by a martian. If there is a flower on it, add it to your reserve. Don’t take an adjacent flower!

- Move diagonally to a space not occupied by a martian (you cannot jump over peaks). If there is a flower on it, add it to your reserve. Don’t take an adjacent flower!

- Pick any flower from the board and add it to your reserve.

- Swap the positions of your martian and any one peak or planted flower.

- Swap the positions of any one peak and any one planted flower.

- Swap the positions of any 2 planted flowers.

- Move any one planted flower to any empty space of the garden.

- Move any peak to any empty space of the garden.

- Pick the wildflower and add it to your reserve. Do not place a black counter on the circle; when this unique wildflower is gone, this special action is unavailable.

GAME END AND SCORING

If a player can't move her martian to a space occupied by a flower the game ends.

To get your score, count the number of flowers of the colour you have the least (consider the 6 colours, even if you don’t have flowers of some of them!). The wildflower acts as a wildcard; it can be used as any colour but you have to declare which one before scoring.

The player with the highest score wins. Ties are broken by the second colour you have the least and so on. If the tie persists play again.

-description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Environmental, Farming, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Girl Genius: The Works – The Siege of Mechanicsburg
description:
Girl Genius: The Works is a non-collectible card game that consists of several standalone decks of cards. You can play the game with any one of those decks, while also being able to combine some or all of those decks into a single deck for a longer game or a game with more players. Each deck contains many unique cards, but the gameplay is the same in all cases.

Each player gets a five-card hand and twelve cards are laid out face-down in a patchwork pattern. Each card has colored symbols along each side, as well as a point value and special instructions. On your turn, you reveal one face-down card, then spin any face-up card 180º. After spinning, if any of the symbols on the edges of the spun card match the symbols on one or more of the surrounding cards, you "pop" the card(s) with the most matching symbols. "Popping" a card means that you must follow the instructions on the card (whether helpful or harmful), then (usually) add it to your score pile. Cards in your hand are used to replace any popped cards. The game is played until one player has 70/50/40/30 points with two/three/four/more than four players.

The Siege of Mechanicsburg deck features characters and themes from the great battle for Mechanicsburg.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Drop Force Imperator: Astra Militarum Starter Set
description:
Few amongst the Tempestus Scions can match the exploits of the exemplary Zetic Tigers. Several regiments of these decorated killers have gone to war on the world of Vigilus, forming teams like Drop Force Imperator to respond rapidly to the many threats the Imperium faces there.

An expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, this box includes 5 plastic miniatures, a scenery set (with exclusive rules!), and brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- A 5-man set of Tempestus Scions: supplied on green plastic, these can be used to represent Drop Force Imperator of your own Astra Militarum Kill Team. These can be armed with hot-shot lasguns, with the option to replace the hot-shot lasguns with a choice of 5 additional special weapons: a plasma gun, meltagun, grenade launcher, flamer or hot-shot volley gun. 1 model can be built as a Tempestor whose right hand can be equipped with a powerfist, chainsword or power sword, and you can choose to upgrade the left handed laspistol to a bolt pistol or a plasma pistol. Alternatively (if this wasn’t already enough choice, with 17 heads available!) they can be built as a Command Squad;
- A scenery set comprising 2 Munitorum Armoured Containers, 6 promethium barrels, and 8 supply crates, supplied on brown plastic;
- 11 Tactics cards and 2 Mission cards: the Tactics cards are split between the 4 Astra Militarum Tactics taken from the Kill Team Core Manual and 6 Astra Militarum Tactics exclusive to this set, giving you new ways to play with your Astra Militarum kill team. Also included is a Tactics card for the included scenery, providing rules for incorporating this into your games. The 2 Mission cards are split between 1 Matched Play and 1 Narrative Play mission;
- An 8-page booklet describing Drop Force Imperator, their history and background, along with a showcase of painted miniatures and a timeline of their deployments;
- 5 datacards for Drop Force Imperator, ready for you to use right away;
- A sheet of card gaming tokens, including 10 Move/Charge tokens, 10 Fall Back/Advance tokens, 10 Shaken tokens, 10 Ready/Shoot tokens, and 6 Objective tokens.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Necromunda: House of Chains
description:
Strength is all for House Goliath. Without the physical strength to dominate rivals or to endure the hardships of Necromunda, a Goliath is nothing. They were created as a slave race to work the refineries and forges of Necromunda and toil in places where even hardy Necromundans could not survive. While the members of the clan are practically abhuman in their size and strength, only fools underestimate their resourcefulness and low cunning. It was the folly of their creators, who believed the Goliaths could be kept docile and ignorant though genetic meddling, that allowed elements of the clan to gain their independence.

Get the ultimate guide to the youngest of the six clan houses on Necromunda. This 160-page hardback book features the definitive history of the House and rules for fielding the six different types of fighters available to House Goliath – Forge Tyrants, Forge Bosses, Stimmers, Forge-born, Bruisers and Bullies. It is ideal for fans of House Goliath or anyone who wants to delve deeper into the dark side of the underhive.

Inside this book, you will find:

House Goliath History and Background: an expansive and extensive background on the House Goliath, includes a timeline of the development of House Goliath over three millennia.
House Goliath Gang List: includes all the rules you need to know in order to field a Goliath Gang in games of Necromunda.
Hangers-on and Brutes: includes rules for hiring Hangers-on and Brutes, including Goliath-specific ones, for your Gang.
Hired Guns: includes rules for using Bounty Hunters, House Agents, and Hive Scum.
Strong Alliances: includes rules for using and forming alliances with three other organisations within Necromunda that House Goliath has connections with, including the Slave Guild, the Narco Guild and House Greim – the Noble House that backs Goliath.
Additional Rules: this section includes new and additional rules usable by House Goliath gangs in games of Necromunda, providing Goliath players a variety of new options, including Skills, Abilities, Gang-specific terrain.
Slave Ogryn Gang History and Background, and Gang List: contains a brief background section on the Slave Ogryn Gang, along with all the rules required to field a Slave Ogryn Gang.
Weapon Reference Chart: contains a comprehensive weapons reference chart for all weapons and wargear available to House Goliath and their Allies.
House Goliath Gang Tactics: contains a D66 table of Goliath Gang Tactics for use in Scenarios.
Dramatis Personae: includes rules for hiring and using six brand new Dramatis Personae characters in your games of Necromunda.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Draw Bot
description:
In DrawBot, players take on the role of robot designers in the world-famous DrawBot Factory. They compete against each other to fulfill customer orders as quickly as possible - all in order to become the greatest designer in the Factory’s history!

DrawBot is a Roll & Write game in which all players take their actions simultaneously with the roll of the dice. Players aim to fulfill a customer’s order before anyone else by drawing on their factory sheet the available robot parts.

At the beginning of each turn, the Workshop Manager rolls the 4 dice that determine the pieces available for robot manufacturing. He or she chooses one that only they can use. This piece is in limited quantity; the Workshop Manager keeps it exclusively for themselves. The other players can take any die other than the Workshop Manager's die. The same die can be chosen by multiple players. This reflects that these robot parts are available in larger quantities!

As soon as the Workshop Manager has chosen a die, all players choose one action:

- DRAW: The player the piece represented on the dice he has chosen
- BOOST: The player uses 2 energies then draws any piece of their choice
- ACCUMULATE: The player does not draw anything and circles 1 energy

Players can only draw on the face in front of them. Before drawing, they can use 1 energy to TURN their Factory Sheet to access the workstation of their choice. The Factory Sheet can do ¼ or ½ turn.

The first one to finish an ordered robot scores 3 points. When a customer’s order is fulfilled, the robot is removed and replaced with a new robot design. If a completed robot does not correspond or no longer corresponds to a customer’s order, it is worth only 1 point. If two players finish the same robot at the same time, this robot design is worth only 1 point!

The game ends the moment a designer finishes their 4th robot. They circle 1 bonus point for finishing first. At the end of the game, players score originality points. Each designer compares their four robots, including the unfinished ones. If pairs of robots having no symbol in common, the player scores 1 point. The designer with the most points wins!

-description from publisher

name: Get Out of Colditz: The Card Game – Expansion Pack
description:
56 card expansion set for use with the Get out of Colditz card game.

Adds new escape attempt types, new searchlight cards and twin Escaper cards.

All cards have 'e' in bottom corner to identify expansion.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Descent on Malta
description:
Descent on Malta is a solitaire operational level simulation of the planned but never executed Axis airborne assault on the British island fortress of Malta. The player controls Axis forces (Germans and Italians). The game system controls the opposing Allied forces and reaction. The objective of the game is for the Axis to capture Malta at the lowest possible cost in casualties. The design is based on the Crete '41 game (World at War #47). The game includes optional rules that allow for two or more players to control different parts of the Axis invasion. Descent on Malta is an area movement game with 1 inch on the map representing 2.5 miles. The map shows Malta, the adjoining islands of Gozo, Comino and surrounding waters, with displays (boxes) representing Axis units in Sicily and southern Italy (6.0). Ground units represent Axis and British regiments, battalions and companies; Axis air units represent 3 to 6 squadrons. Each turn equals anywhere from 4 hours of intense combat action to two days of attritional warfare and refitting.

Optional rules allow up to 7 players.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters.

S&T #335 May-June 2022

name: El Castillo del Terror 2
description:
Expansion to Castillo del Terror.

Includes:

new monsters with abilities and powers.
It also includes a new cooperative game mode.
one new kid card to play up to 5 players
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Expedición Humedales
description:
Expedición Humedales is a deck of cards about the flora and fauna of the Argentine Wetlands. Through four different game modes you will be able to get acquainted with the inhabitants of the rivers and the islands by sharing a fun moment with family or friends.

Playing you will learn the names, characteristics and conservation status of birds, land animals, fish and trees.

Aguará guazú, swamp deer, river wolf, jaguar, are some of the species that you can find in this impressive expedition through the wetlands. Dare to discover these endangered species and many more that inhabit our common home.

Knowing our nature we can take better care of it.


GAME MODES

1. Hidden species (2 to 5 players, competitive): The objective is to get the most points, gathering cards from the center of the table, of the same species group each turn: plants, birds, fish or land animals (mammals and reptiles).

2. Target Watching (2 to 5 players, competitive): Complete objectives on the center of the table with your cards, guessing the species.

3. Group Watching (2 to 5 players, cooperative): You must give information to your partners about the cards on their hand, so that you can complete the most objectives on the center of the table.

4. Park Rangers Duel (2 players, competitive): The objective is to get most cards that your oponent. Guess correctly your opponent species and win cards, until both decks runs out.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Matching, Memory, Set Collection

name: Big Boss
description:
In each round of Big Boss, one player will be the first Big Boss. The Big Boss will pull a random job card and announce it as a vacancy to other players. The other players will check their blue cards (job cards) and decide which one they will go with as their current job. Then, the Big Boss will take the players cards and shuffle them together so they wouldn’t know who played which card. Then, the Big Boss will put these cards in front of the job vacancy and ask the players to put down their qualification cards. Some of the qualification cards have positive effect and some have negative effects, depending on the job and/or the vacancy. Players can either put negative effect to their rivals or put a positive effect on themselves. Cards can be stacked in case one job has multiple positive andand/or negative effects. Then, the Big Boss will call everyone for an interview session. This is the discussion phase. The Big Boss will ask the players for their current job and why they think they would be the suitable candidates for this job. A clever player would use the negative effect that was put on him and twist it to be a positive effect for them. The game depends on persuasion skill after all. A taxi driver can be a minister if you know how to convince the Big Boss. Afterward, the Big Boss will choose the winner which will get points depending on the vacancy.

(Slightly abbreviated description from the designer)

name: Familiars and Foes
description:
The Good Witches and Wizards of Joralee have been kidnapped by a horde of evil Foes! The only hope is for their Familiars to dutifully band together on a quest to overthrow the Foes and save their spell-casting partners. They’ll bumble their way through new spells, unleash ancient artifacts, and craft crazy combo attacks to succeed. They may just surprise their Witches and Wizards with a few tricks (and Familiars) of their own!

Familiars and Foes is a 1 to 5 player co-operative style game where you play as one of five Elemental Familiars with their own unique abilities - Earth, Wind, Fire, Air, or Aether. The game is played in four waves. Each wave increases in difficulty and reveals a new set of Foes that must be defeated to save a Witch or Wizard.

On each turn a player must choose one of three actions to perform - a physical attack, cast a spell, or use an artifact. The success or failure of the action is determined by a dice roll or coin flip. The rest of the players have the opportunity to contribute to the active player's turn and create combination moves. They can perform team attacks, use special abilities, or cash in rewards to boost the initial attack or benefit Familiar health. Group strategy is key to surviving and beating the game.

The Foes don't just sit idly and take beatings the whole game. They have their own turn each round where they release potentially devastating attacks on the Familiars. The Familiars have a few tricks to defend themselves or they can just hope for a weak attack to survive another round.

The game is won when all four waves of Foes have been defeated, all the Witches and Wizards have been rescued, and at least one Familiar is still standing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Kill Steal, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Streets: Board Game Arena Promo Tile
description:
Adds an Arcade to the Streets!
Replaces a wild tile mid-game.
After stage 2 of set up, remove one random "wild" tile from the stack, then shuffle this tile into the deck.

name: Cheshire (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
A fan made expansion, like Japan, available from the base Age of Steam page. A bit more bare-bones in its presentation, but also fairly expansive, and helps fill the high scale niche.

The only special rule involves building a tunnel between two cities, which requires not only a large cash expenditure (8$), but the engineer role as well.

The files are available here:
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/7196/cheshire-based-board...
and here:
https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/7197/mersey-tunnel-ruletx...
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Comic Turns
description:
Comic Turns is a comics storytelling game system – a deck of cards where each has a comic panel all carefully designed so that they can be arranged in any order to make countless new comic strips and infinite stories.

The deck comes with optional rules for three games included; ways to play competitively, collaboratively, and just to explore the storytelling possibilities, but user-created rules and ways to play are highly encouraged!

In the included rules, gameplay involves adding or replacing cards from a hand or pool to create narratives. The goal is always to create the best, most unique, interesting or fun stories. In a competitive version of the game, players have to fill in the middle of a story between a start and end card with cards from their hand. They take it in turns to reveal and tell their stories, and then vote for a winner. Voting is done by simultaneous pointing at the person whose comic strip you liked the best. In the collaborative versions, the emphasis is on building stories as a group, either by adding panels, or swapping panels out for new ones.

Comic Turns is also a tool for learning about comics, building stories, inspiring creative writing and sparking the imagination.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: Zooloretto: Big Boss
description:
Big Boss is part of the Zooloretto-News No. 4, and is also available from www.zooloretto.com

Big Boss is a mini-expansion for Zooloretto Boss. It allows the players to buy different offices, to build over the normal offices, giving the player new options.
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Morg 'N' Thorg – Star Player
description:
From Forgeworld's webstore:
"A hulking brute of an Ogre Blocker, Morg ’N’ Thorg is something of a lumbering juggernaut. Nearly eight feet tall, bludgeoning his way through the opposition, he’s always a spectacle to watch out for on the pitch. Off the field, his frightening appearance disguises a truly gentle nature, making him a bizarre hit with children – on the pitch, however, he tramples anything that gets in his way, often simply handing the ball to one of his teammates and flinging them into the End Zone to score.

Morg ’N’ Thorg, a truly legendary Blood Bowl player, can be added to any Blood Bowl team (except Undead; he’s really not a fan) with this multi-part resin kit. Particularly large and covered in spikes, with a knowing smirk on his gigantic face, he would be an asset to any Blood Bowl collection. His rules are found on a Star Player card in the Blood Bowl boxed set, and in Death Zone Season 1.

This kit comes in 7 components and includes 2 32mm round bases, one featuring a hole to slot a ball into, indicating possession of the ball in your games of Blood Bowl."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Normandie: DUSTMod
description: Heroes of Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo from Dust Tactics universe
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Police Precinct: Crooked Lawyers
description: Crooked Lawyers is a Booster-Pack style Expansion for Police Precinct consisting of Larger Cards (All-new Event Cards -- 14 total) along with Smaller Cards (For two of the Investigation Decks -- 12 total). 26 Cards in all.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Stak Bots: Red Expansion
description: Like each set before it, the Red box brings 60 game cards with 16 brand new Bots, each with a different function: some manoeuvre cards when they enter play, some destroy extra cards when they do damage, some have passive enhancements, etc etc. Used in combination, these different effects and abilities allow you to create weaknesses in your opponent's card arrangement and then take advantage of it to destroy them! This new Red set has a strong focus on the number of face-up cards in a Stak and the arrangement of them, and it mixes in perfectly with both of the existing card sets.

name: Warmaster Armies
description:
Expansion for Warmaster

Warmaster Armies by Rick Priestley was published in 2006 as an expansion and clarification for Warmaster, Games Workshop's 10-15mm fantasy miniatures game. This expansion gives 14 new, complete, and official army lists. These lists include updates on the races and nations included in the original Warmaster book, as well as making some lists that had appeared in various GW magazines "official." In making the step to being "official" it also shows they have been play-tested and are, for the most part, balanced. A brand new list, Araby, with magic carpets and genies, is also included.

This list is superior in its presentation of the individual army rules. Both army composition rules and rules for play, are boiled down to a single page for each race and nation. Each race's spells are also presented.

Armies included are:
Empire (human)
Tomb Kings (undead)
Chaos
Orc
High Elf
Dwarf
Skaven
Lizardman
Bretonnia (human)
Kislev (human)
Dark Elf
Vampire Count (undead)
Daemon
Araby

This book was made available for free as a downloadable pdf. It looks like GW originally planned to print it, based on the b/w interiors rather than color, but went the online route instead.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: All American: The 82nd Airborne at Kellam's Bridge – June 6-9, 1944
description:
Kellam's Bridge is the first of three All American modules developed by Critical Hit. It features the US 82nd Airborne division fighting the German defenders around Kellam's Bridge between June 6th and 9th, 1944.

Critical Hit also published the All American Gamer's Guide which includes additional scenarios and a campaign game for tying together all 3 All American modules. Unlike other Critical Hit offerings, the historical backgrounder and scenarios are printed on glossy paper rather than the scenarios being printed on cardstock.

Contents:
8 pages of historical background
22"x34" map
10 scenarios

This game was remade in 2003. The 2nd edition includes 12 scenarios printed on cardstock.

Kellam's Bridge / Airborne Stand! is not a complete game. Portions of the ASL game system, Beyond Valor and Yanks, are required to play this module.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
Yanks: ASL Module 3


(all are required for expansion play)

name: Eternal Empire: The Ottomans at War – Field of Glory Gaming Companion
description:
The sixth army supplement for the Field of Glory miniatures wargame. This supplement covers the Ottoman Empire, its allies enemies from 1299 to 1500AD. There are eighteen separate lists, each with a sample starter army and point cost chart for making your own force.

The book itself is 72 pages printed in full color with photos of miniatures and paintings from various other Osprey books used throughout.

Armies included:
- Early Ottoman Turkish
- Later Ottoman Turkish
- Anatolian Turkoman Allies
- Tatar
- Late Byzantine
- Later Russian
- Later Serbian
- Later Bulgarian
- Later Lithuanian
- Later Polish
- Later Teutonic Knights
- Catalan Company
- Middle Hungarian
- Moldavian or Wallachian
- Albanian
- Timurid, Black Sheep Turcoman, or White Sheep Turcoman
- Hussite
- Later Hungarian
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Eclipse:  Anticipation of the Elders
description:
Holiday Special 2016

During the darkest times, mysterious objects occasionally appear throughout the galaxy. Fragments of old chronicles suggest that these forebode the return of the Elders. However, the stashes quickly flicker away from the base reality again. Only the quickest civilizations can benefit from their rewards...

Eclipse: Anticipation of the Elders is a print and play expansion.

Player materials:
24 Elder Stash Tiles

Preparations:
Shuffle the Stash Tiles face down (showing the round numbers). Take one random tile of each number and place them face down on the respective spaces (2-9) on the Round Track. Discard the rest without looking at them.

Rules:
First player to pass in the Action Phase immediately draws the tile on the next round space on the Round Track. He resolves the immediate effect and discards the tile. The round then continues normally.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Core Connection: Titans Unleashed
description:
Core Connection is a deck-building card game for 2-4 players in which you take on the role of a pilot of a Resonant, a giant mecha, fighting to free society from the tyrannical reign of its oppressors! Pilot your Resonant with unique tactics and upgrade it with enhancements to defeat the army of Atlantis!

Titans Unleashed is the first expansion for Core Connection and Rise of Atlantis, the base game, is needed to play!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Animal Empire
description:
Capture kingdoms, build your armies, and conquer the world in this intense medieval anthropomorphic card game from Half-Monster Games.

As one of the Animal Monarchs, you gain and army to deploy to a vast undiscovered world of kingdoms ready to be brought into your Empire. The other players are attempting to build their empires too, and friends can become enemies and vice versa in the blink of an eye. Each Army has one of four special abilities relating to their species, as well, so the strategic depth of the game gets richer every time you play.

Explore a rich world with lore, secrets, alliances, battle, betrayal, and conquer your friends to make them fight for your side as Vassals.

Be wary though: conquered Vassals still control their own Kingdoms and Armies, and can rebel against you at any time. You can punish and reward your subjugated underlings by taking or giving kingdoms, but this takes up valuable actions... how will you rule?

Put your strategic, diplomatic, and command skills to the ultimate test in Animal Empire: Conquer or be Conquered!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Hidden Games Junior: Das verschollene Schwert
description:
A brazen theft has the citizens of Rome in an uproar. The sword of the gladiator statue "Maximus", which stands for bravery and discipline, has been stolen. Alfredo, the guide and guard of the Colosseum, is suspected of having stolen the sword. He asks you for help and already has an idea how to track down the real culprit. Go to Rome, report to Alfredo and find the landmark of past times - the sword of Maximus.

Players embark on an exciting hunt for the culprit as a team, examining real evidence, analyzing interrogations and checking alibis. Players use tools like their cell phones and blur the line between game and reality.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Flying Tigers
description:
A Pacific module for Rise of the Luftwaffe. Found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr10. Issue #10 comes with Ace counters that can be cut out and used. Issue #11 comes with mounted pilot counters.

Contents:
Background and campaign rules.
Aces: Unmounted, photocopy and cut out.
Planes: 2 sheets
Campaign sheet and mission targets.
Village - Morale Target
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Russo-Georgian War of 2008
description:
The Russo-Georgian War of 2008 is a DTP simulation game covering the military action during that conflict from August 8 2008 through August 12, 2008. This involved full-on combat between the Republic of Georgia and the Russian Federation plus two breakaway regions of Georgia; Abkhazia and South Ossetia. The fighting began in the Ossetia (the primary Georgian target) and quickly spread to all of Georgia and Abkhazia.

At first glance this seems like a fight between David and Goliath - the vast Russian military against a state with only about 20,000 active duty personnel in it's military and only 7 combat jets - but closer examination reveals it was a somewhat stiffer competition with several points of interest. It was with this thought that this game was inspired.

The game is relatively straight forward to learn and play and the system, while adapted to the conflict, very familiar to most wargamers. Learning and playing the game can be done fairly quickly. The game is play-balanced due to a selection of real-world scenarios, including the historical situation.

This is a Desk Top Published (DTP)game - gluing and cutting of counters is required.

SCALE - Game Turns represent 12 hours, units typically represent battallions of 500 - 1000 men plus some smaller and larger, units and hexes on the map are approximately 12 kilometers across.

name: Dragon's Path
description:
Dragon's Path is a card game in which 2 player race to find the Ancient Dragon. Your deck of cards represents different elemental paths that you can choose from. Each elemental path gives you the power to stop your opponent or it can help to follow the right path to the Ancient Dragon.

The legend has it that the Ancient Dragon reveals himself only to those who complete the Dragon's Path, rewarding them with power and wisdom. Many wizards attempted, only a few of them succeeded.

The goal of the game is to collect five different path cards or four cards of the same element in your play area. Each of the five different path cards has two powerful effects. On their turn players:

• Draw a card.
• Play a card declaring which effect to use.
• Wait for the opponent to play a card in response (some effects allow you to play cards during opponent’s turn).
• Eventually apply the effect and collect the card.

In the Advanced Mode you can use unique powerful spell to twist the game! Before starting the game, players take two spell cards. Each spell card can be played by discarding two specific path cards. In addition, players do a best of three game.

Dragon's Path is the first game of the "Deck Box Game Line": the game box is manufactured by UltraPro and contains 60 cards, the player aids, the rulesheets and three wooden dragon tokens.
Extend the gameplay to four player with another Dragon's Path copy!

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Mixtape Massacre (Director's Cut)
description:
More Game. More Gore.
6 years ago, players took a chance visit to the small town of Tall Oaks… and Mixtape Massacre was born.

Mixtape Massacre is a tabletop board game where 2 to 6 players terrorize the town and compete in an over-the-top fictional killing spree to be remembered. Dripping with nostalgic 1980’s pop-culture and classic horror tropes – Mixtape Massacre will have you laughing while you’re slashing! Dispatch victims, collect kills and brawl with fellow slashers to prove once and for all who is the baddest of the brood!

Even better, this brand new Director’s Cut edition boasts updated rules and components, improved mechanics, and even more killer additions to create the ultimate version of the game.

Welcome to the next chapter of Tall Oaks — Mixtape Massacre: Director’s Cut.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Finger Baseball
description: The game of baseball now in finger form. One player pitches and the other bats. The pitch starts by flicking the marker towards home plate. Based upon where it lands the result could be a ball, strike, pending hit, or a player choices. If it's a pending hit, then the batter must flick the marker and land on the corresponding "hit" location, otherwise it's an out.

name: Star Munchkin Cosmic Demo
description: Star Munchkin Cosmic Demo is a 17-card booster pack for Star Munchkin (or any standalone Munchkin game), but you can also use the cards as a rigged demo to demonstrate Star Munchkin to others.

name: DC Deck-Building Game: The Batman Who Laughs Promo Card
description:
Originally created for the DC Deck-Building Game 10th Anniversary Kickstarter, this FOIL card for the DC Deck-Building Game series features The Batman Who Laughs.

-description from publisher

The Batman Who Laughs
Super-Villain
You may gain Weakness cards from the destroyed pile.
At the start of your turn, you may gain a Weakness. If you do, play the top card of the main deck. Then, destroy it.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Sophonisba and the Battle of the Great Plains: Africa – Territory of Carthage: SPQR Battle Module
description:
Sophonisba and the Battle of Great Plains is an expansion module for SQPR in GMT Games' Great Battles of History Series. It is a tactical simulation of a combat from the late Second Punic War on African soil in which Scipio's Roman army met a combined Carthaginian and Numdian force in an area 75 miles southwest of Utica called The Great Plains. The Carthaginians were lead by Hannibal's less famous brother, Hasdrubal, and the Numidians by King Syphax.

Sophonisba is Hasdrubal's own daughter offered in marriage to Syphax to ensure Numdia's continued loyalty after the defection of their cavalry general, Masinissa.

To play Sophonisba and the Battle of Great Plains, you will need SQPR "II", the second edition rules (from 1994).
The needed counters can be found in SQPR and in the module counter sheet included in C3i #4. (Some counters from the War Elephant and Africanus modules are reproduced in the C3i that players without those scenarios can play Sophonisba.) The Cannae map from SPQR is also required as it resembles the Great Plains battlefield.

name: The Institute for Magical Arts: Ethereal Powers Expansion
description: This 12 card pack provides 12 unique Institute cards for use with the base game. The new cards provide a variety of powers, some of which affect the Portal and/or the Ethereal Realm -- in contrast to the base game. In addition, there is a recommended rule change regarding the game ending condition; players may now win the game by having 3 more character cards than his/her opponent.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lucky Flip
description:
Lucky Flip is the fun-for-all roulette style party game that pits family and friends against each other in a lively challenge of strategy, memory, & luck. There are 53 total cards in the deck- forty cards numbered 1-40, 10 Lucky Pot Cards, and 3 Lucky Flip cards. The objective of this game is to win more points than your opponents by correctly guessing what each card will reveal once flipped over. To increase the chances of winning even more points, players must rely on their memory to avoid guessing cards that were already flipped and removed from the deck. Playing Lucky Flip is as easy as 1, 2, 3!

~Each player receives 7 tokens to start the game and attempts to guess what the top card will reveal once flipped over by placing all their tokens on the game board.

~Top Card is flipped over to see who won points:
1 point- Guess the correct color
2 points- Guess the correct group of numbers
3 points- For every token on a winning number
10 or 30 points- Guess the Lucky Pot card
100 points- Guess the Lucky Flip card
~Players on winning number roll the dice to double their total points won for that round

This fast-paced party game is easy to learn and play, making it perfect for players at all skill levels and those ages 12 and up. The rules are short and simple; making it easy to convince friends and family to gather around. With 2 – 6 players, Lucky Flip promise to be an exciting game where everyone leaves as happy as the winner.

The objective of the game is to earn points by correctly guessing what the top card on the deck will reveal by placing your tokens on the Lucky Flip game board.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Memory

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Killzone: Sector Mechanicus Environment Expansion
description:
Sprawling over countless Imperial worlds, the landscapes known as Sectors Mechanicus are tangled mazes of pipes, conduits and heaving machinery. Without these rumbling furnaces and smog-belching chimneys the ceaseless war industries of Humanity would stall, and the armies of the Imperium of Man – shorn of materiel reinforcement – would fall to the xenos and the heretic.

The Sector Mechanicus Killzone Environment is an expansion for Kill Team – in the packed box, you’ll find a gameboard, scenery, and exclusive rules that use the unique nature of Sector Mechanicus terrain to introduce dangerous new missions and powerful effects to your games. Included:

- A double-sided Kill Team gameboard measuring 22” x 30”, printed on heavy, durable card stock. 1 side depicts a Zone Mechanicus, a bleak and blasted area designed to arrange your Sector Mechanicus scenery on; and the other an Imperial Sector, an area of war-torn city;
- 12 Sector Mechanicus Tactics cards – these can be used by any Kill Team faction, with 8 cards providing interactions with the Sector Mechanicus scenery and 4 being used specifically by Comms and Demolition Specialists;
- A Sector Mechanicus Environment card, which provides 6 different rules allowing interaction – positive and negative – with the scenery;
- 4 Sector Mechanicus Mission cards – designed to be used in conjunction with the gameboard and scenery, this is a set of 2 Matched Play missions and 2 Narrative Play missions, which are split between attacker and defender;
- 8 frames of Sector Mechanicus scenery – providing endless variety, these frames of industrial scenery include a huge array of walkways, platforms, supports, ladders and plasma pipes. Included are enough components to build an Alchomite Stack (a series of chimneys evoking the thick, acrid atmosphere of industry), a Ferrotonic Furnace (an enormous silo filled with toxic chemicals – or worse) and 2 sets of Plasma Conduits. This scenery is designed to be entirely modular, and can be assembled, taken apart and re-assembled any way you like. It is compatible with all Sector Mechanicus scenery – add as much as you like to create massive, multi-level structures for your Kill Teams to battle over;
- An 8-page booklet describing the Sectors Mechanicus, with an example of a fully-painted scenery set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Phantom League: Mostly Harmless Promo Deck
description:
Set of 9 promo cards for The Phantom League: Mostly Harmless.

The set includes:
2 Improvement cards (I55 ZPG Special Edition, I57 Shielded Hold Mk1),
1 Docking card (D34 Special Occasion),
1 Pirate card (P14 "The Lure"),
1 Hyperspace card (H24 Dark Matter),
1 Captain card (C13 Inquisitor Alysha),
1 Mission card (M36 Holy Relic),
and
2 Battle cards (B87 Hail Mary, B88 Gatling/Jam)
publishers: Dragon Dawn Productions, Tuonela Productions Ltd.

name: WWII Tank Leader Commander Cards
description:
From the publisher website:
For Sherman or Tiger Leader
Historical Enemy Commanders to give the enemy unique combat abilities! Commanders for the U.S., U.K., Russia, Germany, France, and Poland.

name: Dragon Castle: Single Player Mode
description:
2-sided instructions to play Dragon Castle solitaire.
Handed out at Essen Spiel 2018.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Fossilis: Kickstarter Edition Expansions
description:
All mini expansion included in Fossilis: Kickstarter Edition were sold by the publisher as one bundle.

Included Mini-/Micro-Expansions:

1 Bone Wars Solo Mode
Determined fossil hunters Othniel Marsh and Edward Cope shared a heated rivalry known as the “Bone Wars” in the late 19th century, to see who would dominate the world of dinosaur discovery. This is your chance to test yourself against one of these fierce competitors!

1 Power Tools Micro-Expansion

1 Caution Tape Micro-Expansion

1 Ice Age Mini-Expansion (includes 20 beautiful aqua "Ice Crystals"

1 Scorpion Mini-Expansion (includes 1 scorpion miniature)

2 Undiscovered Species Cards
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Shanghai Mah Jong
description:
Multiplayer version of the famous game « solitaire », or simplified version of the mythic game « Mah Jong », this friendly tactic game but with simple rules will make you travel in a very oriental atmosphere !

Score a maximum of points by gathering same tiles (by pairs, by three or four). But remember to protect your combinations. Your opponents won’t hesitate to steal it at the first opportunity !
Included:
1 thermoformed plateform
120 tiles
16 mission cards

name: Beer Empire: Beer Madness
description:
Description from the publisher:

Beer Madness is a small add-on that adds some possibility of interaction between players.

It contains:
1 new beer reviewer,
2 newa Market tiles,
1 new Beer type tile.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: True Crime Legends
description:
True Crime Legends is a gangster themed card game for 3-5 players. It takes around an hour to play. Players will lead a syndicate competing to control the lucrative and dangerous markets of the underworld. Invest in assets, smuggle, bribe, murder, steal and hire legendary gangsters from a deck of the most iconic criminals of the past century, each with unique stats and abilities. Ruthlessly rise above your rivals to be crowned the boss of bosses.

(website)

Players start with one boss card, but there is a public marketplace that allows players to fill out a tableau (their syndicate) by draft-purchasing up to 3 extra *historical* gangsters, 4 assets (usually venues associated with crime) and 4 upgrades (eg drug boats, evidence, guns, armor).

The tableau allows each gangster to be lined up with an Asset and an Upgrade which increase the gangster's abilities.
The players will take it in turn to activate each gangster, with various abilities including earning money, stealing money, attacking other gangsters, stealing other gangsters, destroying Assets/Upgrades and attempting a narcotics shipment. The success of these actions depends on a dice roll, but increasing the gangsters' abilities increases their chance of success. If they do not succeed, a gangster they have targeted will usually have an ability that allows retaliation.

Some of the Assets (locations) give income at the end of each round, if they still have a gangster assigned to them.
At the end of four rounds, the player with the most money is the winner.

(NB this is based on the 2018 version of the game)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Epic Card Game: Guardians of Gowana – Kickstarter Promo Pack
description: KS exclusive promo pack for Epic. Contains stretch goal promo cards from Epic Jungle (later renamed to Guardians of Gowana).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Prehistoric, Zombies
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Enclosure
description:
In Enclosure, players act as a researchers studying the adaptability of the creatures that were newly created with 'Biohack'. To ensure the highest quality of research data, each player has to fulfill a randomized set of research objectives. These objectives will dictate which set of creatures the players will need to have or to position in the various habitats they are testing. After a player completes 12 research objectives, the game will end and the player that has the most EP will win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Command Cards, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Square Grid

name: Spain (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
Spain is a fan made expansion available as a free download, and should not to be confused with the later Steam Brothers map.

The map of Spain has some minor rules twists, mainly having to do with the Baleares islands off the coast of Barcelona. These islands have sea routes going to them, start with additional goods, and can have fresh goods put onto them directly by taking the production role. Other than that, the rules are standard AoS.

See Web Links for map and rules in French. For an English translation, see Files.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Knight Line
description:
Knight Line is a minimalist connection game for two players.

Each player has 20 square tiles in their colour; at the start of the game, these tiles are placed in two adjacent stacks, one of each colour.

A move consists of moving part of a stack (at least one tile must be left behind) to an empty space by making a knight's move. All pieces must be connected at least diagonally throughout the game.

The first player to make a line of 4, orthogonally or diagonally, wins.

To offset the first player advantage, they must move only a single piece on their first move.

name: Wing Leader: Supremacy C3i #30 Scenarios
description:
Two scenarios and 20 counters for Wing Leader: Supremacy 1943-1945, included in C3i Magazine, Issue #30.

Scenario 1 - Here Comes the Beast, Rabaul, 11 November 1943.

Scenario 2 - Operation Meridian, Sumatra, 24 January 1945.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Star Wars: Corellian Smuggler
description:
A solitaire Star Wars boardgame focused on the exploits of a galactic smuggler flying a Corellian ship, in the style of Han Solo and the Millenium Falcon. There are six scenarios of increasing difficulty, with varying victory conditions.

Published in Shadis magazine issue 27.
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Hegemonic Promo Card: Dimensional Anomaly
description:
A Kickstarter and convention promo card for the base game.

Once advanced, this card provides a one-use technology effect that allows you to search through the technology draw pile for one card of your choice instead of taking a normal draw action, When used in a conflict, it provides no power but instead allows you to immediately return your inactive cards to your hand.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dead Reckoning
description:
Description from the publisher:

Things were normally quiet and peaceful in the old mining town of Denney Springs, Colorado. That is, until the Environmental Protection Agency suddenly showed up in nearby Denver. A horrible mine accident occurred near the city when careless E.P.A. workers mistakenly released thousands of gallons of Widgetanium (a strange experimental chemical that was being tested by the U.S. government) into the city’s water system. By the next day, the contamination was widespread and infected residents were slowly turned into some kind of zombie-like monsters. There were even rumors of the recently-deceased being re-animated from the city’s morgue! These “living corpses” soon took over the city and infected thousands of others as well. Slowly expanding out from the Denver city limits, the “Day of Reckoning” was finally upon the citizens of Denney Springs. At first, they were horrified and completely overwhelmed, losing hundreds of their fellow citizens. But the tough community eventually organized, gathered its resolve and fought back courageously. The majority of townsfolk were herded out in refugee columns and headed for the protection of the mountains. A series of distress calls were sent out, begging for help from the Colorado National Guard. A plan was arranged for full evacuation from a quickly-constructed Guard base in nearby Wagon Gap, on the other side of the mountain range. This was a welcome and hopeful plan, but getting everyone there safely was another matter entirely …..

Dead Reckoning is a light, fast-playing zombie-themed wargame that features a new, streamlined system which allows both players to be constantly involved in the game play, provides challenging decision making and yet easily resolves all combats with the simple drawing of cards. There are no complicated combat results tables, no dice rolling, no factor counting, no lists of modifiers and almost no math calculations. This game is designed to be enjoyed by both grognards and zombie fans alike.

name: Alhambra: Designers' Expansion – Alhambra Zoo / Buildings of Power / Travelling Craftsmen
description:
Alhambra Zoo / Buildings of Power / Travelling Craftsmen were offered together under the "Get to Know" pledge for Alhambra: Designers' Expansions Box.

Alhambra Zoo:

The animals are loose in the Alhambra! Your goal is to bring them to the chambers. But each kind of animal only brings victory points if they are in a chamber with just their kind.

Each time a chamber is revealed to the building market two animal tiles are drawn and placed on that chamber. There are 6 different animal kinds in the game, each awarding points at the end, but only if it is kept in a chamber which only has his kind on it. In order to move the animals to the desired chambers a player has the option to play a money card at the end of their turn, moving an animal one space (from building to building) for each value on the card plaid.

The player who organizes their animals most cleverly will earn additional victory points at the end of the game.

Contents: 18 animal chips

Buildings of Power:
The Towers in the game are replaced with new ones, each having a special ability:

Blueprint - The player rolls a die and draws that many building tiles, choosing one to keep. The others are returned to the draw tower in the order the player chooses. The building tile the player kept can be placed on the building market at the start of any player's turns, replacing any already on the tableau. The exchanged tile is placed back in the draw tower.

Loan - The player rolls a die and draws that many money cards from the draw pile, choosing one of them to keep. The others are returned to the top of the draw pile in the order the player chooses.

Discount - The player rolls a die and places it on the tower. Every time the player purchases his first building in the round, he can choose to decrease the value on the die by one to decrease the purchase prize by one.

Pinnacle - The player rolls a die and places it on the tower. When scoring walls that number is added to the shortest external wall. This can propel the smaller wall to be the biggest and therefore score more points for the player.

Contents: 11 alternate tower tiles, 4 white dice, 32 black dice, and 1 purple die

Travelling Craftsmen:
The Craftsman came from the far away—Carcasonne to Andalusia—to help build the Alhambra.

At the start of the game each player will receive one traveling craftsman which can be used for their ability on a future turn. Once used, the craftsman travels to the next player in clockwise position who then can use him. The craftsman have various abilities that can give a player bonuses on their turns. Following are some of the abilities:

Switch - Before buying a building tile the player may swap two buildings on the building market.

Change - The player may exchange an money card in his hand with one from the display.

Direction - A player may build a building in their Alhambra, rotating it in any direction desired.

Contents: 6 craftsmen cards
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: CAPcolor: Les Pyramides d'Émeraude
description: CAPcolor: Les Pyramides d'Émeraude is a combination of book and game.

name: Mysterium: Blue Jay
description:
This promo is given out by the publisher at conventions.

Add this new vision card to the Vision card deck of the ghost.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition

name: Hoa-Binh 1951-1952: The Battle of the Black River
description:
On 22 September 1951, the Viet Minh 312th Division crossed the Red River and attacked a Franco-Vietnamese garrison along the crest line of Nghia Lo, 140 km from Hanoï, on the Thai highlands between the Red River and the Black River. This action made it clear that Giap’s objective was to control the Tonkin delta in order to threaten Hanoï from the south. De Lattre decided to block him by launching a vast operation against his supply lines by occupying the Muong country in the Hoa Binh and Cho Ben sectors between the Da River and the Black River. After seizing Cho Ben (Operation Tulip), the French launched Operation Lotus to seize Hoa Binh.

Hoa Binh, the Battle of the Black River is a solo-player game simulating the combats around the Black River and Colonial Route #6 that occurred from 13 November 1951 to 25 February 1952. The counters mainly represent the French battalions or Viet Minh actions and one game turn represents ten days of operation. The map represents the region of the confluence of the Red River and the Black River in Tonkin, specifically from Viet Tri in the north to Hoa Binh in the south and the immediate surroundings of the Muong territories.

VaeVictis #163
Duration: Approximately 3 hours
Complexity: 5/10

Solitaire game.

[English rules are available for download from the VaeVictismag.fr webpage.]

name: Звёздные империи: Командиры (Star Realms: Commanders)
description:
Дополнение "Звёздные империи: Командиры" предоставляет игрокам ещё больше возможностей и средств в борьбе за господство в космическом пространстве. В коробке вы найдёте 6 колод командиров, каждая из которых включает в себя стартовую руку из двенадцати карт, 2 гамбита, флагманский корабль, а также 2 карты подсчёта очков влияния и памятку. Кроме того, с этим дополнением можно сыграть как в классический дуэльный вариант "Звёздных империй", так и попытать счастья в одиночку дать отпор сразу против двоих соперников. Объедините под своим началом всё лучшее от двух фракций и воспользуйтесь преимуществом!

The expansion Star Realms: Commanders gives players even more options and tools in the battle for space domination. The box contains six Command decks, each with a starting hand of twelve cards, two gambits, a flagship, as well as two influence score cards and a memo. In addition with this add-on you can play both the classic duel version of Star Realms as well as try your luck against two opponents at once. Combine the best of both factions under your command and take advantage!

Additional command decks were introduced named The Alignment, The Alliance, The Coalition, The Pact, The Union, and The Unity.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management

name: Shattered Olympus
description: Shattered Olympus is a tactical mythological card game for 2-4 players. Two factions fight with unique heroes on a battlefield und can play cards from a central card pool. With crystal as resource, they can built up their fighting forces with units, equipment, spells and locations. To win the game, one faction has to defeat the opponent heroes. The card deck is customizable to provide a huge amount of variety. This game was designed to minimize the impact of luck and therefore doesn’t include dies or coin flipping mechanics.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Adamai Promo
description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. Offered through the Krosmaster: Quest Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Microworld: Promo Spiel'16
description:
This punchboard adds two new rules to the base game.

A1: Special pawns. At the beginning of the game each player takes his special pawn. Special pawns count as two pawns for the purpose of the end game scoring.

G1: At game end, each player looses 0/1/3/6/10 points for 1/2/3/4/5 gene tokens he has taken during the game, regardles if they have been used or not.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: The Battle of Hue!
description:
A solitaire game designed by Jay Ward and based on his popular Tiny Battle Publishing title, The Battle for Ramadi. The Battle for Hue! Allows gamers to control the forces of the United States and their allies as they battle to wrest control of Hue from the North Vietnamese Army and their Viet Cong friends.

—description from the publisher

name: Roll 'n' GOL
description:
Anything goes for your team to WIN!
What happens on the court is solved at the table.
Predict and change the results in your favor!
You don't need to know football to play.

A fun and dynamic game ideal for soccer lovers!

In Roll 'n' GOL you are going to simulate a soccer world cup, but living it from the table!

Each player will have a sheet where he will write down who, according to him, will win the World Cup, how the games will go, the number of goals and fouls, among other things.

The results of the matches will be given with dice rolls and each player will be able, at the cost of points, to use his special abilities to change the result of the matches.

Try to get your teams to the final! But don't forget to make life miserable for your rivals' teams!

At the end of the championship, the player who obtains the most points in his checkbook wins the game, correctly predicting the results of the matches. Points can be earned by using stars, inventing goals or penalties, or even having the game replayed.


Components:

block of sheets
2 Dice
1 schematic card
15 team cards
rulebook



Super Estadio second edition includes a large box so you can store all the game's expansions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tawantinsuyu: Children of the Inca
description:
Children of the Inca is a mini-expansion for Tawantinsuyu: The Inca Empire produced during the Turczi Junior Promo Pack campaign on Gamefound in October 2022.

the promo contains 5 meeples matching the colours of the workers of the game, placed near the village during setup.

If at the end of your turn, you have two identical coloured worker meeples, take the matching coloured child meeple if available. The child meeple does not count against your limit of meeples, however if you still have them at the end of the game they can count towards the relevant prophecies on Palaces when using Golden Age.

As a secondary action, you may place a child meeple onto the board, on top of another worker of the same colour without paying gold/god card and ignoring climbing/roaming costs. Resolve tasks as if you just placed the worker below. The worker with the child cannot be retrieved by a Warrior, and the child cannot leave the board once placed.

Solo support: If Axomamma/Pachamama has two workers of the same colour in her supply at any point, she removes the matching child meeple from beside the Village. When this happens, she gains the recruiting reward for that colour another time. Return the removed child meeple to the box, Axomamma/Pachamama will not place them.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Ranger: AO Sierra Expansion Kit
description:
The second expansion for Ranger, the solitaire simulation of modern patrolling operations. Adds eighteen new missions reflecting long range patrols, including new mission types. Components include a card of supplemental tactical event paragraphs, two laminated mapsheets, extended mission card, and two play-aid cards. The expansion maps show the area adjacent to the AO Victor expansion maps. The new mission cards include missions conducted on the AO Sierra maps as well as missions covering the entire map area of Ranger and both expansion kits. Requires Ranger and AO Victor Expansion Kit to play.

Expands:

Ranger
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Cubist: Museum Expansion Pack
description:
This mini-expansion consists of six additional museum cards, all inspired by specific worldwide museums.

Cards included are:
- Ghent, Belgium
- Paris, France
- Gunma, Japan
- New York, USA
- London, England
- Shang Hai, China

name: Danger Danger
description:
Danger Danger is a one-minute card game with an evil twist you won't see coming. Players draw and play cards as quickly as they can for 60 seconds. Each card is worth a number of points, and the team with the most points showing at the end of the game wins. However, the timer in the game is hidden, so players never know how much time is left. If you're still playing when the buzzer goes off, you instantly lose!

—description from the publisher

name: War of Wonders
description:
War of Wonder is a Card Games based on the world of Project H.O.P.E. the RPG. You'll lead an army of superheroes try to win the second world war. You can take the control of the Ally or of the Axis.

Each turn you have to spend an amount of action point and/or cards from hand to play cards. Structures can be played spending action points, and often they help to play heroes. Heroes have different types and different launch costs. Heroes interact with the three mission areas (combat, sabotage, intelligence), resulting in victory points and other important bonus. The player can gain victory points also through the skills of heroes and structures.
The first player that reach 20 Victory points will win the war.

The Basic edition include two decks of 55 card each, that can played immediately. Each player can build their own deck and follow its strategy using card from basic decks or from the future expansion.
