categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, World War II

name: Moby Trick
description:
Narwhals are the trump suit in Moby Trick, but not always because the orcas, sperm whales, and blue whales can also turn the tide.

All the familiar rules of trick-taking games apply, but there is a special twist: Whoever wins the trick chooses a card that has been played and scores it, but whoever played this card receives bonus effects for one of the next rounds. For example, they can change the trump suit or influence the round in other ways.

name: Michael Coe's Dungeon Heroes
description:
Welcome to the Dungeon!

Two players go Head-to-Head controlling opposing sides in a game of deduction and deceit. One player controls a party of four heroes adventuring into a dungeon for treasure. The other is the Dungeon Lord who reigns over the dungeon's traps, treasures, and monsters. The heroes' party consists of a Warrior, a Cleric, a Rogue, and a Wizard, who must work together, using each of their special abilities to overcome the puzzles presented by the scheming Dungeon Lord.

—description from the back of the box

Contains Dungeon Heroes, and the Dungeon Heroes Expansion Pack.
mechanics: Action Points, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Memory, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Communist Cats: Revolution
description:
Welcome to Communist Cats: Revolution, the expansion for Communist Cats! Contains 24 cards to give the game play a new edge. Come join the revolution!

"The Physician" can help restore your numbers, meaning that there is always way back into the game.

Join up with "The Scientist", who can research new technologies to help you gain the advantage over your rivals. He allows access to 6 new Research Cards, but you have to be careful which technology you research and when or your rivals may gain access to even more powerful abilities!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Das Beinhaus von Sedlec: MDXI Erweiterung
description:
The expansion brings 5 new modules for the game at once.

The Poets want to lie next to lonely, unhappy lovers.

The Merchants want to lie next to farmers but far away from villains.

The Champions want to have as many skulls of certain species as possible around them - and The Ultimate Champion wants to be with the other champions, of course.

And with The Relics finally comes the solo module for the game that many have been eagerly awaiting.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: A Matter of Honor: The Battle of Le Bourget
description:
A MATTER OF HONOR The Battle of Le Bourget - Oct 30, 1870
Long before it became the site of Charles Lindbergh's landing after his first air crossing of the Atlantic Ocean and later of a renowned international Airshow, the town of Le Bourget, in the outskirts of Paris, was the scene of a bloody battle between the French Army and the Prussian forces besieging Paris in October 1870, during the Franco-Prussian War.
A Matter of Honor is an action-packed two-player tactical board game using a simple but effective area impulse activation system. The game captures the dramatic intensity of the Battle of Le Bourget and its desperate house to house fighting.
Added chromes include random event cards featuring historical events players may use to influence the outcome of the battle.
Units are companies of elite Prussian Guards, facing determined French Regulars and National Guardsmen in a fight to the finish and for a matter of honor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Semper Fi! Uncommon Valor ATS Upgrade
description:
From the publisher's website:

MOTOYAMA AIRFIELD #2, Iwo Jima, 27 February 1945: The Marines of Colonel Kenyon’s 9th Marine Regiment had a rough time during their first day in the line, 26 February. They had made two determined assaults on ‘Hill Peter’, to no avail. After reorganizing during the night, the 9th Marines were ready for another push to the top of the hill. At 1250 hrs., their break came. Following a ten minute preparation by division and corps artillery, both battalions struck out in a coordinated attack. With the 1st Battalion on the right and the 2nd on the left, the Marines began their move up the slopes of Hill Peter. The 1st Battalion overran the hill and continued on down the reverse slope and up to the crest of ‘Hill Oboe’ to the northwest. The 1st Battalion’s ‘A’ Company did not enjoy the same momentum on their way to Oboe. ‘A’ Company was stopped by a small enemy AA detachment with supporting fire from emplaced machine-guns in a small draw on their right flank. ‘A’ Company rapidly deployed to meet this threat.

ATS SEMPER FI! (aka Uncommon Valor Upgrade Edition) is the new COMPLETE GAME that depicts the battle for Iwo Jima. Three years into the Pacific war the United States Marine Corps had mastered the art of the amphibious landing. The landing force at Iwo still had much to learn about the enemy. Senior intelligence officers did not know until 27 February that General Kuribayashi was in fact personally running the show from his headquarters on Iwo Jima. As the Marines regrouped after their landing, it was obvious that something was different on Iwo Jima. No dense jungles, just ash from the island’s volcano, Suribachi. Steam could be seen rising from the natural sulfur water wells which bubbled to the surface all over the island. Worse, the dug-in defenders actually numbered half again the original estimate of 13,000. Kuribayshi was particularly pleased with the quality of his artillery and engineering troops. The Japanese defenders waiting for the advance of the V Amphibious Corps were well armed and confident. The game depicts the confrontation at Motoyama Airfield #2, a war waged with the most vicious weapons available to the combatants, including flame-throwing ‘Zippo’ Shermans and Japanese heavy artillery. Everything is included to play!.
· A collection of 517 color, die-cut counters representing the USMC and Japanese combatants that fought in the battle;
· Six scenarios, ranging from small to large, that all play on the historical map;
· A 22 x 34 color map of the Motoyama #2 battlefield on heavyweight stock;
· A complete ATS system rulebook tailored specifically to the game;
· Six Play Aid Cards;
· Battlefield Walk around and Special Rules document (an ATS specialty!)
· A color cover sheet (perfect for your rules binder) and a snazzy ziploc bag to hold it all.

name: Serial Killer
description:
Serial Killer is a real-time party game that uses signaling, bluffing, and deduction.

The game simulates the situation where most of the players are assigned as innocent civilians in a city with an undercover killer and police.

The objective of the police is to find the killer before the killer eliminates all of the civilians.

The killer's intention is to eliminate innocent civilians by means of a secret signal. The killer has less than five minutes to secretly signal their murder target without revealing themselves to the police. If the killer's murder attempt is successful, they will need to wait for at least 10 seconds before making another attempt. In the meantime, the killer is also trying to confuse the police into capturing the wrong player.

Civilian roles make the game more complex and interesting. The Journalist, for example, is an innocent civilian with the ability to expose other player's characters.

The game includes 30 characters with 10 unique roles. Each roles has a different agenda. Various characters can help the police or the killer or even themselves to win the game.

This game is easy to play, and can be played anywhere--in a small circle of friends or with family or as a team-building exercise.
publishers: (Self-Published), Board Game Academy & Hostel, Wise Box

name: Flames of War: D Minus 1
description:
Intelligence Handbook on Allied Airborne Forces in Normandy

From the Publisher's website:

5 June 1944, D-1, 2300 hours:

At airfields all across Southern England plane engines roar to life. The first, heavily laden aircraft lumber down the runway and into the air. On board are the brave young men of three airborne divisions, one British and two American. These highly skilled soldiers are trained to drop by parachute and glider deep behind enemy lines.

On this night they will spearhead Operation Neptune, the amphibious and airborne invasion of German-occupied France.

As the commander of an airborne company you have been specially selected because of your leadership ability and initiative. You’ll be leading your men into a battle where you know you’ll be isolated, surrounded and fighting a larger, more heavily equipped and well supported enemy force.

Just to survive, your men will have to rely on their excellent fitness, training, discipline and field craft. To be victorious they’ll need all of your skill, aggression and daring to make the best use of the limited resources. On your shoulders rests the fate of the liberation of Europe. Go to it!

Inside D minus 1 you will find:

• Histories of he British 6th and the US 82nd and 101st Airborne Divisions. These cover their preparations and forces used in Normandy, the role in D-Day and subsequent operations.

• Complete organizations for British Parachute and Airlanding Companies, and US Parachute Rifle and Glider Rifle Companies. It includes all Combat, Weapons, Support and Divisional Support options; no additional handbook is required to field any of these airborne forces.

• Exploits and Warrior rules for British Lieutenant-Colonel R. G. Pine-Coffin and US Lieutenant Turner Turnbull. Pine-Coffin commanded the 7th Parachute Battalion, 6th Airborne Division, and co-ordinated the defense of the bridges across the River Orne and Caen Canal after his unit dropped to re-enforce the glider borne force who had taken the bridges.

• Turner Turnbull 82nd Airborne, veteran of Sicily, commanded a platoon tasked with the defense of Neuville-au-Plein on 6 June 1944, he and his men held off German counterattacks for eight hours, before finally being forced to withdraw due to a lack of ammunition.

• New airborne assault rules including rules for pathfinders, parachute landing and coup-de-main glider assaults.

• New airborne mission: Seize and Hold. Seize and Hold represents the Allied Airborne forces forming up after landing and making for their objective. They know their target and converge on it from their various landing zones on foot, though sometimes British glider troops make straight for the objective.

• Extensive uniform painting guides covering the troops of the Allied airborne divisions.

• And of course inspirational color photographs of painted Battlefront Miniatures, color and back and white artwork, and historic black and white photographs of the real thing.

Flames of War current rulebook range

Publishers Home Page for the Game and Preview: http://www.battlefront.co.nz/Article.asp?ArticleID=1256
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails – Spiel 2014 Promo Pack
description:
The mini-expansion 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails – Spiel 2014 Promo Pack consists of a set of three new event cards.

The new event cards are:
Fool Me Twice (green)
Wild Mood Tonight (yellow)
Finish The Job (red)
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Block Party
description:
Ambush Mission 17: Block Party – A complete January, 1945 campaign scenario and insert cards.

This scenario originally appeared in Battleplan Magazine (#4) September / October 1987.

Errata and corrections appeared in Battleplan Magazine #7.

Includes:
4 Mission cards
12 German Soldier Cards
2 German Vehicles: Panzer V (Panther) and Halftrack
1 US Sherman Tank Card
10 Pages of Paragraphs
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Pana Po'o
description:
Party game in which you have to guess the concept that your partner tries to capture with the pieces of different shapes that come in the game. A challenge to the imagination.

One player in each team, picks a tile with a concept. Then they roll the die an then try to construct the shape using the same color tiles for their partner to guess before the sand timer runs out. A successful guess scores a point. At the end of the third round, the winner is the one who has guessed the most words. and the team with the most points when the tiles are completed, wins.
mechanics: Action Timer, Communication Limits, Move Through Deck, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game

name: Global War 2025: Meltdown
description:
Historical Board Gaming is proud to present Meltdown 2025 - War in the 21st Century!
A severe economic recession among oil producers and manufacturing nations has created instability and fueled ethnic tensions in Russia, China and the Middle East. In a bid to regain control of their economies, China and Russia are about to launch an invasion of unprecedented scale to gobble up markets and raw materials and cripple the West’s ability to intervene. To this end, Russia has been funneling money and weapons to extremist groups in the Middle East. There, a new group of radicals, fueled by foreign money now dominates the region, and parts of Africa. Against this plan for world dominance stands the USA, The European nations (EU and NATO states), and a coalition of Pacific and Indian allies. The dogs of war are about to be unleashed….

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: SLAM!
description:
A 2 player trick-taking card game using a deck of 32 cards.

This was Sid Sackson's first published game. He self published it in 1951. He subsequently included it in his book A Gamut of Games.
publishers: (Self-Published), dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson

name: Romulan Armada
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Next Invasion!

Expanding our Starmada line, the Romulans invade the Federation. This includes rules to bring 40 Romulan, Gorn, and Federation ships into the popular Starmada game system, along with plasma torpedoes, cloaking devices, and those sneaky Romulan privateers.

This 90-page book includes the Essential Starmada rules so it's ready to play without buying or downloading anything else, but Romulan Armada is designed to work with other Starmada products including Klingon Armada.

Integrates with:

Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
Klingon Armada
categories: Book, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: Scripta
description:
There are 26 boxes each marked with a letter, in order of
the alphabet on the game board. The players move a number of boxes the number of words written by them on a "subject" as determined by the chance. These words must start with the letter
marking the box where the players parked.
F.e. if player is in box "M" in must form only words beginning with M.

Player who is fully covered the alphapet and is the first who returns back to square "A" is the winner.

name: Cake Auf!
description:
Cake Auf! features desserts from around the world - each and every recipe in the game is unique.

The goal of the game is to make the most recipes within 3 rounds.

At the beginning of the first round, you are dealt 2 recipes (3 for playing with 2 players) and 5 resource/action cards. On your turn, you can play an unlimited number of cards: place ingredients on your recipes, and play actions on yourself or other players. The first person to complete the most recipes over 3 rounds wins.

In order to help you advance and hinder your opponents, there are the following action cards:


Power Outage: Place above another player's recipe to stop them from completing their recipe that uses power.
Fire Alarm: Place above another player's recipe to stop them from completing their recipe that uses power.
The Old Switcheroo: Play this card to switch a recipe or entire hand with another player.
Picky Eater: Peak at the top 3 cards in the unused Recipe pile and you may choose one to swap out a current recipe with.
One for One: Select another player whose hand to randomly select a card from. They randomly select a card from your hand in return.
Freezer Burn: Play this card to destroy another player's already completed recipe that uses the fridge.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Random Production, Set Collection, Take That

name: Across the Wide Missouri
description:
Across the Wide Missouri is a collection of three Civil War battles in Missouri and Arkansas - Wilson's Creek, Pea Ridge and Prairie Grove. Prairie Grove and Wilson's Creek can be played in three to four hours. Pea Ridge is a two day battle with hidden initial deployments, and can take up to 8 hours. Various alternative history options are included.

Wilson's Creek and Prairie Grove are solitaire friendly. Pea Ridge requires hidden units and maneuver, so some sort of randomized battle plan is needed. Multiple personality disorder or a cooperative friend a plus.

Components:
One 11"x17" Map (Wilson's Creek); One 12"x18" Map (Prairie Grove), One 17"x22" Map (Pea Ridge)
432 9/16" pieces, representing historical combat units and unit or formation status markers.
One Game Reference card for each player with Terrain Effects and Combat Results Charts
28 page color booklet of rules, play illustrations and detailed historical commentary.
1 Six-sided Die

Currently Shipping (15 September 2007)

name: CAP10 n°0.1
description: Cap10 is a combination of book and game.

name: Nome in Codice: Carte Bonus Comics and Games 2016
description: 10 promo cards loosely inspired to Italian culture, released during the 2016 edition of the Lucca Comics and Games festival.

name: Talisman (4th Edition): Optional Characters
description:
Following the release of Talisman: Revised 4th Edition, Black Industries made a PDF available via their website which featured three optional Characters for the game.

These characters were rehashes of ones found in the 2nd Edition of Talisman using artwork taken from Adventure cards in the latest release.

The Gnome artwork was taken from the Adventure card of the same name, and the Character was based on the Leprechaun originally included in the Talisman Expansion Set.

The Hobgoblin artwork was taken from the Adventure card of the same name, and the Character was based on the Hobgoblin originally included in the Talisman Expansion Set.

The Pixie artwork was taken from the Fairy Adventure card, and the Character was based on the Sprite originally included in the 2nd edition The Talisman Dungeon.

One thing to note is that the Pixie character was originally to be a Nixie and use artwork from the Imp Adventure card, but it was thought that this looked a bit too evil!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Quarriors!: Quarmageddon e Quest of the Qladiator
description:
Qua-Boom! After an epic battle between Quaxos and the Three-Eyed Dragon of the Quarmageddon, the Quarmageddon is released upon us! Quarriors! Quarmageddon, the second expansion set to the Quarriors! dice-building game, adds forty new custom dice powering six new Creatures and two new Spells for you to bring a serious smack-down to the battlefield of hexahedron monster combat. Some battle-hardened Creatures come equipped with a new "Immunity" ability so they can laugh off whatever your opponents throw at you! No guts, no Glory!

In Quarriors! Quest of the Qladiator, the third expansion for Quarriors!, you have been selected to compete in the Qladitorial Games! Quadrennially, Empress Quiana calls together the mightiest Quarriors across the land to compete in the great Quolosseum. Will you defeat all other competitors for the greatest Glory?

Quarriors! Quest of the Qladiator adds forty new custom dice powering six new creatures and two new spells, in addition to a new "Lock" mechanism that allows some creatures to have long-lasting game effects.

QUARMAGGEDON
Instaurou-se o caos! O Set de Expansão Quarriors: Quarmageddon! traz 40 dados personalizados novos que dão vida a 6 criaturas e 2 feitiços novos para você detonar em uma batalha insana, cheia de monstros e hexaedros. Algumas criaturas, já calejadas de batalha, vêm com uma nova habilidade de “imunidade” para ficarem rindo da cara dos adversários! Sem coragem, não há glória!

QUEST OF THE QLADIATOR
As trombetas soam em sua homenagem, bravo Quarrior! Por conta de suas façanhas durante o Quarmaggedon, você foi também no Quoliseu, diante de uma legião de fãs! Pronto para testar sua garra com a nova habilidade de PRISÃO? Saber quando e como usá-la é essencial para conquistar a glória almejada. Há 6 criaturas e 2 feitiços novos à sua espera, doidos para serem usados contra os seus oponentes. E aí, vai encarar o desafio do Qladiador?
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Bloc by Bloc: The Insurrection Game – 2nd Edition
description:
Bloc by Bloc: The Insurrection Game is a semi-cooperative tabletop game inspired by 21st century protest movements, riots and popular uprisings. Each player controls a faction of revolutionaries—Workers, Students, Neighbors, or Prisoners—fighting against the State in the streets of a city that change with each game. Build barricades, clash with riot cops, occupy districts, loot shopping centers, and liberate the city before time runs out and the military arrives! Bloc by Bloc features hidden agendas, deep strategy, area control, asymmetrical player abilities, and a special method for randomly generating billions of unique city layouts. Bloc by Bloc 2nd edition features brand new art, streamlined gameplay, improved components and new objectives for the insurrection!

The game lasts up to 10 rounds. Each round is 1 night and each night has 2 phases. During the Nighttime phase, each player takes a turn: 3-5 actions followed by a police response that is controlled by the Police Ops deck and the level of Police Morale. Each player starts with 2 blocs in the city and can add more throughout the game. On a player's turn, they roll dice and take one action (such as looting, occupying, attacking, or barricading) for each die rolled with 1+ of their blocs. Players may use loot cards to enhance their actions. After all factions have taken their turns, the Sunrise phase begins, which is when police go on the attack and factions have a chance to liberate districts.

The police and the State are the common enemies of all factions. Factions must build occupations in all of their own districts for the social insurrection to be successful. However, each faction also has its own secret agenda with a set of specific tasks that faction must complete in order to win the game. The majority of factions will have Social Agendas and they must cooperate to win the game together. But some factions may have Vanguardist or Nihilist Agendas that secretly pit them against the social insurrection. These factions can only win the game alone!


The 2nd edition features a brand new art, streamlined gameplay, improved components and new objectives for the insurrection!
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Out of Order Games, Outlandish Games

name: The Last Lighthouse: Long Nights
description:
Weak sunlight barely filters through the low winter clouds. The nightmares seem to draw strength from the oppressive darkness, gathering in ever-larger hordes.

The Long Nights expansion adds 5 new Nightmare/Trap cards. These cards are shuffled into the standard deck and then 3 cards are removed, creating an unpredictable and more challenging experience for veteran players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Dice of Destiny promo card
description:
A promotional set of three cards offered during the "Dice Tower - 2018" Kickstarter campaign.

This card goes in the Odin's Path deck.
Cost: 3 beer
Effect: Draw 3 cards.
Keep 1 and discard the other two.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Mythology, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Hakenschlagen
description:
Who beats the best hook and wins the race?
A running game for the whole family.
   
Up to 5 rabbits go on the racetrack, sit on fields, dandelion, carrots and salad. Start and finish fields are identical, every bunny has to go back and forth across the field. The winner is the player whose rabbit is the first to return.

At the start of the game colorful leaves are distributed on the field and thus the appropriate fields for carrots, salad and dandelion are set. The matching marbles are in a cotton bag. Drawn blind, they indicate the way of the rabbits.

A red fox and tall trees are slowing down the rabbits. A molehill on the other hand prolongs the leap of the rabbits.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Rockwell: The Fluctuating Market
description:
Now available for free on Sit Down! website (download).

The Fluctuating Market is an expansion for Rockwell.

From now the Rockwell stock exchange will fluctuate (the resource values are fixed in the basic rules), which will allow the prices of resources from the mine to rise or fall, which will require players to buy and sell at just the right moment. Enough to challenge even the most hardcore gamers!

This expansion includes a new Stock Exchange board and a new deck of 64 cards, both of which replace their counterparts in the base game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Transformer Boxes: Taiwan's Most Beautiful Scenery
description:
Transformer Boxes: Taiwan's Most Beautiful Scenery is a card game that helps people to learn the importance of the city landscape!

In Taiwan, transformer boxes don't fit in with the city well because of their unpleasant appearance. With simple rules and transformer box cards, our designer would like to invite you to experience the beauty of the harmonious landscape!

In this game, players divide transformer box cards, make bids, and collect different cards as urban landscape architects. In each round, the first player divides the revealed transformer box cards in piles for the other players to make their bids and collect different transformer box cards. The scoring varies with different kinds of cards. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score is the urban landscape architect who creates the most beautiful city and wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection, Turn Order: Auction

name: Sblocca la porta
description:
Sblocca la porta is an escape room for children.

You are locked in a room and you must work together to find the way out, solving puzzles of logic, observation and mathematics. Use the objects you find in the room, observe the smallest details and do not be rushed: if you correctly solve all puzzles, you will leave the room!

The box includes 3 adventures: The pharaoh's pyramid, The cursed castle and Escape from space.

—description from the designer

name: Death Battle!
description:
Death Battle!: The Game is a fast-paced head-to-head card and dice game where players duel to the bitter end... To defeat your foe, you must outsmart and outwit their own devious battle plans. Are you deadly enough to win a Death Battle?

In Death Battle!, gameplay continues until there is one player left standing. Each player is given a number of Armor, Weapon, and Skill cards to assemble a combo of card and dice abilities to combat their opponent's battle plan or punch right through it.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Progressive

name: 1944: War in the West
description: 1944: War in the West is a beer-and-pretzels, two-player game based upon the Allied liberation of Western Europe in 1944 - 45. One player controls the Allied forces, the other the Germans. Command and supply play an important role in the game as it did in the historical conflict. The geographic scope of the game is from Cherbourg, France to Vienna and from Arnhem to Florence, Italy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Enchanters: Browntails Den Promo Card
description:
A Kickstarter Exclusive promo card.

The card is a village (of which one random is in play)

The players have the following effects:

1. Start with 15 crystals, but lose 1 crystal at the start of each turn.

2. During a fight, pay 2 crystals, add 1 strength

3. While resting, gain 5 crystals

4. At the end of the game, gain 1 victory for each 5 crystals
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Under Falling Skies: Essen City promo tile
description:
Additional city tile released as a promo at Spiel 2021.



Essen (E/B)Blue side (research 6)

"During setup, place 1 token in each research room. When you resolve a research room that has a token, discard the token and apply a +1 bonus."

Red side (research 5)
"During setup, place 1 token in each research room. When you resolve a research room that has a token, you may discard the token to apply a +1 bonus."
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Die Drei
description:
Die Drei, means the three games. The box indeed contains the material and the German rules to play three Alex Randolph's games: Hepta, Pegs, Tetrods. It also contains the rules of T. for two, a game created by Franz-Josef Schulte with the pieces of Tetrods.

Hepta is also known as Hepta (Ravensburger) or Magic 7 (Ideal).
Pegs was published as Peggino (Ravensburger).
Tetrods was never published before.
T. for two was never published before.

name: Space Fighters
description:
This game of ship to ship combat takes place on a mapsheet depicting the surface of a large space station dotted with gun towers. There is a trench down the middle of the map with a target at the end. The good-guys are called the Rebels. Their ships are Red Leader, accompanied by Red Two through Red Eleven, and Gold Leader, accompanied by Gold Two through Gold Five. There's also a Pirate Freighter. The bad-guys are called the Empire.

If you haven't gotten the picture yet, the cover art is a drawing of an X-Wing shooting at a Tie Fighter, straight out of Star Wars. This independently produced (and unauthorized?) game depicts the climactic attack on the Death Star . . . I mean, on the "Imperial space station".

This game is part of the Star Wars Games.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Duello
description:
Contents: Gameboard and 12 cards/tiles (6 red, 6 blue).

A small box game for 2 players, Ages 9 and up.

An abstract strategy game where each of a player's six tiles can only move in a certain order and to certain spaces (outlined on the tile itself) on the 12-square board. Opponent's tiles are captured by landing on them. Each tile has 5 moves - if it is able to make it to it's fifth and last place on the board without being captured, the player is able to take his/her own tile for themselves.

The first player to acquire 6 tiles from the board wins.

name: Taxi
description:
From the box:

Everyone is a driver working for YELLOW BIRD TAXI COMPANY. Each driver takes a shift driving the Taxi, doing your best for the company and leaving the Taxi in good shape for the next driver.

The object of the game is to deliver as many of the 15 customers as you can to their destinations and earn as much money as you can. The game ends in one of two ways. All the customers get delivered or your taxi gets hauled off the road with too many Demerit Points against it.

There's lots to do before the night is over besides just delivering fares to their destinations. Events are happening all over the city while there are speeding tickets to deal with, grabbing that necessary cup of coffee when you get tired, getting through traffic jams, past construction sites, watching out for thieves, keeping an eye on the gas gauge, fixing failing brakes. It will be a night to remember, no matter what happens!

name: Galaxy Chess
description:
From the box:

Once in future time ... mankind lives as nomads and astronauts in the universe. They call themselves Terranians and their needs are supplied by huge space shuttles from distant planets and galaxies. They are very wealthy, but not alone in space.

Aliens, extraterrestrial tribes, like the fierce Martians, scouting through the universe, always eagerly search for resources, energy and slaves. So the conflict is due to come....
categories: Abstract Strategy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Control
description: In Control, you try to gain control of a "town" while your opponents from doing so. Very similar to Monopoly, with added features such as Chief of Police, Tax Collector, and Companies (for each town, or set of 4 properties) and a few other basic features.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Grand Prix Circus
description:
A solo Formula 1 management game.
Take over one of 13 two-car fantasy teams for the 1995 season or one of the 11 two-car real teams for the 2001 season (latest edition). Hire and fire drivers; arrange engine testing sessions and contracts; worry about Chassis Development and Tire Contracts; obtain Sponsorship; sort out your long-term Finance.

30 minute playing time is for one race (typical roll-dice & lookup chart). A whole season obviously takes much longer.

name: Mighty Trees
description:
An educational "collectible card game" that is built around the competition of trees for resources in order to dominate in the canopy. In the course of the game, you must deal with the natural disasters, sunlight, and combat with other trees. Painstakingly researched, the game is exceedingly detailed and amusingly illustrated.

Each deck consists of the same 100 cards, which is all you need to play--though a second deck adds a little variety. There are rules for three levels of games (seedling, timber, and elder stage) that slowly introduce all of the mechanics.

You can get more information and order at
https://mightytreesgame.weebly.com/
OR
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Mighty-Trees-Card-Game/199342...

name: The Next President
description:
The game comes with separate rules for The Nomination Game and The Election Game.

The Nomination Game puts players in the role of campaign manager. Each player records the number of points one wants to commit for each of twenty-two state primaries. The one who commits the most to each state wins it.After the last state has been contested, players move on to The Convention phase where players once again bid to win the remaining states. If no player has the 769 votes needed to win the game. The player with least number of votes drops out and the process is repeated until there is a winner.

The Election Game simulates a presidential election. Both players choose a candidate for president and vice president. Play is simultaneous. A round consists of each player collecting campaign funds, revealing three event cards, secretly allocating resource markers, revealing those allocations and determine campaign results. This goes on for six rounds and then it's Election Day. The results of the campaigns are realized and the player with 270 or more Electoral Votes is the winner.

The game comes with statistics for all of the major candidates from 1972 and fifteen historical candidates such as Andrew Jackson and Abraham Lincoln.

name: Escape of the Goeben
description:
Panzerschreck Magazine #9.

Escape of the Goeben is a two-player tactical WWI naval game that extends the Jellicoe vs Scheer game system (not necessary for play) to the Mediterranean and Black Sea. Includes dreadnought fleets of major Allied and Central Powers nations during the Great War.

name: Slargeball: The National Sport of Irvania
description: Slargeball is a sports game for two players. It plays like a wargame: the playing field is covered in hexes to regulate movement. The players use close assault tactics to score points, they fling the ball like a ranged missile weapon, they block the opposing team members by using hand-to-hand combat. It is a game of wits, skill, determination, and whapping people upside the head.

name: Compact Warrior
description:
Compact Warrior is a game of individual combat using swords and shields or other fantasy-type weapons. Each player controls one or more "characters" and makes combat decisions for each character concerning where he moves, how he attacks and what the character's specific tactics are.

Compact Warrior is the core game of the Compact Combat tactical game system.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Great War Spearhead
description:
Great War Spearhead does require ownership of Spearhead to play it.

Units are companies, as armies were much larger in WWI.
The scale is 1/285 or 15mm.

The rules may be used for Russo-Japanese War actions as well. ToEs are included for all major (and many minor) WWI countries.

Special rules allow for realistic portrayal of trench warfare, pre-battle bombardments, and use of gas.

Expands:

Spearhead
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Check-up Charlie
description: This is a game for children who like to play doctor. The vertical board features a picture of Charlie who "has the Icky Wickys and needs you to help him feel better!" On your turn, you select what sort of check-up you'd like to perform: Ear Scope Check-Up, Thermometer Check-Up, X-Ray Check-Up, or the Ankle Cast Check-up (which must be done last). Each check-up has an instrument to use which also reveals a hidden picture. For example, the Thermometer tip is inserted into Charlie's mouth and pressed until the window pops open, or a slide is inserted into the X-Ray machine and a light is switched on to reveal the picture. If the picture of a happy Charlie face appears, you are successful and you take a puzzle piece depicting the check-up and place it in a frame. If an Icky Wicky is the picture, your turn ends and you must perform the check-up again later. The first player to perform all 4 check-ups successfully (and thus complete the puzzle) is the winner.

name: Number Please
description:
Somewhat based on the obscure 1961 game show, players (or teams for more than two players) begin with $5,000, a 24-square playing rack, and 24 shutters valued at $0 to $1,000.

Each team selects a word or phrase for the other team to guess. The mystery word or phrase is secretly entered letter by letter with a wax pencil onto the 24-square rack and then the squares are covered with the shutters. Players strategically place the shutters and the shutter value is secret.

The players then take turns calling out numbers to be revealed on their opponent's rack. Players must pay (to the opponent) the value on the shutter they call out. A correct guess earns $1,000, while a wrong guess costs $1,000.

Play continues until five phrases have been guessed or someone runs out of money. In the case of the former, the player/team with the most money wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Chantilly
description: Another excellent, simple, innovative game from Ivy Street Games. Covering the battle of Chantilly, the game has a neat system for simulating how you as the general gives orders to your subordinate commanders. A desktop publishing title that deserves life as a professional publication.

name: Monster Destroy
description:
Do you remember old B-movies when monsters of every kind tried to destroy cities or small villages?
In Monster Destroy every player plays a monster trying to destroy more buildings than the others using his powers and trying not to be stopped by other monsters or gangstas, XXX rays, missiles etc...
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Money Monsoon
description:
Money Monsoon is a simple auction game with some twists. The board is simply a track, and each player has two pawns. The game ends when any one pawn reaches the end space, and the player with the most money then wins.

The turn player rolls an 8-sided die, and the result of the die roll is then auctioned using a silent bid (written on pieces of paper). The high bid wins but pays the second highest amount (like Knizia's Last Paradise), and that player can move one of their pawns the die roll amount. Money is paid to the die roller, unless they win in which case they pay the bank. Rolls of seven and eight have special properties. Moves can be made forward and backward, and this is relevant since when landing on another player's pawn, that owner of the pawn hit pays 50 points to the mover. There are bonuses for finishing in first, second, and third place also.

name: Operation Ironfist
description:
This wargame is set in 1951 in an alternate world where the U.S. landing at Leyte Gulf was defeated by the Japanese navy. The Japanese still lose the war but it takes longer and the Soviets and the U.S. are forced to invade Japan.

The Soviets have established a communist Northern Japanese people's Republic in Hokkaido while the U.S. establish the democratic state of southern Japan (Honshu and the rest of the Islands).

In 1951, combined U.S. and Japanese forces invade to take back Hokkaido.



This game is also based on Daisuke Sato's novel of "Seito" (征途).

name: Innocence Lost: First Bull Run 1861
description:
Innocence Lost: First Bull Run 1861 is a Desk-Top-Publishing Tactical level board-wargame on the first major engagement of the American Civil War war....excellent counters and even better map: typical DTP fare 2-part map and cut out counters but worth the price unlike at a lot of games out there.

For all the students of the ACW here is another variation on the first great battle of the War, First Manassas. Using a system derived from Ivy Street’s brigade level wargames, but with a totally different combat method, Innocence Lost uses a chit drawing activation system, that strains the command differences between the two rival armies in this early stages of the Civil War. With historical and what-if scenarios and variants.

It is a fast and furious wargame, easily playable both face-to-face than solitaire in under 2 hours.
4 A4 full color maps and 140 full-color counters with the usual impressing graphics that gained a nomination for best DTP effort at 2003 Charles Robert Awards

Released as Print-n-Play in June 2007. Available as a DTP game from Boulder Games.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Championship! Show Jumping Game
description:
CHAMPIONSHIP, "The Most Authentic Show Jumping Game" from Capri, dated 1975.

CHAMPIONSHIP SHOW JUMPING captures the atmosphere, the skills and excitement of international show jumping, making a gripping and absorbing game for all the family."

The contents of the game include-

base board
instruction manual
two wall brackets
six different horses
17 jumps or obstacles
scoreboard to record moves and faults
penalty zone cards
leader score card

name: The Screen Test Game
description: This game includes several cards with humorous plots and dialogs. It also has several blank cards to write down some props and locations appropriate for your group. Cards are drawn at random and players have to incorporate those elements into a skit which is video taped. The video camera is not included.

name: Star Trek: The Invasion of Klingon Empire
description:
This is one of Tsukuda Hobby's SF Series games, #9 in that series (the game is numbered HG-009-4000). It bears the subtitle "The Game of Space War in Star Trek" in addition to the less generic "Invasion of Klingon Empire."

This is definitely a strategic game, given the 4-part mounted map showing the United Federation of Planets, the Klingon Empire (or a portion thereof), the Romulan Empire (ditto), and a large amount of space between these. Production is clearly important, as there seem to be many rules sections covering factories.

The game definitely appears to have two sides, the Federation and the Klingons. It gives the appearance of allowing either 2 or 4 players - the map has a line down the middle which would split it reasonably enough for this purpose. Presumably two players split the Federation and the other side has a Klingon and a Romulan player.

The missions of the USS Enterprise are clearly of some importance to the game. The green lines on the map appear to chart these (many of the systems have names familiar from the original TV series), there is a rules section labeled "ST Game Enterprise Mission Chart," and one of the scenarios is called "Missions of Enterplize" (I swear!). Other missions include "la Brandy de Camus" and a campaign game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: When the Grass Was Real
description: When the Grass Was Real is a tabletop baseball game with a difference: it's designed to simulate a fictional baseball league, in the spirit of the game described in Robert Coover's novel The Universal Baseball Association, Inc.: J. Henry Waugh, Prop. When you roll the dice, you don't find out that the hitter singled; your batter will hit a hard ground ball in the hole to the left side, and the shortstop is moving toward it. Using data from Retrosheet, we've attempted to replicate things like batted ball distribution: your hitters will tend to hit their lazy fly balls and pop ups the other way, while pulling harder hit balls. Similarly, good hitters will tend to hit the ball harder (more line drives and hard grounders and fewer pop ups), and poor hitters will do the opposite.

name: Eagles
description:
Subtitled "Rome on the Rhine Frontier, AD 15", Eagles is about a Roman invasion of Germanic tribal lands in the eponymous year and their attempt to re-capture three "Eagles" (legion standards) taken from a Roman army that the German barbarians defeated six years prior. The Romans, under Drusus Germanicus, must fight against twelve Germanic tribes, led by Arminius. The Romans are very powerful, but few in number. They are aided by a large number of auxiliaries and Germanic tribal allies, all unreliable in combat. The Germans are many, but need to be "motivated" by Arminius in order to join battle against the Romans. A fairly even match that historically went to the Romans.

380 counters

Revised version:

Caesar's Legions
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: 4 Alarm
description:
Race to put out the fire in this vintage game from Milton Bradley. The subtitle is "Exciting Fire Fighting Game."

[DESCRIPTION FROM INSIDE BOX COVER]

4 ALARM GAME
For 2, 3, or 4 Players

This exciting FIRE FIGHTING game is for all who love the fun of playing fireman. Players are District Chiefs, each with 3 ENGINES of his own color. A CARD is drawn telling where a 2, 3, or 4 ALARM fire has started in the city. Each Chief, in turn, moves his ENGINES, by throw of the DICE, along the streets to put them alongside the FIRE and put it out. A 2 ALARM FIRE requires 2 ENGINES to put it out, a 3 ALARM FIRE needs 3 ENGINES, and so on. If a fire is not put out when another CARD is drawn, it may SPREAD to the North, South, East, or West. When a fire is “put out,” the owner of each Engine at the fire gets a POINT. After ALL CARDS are drawn and all fires “put out,” the game ENDS and the player with the MOST POINTS is the WINNER.

name: P.T. Boat 109
description: Billed as an 'exciting game of strategy and imagination' but looks and plays a lot like Battleship.

name: Scarne's Encyclopedia of Games
description:
Large book mainly covering card games but also has sections on dice games, parlour games, lottery games, tile games, chess, checkers, gambling games and a section called "Games requiring special equipment" which covers some traditional board games. There are also some original games by John Scarne sprinkled throughout the book and a glossary of game terms.

The ISBN-10 is 0060138130.

name: Piquet: Anchor of Faith
description:
Anchor of Faith warfare in the seventeenth century. At the beginning of the seventeenth century armies deployed in large units comprising many thousands of men. Firepower, while important, was still subordinate to shock of contact and the use of pole arm weapons. The period can be characterized: - The introduction of smaller formations, reduction in the use of pike and increased reliance on firepower and the development of linear tactics. Anchor of Faith allows the gamer to recreate the battles and tactics of this colorful period.

Anchor of Faith covers warfare in Europe and the fringe nations in the Middle East and Asia. The supplement introduces new rule mechanisms, formation types and army generation tables particular to the period 1600 to 1690. It combines the main rules that allow battles to be played at a regimental scale, and a sub set of rules, the Twelve Apostles, for fighting smaller actions with units typically representing a few companies of infantry or troops of cavalry. The latter being particularly useful for fighting large English Civil War skirmishes.

Anchor of Faith includes a range of new formations definitions including tercios, Swedish brigade, deep line, caracole cavalry, commanded shot, galloper cavalry and war wagons. New period rule mechanisms are introduced to mirror both the abilities and shortcomings of the troops of this era. New rules include revised pursuit rules, morale points by command and new fire rules to reflect the low effect of musketry and the importance of ‘push of pike’ in deciding the outcome of engagements. Many of the new ideas and mechanisms can be used in other Piquet periods.

Expands:

Piquet: Master Rules for Wargaming

name: Cat 'N Mouse
description: This children's dexterity game features a moving carousel shaped like a circular clothesline. Plastic mice are placed around the rim of the circle. Each player has a lever with a plastic cat on it. Pressing the lever launches the cat upwards and (hopefully) knocks a mouse off the carousel. The player that has caught the most mice when time runs out is the winner.

name: The Green Pipe
description:
Finalist for 2005 About.com Deduction Game Design Competition.

The first player places the "head" of the pipe on a 4x4 board; the second player, the "tail" of the pipe. Then each player draws a secret pipeline path between the two, crossing at least three spaces. Each player then marks three spaces of her pipe with holes.

By placing and moving injectors of colored liquid, as well as probes, on the board, each player reveals information about both players' pipes. The first player to correctly guess the location of her opponent's three holes wins! (Each time you make a wrong guess, you may not guess again for G turns, where G is the number of wrong guesses you've made so far.)

name: El Salvador 1992
description: From Spanish publisher El Cinturón de Hierro, "El Salvador 1992" was intended as a wargame from a leftist perspective. The game covers one year of fighting between the forces of the FMLN(Frente Farabundo Martí de Liberación Nacional) and those of the El Salvadoran government, following a hypothetical breakdown of the 1992 peace talks.

name: Dimension 0
description:
Summary
Japanese trading card game designed by Nakamura Satoshi (Fairy Tale, Yuhodo). The game is somewhat like Magic: the Gathering, and somewhat like Duel Masters. Units move and fight on a 3x3 grid. The game is set in a mixed science/fantasy setting, with both metal robots and dragons. Depth of game play is claimed to be one of its features.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: Operation: Sealion 1940
description:
From the web-site description:
"It is the year 1940. France has surrendered. The British and the remains of the French Army have retreated across the English Channel. Germany now controls the whole of Western Europe. The United Kingdom stands alone, waiting for the Germans to strike. Hitler approves plans for an upcoming invasion of the United Kingdom. A plan called Operation: SEALION. The invasion of the United Kingdom is about to begin!"

This follows in the same vein as some other 'Battle' GAME based upon the "Axis & Allies" series, while you'll need to procure the necessary 'bits' from one of those to play this. There are entirely NEW components made up for this, with "Order of Battle" charts, the 'Gamemap', and with '3' SETs(or 'kinds') of CARDs for use in it.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Tactica: Medieval Rulebook
description:
Tactica Medieval is, not surprisingly, an adaptation of the Tactica: An Historical Approach to Ancient Wargaming ancients period rules set to the medieval period. There are three games included in the book: an army game, a siege game (involving boiling oil, siege engines, siege towers, etc.) and a campaign system.

Army lists for the major armies from about 1000-1500AD are included.

name: Freddy Vs Jason Killer Trivia Game
description:
The bloodbath continues, but now it’s your turn to slay. Jason Voorhees and Freddy Krueger, the most iconic cinematic serial killers of our time, have nothing on you. Recount your knowledge of all ten "Friday the 13th" films, seven "A Nightmare on Elm Street" films, and the only "Freddy vs. Jason" film in an effort to collect corpses and accumulate enough bodies to win.

Choose to play a “Friday the 13th” trivia game with 500 questions, testing your brainpower on 2 decades of atrocious homicides. Or play an “A Nightmare on Elm Street” trivia game with 500 questions to keep you wide-awake through Freddy’s dreamy killing spree. And if you have enough time for a double homicide, play a combo game for twice the scare.

With over 1,000 questions, a custom die, and coroner’s reports that challenge you to recount the gruesome ways that Freddy and Jason slaughtered their victims, this trivia game is sure to provide frightening fun for all horror film fans.

Ages 17 and up 2+ players
categories: Horror, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Shoestring Racer
description:
From the game's introduction

"Shoestring Racer is a game about racing at the bottom end of the financial spectrum, where getting a bike built at all is a triumph of determination over lack of cash. The first part of the game represents the panic-stricken rushing around to get the racing goodies in the last fortnight before the racing season starts and the second part is the actual race, in which you discover whether your hastily assembled pile of bits is a potential winner."

Components
- Board featuring racetrack on one side, buildup grid on the other.
- 8 page rules booklet (A5 size).
- Movement Aid sheet (A4) giving examples of various moves.
- 2 decks of cards/tiles "Shop" and "Practice".
- pad of score sheets.
- plastic bike tokens.

name: Mechad-1
description:
This is an expansion for the game Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is from the description on the back cover and contents:

Includes all the rules needed to play:
- The Mechad: a new star faring race of machines
- Bolaar phaser capacitors
- Electromagnetic Field
- Power Distribution Nodes
- Trans-Warp Missiles
- The Distortion Cannon
- Subspace Whips

Historical background for the Mechad:
- Mechad history
- 3 historical scenarios

Technical information including:
- Ship descriptions for 25 Mechad units
- The Mechad tournament command cruiser

Also included: 24 Companion SSDs
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Remember Signale
description: Similar to Memory. The cards show only different colors and forms.

name: Kwatro
description: "The game of speed and concentration." Players attempt to place 4 marks in-a-row while stopping their opponent. Released as a paper-and-pencil game as well as in a boxed set.

(From the game):

1999
In 1936 we changed the world.
Altered the course of history. And of man.
Now the past has caught up with you.
This is your war.

With every 1999 miniatures package you get a complete rulebook as well as the rules for the miniature you purchased. This allows you to get started immediately collecting and playing with miniatures for any of three core factions. The game will only be sold in blister boxes and each blister box will contain a rulebook, so each blister box is a Starter. The first release is five blister boxes for each of the three core factions: Angels, Demons and Men. Each model has a full color card with its rules in local language attached to the front of the blister box.
Due to the modified genetic code of many warriors, you can tailor the programming of their DNA before every battle, tweaking your chosen tactic to gain momentum and moment of surprise, every time you play an opponent. Even the same opponent.

Â· Highly detailed expressive miniatures.
Â· Scalable system allows you to play with any number of miniatures.
Â· Tactical and fast-paced dynamic rules for retro-futuristic warfare.
Â· Unique genetic ability tweaking and deployment system.
Â· Complete rulebook comes with all miniatures.
Â· Affiliation/value indicators makes army construction and modification a breeze.
Â· Experience the advantages and spectacular drawbacks when man's tampering with creation backfires.
Â· Each miniature comes with full color rules card.
Â· Epic dark gothic setting and artwork.

name: Blitz
description:
The players have 8 different army units. Each one has a different strength, from 1 to 8. With those, players must try to conquer the opponent's capital, on the other side of the board. The first one to do so wins.

This is a direct reskin of Jungle with a military theme.

name: Escape from Chosin: Toktong Pass 1950
description:
Critical Hit's newest Advanced Squad Leader compatible game extension covers the fighting in Korea in 1950.

Contents include:
Two sheets of die-cut variant counters, representing all the SMC and MMC counters, plus AFVs and guns, that you will need to play the game IN NEW FULL COLOR FORMAT, including CCF Buglers, grenade squads, USMC in Winter Uniforms, and much more;
A large historical game map on heavyweight stock;
8 scenarios printed on cardstock
PLUS TWO BONUS scenarios
VARIANT Rules and a PLATOON LEADER campaign game;
The scenarios and CG are fought on a colorful map depicting the rugged terrain found on the Korean Peninsula. This expansion is the first of Critical Hit's products to feature full color counters.

This is not a stand alone game. You must have the ASL Rulebook and any other ASL module (Beyond Valor) for the necessary game markers in order to play.

Visit www.criticalhit.com for more information
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: No Quarter
description:
No Quarter is a fantasy mass battles generic rules system for 28mm miniatures set in the fantasy world of Genayria. Games can be played from small scale skirmishes to full scale battles using hundreds of figures. The system is not tied to any particular miniatures manufacturer.

The No Quarter system uses an alternate unit activation turn sequence in which players take turns in moving and fighting with units until all units have been activated.

Available in English, French and Italian!!!

name: Rush on Berlin
description: Original game published in Command Magazine Japan #39 in 2001.

name: If the Lord Spares Us: Wargame Rules for the First World War in the Middle East
description:
Miniature Wargame rules for the First World War in the Middle East.

“…Til we meet again, if the Lord Spares Us”. So ends the last letter written home from Gallipoli veteran 202537 Lance Sergeant Albert Skinner, 2/4th Royal West Kent Regiment, just a few weeks before his death in the hills near Tel Khuweilfe, a few miles north east of Beersheba, Palestine on 4th November 1917. These rules are dedicated to Albert and all those other poor sods who are still out there.

It's a long way to Tipperary but whether you're fighting your way up Anzac Cove, sipping Pimms as part of Townshend's Regatta up the Tigris, marching through Jerusalem with Allenby, or bouncing on a flea-ridden camel on the route to Damascus with Lawrence of Arabia these rules will enable you to pack up your troubles and take the fight to Johnny Turk. Away from the quagmire of the Western Front ITLSU proves that brigade level games the Great War in the Middle East have components of everything; camels, arab war bands, sweeping cavalry attacks, opposed beach landings, massed machine guns, gas attacks, tanks, armored cars, fighting in the mirage, water shortages, trench assaults, river gunboats - and enough command and control dilemmas to test the most cunning Pasha.The opportunities it provides are boundless. ITLSU makes every wargame a Great War game!
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Montjoie!
description: Miniature wargame rules for Medieval skirmishes. The rules are developed from but different to the 2 Hour Wargames Chain Reaction 2.0 system. The rules include army lists for the major Medieval wars and both a campaign system and siege rules.
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: AK47 Supplement
description: This is a supplement to the AK47 Republic miniature wargames rules providing extensions to the standard rules (cavalry, off table artillery, ambush, collateral, victory conditions, APCs, unarmed militia, night actions, minefields, boats and AA) along with rules for using AK47 for the war in Lebanon and Africa in the 1990s.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Luftwaffe 1946
description:
What if Word War II hadn't ended in 1945…?
What if Allied Air Superiority was challenged by new
Luftwaffe secret weapons…?
What if the Manhattan Project had been delayed…?

The historical end of the Third Reich occurred in May 1945, before the Luftwaffe could bring its advanced rocket and jet aircraft into full combat service. For over 50 years, historians have debated what could have happened if a number of events had ended differently. Ted Nomura and Ben Dunn of Antarctic Press have created a fictional world where several key events delayed the allies' victory. Fitting within the broader scope of the Families of Altered Wars fictional time line, Luftwaffe 1946 and Kamikaze 1946 describe WW II in the air from the view of pilots on all sides in the conflict.

What follows is just a brief overview of the circumstances that led to World War II continuing another year, giving the Luftwaffe and their counterparts in Japan a second chance. A chance to overcome their numerical weaknesses and training deficiencies through technology and the courage of their pilots. Suspend your disbelief, consider what might have been, and join us as we explore the people and story of LUFTWAFFE 1946.

name: All About Jefferson City
description:
Another in the All About Town series. Jefferson City (Missouri), 1983. Object is for players, using dice and playing pieces, to acquire 8 Travel Cards by moving about the gameboard. (The length of the game may be varied by changing the number of cards required to win.)

Game includes $100 in Merchant Coupons.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: Rolica
description: Rolica is the second game in the ‘La Guerra de la Independencia’ series, following ‘Vimeiro’. Rolica covers the battle of the same name in August 1808 in Portugal during the Peninsular War between an army consisting of British, Spanish and Portuguese troops led by General Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, against a French army led by General Henri Delaborde.

name: Konarmiya Year of the Red Tide
description:
Konarmiya Year of the Red Tide is a simulation game of the battles between Soviet Russia and the Republic of Poland during the Summer of 1920. The Game is for two players who respectively play the roles of M.N. Tukhachevsky, commander of the Soviet forces (the Red player) and Josef Pilsudski, commander of the Polish forces (the White player).

The game uses the same system as Freikorps: The Bolsheviks Invade Germany, 1920 with 192 counters and a map covering from Warsaw to Kiev.

Rules include random events, morale, air power, two CRT tables (regular and shock), elite troops and much more...

name: Shipping
description:
A classic game of shipping, first published in the 1950s.

The players are shipping magnates sending their ship around the world to bring goods like coffee from Brazil, rice from Siam and oil from Venezuela to the Scandinavian market at the best price possible.

With its hex-based game board, changing market price for the goods and the players’ freedom of where to go, Shipping is quite an advanced game and leaves more to be decided by the players then what's normal for games of this period.

The original version is marked Damm game 387 and was published in the 1950s. There must have been at least two print runs, as some game boxes has the publisher’s logo in a white field, others in a yellow, but no variation in the game contents have been observed between these.

Confusingly, when the publisher made a Norwegian translation of the similar (and possibly related) Swedish game Wangaratta in the 1970s, they reused the name Shipping for this.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver

name: StarWars DogFight
description:
StarWars DogFight is a cardgame/boardgame for 2 players.
As you can imagine by the name it’s set in the fantastic world created by George Lucas: StarWars.
The things you need to play is the dedicated deck available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section, a little board (8x8) and a set of counters.

Each player starts with 8 ships.
The main objective is to kill 5 enemy ships (the remaining 3 will flee for fear).

REBELS starting units:
2 A-Wing (mov: 6, range: 3)
2 B-Wing (mov: 4, range: 4)
2 X-Wing (mov: 5, range: 4)
2 Y-Wing (mov: 4, range: 3)

IMPERIAL starting units:
6 TIE Fighter (mov: 5, range: 3)
2 TIE Interceptor (mov: 6, range: 4)

Players draws their cards from a common card deck.

The 3 main phases of the game are:
1- Plan
2- Movement
3- Fire
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Pirelli
description:
Pirelli is a card game played with a standard deck of 52 cards. Points are scored by having the largest total value in rows, columns, and diagonals on a 5x5 board. Additional bonus points are given by having adjacent cards of the same suit. Play is simultaneous with each player selecting a card from his or her cards. The player with the lower numbered card then places both cards.

This game was the basis for the game FNAP.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Under the Black Flag: Swashbuckling Action on the High Seas
description:
Under the Black Flag is the first supplement to the Gloire: Swashbuckling Adventure in the Age of Kings rules, and it covers swashbuckling pirate adventure in the Caribbean in the golden age of the buccaneers.

The book includes rules for creating campaigns of linked games, which will allow players to advance their model’s skills and abilities. Rules are also included for sailing and boarding ships, so players can swing from the rigging as they take galleons loaded with gold, or fire a broadside from a pirate sloop. Almost two dozen new character archetypes are introduced, as well as new abilities and skills. Seven scenarios round out the book-tales of treasure buried hastily on desert islands, mutinies, and divided loot gone amiss.

Sharpen your cutlass and prime your pistol, for we leave the world of the kings’ laws and sail Under the Black Flag!

Expands:

Gloire: Swashbuckling Adventure in the Age of Kings
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Fragapalooza
description:
(from the rules)
Isn’t it fun to blow the crap out of your friends while playing video games? Don’t you get a sense of smug self-satisfaction? Now get that feeling without getting motion sickness or eye-strain. Fragapalooza is a miniatures game of multi-player, shoot-‘em-up, video game-style action for 2 to 10 players.

The basic setting of Fragapalooza is your standard sci-fi shooter like Halo or Unreal. Players frag one-another on a board strewn with deadly weapons and fantastic power-ups. Change the names of the weapons, throw down some appropriate terrain and you can turn the game into WWII action, a western, spy thriller, etc.

Edit: The second edition of this game is now named "Frag-O-Rama".

name: Fields of Battle: Primitive Combat
description:
The first installment in the Fields of Battle series. A print-and-play board game for 2 or more players. Playable with community deck or customized individual decks. FREE DOWNLOAD

The core Fields of Battle board/card game is a combat tactics and strategy game set in a pre gun powder era. You and your opponent(s) each have an HQ and a small army (multiple d6). Double-effect cards allow you to add more troops or cause something interesting to happen. Upgrade your troops, move across varying terrain, take advantage of your surroundings and destroy an enemy HQ. Simple. Satisfying.

http://www.feltd.com/games/
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Maximilian!: Fast Play Rules and Army Lists for the High Renaissance (1400-1550)
description:
From publisher:

"Maximilian! Rules. Fast Play rules for the High Renaissance. Contains 48 pages, with card cover and play sheet. Has all rules required, plus 30 army lists. Please see the Maximilian Army packs for complete starter armies."

The system shares basing and many mechanics with the DBx series.

name: Trail Drive
description:
Trail Drive by the Aarco Playing Card Company of Chicago, New York, Los Angeles and Toronto. From the box; Round up your herd and hit the trail with your Chuckwagon, Cowboys and Longhorns in this exciting new game of the West. Watch out for rustlers, pardner, good luck on your TRAIL DRIVE.

The game includes 40 new Western Cards and a rule card. For boys and girls Ages 6 - 12

Rules:
How to Play Trail Drive

THE GAME: Try to play as many cards as you can each turn to build a long Trail Drive with a Chuckwagon, Cowboys and Cows, laying your cards in a row on the table in front of you. A Rustler might stop you, but a Sheriff gets you started again.
THE DEAL: If four or more play, deal 4 cards apiece, then play that round, deal 4 more and play again, continuing to deal and play until the deck is used up. If three play, deal 5 cards apiece each round. If two play, deal 6.
THE PLAY: After each round is dealt, beginning at left of the dealer you each play what you can from your hand. The first three cards must be 1 Chuckwagon and 2 Cowboys in any order; then you add cows, the more the better. Discard the rest of your hand, face down. After each round the discards are added to the bottom of the deck. You may play a Rustler card to stop anyone’s Trail Drive when it has cows. Then no more Cows may be added, until a Sheriff is played on the Rustler. You may start a new Trail Drive, when your first Drive is rustled (with 1 Chuckwagon, 2 Cowboys, then Cows, as before), but you may not play on more than one Trail Drive in one turn. Therefore, you may not play a Sheriff card and start a new Drive in the same turn.
When Deck is used up, whether or not it comes out even, the dealer calls, “Last Round.” On the last round, each player passes to the next player the cards he can’t use, instead of discarding.
THE WINNER: When all possible plays have been made, you each take out all the Rustlers, plus two Cows for each Rustler. Count the rest. Whoever has the most wins.

name: Astral Conflict
description:
Astral Conflict is a starship miniatures game designed for small groups of ships. The game includes rules for custom building fighters and capital ships. In addition to face-to-face, rules for double-blind and play-by-email rules are included. Other features include:

Scenarios
Master Engineers
Boarding Parties
Planets/Asteroids
Satellites/Probes
Space Stations/Installations
Suns/Solar Flares
Frigates
Escape Pods
Space Mines
Cloaking Devices
Artificial Intelligence Crews
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Die fliegenden Händler von Karthago
description:
This game was published in Peer Sylvester's book "Jam Dudel" by Bambus Spieleverlag:

4 to 8 try to get as many gems as possible. Beginning with the same hand of cards, they follow a ritual of blind bidding which eliminates the merchants with the lowest bidding. The last remaining merchants wins the gem.

name: Inside the Armor
description:
A game about damage control inside warships in WWII. This Playtest Kit simulates combat aboard the USS Johnston DD-557, a Fletcher class destroyer which sank by gunfire off Samar in late 1944.

It's a two-player game: one player controls the ship, and the other controls all threats to the ship.

Players must weigh relative risks constantly. For the US player, in charge of the ship, it's about triage. For the IJ player trying to sink the ship, it's about trying to construct deadly combinations.

Playtest kit is available here:

UPDATED 5/26/2017

1) Game board: https://goo.gl/h2cZDg

2) Rules etc: https://goo.gl/37xY0B

3) Example of play: https://goo.gl/J0S91J

All feedback welcome.

Cheers,
Jonathan Tristram Miller
categories: Fighting, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: A Glint of Bayonets
description:
Set of miniatures wargame rules for fighting battles of the American Civil War circa 1862. From the cover:

"Being a set of very playable recreational Wargame rules that will create, to some degree, the excitement and pageantry of Tactical Battles of the late War for Southern Independence"

Assuming 25mm\28mm figures are used:

Game scale: One inch = 22 yards
One infantry figure = 25 men
Twenty infantry figures equal a 500 men regiment
Six figures and three gun models equal a 6-gun battery

Reduced scale rulers are provided for playing with figures smaller than 25mm\28mm.

Mounted cavalry is not covered in the rules (it's assumed that they have dismounted prior to the start of the game).

Sequence of play:
1) Movement Phase: Brigades are moved in order of a draw from a deck of cards. Command rolls are made to determine which regiments in the brigade may move. A number of dice are then rolled to determine how far the regiments may move.

2) Firing Phase 1 - All stationary artillery fires and morale tests from casualties are resolved.

3) Firing Phase 2 - All stationary infantry fires and morale tests from casualties are resolved.

4) Firing Phase 3 - All "move and fire" artillery fires and morale tests from casualties are resolved.

5) Firing Phase 4 - All moving infantry fires and morale tests from casualties are resolved.

6) Combat Morale Phase - Test morale for charging and charged units.

7) Close Combat Phase - Fight all close combats and test morale.

8) Morale Adjustment Phase - Make all permanent morale adjustments due to various conditions.

9) Rally Phase - Attempt to rally all Routed units from the previous game turn.

10) Major Morale Phase - Determine each army's Major Morale state and act accordingly.

The Order of Battle for Antietam is given at the end of the rules. No scenarios are included.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
publishers: And That's The Way It Was..., Sergeants 3

name: Chaos Cruisers
description:
A Changing Landscapes game for the piecepack.

In the far future, ordinary racing has become obsolete. The fans have grown bored with driving around in loops at high speeds. So, a new genre of racing is born—the Chaos Cruiser. These unique hover-vehicles are designed for pure speed and maneuverability. And they’ll need every bit of it because the racetrack is not what it seems. The track is made up of individual modules that shuffle about, ratcheting up the difficulty. Also, each driver has radio-controlled drones that can be placed as obstacles in their opponents’ paths. In the midst of all this chaos, one wily cruiser will prove to be the fastest, most agile, and most crafty of them all. Who will earn the Chaos Cup?

The piecepack tiles are laid out, so as to create a racetrack. Each player controls one cruiser, represented by a piecepack die. The number that is face-up on the die designates the speed of that cruiser. The coins have two uses. The null and ace coins are placed on the track as impassible obstacles. The 2, 3, 4, and 5 coins are used as nitro-boosts or shock-breaks, which greatly increase or decrease your speed. The pawns stand for the gates along the course. When a cruiser enters the tile containing a gate, he checks that gate off on the race progress chart. When all the cruisers have reached a certain gate, a chaos round is initiated, in which each player can move the two obstacles of his color. Also, the player in last place can move 3 tiles of the racetrack to entirely new locations. The first player to complete the race by passing through each of the four gates twice in the correct sequence is the winner.

name: Switch
description:
Be the first to move all your pieces into your target area and detain your opponent. With jumps and clever changes of your track switches you block your opponent and redirect your pieces to the shortest route. If you move into the opponent's target area instead, he then has to change one of his own switches as his next turn.
A neat wooden game with nice components. Several variants (such as possible capture) are included.

name: A Few Bricks Short of a Load
description:
From the game box:
The Exciting Game of Visual Identification!
In this fun and exciting party game, players have 3 minutes to identify the objects pictured on the card.

Category topics range from dog & cat breeds, to candy, sports, cars, flowers, birds, animals and much more! There are categories for almost every interest - so everyone can enjoy the fun!
