A promo pack with four Game: Black Stories, given out for free at SPIEL Essen 2019 at the publisher moses. Verlag GmbH's booth. Two of the stories were also relased in the Black Stories: Nele Neuhaus Edition, the other two in the Black Stories: Killer Ladies Edition.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

name: Yukimura Gaiden Episode 0
description:
A tactical level wargame that covers some battles of the Osaka Siege summer campaign (1615), the day before the final battle.
The title is taken from the Japanese popular culture hero "Yukimura Sanada" who was a commanding samurai at the siege of Osaka. A "gaiden" is a tale.

The basic game engine is from Yukimura Gaiden (episode 1). Some rules were changed to fit to the smaller battlefield.
Each player controls either the Tokugawa shogunate or Toyotomi clan forces.

The game include four scenarios: two historical "Battle of Yao Wakae" and "Battle of Domyoji", a fictional situation "Domyoji", a combined scenario of these two battles.
The victory condition varies in each scenario, such as elimination of leaders or crossing of a river.

Number of counters: 252 pieces
Maps: 2 half
Game time: May 6, 1615
Playing time: 2-3 hours
Number of players: 2 people

(translated and adapted from publisher's and user's description)



Notes:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Osaka
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanada_Yukimura
Gaiden: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaiden / https://jisho.org/word/%E5%A4%96%E4%BC%9D

name: SSO: Temporal Anomaly
description:
A 31 card tuck box including 24 Challenge Cards, 6 Mission cards and 1 Achievement card. Allows players to face a new threat and tell a new story of survival horror on the SSO.
The new deck's theme features a strange temporal anomaly that is warping and twisting time throughout the SSO, causing previously dealt with threats to return and overwhelm the thin stretched crew.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: El Palomar
description:
DOVECOTE
Let the competition begins!
The flocks of pigeons are ready to fly off. Your goal is to land in the best boxes of the dovecote and to avoid getting stuck in the mud. Show your skills and lead your flock to the final victory.
Dovecote is a fun dexterity game for 2 to 4 players (6-year-olds and up) and with a duration of 15 minutes approximately.

In Dovecote, each player have a pigeons team. The players throw pigeon tokens to a 3D dovecote. The winner is who pass or put pigeons in the best places of the dovecote.

—description from the publisher (translated)

EL PALOMAR
¡Comienza la competición!
Los equipos de palomas están preparados para alzar el vuelo. Su objetivo aterrizar en los mejores lugares del palomar y evitar quedar atrapados en el barro. Demuestra tu habilidad y lleva a tu equipo a la victoria final.
El Palomar es un divertido juego de habilidad para 2 a 4 jugadores, a partir de 6 años y una duración aproximada de 15 minutos.

En El Palomar, cada jugador tiene un equipo de palomas. Los jugadores lanzan una ficha de palomas a un palomar en 3D. El ganador es quien pasa o pone palomas en los mejores lugares del palomar.

—description from the publisher (English)

name: Frozen 2: Magic Circle
description:
The thick forest north of Arendelle is known as a magical place. Since the Forgotten War, the inhabitants of the kingdom have been trying to avoid it. All local paths lead to the dense thicket, and elemental spirits glide amidst its branches and leaves.
Get ready for a big trip! You have the honor of accompanying Anna, Elsa and their friends on the way north. Will you be able not to lose them in the enchanted forest, or will the ancient powers make you wander in magic circles?

The rules are explained in 5 minutes!

Play Movement cards and move your piece
Reveal Characters and resolve their effects
Remember where your Characters are during other players’ turns as they will get flipped over at the end of their turns
Whoever reveals 6 Characters of their color, wins!


—description from the publisher (English)

Холодное сердце 2: Заколдованный круг

Дремучий лес к северу от Эренделла прослыл волшебным местом. Со времён забытой войны жители королевства стараются обходить его стороной. Местные тропы норовят завести с опушки в густую чащу, и меж ветвей и листьев скользят духи стихий.
Готовьтесь к большому путешествию! Вам выпала честь сопровождать Анну, Эльзу и её друзей по дороге на север. Сможете ли вы найти их в волшебном лесу, или древнее волшебство заставит вас бродить по заколдованному кругу?

Простые правила объясняются за 5 минут

Играйте карты движения и перемещайте свою фишку
Открывайте персонажей и разыгрывайте их действия
Запоминайте местоположение своих персонажей
Первый, кто открыл 6 персонажей своего цвета, побеждает!


—description from the publisher (Russian)
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Track Movement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: The North Sea Runesaga: Fifth Player Expansion
description:
Three Runestones, three more Inscription tokens (shield, hammer, and horn), and a fifth player board, along with a card detailing how to incorporate these, all come with the expansion.

—user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Schatten der Macht: Verborgene Mächte
description:
In this expansion for Schatten der Macht, we present four new factions (Krieger des Brazoragh, Korsmalbund, Clan von Nai Ashyrr, Mehrer der Macht) and their grey eminences. Added to this are 32 new organisations (including twelve fear-inducing demon cults), as well as cards and rules for mercenaries.

—description form the publisher (translated)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: NumberMatch
description:
In Numbermatch you need to make sums.
You need to start in with the 4 numbers in the middle of the board and from that way you can add, subtraction, multiply and divide the numbers to lay down the answer.

Every player starts with 7 numbers (randomly given at the start of the game).
Players go by turn and choose a number from there own board to lay down at a sum. The number that you lay down is the score that you make

Example: 6 6 36 because 6x6 is 36. You got 36 points..
The next player can lay down 42 if he has this number..6+36=42.. Or 30 etc..

In your turn you can also swap numbers from your board from randomly pickt numbers out of the bag.

When a player is out of numbers the game ends and all the scores (written down by a player) are added to see who has the most points.

A game to use for math leasons and to learn your math skills.

name: Saucy Grannies
description:
Saucy Grannies is a competitive, light and family-friendly card game featuring blind bidding, card drafting and set collection mechanics.

You play as a granny participating in a neighbourhood cook-off where the sauce is everything. Score points by sending your family members to the market to purchase choice ingredients, call up your granny friends for their signature sauce recipes and impress the judges by making the best sauces at your disposal!

The player with the most points after 9 rounds is declared the sauciest granny!

You'll love Saucy Grannies if you: 


Enjoy collection and building games.
Delight in outwitting your friends with sneaky tactics.
Thrive on uncertainty by capitalising on probability.
Are looking for a light, introductory game that can be taught in 5 and played in 30 minutes.


—description from the publisher

name: Morale Napoleon: Grand Tactical Rules for the Napoleonic Wars
description:
It wasn’t Napoleon or Wellington’s duty to order units to fire, charge or change formation. That is the duty of others, of the battalion and regimental officers. Where Morale Napoleon excels is in allowing players to “do their duty”. You are in charge of a Corps of soldiers ranging in size from 20,000 to 40,000 men. Once you become comfortable with the rules, you can easily double those numbers. Your duty is simple:

Have a plan. Deploy your troops to accomplish your plan. Decide where to place your reserve and when to use it. In Morale Napoleon, once you have sent your troops into action, it is out of your control, just like in real life. Did you plan well? Is your deployment correct? Will you know when the moment is right to launch the reserve? Do you have what it takes to be in command?

Regimental size formations that allow you to easily command a Corps or more. Mechanics that provide a fun game with realistic conclusions – no “gaming the rules”.

Army lists for over 20 of the nations that fought in the Napoleonic Wars – from the major players to their smaller allies.

Reinforcement tables that reflect Napoleon’s dictum of march divided, fight united.

Complete rules that allow you to pay solo or co-operatively against the game as well as competitively, head to head.

A light book keeping Campaign System that ties your battles together while giving you a reason to fight and telling you when all is lost.

name: Mage Wars: Ankh of Asyra Promo Card
description:
Initially intended to be given with purchase of the first print of Mage Wars Arena: Battlegrounds Domination, this promo card was incorrectly sold separately by some retailers, and was also later released by Arcane Wonders with limited availability, including from the Bower's Game Corner 2017 Kickstarter campaign.

Ankh of Asyra:
Equipment: Light
When a Nonliving creature enters this Mage's zone, it receives 1 direct light damage. At the end of this Mage's Action Phase, each Nonliving creature in his zone receives 1 direct light damage.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: ブタに神樹は癒されて。(Holy Tree Healed by the Pigs)
description:
The theme of the game is to heal the tree of life.

Player earn points by

Placing their token in the main area (Being the highest of the row earns you points unless the total value exceed 11, then the smallest get the points )
Draft and use gemstones for scoring combo
Bet on the player ranking at the end of the round


—description from the publisher (translated)

神樹の癒し手を決する戦略ゲームです。

ゲームのポイントは３つ。

【１．陣取り】チップを配置し、数値を競います。ボーナス獲得条件が反転するバーストありの心理戦！
【２．コンボ】12種類の魔石を使いこなそう。強力な組み合わせを考えて流れを引き寄せろ！
【３．カジノ】順位を予想しチップを賭けろ！わくわくドキドキのギャンブルシステム搭載！！

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Predictive Bid

name: Neo-Morphosis: Infestation – The Third Instar
description:
The Third Instar expansion for Neo-Morphosis introduces more morphosis and new alien forms with ranged attacks!

Contains:-
19 Miniatures
2 double sided map tiles
1 double sided narrative room
4 Character ID cards
12 cards

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Alleycat
description:
Alleycat is based on the informal sport of the same name.
It is an entertaining Peruvian card game that will bring out your mental agility in a scenario of constant change.

In Alleycat you must be the first to reach all the check points in a city that you don't know, competing with people of different nationalities and with nothing but your bike and your ability to find the best route to victory!

The game starts with the definition of the map, for which 3 checkpoints and the starting point are placed randomly. All players start at the starting point but each one can build their route as they prefer since the 3 checkpoints can be visited in any order, as long as they can all be collected.
After this it is determined who will be the first player of the round and the direction in which the turns will be passed. In that same order the characters will be placed at the starting point and 4 cards from the main deck will be drawn.

At the beginning of his turn each player receives 5 energy points, which he can use to move his character or play a card from his hand. These cards can be road cards, action cards or accessory cards:

The road cards are played on the map always adjacent to a previously played road card and keeping concordance, so that there is an adequate route to gradually reach the different check points.
The action cards have different effects that can be played on road cards or on accessory cards.
The accessory cards are stored in a player's backpack (it can be from an opponent or your own) and can have various effects, whether permanent or single use.


At the end of his turn, each player draws cards from the main deck until he has 4 cards in hand again.

The final round is determined when a player collects the 3 check points but the remaining players can continue playing until the current round is completed.
If more than one player manages to collect all 3 check points in the final round, a tie is declared, otherwise the only player who managed to do so wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement

name: FINI!
description:
An ultrafast dice game for 2 players aged 8 years and upward.
Two players face each other, 15 dice lying between them. And here we go! Who has the best overview, the fastest hand, and the steadiest nerves? Be the one who grabs the correct dice fastest, who keeps sight on his opponent and who shouts FINI! without hesitating, and you win the duel. But watch out: In this game you can’t afford to make any mistakes!

name: Dice Monster
description:
Dice Monster - The darkness monster came to this world. Someone summoned them for their own sins, fulfil deeply cunning and ambitious. Players will play as heroes who was students in this school or the adventurers with special abilities, ultimate skill and dice power.

Roll your dices! caught the darkness monster then fliped to backside, changed the darkness to be your good friends...the little monster. Depending on the players' decision, bet your luck and keep eyes on monsters until the boss will unlock and appear.

Semi-cooperation with your friends when the boss came out! , but the only one could win. The student who got the most points from their little monsters will win this game.

Do not forget to learn the characters base story for fun!

—description from the publisher

name: Escape game: Psy Island
description:
A complete kit to organize a puzzling escape game evening with friends, in one of the most oppressive worlds: that of psychiatric hospitals. The director of the asylum has been kidnapped by a madman: your team of psychiatrists has one hour to find him by following the rules imposed by the psychopath. But are you sure that you and your colleagues are not suffering from serious disorders?

As a young ambitious psychiatrist, you applied for lectures from eminent Professor Wise. He invited you to meet him in his Asylum, on island Asylum (aka: Psy Island).

Prof. Wise and you were discussing in his office, when an issue with a dangerous patient occurred. Few minutes after Prof. leaving, you hear the office's door locking...

In Escape game – Psy Island, the game master (the dangerous patient, aka: Psy Island's angel) choose and hide every clues and enigmas, before the play. All along the play, he will check players' answer, give them some punishments for theirs mistakes. On the other side, the psychiatrists try to understand what append and save the Prof. Wise.

A variant could be play where GM give roles to each players.

Components:
• 1 24-page booklet for the game master (scenario, preparations, rules, solutions)
• 60 cards divided into 7 types of games (Amnesia, Bipolar, etc.)
• 1 psychiatric prescription
• 1 Rorschach test
• 1 map of the hospital
• 10 envelopes to conceal
• 6 psychological profiles to introduce a role play dimension.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mechanical Revolution
description:
A battle card game for 2+ players where robotic armoured combat suits fight for supremacy. Use Mechanics to upgrade, fix and modify your combat suit. Then use your Weapons and Equipment to overcome your opponents Shields and damage them until they have no Health Points remaining.

Mechanic cards are used as manna but rotate to provide other options for deployment.

name: Starving Artists: Sketch & Study Expansion
description:
The first "new game mechanism" expansion for Starving Artists from the 2019 Kickstarter:

These cards would be worth no food or points and don't count toward a canvas victory. However, when you complete the card, you can "sell" it (as your free action for the day) and take five paints from the bag of your choice. Not a random pull.

These cards would be available to all players to take instead of a normal buy action. They cost nothing to take, but there's a limited number of them and you can only have one at a time.

They are painted using five of any paint cubes like any other normal paint action.

What this solves

This new Sketch and Study option means:

Players have a better way to convert unwanted/unneeded paints;
Players can use the sketches to better utilize their painting actions (e.g., if you only need to paint once or twice to finish a canvas); and
While they last, there's always something "to buy" regardless of how much paint you have and regardless if the market doesn't have a great set for you personally.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Devil's Chess
description:
Devil's Chess is a deck of cards that compliments traditional chess. It is easy to learn, infinitely re-playable, and is wildly addictive. Devil's Chess brings modern board game mechanics to an old classic. With Devil's Chess you get a bit of randomness, new mechanics and card combos, and a whole lot of new tricks to surprise your opponent. Devil's Chess brings Chess out of the 6th century and into the 21st!

Setting up the game is easy. Shuffle both decks, and set them to the left and right of the chessboard. Each player is dealt a hand of three Playable Cards. To begin the game flip over one Rule Card. Players then take turns playing cards and moving pieces. When a player draws a “Devil’s Chess” card, another new Rule Card is flipped over.


At the beginning of your turn, draw a Playable card if you do not have three
You may use or discard one Playable Card
Your turn ends after you move a chess piece


The game is over when a King is put into checkmate or when a “More Ways to Win!” condition is met by a player.

With 30 unique Rule Cards and 90 Playable Cards, Devil’s Chess is unbelievably re-playable. We know you’ll make it a mainstay in your game library.

—description from the publisher

name: Zombies!!!: Vegas Kickstarter Promotional Cards
description: A set of 10 promotional event cards generated during the Zombies!!!: Vegas Kickstarter campaign (March 2020).

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Stormcast Eternals: Sacrosanct Chamber
description:
Warriors who channel the magical energies of Sigmar through potent weapons, the Stormcast Eternals of the Sacrosanct Chamber turn their attentions to the Chaos-infested Bloodwind Spoil and the foul denizens that call it home.

Harness the mystical power of the Sacrosanct Chamber with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, the cards in this set enable you to restore some semblance of order to the Chaos-infested wastes. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of 12 fighter cards provide profiles four types of Evocators, two types Castigators and six types of Sequitors.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as two divider cards to keep track of tokens that apply to fighters in game. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: SEND IT! The Mountain Biking Board Game
description:
The board game every mountain biker needs.

SEND IT! is for those times when you want to ride, but can't — maybe you're injured, maybe it's too muddy or maybe you're just tired from your latest adventure — because no matter what, even when you can't ride, you should be able to SEND IT!

SEND IT! is a fast-paced mountain bike game where you ride, train, prepare and "send" progressively harder features as you race from the trail head to be the first to send the final feature and reach the Golden Burrito.

Riders roll to train and move while drawing prepare cards to improve their chances of successfully sending the next feature, all while trying not to crash. Should you play it safe or just "SEND IT!"?

On each turn, riders choose two actions, which can be the same or different, from the following options:
1. Ride - roll the riding die and move 1-3 spaces along the singletrack.
2. Train - roll the two training dice to gain the skill points you need to send the next feature.
3. Prepare - draw a Prepare card to gain points (which help you recover from a crash and send the next feature) or special skills.
4. SEND IT - if you are on a feature and have the necessary skills, play Prepare card points and roll the 20-sided die to try to send it and pass on to more difficult singletrack.

Just like real mountain biking, crashing can happen in a variety of ways - you can crash while training, while riding or while sending it - and until you recover from your crash you can't do anything but prepare, giving the other riders the chance to get ahead.

The first rider to send the final feature (the "Hall of Fame") and reach the Golden Burrito wins the game.

For a more advanced version, add the "Trail Building" action which allows riders to place the features instead of randomly placing them at the beginning of the game.

-description from publisher

name: Puppy Park
description:
Let’s walk the dogs in the park. Hopefully they’ll make some new friends!

In Puppy Park, players take turns placing dogs next to each other. If you place them so the breeds match they will become friends and you can bring more dogs to the park. The first player with no more dogs at home wins the game (and gets the bone!).

EQUIPMENT

Base game (2 players): 28 dual-hexagon tiles (with all possible combinations of 7 breeds of puppies), 2 dog houses, 1 bone, carrying case.

An expansion for 3-4 players is also available.

GAME OVERVIEW

Players take turns placing their tiles on the table adjacent to other tiles or atop them. By creating pairs of dogs of the same breed they get extra turns. The first player getting rid of all her tiles wins the game.

Dog houses are used to cover dogs. Tree-poop tiles are used to force/prevent players from placing tiles next to them.

The bone goes to the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: The Body Farm
description:
1930. The Great Depression is in full swing. The suicide rate is up. Hope is in short supply. Life is hard...

Some simply deal with the struggle. Others seek a way out. If the stories are to be believed, Jackson Montgomery suffered a psychotic break and buried his wife and three girls alive at various places on the farm in order to escape the responsibilities of being a husband and father in such a difficult time. He was never seen or heard from again. The newspapers dubbed him “The Gravedigger,” and before long the stories were enough to transform him into an urban legend who might return at any point to punish anyone foolish enough to trespass on his land.

Fast forward to modern day.

When Museum Nocturnus, a cabinet of curiosities dedicated to all things odd and bizarre, decide to open a Gravedigger exhibit they enlist the help of the S.T.A.L.K. ghost hunting group and plan an excursion to the Montgomery farm to find out what really happened all those years ago. The museum group unexpectedly disappears while exploring the farm, and the S.T.A.L.K. group is left to piece together what happened. One of the only bits of evidence they have is a note nailed to the front door of the Montgomery house impossibly signed by The Gravedigger. It’s not possible that Jackson Montgomery has returned from the beyond to murder more innocents. But, if not him, then who? Is this someone’s idea of a joke? Or is it possible that someone else has taken up The Gravedigger’s mantle?

Join the S.T.A.L.K. group and find out what really happened at a place that the locals call The Body Farm.

Difficulty Level: 6/10

name: Tökmagok Kincsvadászat
description:
Four kids (known from a popular Hungarian kids' book series) are diving in the sea. Above their heads the pirates' treasure chest fell into the water and they are trying to catch the treasures. However, currents of the sea move these jewellery around.

This game of logic is played in four rounds, each round consisting of four turns. In each turn a wave tile is revealed and treasures move in the given direction. In every 3rd and 4th turn of each round kids can catch the treasures, however the number of moves they can do in a round is limited. The way treasures move are more and more calculable in subsequent rounds so what feels rather random in the first round becomes perfectly calculable in the last round. Can you collect the most treasure? Or, in the advanced game, can you collect the most valuable sets?

name: King's Trial
description:
In King’s Trial, 2 to 5 brave adventurers will compete in the competition
of their lives - Get rid of the dragon and become the heir to the throne.

Travel through the randomly generated realm, completing various quests for the king
to gain his favor. Whether it be shooing away some evil sheep that are bothering
the farmers, organizing a magnificent party in the local amphitheater or
gathering delicious pastries from a far-away village.

On your travels expect to meet all manner of characters who might try to block
your way. Help your fellow adventurers or hinder their progress, just don’t be
surprised if they abandon you when you need them the most.
Collect gems, help cards and king’s favors to aid you in your journey, and only
once you are ready, you may face the terrifying dragon!...to bribe him of course.
You’re not crazy enough to face him in direct combat, are you? The fastest
adventurer to fulfil three quests and get rid of the Dragon will win the

KING’S TRIAL!
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Race, Take That

name: きゃらおこし (Kyaraokoshi)
description:
In きゃらおこし (Ki Raokoshi), the players are designing mascots for a fictional city by adding three characteristics of the city to a template. Mechanically, the game includes several dry erase cards with outlines of various potential mascot shapes, and a series of cards with three choices of traits for the city (e.g. it is known for its shipping industry).

The start player chooses 1 of 4 types of cards, and one of the traits on it for all players to represent on their mascot cards. Once all the players are finished drawing, the next player chooses a card. The process repeats for a third card as well. Once everyone has named their drawing, the players discuss and vote on which would be best to represent the town. Points are earned, and the player with the most points after 3 rounds wins.

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Blaubeuren
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Stormcast Eternals Warrior Chamber
description:
Warrior Chambers are made up of many different retinues that specialise in varying aspects of war. In battle, however, it is common to find all these Stormcasts fighting as one. Disciplined Liberators and Judicators of the Redeemer Conclaves form the heart of the battle line, while swift Prosecutors from the Angelos Conclaves hunt down those enemies who attempt to flee. Mightiest are the veteran champions of the Paladin Conclaves, whose powerful weaponry and breathtaking skill sees them and their brethren survive even in the cursed lands of the Eightpoints.

Bring the might of the Warrior Chambers to your battles with this card pack! With this set, you’ll be able to bring some of Sigmar’s most stalwart warriors to your games of Warcry, with fighter rules for a vast range of different units. What’s more, an ability card lets you harness the storm-forged wrath of these warriors with a range of bespoke tactics and tricks.

This set contains:
- A faction ability card, allowing you to harness tactics, tricks and abilities unique to this warband, including the runemarks you need to use them. The reverse allows you to identify the fighters in your warband. The set contains a faction abilities card in each of the following languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian.
- Fighter cards for 30 types of fighter, including Liberators, Prosecutors, Judicators and Paladins
- 2x divider cards, used to keep track of any tokens that apply to fighters in games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Batallitas
description:
Batallitas is a very simple wargame for two players. Its game system allows to create historical armies until the middle ages as well as fantasy armies. It is an easy game to explain and very cheap to manufacture. It is a fast game, in total about 20 minutes per battle, which aims to have more fun than being faithful to history, although it tries to find a bit of rigor within its simplicity.
The game consists of moving, and attacking and defending with dice of 6. It is surely too easy for anyone looking to recreate, but it is suitable for children.

—description from the designer

“Batallitas” es un wargame muy sencillo para dos jugadores. Su sistema de juego permite crear ejércitos históricos hasta el medievo así como ejércitos de fantasía. Es un juego fácil de explicar y muy económico de fabricar. Se trata de un juego rápido, en total unos 20 minutos por batalla, que pretende divertir más que ser fiel a la historia, aunque intenta buscar un poco de rigor dentro de su simpleza.
El juego consiste en mover, y atacar y defender con dados de 6. Seguramente es demasiado sencillo para quien busque recrear, pero es apto para niños.
—description from the designer (Spanish)

name: Master of Wills: Cloudecho Fringe War Neutral Pack
description:
The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Cloudecho is linking their collectiv consciousness with these new technologies, creating an advanced evolution.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Castaway
description:
You are stranded on a desert island. Use the resources at your disposal to make life more comfortable and/or increase your chances of rescue. Get points for developing your island. But will you try to make a home on this tropical paradise or do everything you can to get out of there?

Castaway is a 'roll and write' game. One player rolls the dice and each player decides how they will use the dice rolls on their own board. The dice show the coordinates on the map and indicate the area you must work on each turn. The choice of action within that area is yours. Will you cut down trees or plant new ones? Will you build a shelter or plunder a shipwreck? The choice is yours.

The game finishes when one player is rescued, abandoned or becomes self-sustained.

Castaway is a 'Placemat' game - a game contained entirely within an A3 placemat (including the rules). Just add two standard D6 dice.

On the reverse side of each placemat is a second game - Beach Life.

Both games have a desert island theme.

—description from the designer

name: Tsukiji: Special Cards
description:
8 promo cards for Tsukiji, delivered as extras from Brazilian crowdfunding campaign and Argentinian preorders:


Police officer (Keisatsu)
Cat (Neko)
Plunger (Suisoku)
Refund (Modoru)
Ice (Kori)
Insomnia (Fumin-shoo)
Rummage (Kichi)
Pickpocket (Dorobo)
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rus'
description:
Rus' is set somewhere in Russia during the 'Time of Troubles.' The king has fallen, but has left no one to take his place! This sparks interest in even the poorest people of Rus'. As a peasant in this game, each player works their way up the classes to gain royalty in hopes of taking over the kingdom.

This is a 2 - 4 player game that plays in about 45 minutes. It's a secret identity building game. Not like your ordinary secret identity games. You will claim to be whatever character you please (carry out their ability) and build up your estate. Just don't get caught lying by the other players! Action cards will also help you gain advantage by building on your property or even by attacking others.

The game ends when someone buys there way into becoming the king, but the winner is whoever accumulates the most Royal Points. Anyone who claims 10 Royal Points before the King is bought will win automatically.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Ladder Climbing, Pattern Building, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Parolandia
description:
Build your own sentence! Combine puzzle pieces and build your own sentence, as long and as funny as you can. Challenge your friends by making the most original sentence and try to motivate each of them!

Each players starts with 15 puzzle pieces representing words. Each turn they compose a meaningful and grammatically correct sentence with the pieces they have (and possible shared pieces), and scores points for sentence length plus bonuses for reusing words and making combos of nouns, verbs and so on. Then the dices tell him how many puzzle pieces he draws again.
Winner is who has the most points after a threshold is reached.

name: Top Con Card Game
description:
You've seen the movies, you're just as clever, and now you can prove it by conning your friends and stealing your loved one's money! (Metaphorically, of course)

Top Con lets you become that villain you've always dreamed of being with the added bonus of keeping you right where you want to be -- on your couch. Because who wants to do hard time in a high-security prison? Not you, which is why the notion of stealing Grandma's heist sounds as delightful as ever!

The Target - complete as many heists as you can to be the player with the most money by the end of the game. It's only the richest player who will be able to claim the prestigious title of Top Con!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Programmed Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Against Covid-19
description:
500000！
This is not just a number, but a once fresh life!

That equates to 196 people per hour, or one person every 18 seconds.

Covid-19 has caused a great disaster to the world.

Against Covid-19 is a co-operative/ Solitaire PNP game, players fight the virus by adjusting the defense level of each region, organizing more medical personnel, developing medical facilities and factories, producing medical materials and treating infected patients.

Although the high defense level can effectively control the spread of the virus, it will also have a huge impact on the economy, which is also a problem for players.
Now let's start the challenge！
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Boy Band Builder: The Card Game
description:
Welcome to Boy Band Builder: The Card Game. A Fun & Fast Paced Game for 2-4 Players, 15-30 Minutes.

Game Description:
Now you can build and manage the Boyband of your Dreams. Develop new artists, build your group, and spin it into solid gold! Recruit boys to enhance your group. The boys feature 4 characteristics (Pipes, Moves,Heat, and Cool) which can be enhanced with Star Cards. You can throw shade at the competition and fight for all all the best Gigs. It’s a cutthroat business, do you have what it takes to make it to the top?

Gameplay:
Players take turns in sequence and may take two actions per turn from a range of options. Players can recruit Artists for their band, draw two Star Cards into their hand, play a Star Card on an artist or band, or do a Gig. Players are trying to do all the best gigs before the competition, so they must play Star Cards on their artists to buff them up enough to do the gig. The combination and order of actions is critical to building a band with the stats you need and handle the negative Star Cards coming from your opponents.

The game ends when the Gig deck runs dry, whoever has done the most Gigs and made the most $ wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Marvel Battlebooks: Iron Man
description:
Two cards were bound into the comic book. One listed the rules and identified the features of the game. The second card was the character's Maneuver Card which listed the actions the character could take in combat.

Gameplay was similar to Lost Worlds. Each player picks a character and game books are exchanged so each player has a book that depicts POV illustrations of the opponent attacking. Maneuvers are simultaneously selected and the matrix encoded into the books determines the results of each exchange.

Iron Man was #4 in the series.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Global Crisis: A Cooperative Game of Future Earth
description:
Overview
GLOBAL CRISIS blends cooperative game play with elements of hidden role games. Your leadership represents a major world superpower and a collective of nations. Can you overcome ancient challenges and bring about world peace? Global Crisis is a collaborative game (with a twist) where everyone is working to stabilize global chaos. The twist is that one player might be an agent of chaos. Yes, might. This potential saboteur raises suspicion and increases the challenge. Trust will have to be earned, hopefully before it is too late!

Game Play
If players collectively score enough points, they win. Players score by passing as many global policies as possible (before time runs out) to address the five overarching sets of Global Challenges. If a player is the "Agent of Chaos," that player can only win if the group scores in the lowest bracket possible—thus causing all other players to collectively lose.

This game can be played with 2 to 5 players. All players begin with five cards. In the initial rounds, players gather as much information as they can about the cards in the hands of other players. Next, they will aid each other to remove challenge cards from their hands, organize them by sets (color), and finally try to score on each set. There are five sets of challenges that can score. Scoring is based on how many cards within a set the group can collect and whether the group can form a unique policy on each set—all before time runs out. Time expires when the players have formed a policy for all five sets of challenges, or when a player attempts to draw a card from the deck, but the deck has run out.

Theme
Global Crisis::, Earth 2265, the world is on the edge of total annihilation. Natural, social, political, military, and corporate forces have pushed humanity to the brink. The words of a Persian mystic and prisoner who foresaw the future 400 years prior stands truer than ever before...

"O ye the elected representatives of the people in every land! Take ye counsel together, and let your concern be only for that which profiteth mankind, and bettereth the condition thereof . . . Regard the world as the human body which, though at its creation whole and perfect, hath been afflicted, through various causes, with grave disorders and maladies. Not for one day did it gain ease, nay its sickness waxed more severe, as it fell under the treatment of ignorant physicians . . ." —Bahá'u'lláh

In fits and starts the process of creating global stability has been emerging for eons. Now the world faces it's most dire hour. The super-science of catastrophic weaponry, imbalanced and exploited globalization, and the unlocked potentials of Mother Nature's wrath have all given rise to myriad horrific problems which require a host of powerful solutions.

Forces of light and dark battle openly in public discourse, secretly behind the closed doors of the powerful elite, and deep within the minds and hearts of all people. Despite those who cling to a world long gone, a consensus has formed among the world's peoples and great leaders: a new world must be made. Led by the charge of reason and fueled by a desperate hope, a rallying cry for peace is heard:

"The Great Peace towards which people of goodwill throughout the centuries have inclined their hearts, of which seers and poets for countless generations have expressed their vision, and for which from age to age the sacred scriptures of mankind have constantly held the promise, is now at long last within the reach of the nations." —From "The Promise of World Peace" by The Universal House of Justice

Is it too late to counteract eons of destruction? Can humanity set aside their petty squabbles, age old hatreds, and demagogue-stoked fears in order to bring about what is only dreamed of? And what of suspicions? Is everyone a trusted ally or do some lurk in shadow, attempting to plunge the world into a dark age of fallout and waste?

You are the rulers and leaders who will settle the fate of the world, for better or worse!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Traitor Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Gloom: Knighted by a Noble Promo
description:
Gloom Promo card for Noble Knight Games

Card text reads:

"You may play up to 2 additional cards this round."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor

name: Explore: Tomb of Rasha
description:
Co-op game for 2 players (can be played solo)
Tomb of Rasha is a cooperative game where you have to explore a tomb in a team of 2 players and defeat the snake queen Rasha. The game is played with a 54-card deck.

Story:
After the kingdom of Falladin defeated the evil snake queen Rasha, her creatures buried her deep into a tomb. There she lies for centuries, almost forgotten to the outside world. Until creatures of the depth came crawling out of the tomb and disturbed the nearby kingdom. Two adventurers where asked to go into the tomb to see what has happened. For it seems that Rasha might have awakened.

name: PARTYtura
description:
PARTYtura is a game for 3-10 players in which the conductor is to lead an orchestra of the remaining players. In order to meet the expectations of the audience, everyone must maintain the right tempo and understand well the gestures of the conductor. Interestingly, the game will take place in silence - the music is realized in it by playing appropriate cards. Depending on the variant and the number of players, it is a cooperative or team game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

PARTYtura to gra dla 3-10 graczy, w której rolą dyrygenta jest, aby pokierować orkiestrą złożoną z pozostałych graczy.
Aby sprostać oczekiwaniom słuchaczy, wszyscy muszą utrzymać właściwe tempo i dobrze rozumieć gesty prowadzącego.
Co ciekawe, gra odbywać się będzie w ciszy – muzyka jest w niej realizowana poprzez zagrywanie odpowiednich kart.
W zależności od wariantu i liczby graczy, jest to gra kooperacyjna lub drużynowa.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Music, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Ducks in Tow: The Angry Goose Mini-Expansion
description:
The angry goose is scaring away the ducks! Even you're afraid to go near him! Help your duck friends to stay away from the angry goose.

The Angry Goose mini expansions adds a new level of strategy for players looking for a deeper level of spatial puzzle solving.

Score 2 bonus points per Goose Icon if there are no ducks to the left AND to the right of the goose. You can also have geese next to each other. Scaring ducks is a group activity after all!

You don't score any bonus points if there is a duck next to the goose or if there is a missing card on either side of the goose!
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Egg Add
description:
Smart hens lay eggs and fight for their seats.
The way to get a place is math!
But you need to remember where the eggs are. You can remove it the moment you are off guard.
Who is the smartest hen?

<Purpose of the game>
1. You need to figure out the location and number of eggs to score more points than other players.

<Game ready>
1. Each player takes 20 pieces of the same color.
2. Randomly cover 25 lid tiles on the board.
3. Each player shuffles the cards and draws 4 cards.
4. The remaining cards are placed in a pile next to the board.

<Game play>
1. When the first player's turn comes, he uses it to add the required number of 4 cards in his hand.
ex) When using 2 cards: (1) card + (2) card = 3
ex) When using 3 cards: (1) card + (2) card + (3) card = 6
2. Open the divider cover, insert 1 game piece (egg), and then close the cover again.
3. Discard the used cards and draw cards from the pile for the number of cards used. This way the turn is over and the next person's turn begins.

<Game ends>
The game ends when all players' game pieces are used up. And when you open the lid, the one with the most eggs wins. Completing 3 and 4 items straight and diagonally gives 3 and 4 additional points each, and if there are discarded game pieces (eggs), the player with the most points by calculating -1 per piece wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Economic, Educational, Math, Memory

name: Savannah Territory
description:
In Savannah Territory, you play as a ranger who keeps the peace in the savannah by dividing the territory to prevent conflicts between the animals.

However, the savannah is a world of the weak and the strong, and the rangers will not be able to avoid kicking each other down to the ground. You need to place the animals well while interfering with other players.

Once the game board is made up of curiously shaped savannah boards, each player's assigned animal tip is placed in a way that prevents the same type of animal from being placed next to each other. If you can place all the animal tips or prevent other players from placing any more, you will be awarded a medal.

Where can you put them to disturb other players? Which animal tip should I have left at the end of the day to help me survive? It is a simple game, but you can't let your guard down until the end.

The ease with which this game can be played from around 8 years old, and the depth of the trouble that comes with understanding the theories, make it an addictive game.

—description from the designer
publishers: Banso Inc. (株式会社バンソウ)

name: Worldwide Football: Ligue des Étoiles
description:
Worldwide Football: Ligue des Étoiles

Take the helm of a major European football club (Barcelona, Paris, Turin…) and set off to conquer the most prestigious of European leagues!

This expansion requires the Worldwide Football base game plus Expansions 1 and'2.
It also includes Worldwide Football First Edition Update Kit.

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Brazen Bat & Vixen Tail
description: This is a set of Halloween Promo pattern cards and gear cards that were included with the Halloween Ringtail Vixen miniature.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Taros Area of Engagement Board
description:
The quiet mining world of Taros became the target of the T’au Empire’s Third Sphere Expansion, and the Imperium of Mankind vowed to take it back at any cost. As the world below erupted in violent action across numerous fronts, so too did the sky become filled with fire and devastation.

This Taros Area of Engagement is a fold-out game board for Aeronautica Imperialis that represents two of the key locations in the conflict between the Imperial Navy, Astra Militarum, and T’au Air Caste. Measuring 19 hexes by 18 hexes (or roughly 3’ by 3’), this game board is even bigger than the one found in the Aeronautica Imperialis: Skies of Fire boxed game.

The double-sided game board comes in two pieces and features artwork depicting the following aerial war zones:

- Side 1: The Furnace – the skies above a T’au Empire military outpost nestled in the mountains, including a space elevator
- Side 2: The Grand Reservoir – a vast subterranean water purification system, including tight confines for tense dogfights

You'll need a copy of the Taros Air War Campaign book or the Aeronautica Imperialis: Skies of Fire boxed game to use this game board

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Rynn's World Area of Engagement
description:
In the late 41st Millennium, Rynn’s World was subjected to a devastating Ork invasion – Waaagh! Snagrod – which culminated in the total destruction of the Crimson Fists’ fortress-monastery and the loss of much of the Chapter’s fighting strength. Yet while fierce fighting erupted across much of the planet’s surface, the Imperial Navy and Ork Air Waaagh! fought a grueling campaign of aerial warfare in the skies above.

Rynn’s World Area of Engagement is a fold-out card game board for Aeronautica Imperialis that represents two of the key locations in the War for Rynn's World. Measuring approximately 3’x3’, this game board is even bigger than the one found in the Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance boxed game.

The double-sided game board comes in two pieces and features artwork depicting the following aerial war zones:

- Side 1: Jadeberry Hill N266-E114 – the strategically vital area on the outskirts of New Rynn City. A blasted wasteland of hills and extensive maglev lines and roads.

- Side 2: New Rynn City N292-W451 – one of the beleaguered districts of the city.

You will need a copy of the Rynn's World Air Campaign book or the Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance boxed game to use this game board.

name: The Dragon's Lair
description:
The Dragon’s Lair is a frantic, fast paced treasure collection game with survival elements. Players work to evade a wide range of fierce dragon attacks while gathering an assortment of rubies, emeralds and gold. Challenge the dragon alone or with friends as you compete to gather as much treasure as you can before your luck runs out. Do you dare enter The Dragon’s Lair?

Setup:

Separate out one blink per player to be treasure hunter (player) blinks and one blink to be the dragon.
Triple click a blink to set to treasure hunter, long press to set blink to dragon (hold off until ready to start the game), double press to set back to lair tile.
Arrange all remaining non-player (lair) blinks around the dragon in any configuration desired as long as each blink has one side open for connection.
Alt Setup - If only playing with 6-9 blinks, arrange blinks in a straight line with the dragon at the end.
Long press the designated dragon blink to set role and start the game.

Rules:

Treasures randomly spawn into the lair playspace for the players to collect.
Treasure hunter (player) blinks have three colored sides - Yellow (Gold), Red (Rubies), and Green (Emeralds).
Players must match the correctly colored side of their blink to a treasure to score points.
Each red (ruby) and green (emerald) collected gains the player 1 point, while each yellow (gold) collected gives the player 5 points.
Yellow (Gold) treasures require the play to mine (be connected to them) for 3 seconds before awarding their points.
Players collect treasure points until their luck runs out (all 3 luck lost).
One luck is lost by incorrectly connecting to a treasure or by being adversely affected by a dragon attack.
The players current luck count is displayed by the three white lights on the treasure hunter blink.
The Dragon has three attacking moves:
A. Fireball - Orange light (Fire) moves quickly throughout the lair. Any player attached to an actively affected tile looses one luck.
B. Poison - Pink light (Poison) moves slowly throughout the lair. Any player attached to an actively affected tile looses one luck.
C. Void - All light is sucked from the Lair, and players must collect tiles based on their memory. The incorrect matching penalty of one health still applies.
Dragon attacks get more frequent as the game progresses eventually resulting in the end of the game.

Win Condition / End Game:

After a player has lost all of their luck, their blink changes over to score mode.
In score mode, lights of different colors flash in quick succession followed by a several second gap.
To determine your score, count the number of Gold flashes in the group and multiply by 100, and then red by 10 and green by 1. The sum of these numbers is your score.
If playing single player, try to set and beat your high score.
If playing competitively with multiple players, the player with the highest score when their luck runs out wins.

name: Samusara
description:
Japanese Buddhists believe that death is followed by rebirth, a cycle they call Samusara: other Buddhists call it Samsara. This game is dedicated to that tenet.

Any opposing piece that you capture you can reincarnate as one of your pieces.

The goal in Samusara is to occupy the opponent’s power cells or the hilltop cells. You can also win by making ten capture moves.

name: Catacombs Cubes: Bothaar Brickworks & Forge of Gnoth
description:
2 new Village Structure Tiles:

Bothaar Brickworks (Level 1): Requires 8 blocks to complete and generates 3 points

Forge of Gnoth (Level 2): Requires 10 blocks to complete and generates 5 points

- Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign -
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Que Ves II
description:
OBJETIVO DEL JUEGO: Ser el primero en deducir cuatro sacertijos de las tarjetas de rebus y obtener 4 puntos.

PREPARACIÓN: Antes de comenzar se mezclan las 200 tarjetas y se colocan en el centro de la mesa con el acertijo mirando hacia arriba. EL reloj de arena deberá ocupar también el centro de la mesa junto a las tarjetas durante toda la partida.

CÓMO JUGAR: Comienza el juego el más joven del grupo. Su compañero de la derecha tomará la 1er tarjeta del mazo y le enseñará la imagen del acertijo sin mostrarle la respuesta, e inmediatamente dará vuelta el reloj. Si el jugador deduce el acertijo (concepto, frase o palabra) antes de que se cumpla el tiempo, se quedará con la tarjeta y obtiene 1 punto. Si no responde correctamente, la tarjeta se devuelve al fondo del mazo, sin que se muestre la respuesta. La ronda continúa en el sentido de las agujas del reloj de la misma forma con el resto de los jugadores.

TARJETAS "QUÉ VES PARA TODOS" (para todos los jugadores): Qué ves incluye un conjunto de tarjetas que están marca-das con EL REY en color rojo. En caso que a un jugador le toque una de ellas, perderá la oportunidad de descifrar esa tarjeta en esa ronda y deberá mostrarla al resto de los participantes. Luego de dar vuelta el reloj, el primero en responder correctamente se lleva la tarjeta obteniendo 1 punto.
En cambio, si ninguno de los participantes logra descifrar el acertijo, se lleva la tarjeta el jugador que la extrajo del mazo y suma 1 punto.

¿QUIÉN ES EL GANADOR? El primer jugador en descifrar 4 acertijos y obtener 4 puntos, es el ganador.


OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME: Be the first player to decipher 4 riddles.

PREPARATION: The deck (all 200 cards) is shuffled and placed in the center of the table with the riddles facing up. The hourglass must also occupy the center of the table, next to the cards, throughout the game.

HOW TO PLAY: The youngest player begins the game. The player to his/her right will take the top card from the deck and show him/her the picture-riddle, without showing him/her the answer, and will immediately turn the hourglass. If the player deciphers the riddle (concept, phrase or word) before the time is up, s/he will keep the card and get 1 point. If he does not answer correctly, the card is returned to the bottom of the deck, without the answer being shown. The round continues clockwise in the same way with the rest of the players.

"WHAT YOU SEE, FOR EVERYONE" CARDS: The game includes a set of cards that are marked with the king in RED. If a player gets one of them, s/he will lose the opportunity to decipher that card in that round and must instead show it to the rest of the players. After turning the hourglass, the first player to answer correctly takes the card, obtaining 1 point. On the other hand, if none of the players manages to decipher the puzzle, the player who extracted the card from the deck takes it and gets 1 point for him/herself.

WHO IS THE WINNER?: The first player to decipher 4 puzzles (get 4 points) is the winner.

-from the game's official rulebook

name: Coats & Hats
description:
These coats and hats are terribly disorganized. Group them by colour to win!

Coats & Hats is a tiny card game packed with coats and hats that need sorting. Match the colour of the items on a rack, while preventing your opponent from doing the same.

Each turn, add a card to the outer edge of the rack; then either use a special ability on a card, or flip your card — there's a hat on the back of each coat. Group three items of the same colour and you score!

—description from the publisher

name: Lines of Fixation
description:
Lines of Fixation is an abstract strategy game for 2players, inspired by Lines of Action (LoA). As same as LoA, it also has several game pieces start from a distance, the object to unite own pieces and some move constraints, but unlike LoA, it uses a hexagonal board and stacking mechanics.

GAMEPLAY (overview)
Setup each 9 of 2-height stacks as the diagram above. Light color player goes first, alternate turns taking one move with a stack their control (That is, a stack with your color at the top).

Stacks move a straight line the distance exactly its height, dropping bottom disks exactly one by one for each hex. Dropped disks may capture opponent's stacks and/or merge with own stacks. If your mono-color stack of 3- or more height can make capture, you must do so.

And there are important restrictions; if you do not have the highest stack on a straight line, your stacks on the line cannot make any move along the line. And if both of you and your opponent have the highest stacks of same height on a line, your stacks on the line can move and merge but cannot capture.

The object is to make all stacks you control adjacent each other as a group. You can also win by having two bi-color stacks of 6-height.

-description from designer

name: Cthulhu Storming: Orrore a Innsmouth
description:
A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with three or four players by combining the two sets of Cthulhu Storming!

The citizen of Newburyport are missing from their houses, therefore an archaeologist and a psychoanalyst go to investigate in the near village of Innsmouth, finding it inhabited by fish-man hybrids.

In each turn, a player can move its miniature by a space on the map, and do one of this action:

explore: if it's the first time a space/room is entered, roll one die and place the monsters listed from a table,
attack a monster: roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is higher than the level of the monster, the monster is killed; if all the monsters in a space/room are eliminated, roll one die and take the treasures/money listed from a table,
use a special ability/object.


After the turns of the players, the monsters attack every character in their space; a player roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is lower than the level of the monster, the monster inflicts a damage (physical, mental, or both) on the character.
The players can leave the map and go to the city to buy additional equipment, but the time spent is added to a track, and the game becomes harder if too much time is spent in this way. If a character is defeated (the inflicted damage is equal to its physical or mental resistance) is forced to go to the city.
The game is lost if all characters are defeated in the same round, instead the game is won if the players finds all the clues and keys that open the way to the final boss (Dagon), and succeeds in defeating him.

name: Mixtape Massacre: Escape From Tall Oaks – Revenge Pack
description:
Four classic slashers (Dr. Ravenous, Thorne, Hatchling, and Stitches) return to Tall Oaks for revenge. Look out kids, they’re coming for you!

This pack brings 4 classic slashers back for use in Escape from Tall Oaks as optional enemies to mix into your rogue gallery.

WHAT’S IN THE REVENGE PACK?
4 New Slasher character pieces
4 Slasher Profile cards for use with Escape From Tall Oaks

-description from publisher's website

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Imperial Nobility Team Card Pack
description:
This deck contains 44 cards to help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Imperial Nobility teams. They come packaged in a flip-top card box for safe travels.

This set includes:
– 5 Player Reference cards for Imperial Retainer Lineman, Imperial Thrower, Noble Blitzer, Bodyguard, and Ogre
– 5 Star Player cards for Griff Oberwald, Helmut Wulf, Karla Von Kill, Mighty Zug, and Morg 'n' Thorg
– 8 Heroic Feats Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 17 Blank Player cards: 8x Imperial Retainer Lineman, 2x Imperial Thrower, 2x Noble Blitzer, 4x Bodyguard, and 1x Ogre
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl – The Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

-description from publisher's website

name: Middara: Faunus, God of the Nymphs Resin Kit
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Faunus
An exceptionally detailed resin model of Faunus. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

This resin kit includes a Faunus miniature on a 50mm base, 1x Adventurer card, 2x Loyal Esper Cards, 2x Opposing Esper Cards, 4x Item Cards, 4x Initiative Cards, and an Art card.

Requires assembly.

-description from publisher's website

name: Genotype: Fellowship Hall Promo Cards
description:
Part of the Tantrum House Season 7 Kickstarter, contains 2 cards of the same kind:

Fellowship Hall

You may activate this Tool when another player validates a Trait to validate the same Trait
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simulation, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Worker Placement

name: Robotech Macross Dog Fight: The Miniatures Game
description:
A gigantic spaceship crash lands on Earth, foreshadowing the arrival of an alien armada bent on war and destruction. The world unites to unlock the secrets of its miraculous alien technology known as Robotech to defend the world against impending invasion. The challenges they would face would be greater than anyone could have imagined...

Tailor a combination of talented pilots and powerful mechs. Outmanoeuvre your opponents and finish them with the right weapons. Survive until the end and claim your victory.

The game plays over multiple rounds. Each round consists of four phases in order.

Planning - Plan your movement secretly.
Movement - Move according to the plan
Cross Event - Initiate a quick battle when mechs cross paths.
Combat - Shoot your opponent down!


The game ends when only one player or one team has mechs remaining in the battlefield. The survivor is declared the winner. If the last mechs of each player is eliminated in the same phase, the player with lower total pilot and mech costs wins. If the totals are equal, the game ends in a tie.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: 赤い糸大作戦 (Secret Admirer)
description:
Secret Admirer is a game to send tiny letters to each other. Succeed the destiny challenge by confessing your love to someone who you believe sent you a love letter, or meddle in and try to hook other 2 players up.

On your turn, you send one of your letters to someone by tucking it to their post. The person who received it cannot look inside the letter yet.

Each player has 5 letters, and 2 of them are love letters. You send a love letter to someone who you like secretly. While players send letters to each other, if you think the person you sent a love letter also sent you a love letter back, then be brave and confess your love.

If they love you back, then you two try “love love challenge” and see if you can have everyone's celebration.

But be careful! If you are too shy, someone might meddle in!

name: Manstein's War: Decision in the West 1940
description:
Manstein's War: Decision in the West 1940 is a two-player wargame of the German offensive in Western Europe in May-June 1940 in which the Wehrmacht seized a stunning victory over Allied forces in the Low Countries and France. The game uses a variant of the Boots system to model command, control, and logistics on an operational scale. Both players can fight a campaign of mobility and decisive battles.

The general structure of the game is that each player uses command markers to activate their forces, which are divided into sub-commands (army groups and similar echelons). Each player has special markers which provide additional operational capabilities. Can you turn the tide of history in that decisive spring of 1940?

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #84, June 2022

—description from publisher

name: Gunfighter: Expansion
description:
Enhance your game experience by becoming an iconic western character with a unique ability. Gunfight in various locations that change the rules. Also, bring powerful Action Cards to your gunbelt in this Epic expansion for Gunfighter!

- from the back of the box

Contents:
1 x Rules Sheet
27 x Action Cards
10 x Character Cards
15 x Location Cards

NOTE: All expansion cards have a lined box around the art.

See Community wiki for full components list.
—user summary
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: EDO
description:
EDO A strategy game.

It contains 35 pieces that represent different classes involved in the war of the Sengoku period (1467-1568) in Japan. Final peace and order would come with the arrival of the Edo period, which would become the trigger for the objective of the game ... to end the war.

It is played by placing chips and subtracting the values of the sides that are in contact in that play. The value that remains is the points you add that turn ... and so on until you reach 100 points or the one with the most points after exhausting all the chips.

—description from publisher

name: The Great Chase
description:
The NTSB (National Transportation Safety Board) needs your help!

Assignment: travel the world, solve aeronautic crashes, and resolve diplomatic emergencies. Your team's challenge? Completing 10 missions within 10 turns. You will be scored on the quality of your success

Join Miranda Chase and other great characters from M.L. Buchman's techno-thriller novel series in an interactive global aeronautic investigation game! Build a cooperative team of air-crash investigators, select a mission difficulty, and coordinate global travel with your team each turn to determine the best strategy for solving every crisis... but remember: even the finest plans face the roll of the dice!

Players control multiple characters while moving to various locations. Each game consists of 10 missions which the players must try to solve. The final score is computed based on the number of solved and unsolved missions, flight cards, and time zones.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Dice, Negotiation, Novel-based, Political, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Negotiation, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Jenga: Harry Potter
description:
It’s time for class at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, but before your lessons can begin, you've got to make it through the arched doors at the top of the school's grand staircase. Will you make it before the stairs fall away from underneath your unpredictable path?

Let the ever-changing staircase in Jenga: Harry Potter put your dexterous skills to the test by carefully removing and replacing blocks towards the door at the top of the tower. Represent your favorite Hogwarts house by choosing one of four color-coded markers representing Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Slytherin, and Ravenclaw and prepare to make your way to the top. A custom die determines how many blocks to pull and stack as well as the number of stairs you can move your house marker. Watch your steps! If the tower comes crashing down, you'll be late for class and have to rebuild. The first student to reach the top wins and will bring glory to their Hogwarts house.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Egyptian Treasure Hunt
description:
You and your friends are adventurers, planning to go treasure hunting in Egypt. Everyone has some treasure maps, but you can't go alone. So you guys decide to help each other, even though the helper will decide who claims the treasure. You look forward to collecting the highest value treasure.

Treasure hunting begins now! Each player get 5 cards. The active player plays 1 card face-down from their hand and gives it to another player. The chosen player chooses to either "Receive" or "Reject". The card will be resolved. The next player will become the new active player.

The end of the round is triggered when at least 1 of these conditions occurs:
1. There is only 1 player left (not having a card in hand doesn't matter).
2. Win by the effect of the card.
3. Any player who has a total value of 7 on the cards wins.
4. When everyone has no cards in hand, the players with the highest total value on their cards wins. If there is a tie, all the tied players win.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: BITMAX PuzzleGame
description:
Bitmax and friends spend their life playing. They do puzzles, play cooperative games, competitive games... Inside this box you'll find all of them!

THE SEEKER - COMPETITIVE MODE
FROM 8 YEARS UP// FOR 2 TO 6 PLAYERS

Each player shall say the names of two characters to the player on their right who will write them down on a paper. This will be their objective.

The first player shows one of the tiles.

If it's in its place, you can continue picking up the tiles until you find one which isn't in its place or until you reach your objective.

If the tile is not in its place, place it facing down again and change its position with another tile on the grid.

The player who gets their two characters facing up, wins the game!

THE CHARACTER - COOPERATIVE MODE
FROM 8 YEARS UP// FOR 1 TO 6 PLAYERS

The starting player says the name of one of the characters. This will be your objective!

The first player shall show one of the outer tiles on the grid...
If the tile is in its place, they leave it facing up.
If the tile is not in its place, they leave it facing up and change its position with another tile.

The game will end when you find the objective character. Each tile remaining facing down will give us one point.

30 points Excellent
20 points Very good
10 points You should play again to train

THE HELPER - COOPERATIVE MODE
FROM 6 YEARS UP // FOR 1 TO 6 PLAYERS

The first player shall show one of the outer tiles on the grid...
If the tile is in its place, they leave it facing up.
If the tile is not in its place, they place it facing down and they can change its position with another tile facing down on the grid.

The game ends when all the tiles are in their place, well placed.

PUZZLE

FROM 4 YEARS UP // INDIVIDUALLY OR COLLECTIVELY
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Dinosaur Table Battles: More Dinosaurs, Please
description:
This is an expansion for Dinosaur Table Battles. What happened is that Mary asked for more dinosaurs – she may or may not have said please, and it may or may not have been a request. Regardless, six new dino-combatants are ready to join the fifteen from the base game.

Some of the new dinos are classified as Air Dinos and some as Wet Dinos. Air Dinos ignore blocks – unless those blocks are thrown by other Air Dinos! Likewise, the targeting restrictions of Wet Dinos can be negated by enemy Wet Dinos. Air Dinos and Wet Dinos are also weaker against each other – Air Dinos aren't very strong swimmers, and Wet Dinos are afraid of heights. From the massive Quetzalcoatlus to the cunning Gallimimus, these new dinosaurs can dramatically change the flow of a match.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Wargame

name: Super Mission Force: Athwart Time
description:
Super Mission Force: Athwart Time offers exciting new options for the Goalsystem game of fast and fun superhero skirmish battles! This supplement includes rules for solo and cooperative play, a complete mini-campaign, new character creation options, and new powers. Athwart Time also includes over a dozen stat profiles from the SuperFigs line of figures, giving you more great characters ready to hit the table for super action! You will need a copy of Super Mission Force 1st or 2nd edition to make the best use of this supplement.

—description from the publisher

name: Cards Against Humanity: Picture Card Pack 2
description:
That’s right, it’s Picture Card Pack 2 — the greatest sequel since Terminator 2: Judgment Day!

- 30 more all-new cards with completely different pictures on them.

- Also some words, but not too many.

- Goes great with Picture Card Pack 1.

~Publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Victory Tank
description:
The Renault FT, a French light tank, was used by both French and American forces to turn the tide during the final stages of the Great War (World War I). The FT was aptly nicknamed the "Victory Tank" thanks to its essential role during the war effort. The tank was sure to terrify its opponents fighting in the trenches on the Western Front. In Victory Tank, one of these tanks has gone AWOL... Two opposing armies fight on a fog covered battlefield to capture bunkers and retrieve resources while trying to commandeer the tank gone rogue to increase their own military prowess. Which army will be victorious?

In this quick, light, and tactical game, two commanders will try to lead their armies to victory over a couple of rounds divided into two phases. During the "Fog of War" phase the active player will draw two cards to be added to the ever growing battlefield. Each card depicts goals and bonuses to be placed on the battlefield. The active player gets to keep and place one of these cards while offering the other card to its opponent, providing interesting choices and dilemmas to the players during the game.

During the second phase, the "Command" phase, players will take up to five actions each to influence their literal and figurative position in battle. Players will move their soldiers, deploy new units to the battlefield and attack their opponent. Each player has a limited amount of command cards that the player can utilize to boost their actions, fighting power, or defense strength during an attack. And don’t forget that somewhere hidden in the mist, a tank has been abandoned. Finding, operating and fighting with this tank on your side may just bring you victory…

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Advantage Token, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Map Addition, Modular Board, Movement Points, Take That

name: Kittens Love Sushi
description:
In Kittens Love Sushi, your goal is to lure 5 kittens, from the street, into your home, by using sushi as the currency that attracts them—all while other players attempt to thwart your progress, of course. It's guaranteed to be one of the most adorable games about kittens, or sushi, that you ever play.

Each turn, players fill their hand to 4 cards. Players play a single action from their hand each turn, then play a number of sushi cards to attract a "kitten" from the row of kitten cards on the board into their house.

The first player to rescue 5 kittens wins.

name: Tagiron: Mini Expansion
description: As part of the 10th anniversary of the board game cafe Jelly Jelly, the store released this mini expansion for Tagiron. The expansion consists of 5 new question cards (such as "How many prime numbers do you have?") and two 10 tiles, one each in blue and red.

name: Hulo
description:
Hulo is a modern take on the Dernier game, with new action cards that make it more fun!
The game consists of running out of cards in hand, discarding them at each turn according to the indicated rules.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Trail Run
description:
Trail Run is a push-your-luck game simulating long-distance running races on various terrain.
