Like in real life running events, players will have to pace themselves by deciding how many times they will roll the dice and thus try to run fast, but not too fast to avoid blowing up before they reach the finish line.

Players will roll the dice to move their pawns across the race course and the goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the Finish line which is the last space located on the Open Road terrain card.

On their turn player rolls 2 neutral dice: if different, player advances 1 step; if equal, 2 steps; if their sum is 7, player goes bust. In this last case the turn ends, otherwise the player may decide to roll again.

Before rolling the dice, player may announce they whish to use a water bottle to avoid going bust on the next roll.
There are 9 terrain cards and majority of them introduce some modifications to the game rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Diver Caschy
description:
How good of an observer are you?

A game where finding the same patterns and objects will give you victory. With beautiful characters from the PUNA salteña.

Players must search among the cards in their hands and the cards available on the table, those that are combined correctly to be able to make groups of three. Whoever gets the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: How the Union was Saved: the American Civil War 1861 - 1865
description:
"How the Union was Saved: the American Civil War 1861 - 1865" is a two player strategic wargame depicting the entire American Civil War. One player controls the forces and resources of the North and the other those of the South.

During each Game Turn, which represents three months of actual time, players must consider how best to spend their precious Resource Points (RPs). These are used to build and maintain the chains of depots necessary to keep armies supplied and enable them to move and fight, as well as to construct fortifications. Generally, the RPs reflect the superiority of the Northern economy and resources; but, the actual number available each Turn is subject to a random modifier and cards depicting some of the most significant events of the war. The latter add historical colour and, often, increase the tension by throwing a spanner in the works of the most carefully laid plan. Those who have played the critically acclaimed How the West was Saved will recognize this approach.

How the Union was Saved it is augmented by a new mechanic which emphasizes the “fog-of-war”. Only army commanders are deployed on the Game Map. The strength of forces under their command (comprising artillery, cavalry, and infantry) is hidden from the opponent until combat occurs and, even then, the total strength of one or both sides may not be revealed. This device puts players in the shoes of army commanders, able to gain an advantage through the clever use of bluff and deception; but, also vulnerable to a stinging reverse if, for example, they mistake a major offensive operation for a feint. It has produced some really exciting games during testing.

name: Return to Europe
description:
Return to Europe: Sicily & Italy July–Nov 1943 is a Strategic level board-wargame of the Allied invasion of Sicily and Southern Italy. The operation was viewed as only a limited offensive to secure the Mediterranean and force Italy out of the war. The Germans also intended only a limited effort to delay the Allies while a strong defense was established at the far North of the peninsula. Both sides scented greater possibilities in the early going and were drawn into what would become a grueling and expensive campaign.

Using a modified version of rules from Desert Fox Deluxe, one player or team of players commands the Allied forces, the other the Axis. In general terms the Allies are trying to knock Italy out of the war and seize the greatest amount of territory as possible, while the Axis seeks to maintain control of Italian territory for the maximum amount of time.

Each game turn represents one month with up to six player impulses in each game turn.

There are two scenarios, but only the campaign scenario included in the printed rules. The second scenario is included in the PDF version of the rules located at the Decision Games website in the E-Rules section for Strategy & Tactics magazine. http://strategyandtacticsmagazine.com/site/e-rules/

Originally published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #341 - Jul-Aug 2023.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 month
Hex: 6.7 miles / 10 kilometers
Units: Company to Regiment

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-10 hours

Note: Players will need to provide two 6-sided die for game play.

name: The Dead Eye: Kickstarter 2020 promo cards
description:
Set of three promotional cards from the 2020 Kickstarter campaign for The Dead Eye.

Kanyn - A narrow escape. + 2 distance

Rovr - Catch and release. Use BALL to discard heat.

Htcha - It's bait. - 2 distance

name: Rome: Fall of the Empire
description:
Reenact the fall of the Roman Empire in this grand campaign map. Hold the line as the Eastern or Western Roman Empire, supplant the empire with your kingdom as the tribal factions of the Sassanids, Franks and Goths, or trample all before you as the Huns. Each faction has unique victory conditions and ways to play. With numerous paths to victory, including variants, the game offers much replay-ability.

—description from the designer

name: Rainbow Rabbits: Friends Expansion – Frog & Lamb
description: The Frog and the Lamb join the rabbits in the base game. Increases the player count by two.

name: Stack the Scoops
description:
Stack the Scoops is a an award winning ice-cream themed family card game kids and adults can enjoy together! Created to be both fun and educational, Stack the Scoops helps reinforce fundamental math skills while encouraging families to connect through games.

The premise is simple, kids and adults take turns trying to make ice cream sets by collecting a base, scoop, and topping. Different cards are worth different points. At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

Kids love the easy playability and the fun images while the strategy plays on classic card game concepts making it recognizable and fun for adults.

name: Dragons vs Ogres
description:
Dragons vs Ogres is a fantasy themed two-player card game. It is a speed/dexterity game where players compete to capture the most villagers. It has elements of the card games War and Old Maid.

In Dragons vs Ogres, players choose to play as either dragons or ogres and each have ten cards. They draw a hand of five cards to begin the game. A deck of forty villagers is placed at the center of the table. Players flip up a villager, one at a time. The fastest player to capture that villager scores one point. However, the card used to capture the villager must meet one of three conditions:

Exceed the number
Match the number
Be the correct corresponding image


Depending on which condition a player uses to capture a villager, they might return the dragon or ogre card used to their hand, discard it and draw a new card, or shuffle their discard pile back into their deck and draw back up to five cards.

There are forty villagers and only twenty combined dragons and ogres. So each card must be used an average of two times in order to capture half the villagers. If one player runs out of cards, the other may keep playing until they are also out of cards. Players must be quick enough to beat their opponent to the villager but clever enough to make matches.

name: Os 3 Porquinhos
description:
Os 3 Porquinhos ("The 3 Little Pigs") is the first volume in a series of fun games based on ancient tales passed down from generation to generation, later grouped into books by writers who became famous for such feats and came to be known as "Fairy Tales".
Here players have to band together to stop the wolf from taking down their houses. For that, they must think strategically and together, as it is a cooperative game.
Build the three houses as quickly as possible by putting an end to the wolf's plans will make the players win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Pieces as Map, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Super Pas Vite!
description:
I arrive, I run, I fly!

No, you don't arrive, you don't run, you crawl. But it's perfect for this very original snail race where the slowest one wins. An ode to slowness which is good in our society where everything has become urgent. The color of your snail is secret.

On your turn, roll the 4 colored dice. Each dice allows you to move a snail if it is of the indicated color or if it is on a flower of the color of the dice.

Try to move the other players' snails without revealing yourself too much. If the other players spot you, they might make you finish first.

The player who finishes first, loses.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Hindsight
description:
2 player traditional card game, combining trick taking and melding. Players aim to win tricks with their playing hand, and to convert their stock into a spread of 13 cards containing melds scoring as high as possible. The melds are: 1 per card in its longest suit, plus 1 per card in its longest sequence, plus 2 for a pair, 3 for three of the same rank and 8 for four of a kind. Also: to announce in advance which of one's two scores - tricks or melds - will count double. Trick play has the unusual feature that you have to follow suit, but if you can't and play a card of the same rank it trumps and is worth 10 points. Tricks of the same suit are worth 2 and tricks of differing suits are worth 6.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Memory, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Seize the Bean: Extra Founders Expansion Pack
description:
From the Snack Menu (Expansions) Rulebook: An additional 6 Founder Cards are included in the 5-6 Player Expansion, sold separately. They are also available as a standalone, add-on back for players who do not intend to play the game with more than 4 players, but who don't want to miss out on all of the extra content. These 6 Founders work identically to the Base Founders and simply add more variation to the game.

All of the additional 6 Founders pay tribute to real people who contributed massively to the creation of Seize the Bean. They don't own cafés in real life so their corresponding cafés are fictional ones, created for fun and to support some very imaginative Solo Scenarios.

The cards in the pack include:
-Adriano Rahde (Hungry Media)
-Rodrigo Cunha (Cyclists)
-Priscilla Anton (Happy Families)
-Nala Q. (Fashionistas)
-Salome Q. (Funemployed Expats)
-Jazzbot™ (Tourists)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Worker Placement

name: A Billion Suns: Warzone
description:
Warzone is the first new contract set for A Billion Suns. It allows players to use A Billion Suns to tell brutal stories of military might and system-shaking clashes of far-future weaponry.

A Billion Suns, played with the Core Systems contract set provided in the rulebook, is a game of cleverly and frugally assigning resources, telling stories of industrial espionage and resource capture.

The Warzone contract set changes the feel of A Billion Suns considerably. The Warzone contract set allows players to play an all-out war between their two corporations. The stories these new contracts tell are different, and you’ll find a host of new tactical questions to wrestle with.

—description from the publisher

name: Air Scarmush: Tactical Flight Contest
description:
A 'hybrid board/app' tactical air combat game for two players that runs on a 'simultaneous turn by turn' basis over a board of hexagons. (Print n' Play)

This unique system allows you to apprehend the flow of an air engagement (dogfight) in a dynamic and realistic way. Hands on throttle-and-stick, you manoeuver to get into your opponent's six, or to get out of the pursuit! It's a duel of minds in which the most experienced pilot will certainly win.

A bomber is not able to turn its nose as fast as a fighter and the latter does not have the same turn rate at different airspeeds. In this game, each aircraft has a specific flight model (energy management chart) which you can study to integrate its strengths and weaknesses. Moreover, the resolution of offensive actions takes into account the actual position/attitude of the planes and evasive manoeuvres to determine success.

The app contains the game manual, the scenarios, a link to the pdf document to print and shape and the user interface to easily select and present your choices.

Each game turn represents 8 seconds of flight time, which allows complex manoeuvres such as Immelmann, Split S, High yo-yo or Barrel rolls to be performed in sequence.

The game features 20 skirmish scenarios (involving up to 8 airplanes) that include air-to-air and/or air-to-ground objectives, 5 aircraft types (fighter, interceptor, ground attack, bomber, transport) and 11 weapon/action types (cannon, missiles, bombs, countermeasures,...). Each scenario offers a number of points to be won by each team, the one that has won the most points wins the battle.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Muskoka: The Board Game
description:
Adventure awaits! Discover twelve different locations of Muskoka. Adventurers will move between locations by completing journeys connected by land or lake, sometimes both. Each journey has a specified number of modes to travel by, represented by “explore” cards which adventurers will need to collect. Along the way, adventurers will complete a “detour” by visiting a specific location and will receive “wildlife” point tokens of varying values according to the length and type of journeys completed. There is also the “inuksuk” card available, allocated to the adventurer who holds the most “wildlife” point tokens and worth additional points. Adventure is all about experiences, of which Muskoka has plenty to offer. Take time to acquire “rest & relax” cards along the way though, as these provide adventurers with all sorts of advantages in the game. The first adventurer to: (a) complete their “detour”, (b) earn all 5 categories of “wildlife” point tokens (moose, bear, deer, beaver & loon) and (c) accumulate at least 25 total points in the game will be declared the ultimate adventurer of Muskoka.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Balkans
description:
The Balkans, also known as the Balkan Peninsula, is a geographic area in Southeast Europe with various geographical and historical definitions.The region takes its name from the Balkan Mountains that stretch throughout the whole of Bulgaria. The Balkan Peninsula is bordered by the Adriatic Sea in the northwest, the Ionian Sea in the southwest, the Aegean Sea in the south, the Turkish Straits in the east, and the Black Sea in the northeast. The northern border of the peninsula is variously defined. The highest point of the Balkans is Mount Musala, 2,925 metres (9,596 ft), in the Rila mountain range, Bulgaria.

This expansion takes place in this beautiful area. It is designed for 3-4 players. The expansion uses the same rules as the original game, with the following exception: the 'Production' action is replaced with the 'Roma' action.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: The Emissary
description:
In The Emissary, you are a young noble sent by your father to gather support from eight neighboring kingdoms. In each kingdom, you engage in a series of debates with their ruler. Using the right amount of force and deference, you must win exactly a certain number of debates per kingdom. Succeed and you may call upon the ruler for future support; fail even once and lose the game.

The Emissary is a solo trick-taking game playable with a deck of regular playing cards, with rules created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series. The game begins by arranging the deck's eight kings and queens in a row. The player then "visits" each card, in whatever order they choose, drawing a new hand of eight cards from the remainder of deck at each stop. They then draw cards one at a time from the deck, forming the basis of tricks, which the player answers from their own hand. The catch is that whatever place the king or queen being "visited" by the player is (e.g., 1st place through 8th place), that's how many tricks must be won by the player -- no more, and no less. With only a limited capacity to bend the rules through special abilities, the game becomes an exercise in careful hand manipulation and excruciating trade-offs.

The game is inspired by the decktet game Gongor Whist, which itself was patterned from the standard-deck card game Oneonta Whist. This game also holds the core for the free print-and-play game For Northwood!, which swept top prizes in the 2021 BGG 54-card contest. Familiarity with trick-taking games will make understanding the following rules a breeze. Of course, prior knowledge isn't strictly necessary.
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trick-taking

name: 吾妻鏡 (Azuma Kagami: Yoritomo's Eastern Campaign in 1180)
description:
Azuma Kagami (吾妻鏡) is a historical chronicle: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azuma_Kagami

This game covers the Eastern campaign of Minamoto Yoritomo (源頼朝).
It was published to coincide with airing of NHK's The 13 Lords of the Shogun (鎌倉殿の十三人).

Inspired by the Taiheiki system.
(Taiheiki, was republished by MMP named as Warriors of Japan: A Country Aflame 1335-1339).

Theme: Conflict between the Genji and Heike clans

Number of counters: Approx. 70 pieces
Map size: 1 half-map

Game period: August - November 1180 (8 turns)
Scope of the game: The whole of the Kanto region

Turn scale: 1 month per turn
Unit size: 1 warlord per unit + hundreds to thousands of warlords

Play time: 1 - 2 hours
Number of players: 2 players
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest): 1


Game Journal #79 contains three games: Azuma Kagami / Three Kingdoms Jingzhou War / Minsk 1941
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Crooks in Crisis
description:
Crooks in Crisis is a comedy game all about villains struggling with modern life.

Players evolve and play as unique bad guy characters and compete to solve each others problems with a series of drawing, writing, searching and performing challenges.

To start the game each player gets a villainous profession and trait to start their character. The winner of each round earns a new trait to add to their bad guy character. The first to reach five traits wins the game.

There are millions of character combinations and thousands of challenges to play in the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Random Production, Role Playing

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Frozen Shore Bear Riders
description:
The Frozen Shore Bear Riders unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders one of the hardiest cavalry units ever fielded in battle. While being kicked by a destrier might be a worry, it doesn’t hold a candle to being mauled by a bear while its rider stabs at you with their spear. Enemies are sure to be in disarray when this monstrous cavalry unit makes it into battle.

Contents:
4 Miniatures
‣ 4 Frozen Shore Bear Riders
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: II Grass II Crown
description:
Over the course of ten battles, The Grass Crown charted the military evolution of the Roman Republic from the days of the manipular Legion and its Triplex Acies formation to the veteran professionals that fought in a series of bloody civil wars. These battles were carefully chosen by designer Amabel Holland with an eye toward only keeping those that would propel the game's central themes forward. Some otherwise compelling, engaging, and interesting battles didn't make that list, either because they made the same "point" as a battle that did make the cut, or they introduced a level of complexity that detracted from the narrative.

You probably see where we're going with this! II Grass II Crown is an expansion that provides eight new scenarios: Beneventum, Metaurus, Ilipa, Great Plains, Cynoscephalae, Magnesia, Zela, and the Cilician Gates. These are aimed at experienced players who don't mind tackling a few extra special rules. Also included is a new countersheet with additional units. Among them are counters for two new unit types, Scythed Chariots and Cataphracted Cavalry, which provide new and daunting challenges.

—description from the publisher

name: Pantheon
description:
An asymmetrical strategy game. In Pantheon you will be tasked with the construction of a monument to honor your deities, but only one culture will endure in this clash of titans.

This 1v1 game, which can also be played against an automa, tastes like a war strategy game and has that card games aroma which will make you play again and again whether you win or lose.

You will have to adapt your moves to each deity's needs, but as soon as you know their hopes and fears, your games will become a battle of epic proportions.

Complete the different quests in the campaign mode and claim your victory in this Olympic competition.

The game takes about 1 minute to be learned and 15 minutes to play on average.

—description from the publisher

name: Catacombs Big Box
description:
This is the base version of the award winning fantasy, dexterity board game, Catacombs™ that packs the core game in a big box. Includes the Ice Box exclusive expansion.

This exclusive version of Catacombs 3E (not available at retail) includes:


Three double-sided neoprene playmats (instead of the game boards in the retail version of Catacombs 3E)
The new “Kallax shelf” friendly extra large box and TWO organizing trays instead of the single organizing tray in the retail version
The new wall system including custom plastic stands
The fully revised and updated 36 page Reference manual
The new 40 page Tutorial manual


The three, double-sided playmats included with this set:


Campfire | Stone Altar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Lava Tube | Root Cellar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Mausoleum | Throne Room (from the Catacombs 3E base game)


How does this playmat version differ from the retail version of the third printing of Catacombs 3E?


All “big box” versions of Catacombs 3E include double-sided neoprene playmats instead of cardboard game boards used in the retail version.
All “big box” versions of Catacombs 3E feature the large storage box (obviously) and the second organizing tray.
All “big box” versions of Catacombs 3E include the exclusive Ice Box expansion
mechanics: Flicking, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Khu Rừng Kim Cương
description:
To celebrate Virgo's birthday, Leo decides to invite the class to play Diamond Forest - The most favorite game at the Galactic Park. The whole class believes that "Being with friends is much precious than being in a pool of diamonds". But wait... Virgo turned what seems to be a friendly game into a dramatic duel. What happens next? Can you collect diamonds while planting trees, fight against the "mysterious forces", and be the fastest one to complete your quests?

The goal of the game is to be the first one to plant 7 trees. Players will perform 4 actions in order:

1) Quest: At the beginning of your turn, check and (if needed) draw until you have 3 daily quest cards.
2) Collect Diamonds: Roll the 2 dice, then move the Raccoon as well as the Collection Basket corresponding to its die.
3) Trade: Either trade a quest or trade a gem.
4) Plant a Tree: You can plant a tree by a) Spending 4 different colored gems or b) Spending 5 Achievement Points c) Move any 2 planted trees with any 3 gems.

name: Joking Hazard: Deck Enhancement #4
description: Mix these 100 cards in with your Joking Hazard game for a bigger, girthier deck. Size matters, enhance your deck.

name: Under Falling Skies: Kyiv City promo tile
description:
Kyiv (B/F)
Blue side (research 4)

"Whenever you place a gray die in an AA gun room, you can increase one worker die that hasn’t been placed yet by 1."

Red side (research 5)

"Whenever you place a gray die in an AA gun room, you can increase one other worker die (placed or unplaced) by 1."

Available in the Spielbox Issue #1 - 2023 issue.

name: Ragnarok: The Board Game
description:
Ragnarok: The Board Game is a betting and meeple-rolling board game based on a global IP video game, Ragnarok Online.

In each round, players plan out how they will deploy their mercenaries to subjugate monsters. Those mercenaries are wooden meeples with different shapes. They select which and how many mercenaries to roll to win each monster card or item card. Depend on the posture of the meeples they roll, they gain combat powers. And the player with the highest combat power wins the card.

Players start with unique innate abilities which can be upgraded as they play the game.

When the round 5 ends, the play who achieves the most points by subjugating the monsters becomes the winner of the game.

Achieve items! Defeat monsters! And become the renowned adventurer!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Tipsy Chicken
description:
A Fun, Hilarious Party Drinking Game: Set Your Inner Party Animal Free! Turn game night up a notch with this adult party game. Compete with your friends to complete the most dares without getting too TIPSY!

Fill up you glass with any drink you favor.

Draw a dare card and read it out out. Complete the dare or ...don't. If you complete the dare, draw a goat card and keep your dare card for points. If you don't, draw a chicken card and take your punishment. Discard the dare card. No points for you!

When a player reaches 13 points, the game ends. The player that first reached 13 points is the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: The Battle of Aqbat al-Bakr
description:
The Battle of Aqbat al-Bakr is a small and simple postcard game published as a freebie by SNAFU Design, as a gift for attendees to the Pax Ludica 2022 Wargaming convention (Cadis, Spain). It's the fourth of the Snafu Postcard Games.

It's a 2-player game depicting a small battle during the civil war in the Caliphate of Cordoba in 1010 AD. Some Christian Catalan counts joined forces with one of the Muslim candidates (Muhammad al-Mahdi) and fought against the other candidate to the caliphate, Sulaiman al-Mustain, backed by berber (imazighen) troops.

On his turn the player rolls two dice and the results are the number of Movement Points (one die) and the number of Combat Points (the other die). Then the player assigns these points among his units as he sees fit to move, rally, fight, charge (heavy units) and/or harass (light units). The first one to disorganize or kill all enemy units wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points

name: Island Alone: The Search for Captain Smith
description:
You have come to the island in search of revenge against Captain Smith. You believed he died many years ago, but recently evidence surfaced that he may still be alive and hiding here....

The Search for Captain Smith is the second story campaign and expansion for Island Alone. To succeed, players throughout the game must complete the tasks on the campaign cards before the all supplies of food and water run out.

This expansion includes a new map for "The Search for Captain Smith" consisting of 6 parts, new character cards, a goals card, and 9 new campaign objective cards.

The expansion follows classic gameplay but introduces a few changes and new rules. Instead of one scenario, players complete the objectives from the campaign cards starting with card #1. Players will encounter outposts guarded by rebels and will need to resolve combat to survive.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mord Couture
description:
Mord Couture: Claude Doedel - Master of Fashion and Haute Couture - is dead. His dead body is found in his villa with a High Heel stuck in his chest. Murder! His closest aquaintances sit together and try to find out who did it!
It's a 6 player murder mystery game were you can lie, betray, investigate and accuse! Included in the mix is a cook book to fully enjoy a perfect crime dinner evening.

name: Blood & Steel: Victorian Age Combat 1837-1901 – Core Rulebook
description:
Blood & Steel is a skirmish level miniatures game set during the reign of Queen Victoria. It focuses on combat at the fringes of larger battles and is based on the same mechanics as Blood & Plunder and Blood & Valor, but with key changes that makes it a different gaming experience. The following conflicts (and force lists) are included:

– 2nd Seminole War (United States & Seminoles)
– Mexican American War (United States & Mexico)
– US Civil War (Union & Confederacy)
– 2nd Taranaki War (Great Britain & Māori)
– Anglo-Zulu War (Great Britain & Zulu)
- Spanish American War (United States & Spain)
categories: American Civil War, American Indian Wars, American West, Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: EscapeBox: Black Heart
description:
EscapeBox is a board game that provides you with an exciting escape room experience. You can think with your friends, family or co-workers, put together clues, find a way out of the predicament you are in, and complete your mission. You do not have a simple task ahead! You have to be focused and precise. Even things that seem very trivial may help you. Be aware of time! You do not have much time to complete this mission.

Story: On the morning of the 11th of January, a mysterious murder occurs in Jam Hotel. As soon as the police discover the crime, according to the prosecutor's order, all the hotel doors are closed for two hours, and commuting to/from the hotel is prohibited. You, a capable detective team, have been contacted and requested to reach the crime scene quickly. You have 120 minutes to identify the killer or killers before they leave the hotel, discover their motive and finally arrest them.

name: ¡Te atrapa el pirata!
description:
Try to snatch diamonds from the pirates' cave or even run away with their hidden treasure. But beware of the pirates! If two of them spot you, you've been captured and you're out!

A very simple push your luck game, where you draw tokens from a bag. Small tokens are more numerous, less dangerous and have smaller rewards. Big tokens have bigger rewards, but could get you out the round immediately.

Winning a round grants you a small diamond token, which will change the odds for the next round.

First player to win 3 rounds is the winner of the game.

-description from designer

name: Hide nor Hare
description:
Hattie the Hare and her friends are in the park for a game of hide and seek!

Hide nor Hare combines dice-rolling with sudoku. The game consists of a board, 40 tiles, 10 markers, and 3 dice. Alternately, the game can be played as a roll & write, with just 3 dice and 1 sheet of paper.

Players use dice rolls to fill the park (a 6x6 grid) with Hattie, her Friends, and plenty of Trees to hide behind. To win, each row and column must have exactly one Tree and exactly one Friend. Additionally, players must place at least ten Pigeons in the park. A Pigeon must correctly show the number of Friends visible from its position, looking horizontally and vertically, with Trees blocking the view of Friends.

Each roll, the player can assign one die to a Friend, one to a Tree and one to a Pigeon. If it is impossible to place a Friend or a Tree, they must place a Pigeon instead. If it is impossible to place a Pigeon, they must replace a Pigeon wit Stone. Too many Stones on the board and it's Game Over. The player has 3 Flowers they can use at any time to move tiles, remove stones, or reroll dice.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Voids: Memory Meets Matter
description:
Collect matter from the far corners of the Galaxy and fill the Wormhole at the centre before the ever increasing Voids consume the board!

Play solo, as a team or in competitive mode to collect cards and bridge, boost and warp your way to victory.

A good memory will help you find the cards you need, but with a limited hand, will you play it safe or push your luck?

The more cards you play, the more Voids appear...so choose your path wisely!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: War of Beasts
description:
Object of game: Play beast and phenomena cards in turn to win gems. Win gems by playing high-ranking beasts that cannot be defeated by another player or by playing the same value beast to trigger a war. Be the first player to earn enough gems to win the game.

Cards: There are 72 unique beasts with 6 unique beasts of the same value with varying single or double elements and 48 phenomena cards that are either +1 or -1 modifiers for two, three or four elements.

Gameplay: The first beast card played can be any value and is called the current beast. Play moves clockwise to the next player attempting to beat the current beast card. The current player must play only one beast card that is of equal or higher value than the current beast. Phenomena can only be played on your turn and can act on any individual beast; you can play as many phenomena as you wish. There is only one active beast at a time, once a beast is beaten it can be discarded with all the phenomena attached to that beast. The round will continue until all players cannot beat the current beast. Ties will result in a war occurs.
End of Game - If at any time during the game the draw pile has been exhausted just re-shuffle the discard pile. Game ends once one player reaches 10 or greater gems for 2 players.
3 players – 9 gems
4 players – 8 gems
5 players – 7 gems
6 players – 6 gems

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Number
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Score-and-Reset Game, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Effetto Terra
description:
Effetto Terra is a game aiming at increasing our carbon footprint awareness.

Competitive version

Each player receives 5 CO2 cards and places them face-down with the CO2 side value covered. In the centre of the table a random face-up card is placed with its CO2 value in view.
The goal of the game is to succeed in playing all the cards in your hand before anyone else.
On your turn, choose a card in your hand and place it in the centre of the table in line with those already present so that all the cards issuing less CO2 are to its left and all those which issue more to its right.
After you decide where to place your card, turn it down immediately. If you have placed it correctly, the card remains in play and you haven’t to draw nothing, while if it is wrong it’s discarded and you have to draw a new card from the pack.

Cooperative version

The team that faces the first mission, as shown in card n.1, draws 4 CO2 cards without disclosing the related values.
The goal of the team is to place cards in order from the lowest to the highest CO2 issued value. For each level, the team will have to locate the number of indicated cards from the related mission card in the centre of the table, always face-down – the goal is to lay out the cards in rising numerical order, from the left to the right.
The team can talk to take decisions on the layout of the cards.

—description from the designer

name: Um, Actually...: The Community Pack
description: This expansion deck for the game "Um, Actually..." includes 60 questions, proposed and/or chosen by the Kickstarter backers through a variety of online polls and challenges. These additional statements are integrated as a single new topic into the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sabobatage: Legends Of Matcha
description:
Sabobatage Expansion Pack: Legends of Matcha (LoM) allows up to 7 players. We introduce a completely new game mechanic that introduces a more complex strategy into the game. New ingredient cards, flavors, and action cards were carefully curated to help keep the speed of the game and maintain a healthy balance for 2-7 players!

(1st edition LoM comes with 2 foil-stamped exclusives)

name: Dog & Cat The Team
description:
In いぬねこサンチーム (Dog & Cat The Team), players divide into two teams, either the dog or cat team. Deal out 5 cards per player (7 cards in a 2 or 3 player game). The first player can play any card they want. The next player must play a card that is equal to or greater than the previously played card or they can play a special card.
When playing a regular card, you may play 1 card or 2 cards that have matching numbers. However, the 2 cards can only be a combination of milk and dog cards or milk and cat cards (dog and cat cards cannot be played together).
If you cannot or do not want to play, you can either pass and draw a card from the deck or pass without drawing.
If you only have one card left in your hand, make sure to cry out your team's call (dog team: "bow wow", cat team "meow") or else you will have to draw 1 card as a penalty.

As soon as one player runs out of cards, they win the round and gain a point chip matching the suit of the last card they played.
After 3 rounds, the team (or the individual in 3/5 player games) with the most points wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Danger The Game: Mythical Mayhem
description:
Wizards and dragons abound, it’s a fantasy take-over! Elevate the role-playing experience using the D20, epilogue, coins, bestiary, and more in this epic adventure.

An introduction to role-playing games where you use your
skills, tools, and imagination to devise a foolproof story to save the day!

The first victim is the person who lives the most dangerously. Each of the other players is called a rescuer. The victim draws and reveals a danger card containing the perilous situation they are caught in. The rescuers then place one skill card and one tool card from their hands which they will utilize to tell a story of how they will save the victim. While a Rescuerer presents their rescue story another can play a plot twist on their cards tripping them up and changing the story for more engaging play. the Victim awards the Danger card to the Rescuer with the best Rescue.

Cards are written for embellishment and lateral thinking. "Ph.D. in Dwarfish customs" well, what kind of custom?! Beard growing, axe throwing, anger managing, earth mining?

A 20-sided die is included. Whenever there is a prompt to roll you'll use this to find out what happens! Match what you rolled to the given prompts in order to reveal your fate.

A bestiary that documents the characters and critters of these worlds is also included. This also includes other optional ways to play to deepen the role-playing experience!

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel Total War
description:
"Marvel's mightiest heroes and villains battle each other in a war for the universe. Use your super powers, win this epic battle and be victorious."
— Description from the publisher


In Marvel Total War we will summon the heroes and villains of the Marvel universe using cards. Each character will have an Attack and Defense value, as well as special abilities (we can also use different objects to improve their abilities).

After summoning 3 characters each player, one of the players chooses one of their cards as attacker and a rival card to be attacked. Each player rolls a dice, adding its value to the attack or defense of his card and, after applying the special abilities, the defeated character is removed from the game (and the player will summon a new character in his playing area).

One by one, the character cards are removed from the play area.
The winner will be the player who still has characters in his play area when everyone else has been eliminated.

name: Cast The First Stone
description:
Cast The First Stone is a game where it's okay to judge your friends. Each round, a question is asked, and players cast stones to uncover the truth about their friends.

This game is a great way to relive old memories and laugh at ourselves while embracing some spicy gameplay.

—description from the back of the box

The player with the most stones cast their way wins the round, and the first player to win seven rounds wins the game, so the criteria for winning is pretty clear.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Carnevale: Blood on the Water
description:
Blood on the Water is Carnevale’s first campaign expansion book. Written by returning authors Gav Thorpe and Lewis Clarke and joined by David laPorta, this book introduces a whole new narrative, exploring each faction.

In addition to a wealth of new background story, this book contains the full updated

Carnevale rulebook, including new additions for advanced players.

With Reactions to your opponents’ moves, Advanced Acrobatics, and ways to customise your gang like never before with the fated Ill Tides and Artifacts, this is the most up-to-date, balanced, and exciting Carnevale ruleset ever.

There are also 15 new scenarios, guiding your gangs through the story and letting you fight this new era out on the tabletop yourselves.

At 112 pages, this softback book is every Carnevale player's dream. Filled with beautiful new art, fully updated rules and the next chapter of the story, it really has everything you could need.

You must have "Carnevale: Vicious Fighting Along the Canals of Venice" to use this expansion, It can not be played alone. "Carnevale: Escape from San Canciano" is a simpler version of "Carnevale: Vicious Fighting Along the Canals of Venice" with other scenarios. But the rules are the same.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Anarchy
description:
Are you for people? Or will you send the kingdom into anarchy? Social deduction meets resource management in this palace intrigue game.

Anarchy is an event-based resource management game putting a twist on the classic social deduction genre. Players are their kingdom's newly elected council members — each with a hidden objective and tasked with balancing their self-interests with the kingdom's well-being.

Players must work together to prevent their kingdom from falling into Anarchy whilst simultaneously plotting against each other to achieve their unique objective. But, be careful because amongst your friendly council members are Anarchists who are trying to sew descent and throw the kingdom into Anarchy.

Anarchy is just a vote away. Trust no one.

Follow our project on Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/westargames/anarchy-tru...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Voting

name: Remolacha: Picantona
description:
Adds 6 new sets of cards with 180 words about non-family-friendly concepts for adults. The game rules don't change.

Remolacha: Picantona es una expansión del juego básico Remolacha, con la que se incluyen 6 nuevos sets de cartas, un total de 180 palabras, especialmente destinada a los adultos.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Navegantes Espaciales: Pioneros Planetarios
description:
Attention space explorers!
It's time to board your ships and find the best space route to travel from one planet to another in this fun filler for 1 to 6 players.

Each player will have a personal board. Two dice will be rolled each turn. One of the values will be assigned to each player. With it, they must decide whether to advance along the space route (bringing it closer to the destination planet) or activate a sector of the ship to earn points and modifiers for upcoming turns.
The game ends when one or more players reach the end of the space route, however the winner will be the one with the most points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Race, Relative Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Picto Palabras
description:
Be creative and discover as many hidden words as possible in the images!

In this game, players must challenge themselves to find words and concepts in the displayed images, starting from a given category.

Whoever finds more words that the others have not found, adds points.

Repeated words between players are crossed out... so being original is a plus in this game (and in life),

name: Family Feud Canada
description:
Canada now has its very own version of Family Feud.
Complete with hundreds of Survey questions, and a Fast Money Bonus Round, competing with family and friends has never been so much fun.

name: Шакал Архипелаг: Остров Весёлого Роджера (Jackal Archipelago: Jolly Roger Island)
description:
This is a new island for Jackal: Archipelago. An adventure awaits you on Jolly Roger Island. A rare elephant turtle lives here, and strange enchanted steering wheels are scattered around the island.

Mix this set with the ones you already have to build even bigger islands.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Island Alone: The curse of the Golden Raven
description:
Go through a revenge adventure. The add-on introduces many new mechanics.

A unique survival game

1 player
6 maps
9 campaign scenarios

name: Eleven: Man vs. Meeple Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Includes:
3 Staff
-Emily Andrulis: Agent
-David Waybright: Doctor
-Jeremy Howard: Trainer

1 Director
-Ryan Schoon

1 Sponsor
-Man vs. Meeple

name: Forest of the Demon
description:
A solo roguelite in a mint tin, with dice driven combat.

A hero must fight through a forest dominated by monsters, servants of a powerful demon, so they may fight and defeat the demon itself.

The forest comprises several levels of cards which are flipped to reveal monsters (or occasional pickup bonuses or traps) to fight. As the player progresses they can upgrade their hero's attributes with each victory, providing greater power or defense needed to tackle the stronger monsters deeper in the forest.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Goosed
description:
Goosed is a trick taking game for four players. It uses traditional playing cards and two poker chips.

During the game, partnerships for each round are determined by who plays the the first goose card and who captures it. Those two players are trying to capture as many geese as possible without capturing all of them. If that team does capture all of the goose cards, they will earn a scoring penalty.

The scoring system for Goosed will keep players on their toes. Teams share the points they earn for capturing geese, BUT each individual player earns points for the tricks they capture. This forces players to balance working together with getting as many tricks of their own as possible.

Partnerships in this game are temporary, and there can be only ONE winner. Whoever has the most points at the end of the final round wins.

-description from designer

name: Golden Journal Number 51: Kursk – Dogs of War
description:
The II SS Panzer Corps controlled three mechanized infantry divisions made up of party militia and lavishly equipped with tanks, vehicles and artillery. They spearheaded the southern flank of the German offensive at Kursk in July 1943, where the Soviet 5th Guards Tank Army decisively blunted their advance.

This Golden Journal supplement includes four new scenarios highlighting these Corps. There are two versions of this: one with just the supplement that uses the default pieces in the games, one with a set of pieces in an all black color scheme.

—description from the publisher

You need Fire in the Steppe, Kursk: Burning Tigers, and Kursk: South Flank to play them all.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: T.I.M.E Stories: Semper Invicta (fan-made scenario)
description:
You finally get to the transfer room, answering the urging call of Laura. The AI is awaiting, impatient. «I assume it is impossible for you to arrive on time, so I will get straight to the point. Meet Bob immediately, there is no time to lose.»

Bob greets you with his usual countenance, standing in front of the pods. «As Laura stated, there’s no time to lose!

You know that we don’t know much about Mallartia. It’s the only country that aligned against the creation of the T.I.M.E Agency, so they have blocked all communication efforts since the very beginning.

We’ve got serious suspicions that they are trying to develop their own Tachyon Insertion technology, and you can bet that would be no good for all mankind.

Now we have an opportunity to, well... fix the situation. We have received a transmission from one of our inserted confidents telling us that he located some vital information for the rising of their leader Daerek Mallart. You will go to a military bunker, and the year is 2027, just before the Mallartian regime rose from the ashes of the war.»

—description from the designer
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Squirrel Girl & Gwenpool
description:
With Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Squirrel Girl & Gwenpool, players will turn the laws of reality into an open negotiation. This duo of fourth-wall-breakers will suspend disbelief as they bend the usual flow of gameplay to suit their own unique playstyles. Equipped with Team Tactic Cards that make them perfect tank-busters, this duo comes ready to warp the battlefield into a far stranger place to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Elekt: Wiedźmy 2
description:
New expansion for base game ,,Elekt". Adds brand new card ability and fresh 20 cards.

,,Elekt to gra wiecznie żywa.
Nie tylko na stołach ale i naszych planach." Wiedźmy 2 to
najnowszy z dodatków do Elekta zadebiutuje w III kwartale 2023 roku. Zaprezentuje Wam około 20 kart i nowy rodzaj zdolności.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Wargame

name: Key Enigma: Circus of Mhodryak
description:
Key Enigma presents an escape box that mixes puzzles, narrative and technology to immerse you in a challenging experience so carefully designed that it will be impossible to distinguish reality from fiction.

In this experience, you will investigate a mysterious circus that worships an ancient and unknown deity. You will focus on discovering the strange disappearances that have taken place there. Do you dare to face your fears and the unknown?

—description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Estranho no Ninho
description:
Estranho no Ninho is a fun trivia game of curiosities, absurdities and desperate guesses. In each round there is a new category (weirder than the previous one) and you have to guess as many answers as possible, but beware, some of them are outright lies, or...Strangers in the Nest.

On your turn, choose between:

Place one of your egg tokens on one of the answers on the board
Pass the turn and leave the round.


When all players have passed, check the answers. The winner is the one with the most correct answers.

Do cows kill more humans per year than sharks? Is it true that hippos can't swim? Bet against your friends each round, trying to avoid running into the Strangers in the Nest.

—description from the publisher

name: WORMS
description:
At first they are little worms! Roll the die to wriggle and make them grow and grow!
But be careful! If you run into another worm, you'll lose!
Try to escape or get out of the way!
Survive to the end to win!

—description from the designer

name: Elekt: Powołanie 2
description:
A new series of Core Units introducing exciting openings, requiring new strategies. This time, the box contains 5 sets of Units for each player - 20 cards in total. You can combine them with other additions to Elekt.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Nowa seria Jednostek Podstawowych wprowadzających ekscytujące otwarcia wymagające podjęcia nowych strategii. Tym razem, w pudełku znalazło się 5 zestawów Jednostek dla każdego gracza - w sumie 20 kart. Możecie je łączyć z pozostałymi dodatkami do Elekta.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Elekt: Rubież
description:
In this expansion, we focus on the locations and events of the Outlands world. You get 10 Missions and 10 Influence and 2 Privileges. Their abilities will overturn your strategies or open up completely new opportunities for you.

—description from the publisher (translated)

W tym dodatku skupiamy się na miejscach i wydarzeniach ze świata Rubieży. Otrzymujecie 10 Misji oraz 10 Wpływów a także 2 Przywileje. Ich zdolności wywrócą wasze strategie albo odkryją przed wami zupełnie nowe szanse.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Isle of Trains: All Aboard KS Promo pack
description:
Kickstarter promo pack, originally bundled with the Deluxe edition of Isle of Trains: All Aboard.

The promo pack consists of:

Promo Train: Future Train (x1)
Promo Tickets (x3)
Promo rule sheets

The train promo and tickets promos can be used either both together or only one or the other.
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trains
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Marvel HeroClix: Spider-Man Beyond Amazing Miniatures Game
description:
Swing straight into the action with the brand new Marvel HeroClix: Spider-Man Beyond Amazing smash hit Miniatures Game standalone experience! Spider-Man teams up with Miles Morales, Spider-Gwen, Spider-Woman and Spiderling to defend New York City from Venom, Bullseye, Shocker, Hydro-Man and Mysterio in exciting scenario-driven gameplay!

Play up to 8 campaign scenarios unique to this Miniatures Game for 2 players where results matter from session to session, or sit down for a head-to-head single match of raw power! Each of the 10 beautiful ready-to-play figures comes with two different ways to play for both first-time and advanced players making this an excellent entry point for first-time miniatures players! Map components are thick and double-sided tiles and the box includes everything that you need to get started exploring HeroClix!

—description from the publisher

name: MAD
description:
In this trick-taking game, winning a Trick isn’t always desired because each card has a ‘Science’ (+) and ‘Madness’ (-) side that could challenge the balance of players’ Score Piles. Trick winners take an opponent’s card into one of their matching Score Piles - 2 suits of which are imbalanced from the start - with the goal to reduce each suit to 0. The lowest total score wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Diez Ladrones
description:
The alarms go off in the middle of the night: the Numeri gang has robbed the mall again. As you are the only witness of the robbery, Zumm the policeman asks you to identify the thief among all the suspects.

Diez Ladrones ("Ten Thieves")is an educative speed game based on the number partners that add up to 10 (9+1, 8+2, etc).

One clue card with tons of suspects (numbers) will be shown in the middle of the table, the first player to put his hand on the correct guilty number will win the card.
There are three possible options:

If there is an odd amount of numbers you have to make pairs between number partners. The number left alone without his pair is the guilty number. For example, in the card there are: 3,6,7,8,4. Number 8 is the guilty one.
If there is an odd amount of numbers and also Zuum (policeman) on it, you don't have to put your hand on the number left alone because Zuum has already caught him. You have to put your hand on his pair, the missing number. For example:3,6,7,8,4 and Zuum. Number 2 is the guilty one.
If there is an even amount of numbers, all of them have their pairs, you have to put the hand on Zuum's card.


—description from the designer

BGC Málaga 2023 - Best Spanish Educational Game (Finalist)
publishers: Class Games, Falomir Juegos, Haikoyi Ltd.

name: Kawasaki Factory 20th Anniversary Box
description:
Kawasaki Factory 20th Anniversary Box was published to commemorate the 20th anniversary of Susumu Kawasaki, a Japanese game designer who has received high acclaim around the world.

This is a set of the new "Builder's High", the new version "R-ECO+" of the representative work "R-ECO", and "Rule Master".

name: Wunderbar Sonderbar
description: Choose a tick, then each player declares secretly whether it applies to them. You may guess as many as you want. Score 1 point for every right guess - but only if you didn't guess wrong.

name: Cycling Legends
description:
Cycling Legends is a strategic racing game in which you, as a manager, will try to get the most points with a team of four cyclists to win the game. With your Team Management Board, you will be able to defend your cyclists against incidents, upgrade the skills of your team leader and to control the energy status of your team. Nine pre-defined stages will keep you busy for a while, but you will be able to make your own!

A unique game mechanism will provide players to do additional actions during their turn which will influence the game. Reacting to unforeseen actions of other players on three different road types where you will need to use your cards wisely and escape on the right moment. Manage your team, use energy and power-ups to perfect your strategy.

The "Elite version" will take you to the next level by adding individual skills per cyclist and more tactical options during the game.

This dynamic game has been designed to maximize the interaction between players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement

name: Merchant Trails: The Silk Roads
description:
Merchant Trails: The Silk Roads is a competitive Print & Play strategy game for 3 to 5 players.

Players are curious merchants who, excited by the bustling exchange made possible by the Silk Roads, are racing to collect various goods and trade them in the diverse cities along the renowned trading route.

During each trading season, players will make trade agreements, send out camel caravans to collect goods and sell these goods in different cities on the Silk Roads. Gain VP and special powers by selling combinations of goods in each city.

Optimise your trade, but don’t make too many enemies; as your caravans meander through the Silk Roads’ harsh terrains, the other players determine your route – and the goods available to you!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Map Reduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement, Set Collection, Square Grid, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Pharmacology
description:
Pharmacology is a dice-driven strategy game featuring dice drafting, worker allocation, engine building, and strategic chaining of actions.

Pharmacology is for two to five players (plus a solo mode), playing in about 15-20 minutes per player. Lead a pharmaceutical company to victory by developing the most lucrative drug treatments and vaccines. You’ll need to send your medical workforce to outbreak locations to secure samples, research drugs, and develop vaccines to fight the world’s diseases.

Each turn is a puzzle to solve. How do you maximize your workforce and resources with the dice available to you in the dice pool? Deftly manipulating your drafted dice can create exciting action chains that make for huge turns!

Drafted dice can be used to power locations to generate temporary workers, medical supplies, resources, and money, which can then be used to power other locations to research drugs and vaccines so you can treat diseases to earn points. Outreach Programs provide abilities that can further increase your engine’s potential output.

Features:

Unique dice drafting, dice allocation, and action chaining mechanics.
Simple to learn, but complex puzzles result in feelings of accomplishment every turn.
Interesting interactions provide layers of depth.
Build up to amazing turns with action chains.
Solo Automa provides a challenging competitor that gives the feel of a multiplayer experience. The Automa can defeat you!


Overview:
Pharmacology uses a unique dice drafting mechanic. Everyone drafts from a common pool of Action Dice, which represent your Workforce. On your turn, you will draft dice from the Action Dice Pool equal to your Workforce level, then take your Actions. If there aren’t enough dice in the pool you’ll re-roll all the dice used by other players and then select the rest of your dice.

Using the drafted dice, you will work to collect Samples, use and upgrade various Locations, hire Medical Technicians, Doctors, and Scientists, develop Drugs and Vaccines, gain benefits through Outreach Programs, and Treat Diseases. You can also increase the size of your Workforce, boost your score by specializing in certain Disease Classifications, Quarantine diseases for easier research, and use profits to buy Medical Supplies, re-rolls, additional resources, and more. In an advanced game, you’ll also have opportunities to commit acts of Industrial Espionage and file Lawsuits to hinder your opponents.

Any dice remaining in the Action Dice Pool at the end of your turn are passed to the next player to begin drafting their Workforce. Throughout the game, your Workforce will increase and actions may allow you to draft additional dice. In this way the number of dice passed from player to player changes, resulting in a new puzzle to solve on each turn!

Pharmacology won the 2017 Manhattan Project Dice Game design contest presented by Minion Games. The late James Mathe loved the game, but it was bigger than what he was looking at publishing at the time. He suggested retheming the game (thanks to Troy Pichelman for the new theme idea) and continuing to work on getting it produced.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Chaining, Die Icon Resolution

name: Subjective
description:
We all know everything is subjective, but how does that help in a game of general knowledge? Because in SUB•JEC•TIVE, it's NOT about WHAT you know, it's about WHO will give you the best clues and HOW well you know your fellow players.

Add PERSONALITY to trivia and experience how SUBJECTIVE this game can get!

Start with a category and a secret word. Players then grab a different category and write down a clue. Choose a category to reveal and score points if you get it right. Finally, collect more points by guessing the rest of the player's clues!

name: Würfelwelten: Promo-Pack
description:
This expansion includes 5 published worlds, from games Feuerland publishes in German:

Arche Nova
Ein Fest für Odin / A feast for Odin
Libertalia
Parks
Würfelwelten / Rolling Realms

name: bitches (a dice game)
description:
Goal of the game to roll a "Drunken Stranger" or get a better score than your friends so you can claim you're better at rolling dice they are.

How to play:
1. Roll all the dice
2. Determine if you have bitches a "bitch" is the highest number on any dice usually this is the six but there are a few exceptions the 8 & 10 and 12-sided die as well as the custom
3. Remove dice you want to set aside your highest dice to get the best past possible score. You must set aside at least one die per roll you can set aside as many dice as you want.
4. Reroll the remaining dice and keep setting them aside until you're out of dice.
5. Score add up all the dice The person with the highest score wins.

name: The Sackson Legacy Collection (Red)
description:
A collection of three games pulled from the design notebooks and older releases of designer Sid Sackson.

In Cinema, players engage in light negotiation to create movies that will (hopefully) be big hits at the box office and during awards seasons. Players take turns being The Producer, soliciting items from other players to assemble films, matching directors, actors, and actresses to scripts that suit their talents. After a set number of rounds, awards are given out to the most prestigious films, and the money earned from them is added to the money players have acquired during the game. The player with the most money wins!

In Dig Site (originally published as Corner, two players (or four players in two player teams) take turns moving their trowel tokens to different rows of the board, taking gems where their trowel and their opponent's trowel intersect. Sets of gems score more points the more you have of them, but be the only player with a gem type and double your score!

Included also is Sackson's classic Bowling Solitaire.
mechanics: Negotiation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Reif für die Insel: The Outlaws
description:
A promo item for Reif für die Insel that adds 10 outlaw monkey tokens to your bag. Outlaw tokens are numbered 1-10.

Play Reif für die Insel as described in the rulebook, but with the following changes:
Set up

Draw 10 banana tiles from the bag and lay them face up on the table as the outlaws’ hoard. Only include good bananas – black bananas, storm clouds, and parrots should be replaced and returned to the bag.
Add the 10 numbered outlaws to the bag.

Play
Any outlaws the starting player draws from the bag
at the start of a skirmish go beneath the next free space in the banana row, just like parrots. They form a group with the next banana to be drawn. Multiple outlaws and parrots can be in one group.
Also like parrots, place the outlaws you win next to your island.

The Feasting Phase
At the very start of the feasting phase, before even the greedy parrots strike, the outlaws make their move. All players can trade their outlaws for bananas from the outlaws’ hoard. The highest-numbered outlaw goes first, followed by the rest in descending order.
When it‘s your outlaw‘s turn, choose a banana from the outlaws’ hoard and place it next to your island. Then return your outlaw to the box. Alternatively, you can choose not to take a banana and instead save this for the next season.
After resolving all the outlaws this way, the feasting phase resumes as usual. Bananas you grabbed from the hoard can be stolen by parrots or added to your points pile if ripe enough.
If there are any bananas next to your island at the end of the feasting phase, place them on free spaces on your island. If you don’t have enough space, return bananas you don‘t want to the box – either from your board or beside it – until you‘re down to 5 in total.

name: Rondeli
description:
Rondeli is a solo game in which you take the role of a new manager at the famous restaurant Rondeli. Actions on a rondel are taken using the mancala mechanism. Play and utilize multi-use cards to feed hungry customers and make it through the day with as many fed as possible.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Mancala, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Rondel, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sequitur
description:
Sequitur is a game of spelling, sequence, and strategy. To create a word, you’ll rearrange, insert, and remove letters on your rack with only three actions. Take out the right characters and your word will roll together with uniquely designed spherical letter pieces. Compete with your friends to earn points by spelling words that meet creative and challenging goals.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Ordering

name: Skara Brae
description:
Around five thousand years ago, a resilient group of farmers and hunters built a thriving community on the Orkney Islands of Northern Scotland. Rather than discarding their empty shells, broken tools, bones, and other waste, they used them to form large mounds of earth over hundreds of years. Later generations dug into these midden piles to create a series of rooms and tunnels to shelter from the harsh winds and cold winter months.

The aim of Skara Brae is to gather various resources in order to feed, clothe, and shelter the growing number of settlers. Players take turns drafting cards and using their workers to furnish, cook, craft, clean, and trade. At the end of each round, players need to provide for their settlers and will likely create more midden that needs to be cleaned up. After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: マドリイズム＋ (Madori-ism Plus)
description:
Madori-ism is a card game that creates Madori (floor plans) by stacking cards and connecting them.
Increase your favorite equipment and erase unnecessary equipment by stacking cards to aim for your ideal Madori.
The card game that creates Madori has become Madori-ism+ and is even more powerful!
New ways to play, such as resident markers to protect equipment and cooperative mode, will further expand your excitement!

name: Pokemon Dice Game
description:
Pokemon Dice Game (aka. Snorlax Dice Game) is based on traditional dice game Yacht.
On your turn, you roll 5 dice to fill one of the combination on your score sheet. The dice can be rolled up to three times in a turn to try to make these combinations.
The object of the game is to score the most points after 12 rounds.

—description from the publisher

name: The Attic monster
description:
Four friendly ghosts lived in their big old mansion for centuries. They had tons of fun scaring and tricking the villagers and throwing their cute but, of course, horrifying parties. What a wonderful afterlife!
The ghosts loved inviting guests, but not every one of them was so grateful for the invitation… A creepy Monster decided to have their mansion all to itself, so it kicked them out and nestled in the attic to play the ghosts’ favorite video games non-stop.
The little ghosts need your help! Together with them, you will explore the graveyard looking for keys to the rooms and the attic, find your way around traps, accumulate power, and then use it to get their sweet, spooky home back, sending the ungrateful Monster to its world.
But be careful! The Monster becomes more powerful every round. Throw the dice and think through all your moves together!

name: Zoning Out
description:
A city building game for 1 or more players using the Looney Pyramids game system.

During the game, you will be drawing random pyramids and adding them to your city's grid. Pyramids represent different municipal building zones. Red is Residential ("redsidential"), Yellow is Industrial ("industriyellow"), Blue is Commercial ("bluemercial"), and Green is Parks ("green space"). Black pyramids represent certain necessary, but perhaps unpleasant to be next to, facilities such as wastewater treatment plants and city dumps.

Large pyramids are large developments, and smaller ones are smaller. You will be building out your city subject to certain constraints. Generally, you want colors to be grouped together with the exception of the black pieces, which you usually want touching as few pieces as possible. Depending on which scoring rules you're playing with, these rules of thumb can vary, however.

The scoring rules you choose will have target scores written on them. The sum of all three target scores will determine the score you need to win.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: H.O.L.E.
description: A must-follow trick-taking game where 1's are trumps. Each player has a secret objective (High or Low or Odd or Even) - they get a point for each card that meets their objective and lose one for each that doesn't. Players are not guaranteed to have a unique objective.

name: A Cornered Wolf: The Air Assault on Rastenburg (July or August 1944)
description:
A Cornered Wolf is a "what if" game that explores what could have happened had Stalin decided to launch an attack (Operation "Wolf Hunt") in July or August against the Nazi dictator's command headquarters.

A mini-game included as part of Against the Odds Annual 2021. Includes 80 dice-cut counters, a 11"x17" map, and requires a deck of cards and a d6 to play.

name: Blade Rondo: The Legendary Set
description: A limited collector's box. Includes all five individual games, an art book, a metal day and night coin, two small playmats, six alternative art muse cards, the same six alternative art muse cards in foil and five breath control cards in foil.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bloomchasers: A Delightful 3D Tree Game of Flowers and Wits
description:
30-min light strategy game for adults - grow your flowers and outwit opponents on a stunning 3D tree, either solo, as a team, or competitively.

Each turn, players — affectionately called "Bloomchasers" — place a new branch onto the tree, along with a "bud" of your color. Your goal is to place your buds in certain shapes so when a Bloom card is drawn, you're set up to grow flowers (and your opponents aren't!) Your ability to read and predict the weather will help you bloom faster and make sure you're growing the most valuable flowers to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement
publishers: Evan and Josh's Very Special Games Company

name: 別荘殺人 (Villa Murder)
description:
Owner chef operating multiple restaurants, Sekunori Konishi had a moment of relaxation, inviting close friends and workers to a remote island vacation home.
However, the next morning in the wine cellar, a young gourmet writer and a Washi Ottane are discovered in the naked body.
Blood hammered near
The nesting incidents have been continued for a while.
Is this a criminal contractor?
But why the victim was naked..?

The complexity of the former disciples of the owner chef, assistant, his lovers' criminal, president IT and celebrity wife are intertwined with the incidence of characters
The "Mudder Mystery" is a little black adult that awaits the expansion of the shock.

Shorter playing time by about 60 minutes, yet supports 5-6 players.
The essence of multi-player marder mystery is easy to enjoy with this product.

name: Beyond the Horizon
description:
Beyond the Horizon is a civilization game in which players compete to become the most influential society in history through exploration and expansion, development and production, research and technological advancement.

The game is played over a variable number of rounds until enough goals have been achieved to signal the end of the game. Along the way, players will earn points for exploring new lands, settling and building new cities, advancing technologically, and increasing their cultural and economic development. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Worker Placement

name: La Gran Excavación
description:
The famous and eccentric paleontologist John Jamón has entrusted you with a mission. You must find the fossils of four dinosaurs and move them to the museum playing your cards wisely. Whoever gets it first will become your assistant, with the prestige that comes with it...

If you have completed an excavation, at the beginning of your turn you will be able to move the fossils to the museum.

Additionally, you must do one of two actions:


Play a card
Discard as many cards as you want


At the end of the turn you will have to draw as many cards as necessary to have 3 again.

—description from the publisher (translated)

El afamado y excéntrico paleontólogo John Jamón os ha encomendado una misión. Debéis encontrar los fósiles de cuatro dinosaurios y trasladarlos al museo jugando sábiamente tus cartas. Quien primero lo consiga se convertirá en su ayudante, con el prestigio que conlleva... ¡E incluye dietas!

Si has completado una excavación en tu turno anterior, al inicio del siguiente podrás trasladar los fósiles al museo.

Además, deberás realizar una de dos acciones:


Jugar una carta
Descartar tantas cartas como quieras


Al final del turno tendrás que robar tantas cartas como sean necesarias para volver a tener 3.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: ACW Solitaire
description:
In ACW Solitaire, the player plays the Union forces in the American Civil War of 1861-65. The aim is to defeat a simulated Confederate opponent using a combination of strategies.

Units include named Generals, Armies, Forts, River Gunboats, Naval Fleets and different Indian Tribes. The map is province based, including ports and the Mississippi river.

Union victory depends on a series of objectives being achieved, such as cutting the Mississippi and an effective Naval Blockade. It is unlikely the Confederates will win, but it is possible

The game has been intensively play tested and should take about an hour to play to completion - offering an exciting and stimulating experience of directing the strategy of the civil war.

There are a series of optional rules to allow players to investigate different aspects of the war, including a 2 player version.

The game is a "print and play" game available for US$5 from wargamedownloads.com
categories: American Civil War, American Indian Wars, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame
