To explain some of the changes from Mark’s original; a d10 is used for more granularity in combat results (for those times when the modifiers reach +4 to +6); the Prussians win on all ties; French Chassepot fire allows Prussian units to move only once after switching to Battle Formation; Prussians receive an Artillery Bombardment marker to reflect their improved artillery; death-charge rules for cavalry; and, finally, the French receive a Mitrailleuse fire marker which functions like the Sharpshooter marker from Gettysburg.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Space Plague
description:
Space Plague is a modern strategy game of planetary conquest for 1-4 players. The four major galactic powers -The Slimes, The Reptilians, The Rams, and The Flat-Earthers - all want one thing, galactic dominance. Their commanders ready themselves, the armies follow orders, and everything that can shake, shakes. The race to conquer new planets is the most important game in the galaxy and those that win it will gain for themselves and their species a brand new spherical land mass to rule and to populate.

In Space Plague, players will employ hand management and hand building strategies to efficiently guide their plague soldiers through various ecological environments while collecting energy (the game’s currency), adapting to planetary events, and overcoming the opponents’ obstacles that await them on their unwavering march toward the planet’s core. Survival of the fittest is the name of the game as the faction with the greatest number of soldiers to reach the core will be crowned the victor and given the deed to the planet.

The keys to victory are careful planning and adaptability. Everyone will begin the game with the same starting hand of action cards. These will be used each round to spawn, move, shield, or evolve your aliens. Additionally, certain factors will give variability to each game. Each planet you conquer has its own defense mechanisms which will force you to employ unique strategies and play styles. Planetary events are randomized and could spell riches or doom for your advancing soldiers. Additionally, the in-game marketplace offers dozens of evolutions that will improve the capabilities of your hand or grant you unique ongoing or temporary powers ensuring a different game every time. These elements not only force interesting decisions but also give the game extensive replayability.

Fellow commander, are you ready to join the plague?

—description from the designer

Space Plague es un moderno juego de estrategia de conquista planetaria de 1-4 jugadores. Los cuatro poderes galácticos principales, los Resbaladizos, los Reptoides, las cabras y los Terraplanistas, todos quieren una cosa, el dominio galáctico. Sus comandantes se preparan, los ejércitos siguen órdenes y todo lo que puede temblar, tiembla. La carrera para conquistar nuevos planetas es el juego más importante de la galaxia y aquellos que lo ganen obtendrán para ellos y su especie una nueva masa de tierra esférica para gobernar y poblar.

En Space Plague, los jugadores emplearán estrategias de manejo y construcción de manos para guiar de manera eficiente a sus creaturas de la plaga a través de varios entornos ambientales mientras recolectan energía (la moneda del juego), se adaptan a los eventos planetarios y superan los obstáculos de los oponentes que los esperan en su marcha hacia el núcleo del planeta. La supervivencia del más apto es el nombre del juego, ya que la facción con el mayor número de creaturas para llegar al núcleo será coronado como vencedor y se le otorgará el dominio planetario.

Las claves de la victoria son la planificación cuidadosa y la adaptabilidad. Todos comenzarán el juego con la misma mano inicial de cartas de acción. Estos se usarán en cada ronda para generar, mover, proteger o evolucionar a tus criaturas alienígenas. Además, ciertos factores darán variabilidad a cada juego. Cada planeta que conquiste tiene sus propios mecanismos de defensa que te obligarán a emplear estrategias y estilos de juego únicos. Los eventos planetarios son aleatorios y podrían significar riquezas o perdición para los soldados que avanzan. Además, el mercado del juego ofrece decenas de evoluciones que mejorarán las capacidades de tu mano o te otorgarán poderes únicos continuos o temporales que garantizan un juego diferente cada vez. Estos elementos no solo obligan a tomar decisiones interesantes, sino que también le dan al juego una amplia rejugabilidad.

Pequeño comandante, ¿está listo para unirse a la plaga?

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Bias, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Market, Take That

name: Munchkin 10: Time Warp
description:
With Munchkin 10 – Time Warp (our first numbered Munchkin expansion in more than three years!), you'll get 112 new cards compatible with the classic set by the TIME-honored team of Steve Jackson and John Kovalic. Arm yourself with George Washington’s False Teeth and Archimedes’ Screw. Whack your foes with the Philosopher’s Stone and a precious Ming Vase. And what foes! Cleopatra and her Pet Roc . . . Lucrezia Borgia, . . . with Monkeys, and even Mrs. O’Leary’s Cow, aided by Huns, Goths, and Vandals!

Use of these cards will guarantee you fail History class, but a good TIME will be had by all!

—description from the designer
publishers: Hobby World, Pegasus Spiele, Steve Jackson Games

name: Katamino Tower
description:
Katamino Tower is a logic puzzle game played with high-end 3D wooden shapes that must be arranged in order to reconstruct a tower. Each shape of the game is unique.

Experience the next level of challenge with high-end 3D wooden shapes that add a whole new dimension to the original iconic game. Each piece is a unique masterpiece waiting for your skillful arrangement. Take your love for puzzles to new heights as you reconstruct a tower that's not just a game but a visual delight. Katamino Tower is the modern evolution of a classic, inviting both seasoned enthusiasts and casual gamers to embark on an exciting journey.

In the cooperative mode for two players, each turn, a player chooses one of 15 pieces of the game and they play either around the pillar for the rings, or outside for the pentaminos.
Players are allowed to gather.
The rings can be rotated as they are played along the pillar.
The aim is to round off the perfect cylinder.
Each full ring equals 1 point.

Take your puzzle passion to new heights as you reconstruct a tower that's not just a game but a visual delight. Katamino Tower seamlessly blends the modern evolution of a classic, inviting both seasoned enthusiasts and casual gamers to embark on an exciting journey. With the option to play solo, the challenge adapts to your skill level, tasking you to recreate towers of 2, 3, 4, or 5 levels according to your chosen difficulty.

If the player chooses Beginner Mode, they receive clues about the pieces they should use. The Expert Mode comes with Challenge cards and solutions… There is more than 45.000 unique solutions in total!
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Gigamic, Hachette Boardgames USA

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Exclusive Miniatures
description:
This pack contains all the unlocked Stretch Goals miniatures and Kickstarter Exclusives.

Kickstarter Exclusives:

Werewolf miniature (80 mm)
Mr. Damp miniature (40 mm)
Sabbat Priest miniature (40 mm)
VTES — CHAPTERS card (x1)
LARP Introduction scenario (x1)

Stretch Goals miniatures:

Caitiff Twin (40mm)
Thin Blood/Haggler NPC (40 mm)
Prince of Montreal NPC (40 mm)
Arena Trainer NPC (40 mm)
Sheriff NPC (40 mm)
Gangrel Chief NPC (40 mm)
Harpy of Montreal NPC (40 mm)
Hideous Beast NPC (80 mm)
Inquisitor #1 NPC (40 mm)
Inquisitor #2 NPC (40 mm)
Gangrel Protean form (40 mm)
The Ministry Protean form (40 mm)

Note: All gameplay Stretch Goals unlocked during the campaign have been already included in the core box of Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS.

name: Summit: The Board Game – Flare Gun
description:
Summit: Flare Gun is a promotional card for Summit: The Board Game! Discard the flare gun during play to take one of the three actions listed.

Available as part of Pack D from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

name: Hornet Leader: Falcon Leader Module
description:
An expansion published in C3i Magazine Nr. 13. This variant convert the original Hornet Leader into "Falcon Leader", trading Hornets for Falcons and Carriers for Airfields.

Contents:
Rules and chart (4 pages)
2 Sheets (12 Falcon Load Areas and 4 new Campaign Cards)
1 Airfield Display
Additional counters
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Grand Slam Baseball
description: From box: "An exciting battle of wits for two players! All the thrills of real baseball! Includes special 54-card pack; playing pieces; 5 easy-to-follow charts; 2 scoreboards; score pad; complete rules and strategy by Prince Joli Kansil." Sid Sackson's 'Baseball' (from his 'Gamut of Games' book) may have inspired some aspects of it, but the differences are more significant than the similarities. For example, Grand Slam Baseball! uses the same rotation of two minor suits and two major suits as Kansil uses in his backgammon variant Marrakesh; Sackson's 'Baseball' does not.

name: Clay-O-Rama: Claydonia Conquers the World!
description:
Claydonia Conquers the World! is an expansion rule set for Clay-O-Rama. Claydonia Conquers the World! was published in Dragon Magazine #144 pp. 28-31 April 1989. The original Clay-O-Rama game was also published in Dragon Magazine (issue 125) by David "Zeb" Cook.

The original Clay-O-Rama had players make monsters (Claydonians) out of Play-Doh in order to battle each other. Powers from a list were assigned to each monster. Some Powers involve dice-rolling to hit, while others required actual physical actions such as throwing clay missiles or poking a finger through an opponent's monster.

In the Claydonia expansion there are Campaign rules and a list of 15 new Powers. The Campaign rules include Claydonian Experience Level Advancement so monsters who survive can get tougher. The new Powers include dreaded attacks such as "Absorb Opponent", "Use Self as Missile", and "Stomp" (in which a player uses a shoe or boot).

Expands:

Clay-O-Rama
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: The Race for Space
description: The Race for Space is a serious look at the space technology race of the 50's and 60's. There are three two-player scenarios, all of which are playable solitaire as well. The game covers the period from 1955 to 1970 from the first attempts to orbit a satellite to the first manned landing on the moon. Players develop hardware and systems through research, then conduct launches to test those systems. Finally, they announce public launchings in an attempt to earn prestige points (victory is determined by prestige) and through prestige points to increase funding. The game comes with 108 mounted but not die cut counters, 6 development displays, two launch displays, plus various charts, record sheets, and tables.

name: Dead Walk Again
description:
Dead walk Again, DwA, is a set of free, print-and play tabletop rules inspired by zombie movies that we all saw when we were younger. It is SWAT vs Zombies action in a fictional town called "Deadville." Over the last couple of years the designers have displayed the game at different game shows, and have found out what works and what doesn’t. From the designers: "After many game rule adjustments and countless hours of testing, we now feel that we have found the right balance in the game, and would like for you to experience it as well."

Microbadges
Buy It

Buy It
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: The Sertorian War, 80-72 B.C.
description:
An expansion for CAESAR: The Great Battles of Julius Caesar – The Civil Wars 48-45 B.C., this module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr10 and is available here. The counters for this module were inserted in C3i #13 and can be found here.

After Sulla marched on Rome and drove Marius out, Sertorius joined the Populares in opposing Sulla. This module includes battles in Hisapania by Sertorius against Sulla's armies under various generals including Pompey.

Battles:

Baetis River, 80 B.C.
Anas River, 79 B.C.
Langobritae, 78 B.C.
Lauron, 76 B.C.
Turis River, June 75 B.C.
Sucro River, 75 B.C.
Segontia, 75 B.C


This module uses maps from SPQR
categories: Ancient, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Robosoccer
description:
Yes. Robots play soccer too. But a brutal version of it!

ROBOSOCCER is a board game of movement and ball control whose objective is to score a goal (taking your ball to the last row) before your opponent does. Move your robots, and push, and jump above your opponent's robots until you score a goal.

Re-implements: Mundialito (Gold Cup)

name: Plan 1919
description:
Plan 1919 is a variant for 1918: Storm in the West, which was published in Command Magazine Issue #16. Here we assume no decision was reached during the campaigns of 1918, leaving the Allies with the task of driving the Germans from France and Belgium during the sprimg and summer of 1919.

This variant uses the 1918 map and most of the parent game's original counters, along with the new ones (32) provided in this issue. Except as added to or amended in the rules, the standard rules of 1918 apply here unchanged, along with optional rules 16.4, 16.7 and 16.8.

(From the introduction)

name: Steam Torpedo: Octopus Promo Tile
description:
The Inflatable Rescue Octopus (Poulpe de Sauvetage Gonflable) promo tile.

When a marine is on the the octopus tile, it allows to save marines on a destroyed compartment, they are placed on an adjacent compartment and are exhausted.

Tile available during special events.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Nautical, World War I
mechanics: Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Urbania: Subsidy Contracts
description:
SETUP: Take a subsidy contract tile.

RENEW: You may use your subsidy contract tile to add one worker to the total number of workers committed to renewing a building. This is a rainbow colored worker and can be used as a worker of any color. If used for a worker then you must discard this tile.

HIRE: You may use your subsidy contract tile to add one coin to the total number of coins needed to hire a specialist. This is a rainbow colored coin and can be used as a coin of any color. If used for a coin then you must discard this tile.

ITALIAN POLITICS VARIANT: The subsidy contract tile has 2 sides, active and inactive. It begins the game with its active side up. When you use it flip it over to its inactive side. For the rest of the game, if you lose control of a specialist (someone buys it from you), flip the subsidy contract tile back to its active side.

name: Winter Thunder: The Battle of the Bulge
description:
Winter Thunder is a substantial revision of Autumn Mist, an earlier design Brian Train's. Among the many changes are: a newly researched order of battle, with revised counter values and reinforcement schedule; cleaned-up rules including a solitaire play system; and a drastically revised map with a different ground scale and treatment of terrain. Nicely die-cut, two-sided counters and a 17 x 22″ map with nice art by John Cooper!

The system has two main “hooks” to it: an interactive Operations Phase where formation HQs are randomly activated one by one by chit pulls, and take nearby combat units under command to move and fight; and a near-diceless combat resolution system (a d10 is used to check if a particular unit takes casualties, but whether a check is required arises only after comparing attack and defense missions chosen by the players). Brief rules for solitaire play are included.

Released in folio format by Tiny Battles Publishing.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: King of New York: Sewer Crocs
description:
Promocard

Part of the King of Tokyo series.
publishers: Egmont Polska, IELLO, Lex Games, Reflexshop

name: Catan: Playmat Gold
description:
This is a Playmat for Catan with special rules.

The desert is replaced a gold field where you can get the resource of your choice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Bombshells Promo Cards
description:
Female super heroines join the fight, front and center, in DC Comics Dice Masters: DC Bombshells. Lois Lane, Stargirl, and Mera are an all-new, all-female special force taking on the Nazis in World War II, while facing the cultural challenges of women in society.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Mera: Queen of Atlantis (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light)
Stargirl: DC Bombshell
Lois Lane: DC Bombshell


Mera uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light, Stargirl uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League, and Lois Lane uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Nickelodeon Splat Attack! Reptar Rampage
description:
Just when you thought it as safe to return to the cafeteria, Reptar crashes the party! In Reptar Rampage, an expansion to Nickelodeon's Splat Attack!, Reptar joins the food-fight fray as an uncontrollable beast of destruction! Attempt to defeat Reptar by teaming up and splatting him with food, but be careful! Every successful hit causes Reptar to rampage, stomping across the board! if you get stomped on, then Reptar eats your points! The player with the most points by the time Reptar is defeated wins the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Last Summit
description:
Humanity has survived the apocalypse and settled into tribes across the landscape. Can the leaders of the tribes find a way to compromise and make room for a new nation, or descend back into chaos?

In The Last Summit, you’ll either work with the other players, or work against them to make your own new world. This is a diplomacy puzzle game with a traitor mechanic, but no traitor card, except the one in your heart.
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Galaxy Trucker: Rough Roads Mini-Expansion
description:
This FREE mini-expansion, available now, only in a digital form, allows you to add one (or more) Rough Road cards to your flights.

These randomly added cards not only give you new fresh challenges – but you can bet that your ships will be falling apart again, while tears of despair and joy return to your eyes.

Rough Roads can be added to any single flight, and also to the Transgalactic Trek.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction, Transportation
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Shaolia: Emerald Sea
description:
A promo pack from the Shaolia: Great Houses Kickstarter that came free with most of the pledge tiers. It contains a promo 1v1 scenario, 16 Lv2 cards, 2 character cards, and 2 quest cards.

4x Coastal Defense Post
4x Coral Reef Habitat
4x Patrol Boat
4x Pearl Divers

2 quests (they don't have names, they're just two additional quests to add when playing with the Great Houses expansion)

2 Characters - Navigator & Witch Doctor

It also came with a little paper booklet that tells you about the new promo scenario and any rules that the promo pack adds.
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Doppelkopf 2.0
description:
You want to learn Doppelkopf? You have friends who finally want to learn Doppelkopf with you? You want to inspire your family for the exciting game? Then we now have the solution for you: Doppelkopf 2.0 - the classic game rethought.

Doppelkopf 2.0 - the classic game rethought are innovative Doppelkopf playing cards that enable beginners and infrequent players to grasp the logic and mechanics of the game more easily. The playing cards contain supplementary auxiliary information: the trump strengths and order, color coding and order of the missing cards, the value of the cards when counting them, and hints about the possibility of winning special victory points. And the nice thing: You can still play Doppelkopf according to the normal Doppelkopf rules. Our game is tested by the German Doppelkopf Association e.V. (DDV). You can add additional rules to the game, such as the "pig", by using the included additional cards.

For the pictures of the playing cards we have come up with something very special: As a graphical basis for the playing cards, we were able to get reproduction prints of two card decks from the 1930s from the German Playing Card Museum in Leinfelden: German Doppelkopf Card Game VASS Altenburg 1931 and a matching Dondorf's standard ladies' deck from the 1930s. We have taken the pictures from the historical playing cards, graphically enhanced them and put them together to a new beautiful set of playing cards.

name: Wonder Book: Limited Edition Dice Set & Promo Cards
description: Five new dice in lilac, unique dicebag and the two promo cards "Gut instinct" (roll one die for each face up you have (max 5), then apply these effects) and "Bonds" (Choose another hero in your area. Both may gain one crystal, recover one life or move up to three areas).

name: Les Campagnes d'Italie 1859-1866
description:
1859. This is the story of the other — the nephew, the other French emperor, the other Napoleon for the other Italian campaign. Even if the names and places are similar, the events are quite different.
This campaign of 1859 is not the campaign of 1796 or even 1800. The revolutionary tide has passed, and the military movement no longer has the same epic sense. Nevertheless, a king has a responsibility to respond to the call of his people to rid them of the Austrian yoke and lead them to independence and unity. This king found the man who could support him against this formidable adversary; a man with an illustrious name, at the head of a powerful nation with a legendary army.
Everything plays out in Po Valley, from Turin to Verona by way of Milan, with no less than an imperial invasion to push back. They will have to cross waterways like so many hedges standing between them and freedom. They must be victorious in the bloody combats of Magenta and Solferino … Unless the Empire counter-attacks to save the Kingdom of Lombardy-Venetia.

1866 is the story of a young nation searching for its identity and seeking to take back the last part of its territory from despised Austria. However, this nation has not yet come to terms with its recent unification and will struggle against a tough adversary. The austrian army will achieve it’s greatest exploit of 1866, nevertheless so contrary to victory by force of arms.

VaeVictis invites you to experience these two campaigns with the Gaiter Button system, inspired by the Marshals. Incorporating feedback from the previous volume on 1870, the system offers improved fluidity while still perfectly simulating the European operation art of the middle of the 19th century.

Game components:

Two 59 x 41 cm maps
216 die-cut counters and markers
One booklet of rules
Four scenarios and one campaign
Two player aid cards

—description from the publisher

This game is part of the family games Bouton de Guêtre ("Gaiter Button") which includes also La guerre de 1870 (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/311190/la-guerre-de-1870...) and Sedan 1870 (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/306065/sedan-1870))
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Stout Hearts
description:
The Divisional Commander has ordered your Brigade to push on into the bocage. “Keep up with the flanking units, don’t let your chaps get sticky. There are only a few more miles until we are out into open ground!”.

You have three battalions of infantry. Well trained for the invasion but after two months of fighting they are getting tired. Replacements have come from disbanded units as there are few men left in the UK who can be drafted. You have a battalion of infantry tanks to support your Brigade with dedicated Royal Artillery Batteries for each infantry battalion. The infantry have their own mortars and anti-tank weapons for immediate support. Will they make it through the next few days or will they crack? The attack starts tomorrow at 05.00….

Stout Hearts is a solitaire game, based on Jay Ward's popular The Battle for Ramadi and Hue system. As Brigadier, your job is to push through the enemy defenses in exceptionally difficult terrain, utilizing not only your infantry platoons, but also tank, mortar, artillery, and machine gun assets. Intelligence on the enemy is limited. Are they SS? Are there Tigers? How many 88s do they have? Will they fight or will they run? Now is the time to find out!

—description from the publisher

name: Flames of War: Das Book
description:
Das Book is a supplement for the Flames of War WWII miniatures game that compiles many rules and articles from several sources. It compliments the basic rule book and the similar sized starter book. Some rules are updated, such as the "No Retreat" mission which was written to be more balanced than "Hold the Line" from the main rulebook.

The compilation was credited to Casey Davies, from work by The Battlefront team and friends.

From the back cover:
Compiled from across the Flames of War book range, Das Book includes:
Nine Combat Missions: Free-For-All, Encounter, No Retreat, Fighting Withdrawl, Breakthrough, the Cauldron, Roadblock, Hasty Assault, and Breakout.
All mission special rules.
Latewar Airborne Assault Special Rules and Mission.
Bocage Rules.
River Crossing Rules and Mission.
Fortification rules, with updated bunker rules and two fortification missions: Trench Fight and The Big Push
Street Fighting rules and mission
Complete Mid and Late war Arsenals for all of the major forces.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Zyrcan
description:
¡Combate en una épica batalla espacial!
Las cinco razas más poderosas de la galaxia se enfrentan en un estratégico combate por el control de la galaxia Zyrcan... ¿serás lo suficientemente hábil con tus naves?

Contenido del juego:
-1 Tablero
- 60 fichas de nave (12 por jugador)

Objetivo:
Los jugadores ponen todas sus naves en la galaxia Zyrcan y luego entablan una encarnizada batalla por su control. El jugador que más naves consiga tener al final de la batalla será el ganador.


Fight in an epic space battle!
The five most powerful races in the galaxy face off in a strategic battle for control of the galaxy Zyrcan ... Will you be skillful enough with your ships?Game content:
- 1 Boardgame
- 60 ship Tokens (12 each player)

Goal:
The players put all their ships in the Zyrcan galaxy and then engage in a fierce battle for control. The player gets to have more ships at the end of the battle will be the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Ryce: Empire of Sand
description:
The StoryIt is the 23rd century. There is an energy and resource scarcity on Earth. The planet is exploited and the world economy is about to collapse. Desperately Spaceships be sent out to explore the neighboring planets. A crystalline substance, shining like gold, with incredible energy content is discovered on Mars. It gets named Rich Yield Crystal Energy, or in short: RYCE.

RYCE could satisfy the insatiable hunger for energy of Earth if… yes if it is possible to collect the material on Mars, and bring it back to Earth. Every space traveling nation is called to participate and thus to secure a part of the energy source. But the difficulties are considerable. The extraction system must be developed and transported to Mars.

Hostile life conditions and water scarcity in this EMPIRE OF SAND do one last thing, but the challenge is accepted.

But then the shock: Mars is inhabited. The Martians live in underground cities and were not detected by the sensors.The Martians turn out to be cooperative and strongly point to the dangers of the planet. The mighty CRAWLERS, which move through the sandy deserts of the planet and cause dangerous sandstorms. And a mysterious faction, that calls itself THE BROTHERHOOD and that has no sense of humor when competing with their resources.

A difficult task, which can only be overcome with the support of all factions...if it were not for the rivalry among the nations!



DescriptionRyce: Empire of Sand is a area control and resource-management strategy game with a thematic background on a variable game board with interactive mechanisms, low downtime, low luck elements and a variable and calculable game-time. Conflicts in the game are solved by majorities instead of fights and war.

Each player takes the role of one of six space traveling nations of Earth (USA, Europe, Russia, China, Japan, India). The Players land on Mars with their bases, recruit astronauts, and send astronauts out to collect resources, install mines, build tunnels, and taking over control of mines from other players. Collected resources are spent in more astronauts, new mines, new technologies (to upgrade the collection of resources, the amount of astronauts, the movement-range etc.),or in influence to the three mighty factions on Mars (The EARTH, The MARTIANS, and the BROTHERHOOD). From the factions the players get control of special units and also get influence cards, that they can play in their turn to get different benefits. Through the controlled mines, the level of technology and the influence on the factions and their special units the players get victory points. The player with the most victory points wins the game for himself and his nation.
categories: Exploration, Farming, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Hunt Master
description:
Hunt Master is a thrilling game of monster-hunting, deduction and bluffing for 2-4 players. Players travel to creepy locations and hunt for creatures of the night to assist them in defeating their opponents. A player's goal is to locate five monsters of a specific monster-type (Cryptid, Undead, Paranormal or Humanoid) before their opponents assemble their legion of monsters. At locations, monsters hide within Hunt Decks that also hold a variety of action cards that keep the game moving. Players secretly make decisions about what they find while exploring, using the knowledge they've gained to track their monsters and prevent opponents from locating their monsters.

—description from the publisher

name: Makehay
description:
In Makehay players race their combine harvester to collect crop tiles in the fields. When the sun shines (represented by a sand timer) players program their combine harvesters by up to 6 moves at once. In the basic game the winner is the player who collects the most crops.
In the intermediate game players score bonus points for collecting crops of the same type.
In the advanced variant players score bonus points for fulfilling contracts.

—description from the publisher

name: 1-2-3-4-5 I Love Coup
description:
1-2-3-4-5 I Love Coup is a dexterity party card game.
Player will compete to play their card to the play area as fast as they can in order to empty their hand. The rule is easy just play cards in the numerical order 1 > 2 > 3 > 4 > 5. However, some cards will contain symbols that change the play condition that players have to follow. Whoever, play the wrong card or against the rule, has to gather the card pile to their hand as punishment.

1-2-3-4-5 I Love Coup tells the stories about the history of Coup d'état in Thailand. This game makes a satire story about Thai politic that the Thai politic always go in a cycle, starting with 'Campaigning' > 'Election' > 'Set up a Government' > 'Protesting' > 'Coup d'état'

—description from the publisher

name: MERCS: Recon – Covert Acquisition
description: Covert Acquisition adds MERCS from the ISS faction to MERCS: Recon. Included are five ISS MERCS and their corresponding player boards and special rules. In addition, the mission pack contains new missions and a new tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bedroom Battle
description:
Bedroom Battle is a game for couples where you play against each other to win rewards in the form of sexy favors.

The concept is very simple. Each game round you use battle cards to compete for a reward card containing three different sexy challenges. The winner of the round then gets to select one of the sexy challenges for you both to act out. Once you have completed the challenge you move on to the next round and start playing for a new reward card. To make things interesting the rewards will become more and more naughty until the game ends with the final reward - which of course is the naughtiest of them all.

name: 魔女の一撃宅配便 (Witch's Shot Delivery Service)
description:
In 魔女の一撃宅配便 (Majo No Ichigeki Takuhaibin, or Witch's Shot Delivery Service), players work for a...hypothetical courier delivery service, "amajon". It is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players, and in each trick, the players give their packages to the winner of the trick to deliver. (In theme, the packages are going to the same location, need the same refrigerated truck, etc.)

At the start of a hand, each player drafts a quota card which shows how many of their own packages they should deliver. The card also includes a chart showing the health of the player's spine. For each successful delivery, the player's spine worsens, and if they overexert themselves, they'll damage it more quickly. Some packages may also be heavier than expected.

At the end of a hand, players earn points for each trick won, and a bonus if they hit their quota exactly. The game ends after a number of rounds, and players lose points for any permanent damage they've done to their spine. The player with the most points wins.

name: Beards and Booty
description:
Roll your dice to send the other pirate captains to Davy Jones’ locker!

Many tides ago, the seas shook to the sound of cannon fire, the roar of Captains bellowing orders and the creaking of unfurled sails. The Golden Age of Piracy was a search for freedom, wealth, and glory…

But who amongst these fine figures of fortune was the greatest of them all?

Print your pages, grab your dice, and choose your markers as we set sail…

Each player needs a printed sheet and a couple of markers (to track your Reputation and Gold). You’ll also need 5 dice to play.

On your turn, roll each die up to three times. Aim for the combinations on your player board (they’re different on each one) to damage your opponent’s Reputation, boost your own Reputation, or collect Gold coins to take special actions.

Win by being the last Pirate with any Reputation.

—description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate
description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering reintroduces the Commander Draft format originally seen in the first Commander Legends and fuses it with the Dungeons & Dragons theme of Adventures in the Forgotten Realms, using the Forgotten Realms city of Baldur's Gate as the setting.

Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate is designed to be drafted. Each player opens a 20-card booster pack, selects two cards from it, and then passes the pack to the player sitting next to them. They then pick two more cards from the pack they've been handed, and so on, going around the table until all cards are picked. This is repeated with a second booster pack, and again with a third, until everyone has picked a total of 60 cards. Players then choose a commander (or a commander/background pair, if the commander has the Choose a Background ability) from among the cards they drafted, add any number of basic lands, and build a 60-card deck matching the color identity of their commander(s). Then everyone shuffles up their decks and battles in a free-for-all! (A larger pod of drafters splits into two groups first.)

The set is sold in draft boosters (individually or in displays of 24), set boosters (individually or in displays of 18), collector boosters (individually or in displays of 12), and bundles, as well as three-pack prerelease kits, which were made available a week in advance of the set's full release. In addition, four 100-card tie-in Commander decks were released alongside the main set.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Negotiation, Pirates
mechanics: Bribery, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, King of the Hill, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Player Elimination, Take That, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Romulan Ship Recognition Manual
description:
The Romulan Ship Recognition Manual expands on the ships types seen in the base game Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator, adding new variants for almost every Romulan ship in that product, as well as adding a number of new craft.

As with the base Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator itself, this is ostensibly an "expansion" for the Role Playing game, in that it provides more data than just the combat element requires. 3-dimension views are provided for all craft, along with extensive historical notes and background.

The book was released with two covers, each with the same internal info. In both cases, the cover of this 48-page product features a cutaway of the Romulan 'Whitewind' cruiser. However, the first release version has only the words "ROMULAN SHIP RECOGNITION MANUAL" in red block letters on the cover, while the second version has the "framed" design shared with the 2nd Edition Federation & Klingon SRMs.

Indicating the clear tie to the wargame, the last page presents a sheet of counters that you can photocopy and mount on cardboard for use with the tactical game.

Expands:

Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Combat Veteran
description:
Combat Veteran is a simple two-player tactical combat system that simulates the dynamics of infantry combat at the individual (man-to-man) level. This game features two historic scenarios as the introduction to the wider system: Firefight at the Rice Paddy Angle (Vietnam, Mekong region 1967), and Firefight at Combat Outpost Keating (Afghanistan in the Nuristan Province, 2009). Both firefights involved about a platoon of US infantry against an entrenched or numerically superior enemy force. The US and Viet Cong game pieces represent specific, individual (and historic) men of their respective units, whereas Taliban game pieces usually represent several men each. Though the game is meant for two players (one US and one enemy) per scenario, the system allows for multiple players to participate in the same game, allowing each player to control some specific game pieces while another player controls the other pieces on the same side.

Components: Two 22" x 17" maps on one sheet & 280 counters

Modern War #31 Sep-Oct. 2017

name: Classic BattleTech: Record Sheets – 3039
description:
Companion volume to the Introductory Box Set and Technical Readout: 3039 (though Technical Readout: 3039 is not needed to use the Record Sheets: 3039 with the Introductory Box Set).

•Includes more vehicle movement and combat rules, fleshing out the Vehicle and Infantry QSR rules from the Introductory Rulebook (contained in the Introductory Box Set) for more combined-arms action and fun.
•A host of additional BattleMech and Vehicles to play, all completely compatible with the rules from the Introductory Box Set.
•Includes ready-to-play scenarios and quick-start rules for generating your own scenarios
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: La Disfida: Barletta 1503
description:
This game was sent for free to those who pre-ordered Braccio da Montone.
The Disfida di Barletta was a tournament fought near Barletta, Southern Italy, on 13 February 1503. It consisted in a mounted tourney between 13 Italians and 13 French knights. The tournament took place in an area enclosed by the judges of both parties
This is a simple man-to-man tournament combat wargame.
La Disfida (DDB) is played by two parties of 13 knights who compete on a leveled playing field (which is a fenced area previously chosen) that has been overlaid by an hex grid.
Each Knight has indicated on the counter the name and the value (VC), which is fighting capability, morale, strength,etc.
The front shows the knight on his horse, the back the horseman on foot.
The objective is to capture the enemy knights

You must have Braccio da Montone to play La Disfida
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Mage Wars: Oscuda Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play.

Oscuda

Creature, Legendary.

Cost 13 Mana
Health 10
Armor 2

Quick Attack: Melee, 4 Dice, Piercing +1.

Full Attack: Ranged 0-0, Area Attack, Poison Attack,2 Dice, Daze 7+, Unavoidable, Critical Damage.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ninja Dice: Master Ninja
description:
This expansion adds 3 red "Master Ninja" dice to the base game.

''Information from the insert:

Gameplay:
Using the black house dice as normal each round you will add an additional red house die. Round 1 = 4 Black + 1 Red, Round 2 = 5 Black + 2 Red, Round 1 = 6 Black + 3 Red.

Rule Changes:
All red house dice are rerolled every time you reroll skill dice even if they were beat previously. The Fortune face now boosts by 5, not 4, making those seemingly impossible houses now beatable. Scoring remains the same; gain 1 treasure for every red or black house die beaten.

name: Better Me: The Game of Growth and Friendship
description:
Better Me is a new approach to relationships and personal development. It challenges people to take action to improve themselves and their life, and strengthens relationships by helping people understand each other in a deeper and more meaningful way.

The game brings up interesting topics that don't normally come up in daily conversation, allowing players to quickly learn about themselves and their fellow players. And all in an encouraging and fun atmosphere, with no pressure or judgment permitted. When was the last time you told a group of people about a past accomplishment that you're proud of, or had a game challenge you to write a thank you letter to a loved one?

Better Me also harnesses the power of accountability. Any player committing to an action must find an accountability partner to help make sure they follow they follow through on their commitment. Both players write down the action to be taken, and the target completion date on their game sheet. This accountability strategy is key to insuring that players take action and grow.

Players move around the game board and draw cards which prompt all sorts of positive action and discussion. Players race to fulfill each of their five life areas, heart, mind, body, people and tangibles. The game is won by the first player to "fulfill" (3 points) each of the five categories; heart, mind, body, people, and tangibles. Alternatively, the game may be played to a time limit, and if no player has fulfilled all categories by the end of the time limit, the player with the most total points is the winner.

In addition to being played by groups of friends and family, Better Me is also popular with counselors, schools/universities, youth mentoring programs, recovery programs, hospitals, etc.

It's a new and engaging way to improve yourself and your relationships with friends, family, and coworkers, all while having fun!

name: Catan: Playmat Atoll
description:
This is a Playmat for Catan: Cities & Knights with special rules.

Defend catan from attacks of barbarians. This game comes with rules in three languages: Dutch, English, and German. The mat is 61cm x 61cm (42’ x 42’).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Crisis on Infinite Earths Promo Cards
description:
Crisis on Infinite Earths is one of the most well known comic stories of all time - now enjoy it with theses 3 Dice Masters cards. Add versions of Superman, Supergirl, and The Flash to your next team to give your opponent a crisis. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Superman: Invulnerable (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest)
Supergirl: Crisis on Infinite Earths
The Flash: Crisis on Infinite Earths


Superman and Supergirl use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest, The Flash uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Das Licht der fünften Stunde
description:
Die Legenden von Andor: Das Licht der fünften Stunde ("The Light of the fifth hour") is a single card expansion for Legends of Andor that was released for the 5th Anniversary of Legends of Andor at the Spiel 2017 in Essen, Germany.

This Mini-Expansion can be used along any Legend of the three main games.

Rules:
During setup the card is is placed with the green arrow pointing at the 5th hour of the time track.
The first hero who reaches the 5th hour on the time track with his/her time marker while performing the "fight" action increases his/her strength by 5 for this combat round. If several heros fight together and move their time markers on the 5th hour they still only add 5 to the group's strength.

After the card has been used it is turned 180° so that the red arrow points at the 5th hour, indicating that the bonus cannot be used again until sunset. At sunrise the card is turned 180° again so the the green arrow points at the 5th hour. The bonus can be used again.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Guerra de mitos XI: Genios y Ladrones
description:
Guerra de mitos XI: Genios y Ladrones expands Myths at war, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 165 cards split with Persian mythology.

Genios y Lasdrones is the third expansion of the third age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (Myths at War) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

name: Builders!: The Building-Building Deck Building Game
description:
Builders! is a deck-builder in which you're trying to build the tallest, and most valuable, skyscrapers in the city. During your turn you will uses the cards in your hand, Employees, to buy more cards from the market. They could be additional Employees, to make your deck better, for Floors that you can build in your plaza.

Employees are the cards that make up your deck, giving you the resources that you need to either your your own Floors, or to tear the Floors that other people have down. Some specialize at building certain types of buildings, others help you hire more people to your deck, and still more have other special abilities.

As soon as you build a Floor, you've got a Building. Multiple Floors can be stacked to build a higher Building, getting you more points in the process. Doing so puts you at risk of jealous competitors tearing your stuff down, or an unfortunate visit from the Building Inspector.

The game ends based upon the number of Floors in play (8 for 4 players, 9 for 3 player, 10 for 2 players). At that point players determine their end score by adding the value of each Floor they have built, the height of each Floor, and any additional Value they may have added through other Floors creating buffs or advantages. The player with the highest cumulative value wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Codenames: Bonuskaarten 2018
description:
A set of 10 extra cards with (regular) Dutch words for the Dutch version of Codenames.

The cards are:

Doel/Foxtrot
Racket/Draai
Race/Maat
Horde/Samba
Diploma/Salsa
Record/Vloer
Team/Ritme
Basket/Disco
Atletiek/Ballet
Trainer/Choreograaf
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Polywords
description:
In each of the six game modes of Polywords, players must search for the best word to write in their "sea" grids respecting the Constraint card revealed on the table (you will fight with Categories, letters, shapes and a fast sandglass).
Remember that if you make mistake or if you don't write anything, you will gain a plastic bottle in your sea, which will give negative points at the end of the game: in Polyword, in fact, the winner is the players who has more empty space at the end of the game!

Polywords is a fast party game for 1-6 players in which the shorter words are the key to win!
It contains 6 modes designed for different number of players, 1 solo mode and 2-teams variant!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Impulse Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeons and Dinos
description:
Dungeons and Dinos is a family-friendly card game that finds inspiration from the elements, tropes, and iconic characters of Dungeons and Dragons and other role-playing games. Fast-paced and silly, you play as a group of Nomnisaurs that romp around the house on a grand "adventure" full of make-belief magic, construction paper, and costumes!

Assemble your forces as you'll need to defeat fearsome baddies like the quivering Gelatinous Ooze (Jello) or the ferocious Dire Woof (family pet), loot every shiny thing you come across, and steal kills from everyone else to say that you won more than they did in this (mostly) cooperative experience!

With nothing more than a party of 3 Noms and 2 pieces of starting gear, you'll immediately clash paper towel swords and throw glow sticks at wave after wave of baddies as you delve deeper into the heart of a "dungeon" in search of the BIG BAD. Just remember to use the cards you acquire on your journey to subdue foes, defend your fellow adventurers, and heal them up with snacks as you pile on trophies to your ever expanding collection!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Le Mura di Alesia
description:
52 BC. The Gallic tribes led by Vercingetorix were defeated by the army of Gaius Julius Caesar near Dijon and retreat to the city of Alesia, convinced to find in this fortress a safe position and the time necessary to regroup the troops and recover morale.

Julius Caesar, sensing the intentions of the enemy, also takes advantage of the particular isolated position of the city, planning one of the most ingenious sieges in history. He built two rings of fortifications, one external and one internal, to defend himself at the same time from attacks from the city and from the tribes who came to the aid of the besieged. The walls were fortified with towers, ditches and traps and sanctioned the victory of the Romans over the Gauls.

In The Walls of Alesia each of the two players takes the role of a Roman Legatus, commissioned by Caesar to supervise the construction of one of the two walls. Each one will have to take care of creating the most effective fortifications, hiring the necessary workers and deciding for each stretch whether to obtain immediate advantages from the palisades or to erect towers that will guarantee future advantages.

There will be a high competition in this constructors' challenge, but during the match there will also be two coordinated assaults by the Gauls, in which the Legates will have to cooperate to limit the damage. At the end of the second assault, it will be verified who has obtained the most prestige in the eyes of Julius Caesar.

—description from the publisher

name: Sagrada: Promo 19 – Tantrum House 2022 Window Pattern Card
description:
Promotional card offered by the "Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter". It has the code FGG-SA01-PR19.

It's a new double sided player card to build the stained glass window on. Shuffle into the deck with the other window cards during setup and proceed as normal.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – R'lyehian Seizures Promo
description:
A new card for Cthulhu: Death May Die, first made available through the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter.
Also available with the Season 4 expansion box when purchased during the Cthulhu: Death May Die - Fear of the Unknown 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

R'lyehian seizures:
"While there is a wound of this card, you may only communicate in gestures and gibberish. If you don't remove the token and take two wounds.

If there is a wound on this card remove the wound token and heal all your stress. Otherwise, place a wound token on this card".
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Battle of Mackinac Island
description:
The Battle of Mackinac Island is a solitaire and two-player game designed to be played in 30 minutes or less. The player takes on the role of the American commander during the Battle of Mackinac Island, fought in the summer of 1814, the final year of the War of 1812.

—description from the publisher

name: Sumo Rumble!!!
description:
Dominate your competition in this sumo-inspired battle royale! Roll dice into the ring, and then use carefully crafted skills to push, slide, flick, and toss dice into and out of the ring. Prove you have what it takes to be a Yokozuna!

How To Play
Each player chooses a fighter from around the world to represent them in the ring and a set of matching dice. Then everyone is dealt 3 skill cards to give them a fighting edge.

Objective
With the luck of the dice and the skill in your hands, knock your opponent’s dice out of the ring while keeping your dice in play.

Train your fighter!
Each fighter has unique abilities that correspond to their dice and the skill cards that unlock special abilities.

How to win
Once each player has used all their skill cards the round is over and everyone collects their dice to start the next round. The player with the highest score at the end of 5 rounds wins!

name: In Too Deep
description:
The depths of the ocean still hold many mysteries and opportunities. Five companies have now set off to explore the abyss. As they gradually go deeper, their potential value increases and shareholders see their investments appreciate. However, a sudden jolt towards the bottom of the ocean can limit future growth. Will you invest in the right company or go in too deep with a flop?

In a game of In Too Deep players are investors in deep sea companies. Your objective? To build the most valuable share portfolio! Buy shares in the five different companies or let them dive deeper into the abyss and receive profit for your investments. Pay attention to which companies you invest in however, as each company has an ability you can use to your advantage. Buy a share with discount, gain extra profits or discard a card of a company of your choice. With double-sided company cards, there are 32 unique ability combinations, making each game totally different! Will you become the most successful investor?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Investment, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Stock Holding

name: Tossit
description:
This funny activity game is a variant of Pétanque. Nevertheless as it contains so-called Tossits made of elastic material, it has not only similarities to boule but as well to dart as it can be played on nearly every flat surface: tables, windows and even cars, ...

The objective of this game is to reach 13 points. At the beginning of the game one throws the Jack (a special colored Tossit) and the aim is now to reach this Jack as near as possible with the three available Tossits for each team. While your team remains the closest, the opposing team has to throw until they come closer. The team with the Tossit closest to the Jack wins the round and scores one point for each of it Tossits that is closer than the opposing team's closest Tossit. The winning team throws the Jack for the next round.

name: Sweet16: Matchmaker
description:
Sweet16 is a lightly themed memory game inspired by Calcory from Mü & More by Doris Matthaus and Frank Nestel. It can be used as an educational tool to develop counting and memory skills in young children and with the full set of rules is a challenging and fun game for more serious gamers.

The game uses a standard deck of cards and melds hidden information, memory, bluffing and special card powers into a fun, short game.

Cards are revealed with the aim of having their values sum to 16. Players can push their luck or engage their memory and hope to avoid going bust. Or they can play it safe and hope their opponent cannot outdo their achievement. If a player succeeds they collect the revealed cards into a score pile. One of the cards is re-hidden and another can be used for it's special power. Highest score wins.

The theme is nominally about high-school intrigue and dating.

name: American Idol All-Star Challenge DVD Game
description:
from the web site

Experience all the excitement of American Idol as you journey from Auditions, to Hollywood and onward to the Finals round of competition. With real television clips from the first four seasons, plus show questions and performance challenges, American Idol – All Star Challenge will transform your living room into the ultimate TV talent showdown. Test your Idol knowledge as you relive all the trials and tribulations, the victories and the heartbreaks that have made American Idol one of the hottest shows on television today.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: 日の出横丁ニャンばーわん (Top of the Hinode Town)
description:
In 日の出横丁ニャンばーわん (Top of the Hinode Town), the players take on the role of rival groups of feral cats, fighting over territory in Hinode, with the local human population being ignorant of their endless battles.

It is a "may follow" trick-taking game where in each trick, the lead player decides on an area of town where the trick will take place, and the color of the area card determines the "lead suit" for the trick.

In evaluating the trick, each player is ranked, with the first and second highest players earning the right to place a marker on the card, the lowest ranked player collecting a cube of their choice from the card, and the remaining player collecting the remaining two cubes from the card. (Cubes can be used to trigger effects or saved for victory points.)

Players earn points from yellow cubes, markers on cards, and groupings of their markers. After one hand, the player with with most points wins.

name: Animal Color
description:
Animal Color is a collection of 16 Games that can be played with the same deck of 42 cards, containing 32 of them with 4 different animals and 4 different color backgrounds, 9 wild cards and 1 Animal/Color card.

The games are:

1. Line
Players must play at the same time cards in the Line on the center of the table trying to avoid matches with any other card´s Colors or Animals on it. When all cards are played, the Player with fewer cards is the Winner!!

2. Battlefronts
Players must play cards in any of the 3 battlefronts available to destroy the opposing battlefront. The first Player to destroy 3 opposing battlefronts Wins!!

3. Pushing
Push cards on the grid to make it enters in the other player´s zone. But remember, all players have a secret Protection. The one with fewer point Wins!!

4. Roads
Try to get out from all of your hand´s cards by playing them in the table forming Roads. Play all yours card to Win the game!!

5. Missions
Players take cards and use them to complete Missions. Better Missions, more cards. At the end of the game, the player with more cards Wins!!

6. Smack it All
Players take one card per turn from the deck, until someone notices they are three cards matching with one of the Wild Cards in the center of the Table. The First one to Smack it win that three cards. When the deck is depleted the player with more cards is the Winner!!

7. Liars
Duel other players with your card. If they find out you lie, you lose and give that card. If they not, you win the duel and the card. The player with most sets done with the cards Wins!!

8. Groups Forge
Players take cards from the table and then together with the ones in their hands, they forge Groups to win points. When any Player forge his/her third group, end the round an count the Points provided by the groups. The one with most Points Win the Game!!

9. Stocks
Players take cards from the deck and then bet one of them on one of the Stock available on the table. When the deck is depleted, players sell their cards to the Stocks available and the One with more Points is the Winner!!

10. Between Zoos
Players play cards to their right or their left. These are shared with that respective side players, when deck depletes players choose 1 Animal and 1 Color to point from the cards in the right, the left and the one still in their Hands. The player with more points Wins!!

11. Confrontation
Players must choose to keep giving the cards to other player to get a full 3 card match, or ending the turn and giving the other player that chance. When the Deck runs out of cards, player with most cards is the Winner!!

12. Cooperative
Players must play three matching cards every round to draw another three cards from the deck. If Players runs out of cards, the game ends and all Players lose. But if the deck is depleted, all Players Wins!!

13. Match 4 in line
Players must guess where (behind a grid of 4x4 cards) hide a 4 in line of a matching Color or a matching Animal. They can look at one card or switch between two adjacent cards. The First one to guess correctly is the Winner!!

14. Memory-Bear
A classic game with a re-twist. Find the exact pair of a card to get the 2 caeds, or find any Wild card and get the card in that moment. When the cards in the table are over, the one with most cards WIN!

15. Tower
Players must take cards from the tower to match with their secret objectives and form sets of three cards to get the most Points and Win the Game!!

16. Expedition
A solitaire expedition to the pyramid. The player must complete a chain of cards matching the Color or the Animal to Win!!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Battle of Armageddon
description:
From the Microgame Design Group website:

The Bible contains prophecies about the final days describing how the armies of the World shall fight the final battle and that, without divine intervention, no life shall be saved. Modern biblical scholars have described how closely these prophecies correlate to our modern times and put forward scenarios for this climactic battle.

The Battle of Armageddon is a two or three player game dealing with this final battle. The game brings together the forces of Israel, America, Europe, China, Russia, and the Arab world into the ultimate battle for control of the World.

The 11 x 17"map represents the battle ground, stretching from Egypt to the Euphrates. The 280 counters represent the forces of Israel, America, Europe, China, Russia, and the Arab world into the ultimate battle for control of the World.

name: Hillclimb
description:
Choose from eight cars each with different gearing, top speed, and handling, and drive them like a real car via gear changes, accelerating, and braking, trying to find the quickest route up the ten hills featured.

Another dice & chart game from Terry Goodchild.

name: Matoca
description: Matoca is a tile-laying abstract strategy game of five-in-a-row, using 12 red and 12 white squares. Players take turns placing their tiles in a way that touches a previous tile by its side or corner, with the goal of first laying down five tiles in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. If all tiles are placed with no victor, players begin removing their own tiles before placing them in another location. Tiles cannot be removed in a way that would separate tiles from the main group. This continues until the game is won.

name: The Battle for Madrid
description:
This is a 1970s wargame giving a technically simple but remarkably faithful operational treatment to the crucial central battles in the Spanish Civil War - the battles of Brunete, Madrid, and Guadalajara.

144 counters
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Lincoln's War
description:
Lincoln's War uses the same grid based system as the "Square Bashing" World War One rules, where the play surface is subdivided into 1 foot (30 cm) squares. Units advance from square to square coming into conflict when they wish to advance into one of the opponent's square.

The game is designed for a 6' x 4' table. Terrain is abstracted; the individual squares are rated as open (little or no terrain) and closed (terrain that encumbers movement such as woods or towns). Because figures are simply moved from one large square to another, basing standards are very relaxed; units can be based in almost any fashion and both sides need not be identical.

The game system includes rules for off-table effects such as cavalry scouting, supply and shortening/lengthening the scenario.

The scale is as follows:

Infantry regiments are 3-5 bases.
Artillery batteries are 1 base.
Cavalry regiments are 3-4 bases.

Individual squares can hold up to 10 units of infantry or cavalry or 5 units of artillery.

name: Wizard's Tower
description:
Magical energies await exploitation from you and your fellow wizards and the apprentices you each control. Cast the rune stones to find where you may put your apprentices to work. Use them to build towers to gain powers, bonuses and points. Use them to destroy opponents’ towers. Or build your towers next to others to increase their value. Use the special abilities your towers give you to protect yourself, attack others, gain points at the end of the game.
Will you focus on building close together to make a strong base worth a lot of points, spread your towers around to win influence across the land, or focus on destroying competitors’ towers with your awesome army of apprentices?
The wizard that has gained the most power and influence at the end will be the Mage with the Most, the Sorcerer Supreme, and the Mightiest Magician.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building

name: Leibstandarte Pack 1: Blitzkrieg
description:
Eight scenarios that follow the 1st SS Panzer Division, Liebstandarte Adolf Hitler through the opening of World War II. This is the first of four expansions. These scenarios are compatible with MMP’s ASL System.

The scenarios are:

LSSAH #1: Opening Fire
Gola Poland, 1 September 1939

LSSAH #2: They Stop Here!
Pabianice Poland, 7 September 1939

LSSAH #3: Fruhjahrbestellung
West of Bornebroek, Holland, 9 May 1940

LSSAH #4: By the End of a Rifle!
Zutphen, Holland, 9 May 1940

LSSAH #5: "To Hold?"
Wattenburg, France 25 May 1940

LSSAH #6: Hurry Up!
St. Poursain, France, 19 June 1940

LSSAH #7: "Just in Time"
South of Medzidli-Kenali Yugoslavia 4 April 1941

LSSAH #8: The Devil's Pass
South of Lehovon Greece, 14 April 1941

Expands

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Yams! A Game of Power and Glory in the South Pacific
description:
A strategy card game for 2-4 players. Players take up the roles of island chieftains in the Trobriand Islands in the Southwestern Pacific in the 1890s; chieftains are competing to become the new Paramount Chief of the islands. Over the span of several harvest seasons they gather followers and land, harvest yams which serve as the currency of the islands, host dramatic feasts, organize trading expeditions and use magic and deception to undermine each other. The game ends when the cards run out and the winner is determined by a counting of "prestige points," which are acquired through having worker or yam plot cards (worth 1 point each), winning feast cards from other players (3 points each) or kula cards which represent the legendary pieces of jewelry acquired on trade expeditions (worth 5 points each).

Yams! is based on the ethnographic works of legendary anthropologist Bronislaw Malinowksi working in modern-day Papua New Guinea in the 1910s.

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Maegan Cyndewin – Hero Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ready your spells with the Maegan Cyndewin – Hero Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game!

Compatible with the Latari Elves faction, the Maegan Cyndewin – Hero Expansion comes with one cavalry plastic figure, an infantry plastic figure, as well as new terrain, objective, and deployment cards. Six new upgrade cards allow you to customize your Latari army as Lady
Cyndewin leads them into battle!

name: Chechen War: 1994 - 1996
description:
Eternal War is an operational-strategic level two-player simulation of the 1st Chechnya War (1994-1996) wherein the Russian Federation under Boris Yeltsin attempted to directly and forcibly put an end to the Chechen independence movement. The Russian player must deal with low morale at the front and at home to win the war to keep Chechnya within the Russian Federation. The Chechen player is outgunned and outnumbered, but can wage an effective guerrilla campaign to bog down the entire Russian effort and thereby achieve independence. There is a total of nine game turns covering two years of conflict, from December 1994 to December 1996. The game map encompasses Chechnya and surrounding territories (Georgia, Ingushetia, Dagestan). Included on the counter sheet are Bonus counters for Modern War #1 (Red Dragon/Green Crescent), Modern War #18 (Green Beret), Modern War #21 (Kandahar) and errata counters for Modern War #17 (Dien Bien Phu).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Llamagedón
description:
Houston, we have a problem! Meteors incoming! The llama armageddon (llamagedón in short) is coming and llamas are afraid of it. To brace themselves for the end of the world, they need to build shelters.

Llamagedón is a slightly strategic and light card game that combines mechanics such as hand management, take that and set collection. On their turn, a player draws a card from the deck. If they draw a Shelter card, then they have to play it immediately by placing it down. Shelters can also be built by combining resources. Beside playing shelters or building them, a player can use one action card which might involve attacking or stealing shelters, swapping one card for another, skipping the next player's turn, protecting your shelter, drawing two cards from the deck or even canceling the action of another player.

Eventually, a player will draw the Llamagedón card from the deck (which was randomly shuffled into the lower half of the deck) and this means everyone gets another two turns. After that, whoever has the most shelters is the winner.

The game consists of 60 cards plus 5 reference cards and it's in both Spanish and English.

If you like llamas, meteors and sheeps, then Llamagedón might be a good fit for you.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Obey the Clay
description: Obey the Clay sees two teams use their clay to complete Aardman-inspired challenges as fast as they can. As soon as they’re done, they flip the Time-o-Matic to begin their rival’s turn to complete a task. The faster you go, the more pressure the other team is under--for if you run out of time, the other team wins the round.

name: Le Cadran de Kaplan
description:
First you put 12 cards in a circle on the board and 6 cards in the middle. Cards are chosen in accordance with symbols on there backs. On the other side there is a letter or a space for cards on the circle, and a clue for cards in the middle. Letters will make a word 6 to 12 letters long. You don't know where the beginning and the end of the word are. You must find it as fast as possible. More than 400 current French words are available.

The most impressive in this game is that the game itself creates the word! All players can play together to find it, including the player who put the cards on the board in the first place.

Each player rolls 3 d12. The roll indicates which cards are available for auction. Players can put on a card a token face back (values of those tokens are from 1 to 9).

When 3 tokens are put on a card, the value of the token is shown. The player with the highest value can look at the card.

In a second part of the game some cards are shown to all the players. Winning auctions allows the player to look for a clue card.

When a player thinks they have discovered the word he/she writes it on a paper. At the end of the game, the word is revealed. Players win victory points in accordance with the earliest correct deduction.

name: Flutter
description:
"To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,
One clover, and a bee." —Emily Dickinson

Immerse yourself in the wonder of nature and create a vibrant meadow bursting with flowers to attract the most vital creatures of the ecosystem - graceful Hummingbirds, swift Dragonflies, flittering Moths, delicate Butterflies, dancing Ladybugs, and revered Bees, the king of all pollinators.

With each turn, you will place uniquely shaped tiles, aiming to match petals and grow flowers. But it doesn't end there - it's about nurturing the ecosystem by providing the right flowers to each fluttering critter, spreading their rich pollen throughout the meadow. You will accomplish this by strategically enclosing tiles, boosted by clever use of your bee token.

Don't take too long to make your move though - the supply rondel is running low, and once a single stack of tiles is emptied, the game comes to an end. The player with the most pollen at the end of the game will be crowned the winner and earn the admiration of all the pollinators in the meadow!

Flutter is a strategic tile-laying strategy game for 2 to 5 players, ages 8 and up, and it takes about 30 minutes to play. Players take turns laying tiles of varying shapes, earning petal tokens for matching flower petals in each corner. As the game progresses, players will spend those petal tokens when they enclose a previously laid tile, supplying the tile's pollinator with all the flowers it needs, earning pollen. Once a single stack of tiles in the supply rondel has been emptied, the player with most pollen is the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Environmental
mechanics: Matching, Open Drafting, Rondel, Tile Placement

name: Sherlock Holmes: International
description:
For once, Sherlock Holmes' talents are required across borders. It is with his brother Mycroft, a member of the British government, that the famous detective will go from India to the United States to solve three investigations. Play as one or the other of the Holmes brothers, and find the guilty parties.

Sherlock Holmes: International is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
publishers: FoxGames, Graphic Novel Adventures, Makaka Editions, Pegasus Spiele, Van Ryder Games

name: Dark Horse: Outlaw
description:
The Outlaw expansion has a very limited print run and was made available to backers of Dark Horse on Kickstarter.

This mini expansion adds a unique Special Role called the "Outlaw" to the game. This role may come into play when a Jail Action is triggered, with a player successfully rolling a die to escape the scene of the crime. Once claimed, the Outlaw special role will have an interesting ability that allows a player to use the result of a rolled black die to bump opponents off already claimed actions. This powerful ability is kept in check by the owner of the Sheriff role having the added ability to use the result of a silver die to capture the Outlaw player who then loses the special role and must spend the remainder of the turn sitting in Jail.

This expansion gives players a teaser of some of the mechanics that will be added to the pending full box expansion for Dark Horse.
categories: American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Orilla: 1st StarGuard Supplement
description:
