34 page supplement booklet to Starguard adding cybernetics, game scenarios new weapons and three new alien races; Orilla, Nekton and Terrellian.

Expands:

StarGuard!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Stalingrad! Valor of the 37th Guards
description:
This expansion for Advanced Squad Leader contains 9 scenarios and a Campaign Game on a large hex map of the Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works. (Ownership of Red Barricades is required to play this game).

The northernmost of three huge factory complexes along the Volga, the Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works was an extended cluster of warehouses, office buildings and assembly halls built with the help of the Ford Motor Company in the 1930's to improve Soviet farming with modern tractors. The factory itself was bordered by an oil storage facility and worker' housing units. At the outset of the war with Germany, the factory was hastily retooled to make the soon-to-be-famous T-34 medium tank.

The steel ribs of the workshops stuck out amidst enormous mounds of rubble. The German 14th Panzer and 389th Infantry Divisions pounded the Guardsmen and smashed into the workshops of the factory itself for the first time. The factory had been busy, building and repairing tanks to the end, and the last T-34 tanks produced went into action unpainted. Now men cut each other down in brutal firefights staged at arm's length in the broken halls of the factory, while tanks sent shells crashing through the gloomy workshops in showers of sparks.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Wilderness Wars
description: Wilderness Wars simulates company and battalion-sized conflicts during the 18th century - specifically the French and Indian War, American Revolutionary War and War of 1812.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: American Civil War Wargaming
description: An introductory book on American Civil Wargames, with miniatures. Full rules set included.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Deep Space DrillerAce
description:
From the box:
Become a Deep Space DrillerAce. Oil and water are in short supply. The rulers of earth are becoming desperate. You and your opponent have been sent to the planet Arual where oil and water are abundant. Arual is inhabited by a superstitious race. The Arualians have agreed to allow you and your opponent to drill a maximum of 61 wells either for oil or water, but only at a strictly controlled rate. The Arualians are somewhat primitive and you have discovered that they revere a series of sacred symbols. When you place your Driller Domes in a pattern that resembles one of these symbols, the Arualians will allow you to drill wells at a faster rate. Your goal is to place more Driller Domes than your opponent and return home with the title of "Deep Space DrillerAce".

Deep Space DrillerAce is an abstract strategy game for 2 players.
Players take turns placing glass Driller Domes on a hex board in an attempt to complete patterns that are shown on cards in their hand. When patterns are completed the player is allowed to immediately place more Driller Domes. The winner is the first player to place all 33 of his Driller Domes or the player with the most Domes on the board when it is completely filled.

The game comes with: 1 game board, 66 glass Driller Domes, 40 pattern cards and 1 rules sheet.

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Mord in Shanghai
description: A murder mystery party set in the Shanghai of the 30s - a vibrant, multicultural metropolis with two faces. With opium and gambling hat Yu Sheng-Ho, the "Godfather of Shanghai", earned a fortune. In his posh "Shanghai-Club" mixes the illustriously Shanghai Society with the underworld.

name: Time Gradient
description:
Time Gradient has been created for the Traditional Card Game contest.

Players represent rival civilizations from possible futures. Using time machines and the traditional ploys, they try to influence the past, and make their future certain.

Required for play:

Two decks of playing cards
About 40 Counters (of any kind)
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Oracle's Breath
description:
Legend has it that the 'Oracle's Breath' is a powerful relic. Whosoever possesses the trinket can write his own fate. 'Rumors often exceed the truth,' you smirk to yourself. It is no surprise, however, that one day, Caius, a powerful merchant, approaches your group and makes a very lucrative offer.

'Return the Oracle's Breath to me, and I will pay each one of you who comes back 300 silver pieces,' he states.

But that was weeks ago. Now as your skiff approaches the damp wooden pier in the smothering fog, only one thought races through your mind. "What have I gotten myself into!" So you grab your weapons, and tie off, preparing for riches and reward, or a fight for your life in search of the Oracle's Breath.

The Oracle's Breath is a complete fantasy adventure for solitaire or group play. This game includes the adventure booklet, game rules, playing pieces and game board. It is suitable for ages 12 and up and can be played with either the included Legends of the Ancient World games system or other game systems such as Melee.

Home Page: http://www.darkcitygames.com/display.php?series=LAW&;id=21
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Iropoly
description: The Iranian edition of the classic Monopoly game. This version used the standard Monopoly design with city streets from Tehran, Iran. The currency was the Iranian Rial and it had both English and Farsi (Persian) for all printed text. According to there are pre- and post-Iranian revolution versions with different street names.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: BattleTech Record Sheets Volume Four: Assault 'Mechs
description:
From the back of the book:

"100 tons of devastating firepower. Nothing can stand in a BattleMech's way, except another 'Mech! This book compiles for the first time the BattleTech statistics for the variant Inner Sphere & Clan 'Mech designs. Some are rare, others unique, and each could be that extra surprise you need for victory.

BattleTech Record Sheets Volume 4: Assault 'Mechs contains assault 'Mech variants from the 2750, 3025, and 3050 eras of BattleMechs. Included are record sheets for over 45 'Mechs, each with full technical statistics. Included are:


ANH-1A Annihilator
IMP-2E Imp
MAD-4A Marauder II
SHG-2E Shogun
THG-11E Thug
Gladiator A OmniMech
Masakari C OmniMech"


User comment:

This record sheet pack is one of four that cover all of the 'Mechs detailed in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 2750, BattleTech Technical Readout: 3025 and BattleTech Technical Readout: 3050. It also includes the current Combat Values for the 'Mechs, as at the time of printing.

Although the copyright date states that this publication is copyright 1991, it was actually published in 1990.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: ATS TT: Drop Zone Normandy
description:
DROP ZONE NORMANDY is the first release for the ATS TT line. All of the scenarios depict actions in Normandy by the men of the 101st 'Screaming Eagles' Airborne Division as they parachute into enemy-held territory during the Normandy Invasion, and attempt to move inland in the days that follow.

This is a squad-level, tactical treatment of combat in WWII, in which personnel counters represent squads of 4-10 men as well as individual leaders and other key fighting men. Support weapon counters represent individual machine guns, mortars and light anti-tank weapons and vehicle counters indicate single tanks and transporters. The scale of this hex-and-counter game is roughly 1 hex = 50 yards

An offshoot of the popular ATS (Advanced Tobruk System), the "TT" refers to "table top", and strives to provide all the action of any other ATS game while requiring less table space, as well as a lower cost. All of the included scenarios play out on a single map, and ATS TT will use slightly smaller personnel, vehicle and ordnance counters than previous ATS releases.

The game features a new map, 8 new scenarios and all the counters required to play them out.

This is a 18xx game by Paul Stouthard and Rob van Wijngarden. It is based on 1829, which means that the emphasis is more on building than on business. The game works by alternating stock dealing rounds and operating rounds. Stock dealing rounds allow players to buy shares in the available railway companies. Operating rounds allow the presidents of those companies to build track, run trains & generate revenue for shareholders.

The author produced only 32 copies of the game. 15 were sold to 'supporters', 15 free copies were given to game publishers and 2 copies for Paul and Rob.

From 18xx net:
Location: The Netherlands
Corporations: 9
Privates: None or 8
Map Size: 104 hexes (118 total)
Off-Board: Three steps (2 / 3-4 / 5)
Bank: 11,520 (plus 4,500 Company Credits)
Tile Colours: Yellow / Green / Brown
Stock Market: 1D (Linear)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Touchstone: Oubliette
description:
Touchstone is a violent sport played by fantasy races. In Touchstone: Oubliette the game has moved from the sunny stadiums of the Braying Fields to an underground dungeon where the walls are constantly shifting and dancing around the players in an attempt to trap and crush them.

Touchstone: Oubliette is played with a 28 card deck made up of walls, paths, portals, and creatures. It plays in under 20 minutes.

You are the teams coach and take control of the individual players that must attempt to make their way through the Oubliette in order to score points for the team. These attempts are called a Drives. The deck represents the living maze and the opposing team's players that are trying to stop you.

Core strategies:

In order to escape from the Oubliette the player must evade the creatures and shifting walls attempting to block his path, locate a key, and finally find the one door that leads out of the maze. If the player finds and escapes with the Touchstone then he gets extra points. If the player hasn't escaped before the last card is drawn then they are lost in the Oubliette and fail that Drive attempt.

If the Drive isn't going well the players will have to use portals to buy more time. Portals shift not only the players position in the maze but they also propel him backwards or forward in time (either removing cards from or returning cards to his draw deck).

There are also four types of items that can be used to outsmart the creatures or illuminate the dark Oubliette. diamonds, torches, keys, and skulls.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Sports

name: Squad Leader Scenarios 81-90
description:
From the back of the Booklet:

"Squad Leader, Avalon Hill's game of tactical combat in the second world war, together with its companion games Cross of Iron, Crescendo of Doom and GI, Anvil of Victory, is one of the most popular wargames of all time. Now, World Wide Wargamers, in association with Avalon Hill, offer 10 more scenarios for the Squad Leader series. These varied and exciting scenarios include commando raids, bitter rearguard actions, combat in the snowy wastes of the north, river assaults and much more. Designed by Andy Bagley, Simon Haines, and Courtney Allen, doyen of SL scenario designers, these scenarios have been specially created to capture the fullest excitement of Squad Leader, Cross of Iron, Crescendo of Doom and GI, Anvil of Victory."

The following scenarios are included:

81: A BRIDGE TOO NEAR; April 21st, 1940; Verdal, Central Norway
82: TO LOSE A BATTLE; May 16th, 1940; Clairfayts, France
83: THE FINAL ATTEMPT; May 22nd, 1940; Cambrai, France
84: LE PARADIS; May 26th, 1940; Le Paradis, France
85: THE FAR BANK; July 7th, Ulla, Russia
86: RAID ON VAAGSO; December 27th, 1941; South Vaagso, Norway
87: THE BRUNEVAL RAID; February 28, 1942; Channel Coast
88: THE BACKWATER OF WAR; May 6th, 1942; Near Kestenga, Northern Russia
89: CHERKASSKOYE; July 5th, 1943; Cherkasskoye, Russia
90: THE BRIDGE AT KANEV; September 23rd, 1943; Kanev, Russia

This collection of scenarios had a lower standard of production than the original in-box sets.
The actual games tried to set some more novel scenarios. The Raid on Bruneval being particualrly good.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simulation

name: A Throne Vacant
description:
Background:

When Charles II of Spain died in November 1700 the both mentally and physically weak king had no heir to the crown. His kingdoms included not only Spain but both parts of the Low Countries, Italy and colonies in the Philipines and the Americas. Now two dynasties claimed the Spanish throne, the French Bourbons and the Austrian Habsburgs. Charles last will proclaimed that Philip, Duke of Anjou (grandson of Louis XIV) was to be offered the whole Spanish empire. However, the German emperor, Leopold I had launched his son the Archduke Charles as pretender to the throne. England preferred the Electoral Prince Joseph Ferdinand of Bavaria who was Leopold’s grandson. In February 1701 the 17 year old Philip was crowned in Madrid and was reluctantly recognized by England. In the same time French troops secured the Spanish Nederlands and cut of England and the United Provinces from Spanish trade. This resulted in the Treaty of Den Haag 1701 which formed the great alliance between Austria, England and the United Provinces and was later supported by Prussia, Hanover, Denmark, the Holy Roman Empire, Portugal and Savoy. The treaty did actually recognized Philip as the king of Spain but more important, it retained the Spanish trade, gave the Spanish territories in Italy as well as the Spanish Nederlands to Austria and formed a defensive alliance against France. On the other side Bavaria and Cologne supported the French in this upcoming conflict. When Portugal joined the great alliance the focus turned to put Archduke Charles on the Spanish throne.

The war now started slowly in Italy where an Austrian force commanded by Eugene of Savoy invaded the Duchy of Milan, one of the Spanish territories in Italy, which prompted a French intervention. Things are now set up for A Throne Vacant™ to begin.

The game:

A Throne Vacant™( # 107-1 ) is easy to learn and is played in a fast phased manner. The units are blocks in regimental and army size for greatest flexibility in taking steps and differentiating the quality and strength of the troops, like in its sister game Pax Baltica. The high quality map is divided in territories which you have to conquer order to control it. This is made by taking each and every town in a territory. Navies will also play an important part in ATV in the sense that you have to keep the sea lines open to the colonies, and of course transport British troops to the continent. As this intriguing conflict covers the whole of western Europe the map covers a large area from the Atlantic coast in the west to Prague in the east, from northern England in the north to Oran in the south. Playable nations are England/Great Britain, France, Spain, Austria and The United Provinces. Other countries represented in the game are Portugal, Savoy, Bavaria, Denmark and The Holy Roman Empire.

So, why don’t you enter the roles of some of the great military commanders of history, Marlborough, Prince Eugene, Villars or Vendôme. Lead them to great victories and secure the Spanish crown for your pretender to the throne. We are quite sure that this game will bring a Machiavellian smile to your face.

The game, packed in a book case includes a 50 x 70cm-size full color map, 80 high quality wooden blocks, 4 dice, various markers and rules, including different scenarios.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Flames of War: Achtung!
description:
Flames of War is a World War II tabletop game where you use armies represented by painted miniature tanks, soldiers, artillery, and aircraft against another similar opponent's force.

To begin all you need is the Flames of War book/rules and a starting force of miniatures depending on what type of army you want to collect.

The game uses 15mm scale (around 1:100) miniatures, allowing miniatures from other manufacturers to be used. The game aspires to provide a good balance between playability and simulation and has a typical game running under 2 hours.

Flames of War: Achtung! is a two-player starter set with the 3rd Edition Rules.

Achtung! has been carefully designed for someone who has never heard of Flames Of War before, or has seen the 296 page rulebook and not known where to start. Achtung! is not a simplified set of the Flames Of War rules, but rather a complete introductory box for a new player!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Lantern Festival Expansion
description:
NOTE: The Lantern Festival was cancelled in November 2016, in update #100 of the original Kickstarter campaign.

The Lantern Festival greatly extends the campaign adding rules and story events that proceed the fall of the Watcher. It comes with two super mysterious monsters, The King & The Scribe, The Twilight Cloak miniature and the Male and Female Great Game Hunter Miniatures!

The Great Game Hunters hail from the only large and greatly established human city in Kingdom Death. They are sometimes friends but usually are foe. By defeating the Watcher, the survivors are plunged into a series of increasingly dangerous challenges that ultimately (of course) will lead to their death!

Lantern Festival Expansion includes:

One plastic King
One plastic Scribe
One Twilight Cloak Miniature
One Great Game Hunter - Male
One Great Game Hunter - Female
75+ AI Cards
75+ Hit Location Cards
New Special Resource Cards
New Innovation Cards!
New Settlement Events!
Two New Settlement Locations - Exhausted Lantern Hoard!
New Gear Cards!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Locke & Key: Harlequin Key Foil Promo Card
description:
Foil promo card for Locke & Key card game.

During the game you can choose to not participate in trying to solve a challenge. If you don't participate, you may draw a Key card instead. Key cards can be played later to alter the rules of a challenge to help you win it or cause other people to lose it.

The Harlequin Key Promo card is a Key that is added to the Key deck and can be played as described above.

name: Special Ops Issue #5
description:
Special Ops Issue #5 includes

ASL scenarios:

O9: Behind In The Count
O10: City On The Edge


ASLSK scenarios:

S56: In Pursuit Of The French
S57: Haase To Hold On


ASL Map Board 68

In addition, the journal contains the complete game The Battle of Bushy Run and articles covering ASL, Angola!, Lincoln's War, Storm over Dien Bien Phu, Last Chance for Victory, and It Never Snows.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Officer Exchange Program Resource
description:
The Officer Exchange Program is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "A Matter of Honor" episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 0 Squadron Points.

Before building your fleet, you must pick two factions. Captains, Admirals and Crew from those factions can be freely assigned to each others' ships with no faction penalty. Additionally, Captains and Admirals assigned to ships of the opposite faction receive a 1 point discount.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Larger Than Life: The Director's Cut – The Game of Pulp Adventures
description:
What is Larger Than Life - Director's Cut?
It’s a game about the Pulps. That means Lost Worlds, intrepid Archaeologists, Cliffhangers, and more. The setting may be exotic, the villains particularly villainous, but in truth, it’s all about the Story. Whether it’s finding treasure, saving someone, or thwarting the villain, it all boils down to the Story.

Larger Than Life – Directors Cut can be likened to an action movie where your Hero moves from Scene to Scene trying to succeed in his adventure. What needs to be done? How do you do it? Who’s in peril? Who’s behind all this? All these things and more are generated for you by the easy to use game mechanics. Inside Larger Than Life – Director’s Cut you’ll find:


A variety of characters for you to play with and against. Stars, Co-Stars, Love Interests, Femme Fatales, and of course, the villains – we call them the Big Bads.
Over 35 Attributes that you can mix and match to make your characters unique.
A system that allows your characters to increase in skills and abilities when they succeed, but force them into “retirement” when they fail.
An easy to use mechanic that will generate and solve Clues, during each Story, based on your characters abilities. Solve the Clues and you make it to the Final Scene.
Nine different villains to fight, from Mob Bosses to Cavemen, and everything in between.
Four different Locales to adventure in. From the back alleys of a large Metropolis, to the villages in a Lost World, your Hero can travel from place to place, all generated by the game mechanics.
Over fifty Professions to create Victims, Suspects, and People of Interest and enrich your Story.
Mechanics that generate hundreds of possible adventures, with no two ever being alike.
Playable solo, cooperatively, or head to head.


Cover art is a reused image of the original painting "Blood on My Doorstep" by pulp artist Rafael de Soto. The work was originally featured on the cover of the July 1949 issue of New Detective Magazine.
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: The Road to Ruin
description:
The Road to Ruin co-operative card and dice game for 1 to 4 players. The Road to Ruin is set in the aftermath of a zombie infection outbreak that has left the city overrun by hordes of unstoppable zombies.

Each player controls a survivor of the outbreak. On their turn, the players move their survivor around hidden locations, revealing each location and the level of zombie threat at that location. Each of the locations is unique, and they may grant the survivor more items or weapons, allow the survivor to scavenge the location for equipment, or might be hazards that block the survivor's path. Each of the survivors has a special ability, such as an affinity with a specific type of weapons (melee or ranged), general combat proficiency, extra health, or move versatile movement.

The survivors fight the zombies as they explore each location. In combat, the players roll two six-dice and then use their survivor's weapons and items to attempt to beat the zombie's threat level (which is between 7 and 11). Equipped weapons allow the player to reroll, melee weapons give one reroll and ranged weapons give two rerolls but require matching ammunition. If the survivor fails to fight of the zombie, they are wounded. Each survivor can take on a few wounds before they eliminated. However, survivors can use medical items to remove wounds, and can even discard items in combat to gain more rerolls in a last ditch effort to stay alive.

The goal of the game is to recover multiple supply items and to bring these back to the safe house location before the survivors fall to the zombies. The Road to Ruin comes with four scenarios. The basic scenario 'Supply Run' mentioned above lays out the game's 25 locations in a 5x5 grid and tasks the survivors with recovering six supply items. Other scenarios use different layouts to create varied challenges, including one where the survivors must use a radio at a specific location to call for rescue and then reach the airport location to win. Each of the scenarios also has an easy variation, which usually requires fewer items to be recovered.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Warhammer 40,000: Sanctus Reach – Stormclaw
description:
From the box:

Taking place against the backdrop of the brutal Sanctus Reach campaign, Stormclaw pits the Space Wolves of Krom Dragongaze against the Orks of the barbaric Warboss Grukk Face-rippa. Inside this box you will find a fantastic collection of Citadel miniatures representing the key warriors of this conflict. In addition, there is a narrative book and a compact version of the Warhammer 40,000 rules, allowing you to read about and reenact the pivotal battles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Panic: Tower Promo 2016 Tabletop Day
description:
Replaces one of the six standard tower sections with a piece of the same size but with the Tabletop Day 2016 logo on the front side and on the back, the instructions:

"Rebuild this Tower once by returning 3 slain Trolls to the Forest"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Slaughterville: Kickstarter Edition
description:
The following items came with the Kickstarter edition of Slaughterville. Some of these will be available separately at the retail level, others will not.


Caleb, Hope, Brandi, Dylan, Rosie, and Xian Character Cards



Slaughterville Tourist Guide and Ticket to Slaughterville (Item cards)



Slaughterville Town Sign card


The following were results of stretch goals:


Walker's Carnival (24 card villain deck)



Herbert West Character Card



The House on Haunted Hill (24 card Location Deck)



Sherlock Holmes Character Card



Sleepy Hollow (24 villain deck and 1 Ichabod Crane Character Card



Jack the Ripper (30 card villain deck)


Note: the Dream Demon expansion was a $10 add-on otherwise it did not come with the KS pledge
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Werewolf the Party Game
description:
Werewolves are terrorizing your village! You must find them and eliminate them as soon as possible. Each day you, the villagers, will hold a town meeting to vote for a suspected werewolf to lynch. Get it right and you might survive. Get it wrong, and you're in danger because every night the werewolves come out to feed on another sleeping villager...

This set contains unique cards you won't find anywhere else.

Each set comes with 36 High quality cards and instruction manual in a Werewolf logo pouch. There are: 3 Werewolves, 2 Doctors, 2 Seers, 18 Villagers (9 male, 9 female), a Hunter, Vigilante, Child, Sorcerer, Alpha Wolf, 2 Sweethearts, Druid, Executioner, Zombie Wolf and a Moderator card.

name: Heir to the Pharaoh: Cursed Expansion
description:
The Cursed Expansion unleashes all of the delicious chaos of a new puppy and a new kitten into your game. Be warned: this addition of curses, chaos, and mummified pets is certain to both delight and dismay!

Includes:
Cursed Expansion Rules
2 Wooden Cursed Meeples
2 Cursed Bidding Cards
categories: Ancient, Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tanks: Panzer III Tank Expansion
description:
The Panzer III is one of the iconic tanks of World War Two. Serving in the German army throughout the war the tank would be upgraded over time with larger guns and heavier armour. During the desert campaign in North Africa it was upgraded with a long 5cm cannon that was capable of knocking out any Allied tank.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Panzer III tank
1x Panzer III (Long) tank card
1x Panzer III (Short) tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Guardian's Gambit
description:
Guardian's Gambit is a casual 2-player card combat game you can play without having to sit at a table. Quick rounds and a portable size makes this the perfect game to play while waiting in line, sitting in the back seat on a long car ride, laying in bed, or any time you don't would rather play games than stare at your phone.

Each round players are competing to eliminate their opponent's guardians through a mix of deduction, memory, strategy, and a little bit of luck.

Guardian's Gambit is a game of simple mechanics and very deep strategy of how, when and what special guardians to use to gain the upper hand and win the round.

name: Algoracing
description:
Algoracing is an unusual and transformable 3D-race game. You can change the location of hill blocks whichever way you want — the game can have hundreds of different game fields! Complexity of the game is also easy to change, as the set includes the components for two versions.
Automated rovers investigate the surface of uncharted planet. They are searching for life samples! To operate the rovers, the players have to create very precise algorithms. Delivering life samples to the lab won’t be easy, because the samples can be carried off by competitors!

Set contains:
a double-sided game board,
5 cardboard hill blocks,
52 command cards,
4 rover shaped counters,
4 lab base tokens,
20 life sample tokens,
1 algorithm starting point designator token
Illustrated rules
publishers: Falomir Juegos, The Brainy Band, Банда умников

name: Off the Rails: Promo #1
description:
Two bonus Mission Cards and 10 replacement Gold Jewels for use with the base game, Off the Rails.

They were released at UKGE June 1st 2018.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Puzzle, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Dogs & Homes
description:
Time goes by so slowly while humans are at work. It’s hard to be a good dog and wait patiently when exciting adventures are waiting outside. It’s easy to slip out the door, but getting home without help might be tricky. Follow the clues in the park and help the strays get home!
Move your figures along the path in the park following the clues until you find one of the dogs. The place of the dogs is marked by the collars in the park.

There are different patterned spaces (grass, bricks, rocks, sand) in the park and on the clue disks. If the same pattern is shown on the disc and on the field where you stand, you can step forward.

The winner is the player who, using their good memory, can walk around the park the quickest and take the most strayed dogs home to their owners.

name: CardsLab Countries (Third Edition)
description:
CardsLab Countries is an award winning game from the Novabase Gameshifters 2016 gamification event held in Portugal. This new edition includes a total re-branding and new game mechanics/components.

CardsLab Countries is a turn-based game and the goal is to reach a certain amount of mission points or conquer all the opponents' country cards, which are evenly distributed, forming an upside down stack in front of each player. Each turn has a turn owner that has advantages in the mission and battle phases described below.

Each country card features its national flag, world location and capital, as well as stats like population, life expectancy or GDP.

At the beginning of the game, three mission cards are distributed and placed in front of each player, which allow them to score points and earn special cards by forming combinations with their country cards in hand. There are two types of missions which score points based on their difficulty: easy (1 point) and hard (3 points). The first player to achieve 10 points wins the game (for the fast game mode - average duration of 30 minutes).

There are 5 types of special cards that players earn by completing missions:
- Steal the turn (become the turn owner)
- Double the turn prize
- Exchange all hand cards between 2 players
- Search for a card in your own pile
- Cancel any of these effects

Each turn consists of 5 phases: Draw, Mission, Special, Battle and Prize.

Draw phase: Each player draws cards from his stack until having 5 country cards in hand.

Mission phase: Starting with the turn owner, each player tries to accomplish missions with their country cards. When a mission is completed, the country cards used to accomplish that mission are placed at the bottom of the players' card pile and the accomplished missions are placed at the bottom of the missions pile. The player can also discard one or more missions. At the end of the phase, players update their scorecard and receive new missions.

Special phase: Each player can play his special cards, one at a time.

Battle phase: The turn owner chooses a card from the hand, puts it upside down on the table and decides between asking a question about the card to an opponent (flag/location/capital, depending on the thrown dice value by the opponent) or choose a statistic that will have to beat all opponents' cards. For the latter, after the turn owner announces the chosen statistic, each opponent picks a card from their own hand and plays it face-down on the table, to win the battle. This adds an element of suspense and bluffing on each turn, forcing players to carefully choose their plays. Note: the number of possible questions depends on each players' difficulty level. For the easiest level, the player only has to answer the cards' continent.

Prize phase: The winner of the Battle phase receives a number of cards from opponents' hands, based on the number of special cards played, the duel type (question or combat), and player count.

CardsLab is a fun, educational, trivia and strategy game for ages 8-80, designed with simple mechanics that can easily bring together three generations of players to the same table. It features difficulty levels tailored to a variety of gamers, and without noticing it, they are learning as they play.

Pedro Gordalina, CardsLab Designer.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #44 – Medals
description:
Adds 47 cards and 9 sticker sheets to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This Expansion adds Medal cards that you can earn for your Soldiers! The expansion comes with a sheet of stickers that you may put on the Soldier that earns the Medal!

Cards included are:
6x USA Medal Cards
5x Commonwealth Medal Cards
5x Poland Medal Cards
4x USSR Medal Cards
7x Germany Medal Cards
5x Japan Medal Cards
5x France Medal Cards
5x Finland Medal Cards
5x Rep of China Taiwan Medal Cards
9x Medal Sticker Sheets
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire – Rapid Mission
description:
The Mission Pack is a 10-card expansion pack to Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire. Each card is double-sided, with an in-game "mission" on one side and a "bonus" on the other side.

At the start of the game, 5 mission cards are randomly selected and placed "mission" side up. The other five cards are randomly paired with the previously placed cards, but with "bonus" side up.

If a player is the first to accomplish a mission, she takes the bonus card assigned to it, which gives not only an immediate power, but also a recurring power whenever the player takes a die specified by the bonus card.

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Masters of Charms
description:
As a master Charm crafter, you build and sell Charms to aid brave adventurers to on their dangerous quests. The problem is that you are not the only one. Other crafters are also racing to harvest Gemstones from the lode! You must use your wits in order to ahead of the competition and become the most prestigious Charm crafter of all the realms!

On their turn each player may play two actions to travel around the randomly configured game world by using Portals, harvest Gemstones, buy spells from Merchants, craft and sell Charms, or summon new Portals.

Each Charm is made from 3 Gemstones. The rarity of the Gemstone sets determine how much Gold a player can sell the Charms for. Player may also use spells acquired from the Merchant to enhance their ability to collect Gemstones or make Charms.

The goal is to earn the most victory points from sets of Charms sold, amount of Gold earned, and other point bonuses from the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warehouse 13: Leena
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Character for Warehouse 13: The Board Game.

Includes:
1 Warehouse Agent Shield
4 Small-sized Ability Cards (44 x 67 mm)
1 Character Token
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting
publishers: Conquest Gaming LLC, Infinite Dreams Gaming

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Vehicle Rush
description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Vehicle Rush deck includes white, black, and red energies. It focuses on vehicles, making it slightly more complex to play than the other Challenger Decks in the 2020 series
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Robin Hood and the Merry Men: Lady Funkhouser Promo Card
description:
This new Hero (Character) card was originally available during the 2019 "Promo Paradise" KS campaign.

"When Lady Funkhouser visits a location with enemy figures, she can steal a resource from the Sheriff's coffers!"
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Lost Worlds: Woman in Scale with Sword and Shield
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From the back cover:

For hours you have lead your foes along the high paths above the sea - always one step ahead - always one step from your people. They are safe, now. Finally, on the very brink, you turn to face the most dangerous enemy your clan has ever known.

Can your skill and agility overcome this mortal foe?
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Sherlock Holmes: Enquêtes Surnaturelles
description:
Supernatural crimes have been committed in London. If you're hoping to solve them, you'll have to put your intelligence and convictions to the test: are the facts about infernal creatures or simple mystificators ?

Embody Detective Holmes, Dr. Watson, or Mystery Hunter Thomas Carnacki. Keep your mind clear, be methodical, question witnesses with tact, search places, find clues and confront the puzzles, because the hero is YOU!

Sherlock Holmes: Enquêtes Surnaturelles is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
publishers: Ediciones MasQueOca, FoxGames, Makaka Editions, Pegasus Spiele, Van Ryder Games

name: Dice Fishing
description:
Dice Fishing is a fast-paced and exciting dice-rolling game that feels a lot like real fishing!

Each round, the players take turns rolling 6 custom Bait dice.

There is a common row of Fish cards that is replenished after each player’s turn. Each card requires a certain set of bait to be placed on it. If all slots of the card are filled, the fish starts biting! The players can guess which of the 7 fish types they are about to catch — zander, trout, perch, pike, sturgeon, salmon, or ide — but they won’t know for sure until they flip the card and see it!

The larger the fish, the harder it is to catch it. Moreover, every fish might get away! In order to increase your chances, you will be mastering your fishing skills by resolving different Opportunity cards that will allow manipulating your rolls and the assortment of fish.

During the game, the players score additional Achievement tokens for different sets of their fish and as soon as anyone collects 7 different fish, they score the endgame Achievement token. After the final scoring, whoever has the most VP wins!

-description from publisher

name: The Battle of Fismes: Disrupted River Crossing
description:
After dispatching Blücher’s Army of Silesia at Vauchamps, Napoleon diverted temporarily toward the Seine at Montereau, for an inconclusive brush with Schwarzenberg’s Army of Bohemia. His inveterate foe Blücher apparently had learned no lessons and threatened to move again on Paris. By March 3rd Napoleon was returning northward along the bank of the Ourcq River. The fall of Soissons, cheaply surrendered by General Moreau, saw the quarry escape over the Aisne River to link-up with 43,000 reinforcements near Laon, raising his strength to over 100,000.

Fismes is a hypothetical engagement simulating a possible battle at this river Crossing on March 4th 1814.

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Silent Menace Deck
description:
Upgrade your decks with Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Silent Menace. This is a massive expansion with something to offer every warband, and it allows you even more choices when choosing your gambits, upgrades, and objectives. It could well be the key to your next killer deck.

This set contains 32 universal cards, consisting of:

12x objectives
10x gambits
10x upgrades


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Pets
description:
Fleeing from the big city rush, many people prefer living in direct contact with nature. In Pets, you moved in with your family to a countryside house, with a huge and arborized plot, and even a small pound of deep and cristal clear waters. Now your goal is to occupy all this space with the Pets your family loves so much!

Throughout six rounds, you must lure Pets from eight different species: Cats, Dogs, Rabbits, Turtles, Parrots, Poneys, Birdies, and Fishes. After you get these animals, you can interact with them in six possible actions: Sunbath, Feed, Take Care, Play, Sleep, and Breed. But that's not enough, because you need to plan your moves carefully and fulfill your secret goals.

Pets has a quick and simple game system, for children age eight and up, and another one more complex and challenging for adults. It's also included the expansion "Special Pets".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Kampf gegen das Spiessertum: Travel Edition
description:
"A party game for horrible German people"

Play begins with a judge, known as the "Round Boss", choosing a red fill-in-the-blank card from the top of the deck and showing it to all players. Each player holds a hand of eight white answer cards at the beginning of each round, and passes a card (sometimes more) to the round boss, face-down, representing their answer to the question on the card. The round boss determines which answer card(s) are funniest in the context of the fill-in-the-blank card. The player who submitted the chosen card(s) is given the question card to represent a point, and then the player to the left of the Round Boss becomes the new Boss for the next round. Play continues until the players agree to stop, or until they are thrown out of the pub, at which point the player with the most Points is the winner.

Kampf gegen das Spießertum: Travel Edition contains 400 brand-new Cards. 100 yellow and 300 white cards are enough to play with friends. Or mix it together with Kampf gegen das Spießertum and/or the expansions.

It features all new cards with German celebrities, places and topics of interest.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: El-Alamein 1942
description:
The first battle of El Alamein (1–27 July 1942) was a battle of the Western Desert Campaign of the Second World War, fought in Egypt between Axis forces of the Panzer Army Africa and British Eight Army. Allies managed to stop Rommel's offensive.

In the second battle of El Alamein (23 October – 11 November 1942) Allied forces begun their offensive which turned out to be the beginning of the end of the Axis forces in Africa.

This game covers the entire operation, separated in the short scenarios than can played as stand alone games or together, as longer campaign.

It is third game of the WB-95 system set up in the North Africa (after Desert Rats 1940-42 and Kasserine 1943). El-Alamein 1942 is released with optional, mounted board.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Smart 10: History
description:
100 new questions, 1,000 new answers from the History section!

The “History” theme edition is ideal for anyone who is familiar with history. Simply exchange the 100 new questions with half the deck of cards from the Smartbox of the original game or the Family Edition and nothing stands in the way of further exciting quiz rounds.

Questions such as "Which Greek deity is responsible for sleep?", which countries were members of the Warsaw Pact or whether the 100-year war ended in the 15th or 16th century are sure to make history professionals from the age of 14 ponder or encourage gambling.

There are ten answer options to choose from for each question, which are covered with markers. Whoever has a turn chooses one of them, checks whether it is correct and passes the smart box on to the next player. If you don't want to give an answer anymore, it's better to pass, because if you get it wrong, you lose all the points you have collected in the current round. Who knows the right answers or guesses and gambles best?

The pack contains 50 double-sided cards with new questions and answers for even more fun.

Only playable with the Smartbox from the original game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

100 neue Fragen, 1.000 neue Antworten aus dem Bereich Geschichte!

Für alle, die in Geschichte fit sind, bietet sich die Themenedition „History“ an. Einfach die 100 neuen Fragen mit dem halben Kartensatz aus der Smartbox des Originalspiels oder der Family Edition tauschen und schon steht weiteren spannenden Quizrunden nichts mehr im Weg.

Fragen wie „Welche griechische Gottheit ist zuständig für den Schlaf?“, welche Staaten waren Mitglied im Warschauer Pakt oder ob das Ende des 100-jährigen Kriegs im 15. oder 16. Jahrhundert war, lassen Geschichtsprofis ab 14 Jahren sicher teilweise ins Grübeln kommen oder zum Zocken animieren.

Pro Frage stehen zehn Antwortmöglichkeiten zur Wahl, die mit Markern abgedeckt sind. Wer an der Reihe ist, wählt eine davon aus, kontrolliert, ob’s stimmt und gibt die Smartbox an den nächsten Spieler weiter. Wer keine Antwort mehr geben will, sollte besser passen, denn wer falsch liegt, verliert alle Punkte, die er in der laufenden Runde gesammelt hat. Wer weiß die richtigen Antworten oder rät und zockt am besten?

Die Packung beinhaltet 50 beidseitig bedruckte Karten mit neuen Fragen und Antworten für noch mehr Spielvergnügen.

Nur spielbar mit der Smartbox aus dem Originalspiel!

—description from the publisher

name: BARPIG: The Great Festival
description:
The Great Festival is the third, and final, installment in the family of BARPIG Adventure Party Games.

All BARPIG games utilize an addictive fun mechanic that’s both a party game and strategic card-based RPG, taking inspiration from games such as Munchkin, Exploding Kittens, Ring of Fire and Tabletop RPGs. This mechanic goes a step further! Players are invited to be creative in their approach to gameplay and in so, creating an environment in which everyone can really excel in their specialty, while learning a little more about each other and what makes them unique.

This sharing and celebrating of diversity is central to The Great Festival’s thematic, which is enshrined in the nine new Character challenges and the 14 new unique take-that Item card types. Everything was created with the goal of seriously putting the party in the game. The Great Festival also reveals more of the lore behind the story of the BARPIG tavern, which embraces how we grow by exploring and sharing what we’ve found:

“Legend tells of an adventurous piggy, who explored the far reaches of the realm before settling down to build a tavern deep in the woods: A place where all adventuring pigs could meet kindred spirits and share tales from afar. Since then, whenever the harvest moon falls upon the equinox, everyone in the realm is invited to The Great Festival to celebrate why we explore and share what we’ve found.“

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Judge, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Take That, Turn Order: Role Order, Voting

name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Tourism Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign. This promo is also part of the Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition Promo Cards #2 set with a different artwork as card (A)[P30].

Text says:
Raise your TR 1 step for every milestone you have. During the production phase. this produces 2 MC

name: Baetis Campaign, 211 BC
description:
Baetis Campaign focuses on the climactic campaign of the first Roman expedition to Hispania during the Second Punic War. One player commands the Carthaginians under brothers Hasdrubal and Mago Barca as well as Hasdrubal Gisgo, and the other controls the Romans under brothers Gnaeus and Publius Cornelius Scipio.

Baetis Campaign, 211 BC, C3i Series Vol III, is available inside C3i Magazine Nr37 from RBM Studio

name: Space Missions
description:
As director of a space agency, experience the time of the 1960s, when mankind began to explore the universe. Your goal is the manned moon landing. You will train astronauts, make technologies more reliable, assemble rockets and launch missions into space. The player with the most successful space program wins the game.

Space Missions is a risk management game. Using a new deck sizing mechanism, you optimize several decks at once, which will determine the success or failure of your missions.   In order to prepare the missions as well as possible, you perform actions in each round with the help of 6 specialists. Plan ahead and take a few risks to get an early slot for the launch of your rocket.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Zooloretto Würfelspiel: Baby Boom
description:
Zooloretto Würfelspiel: Baby Boom is an expansion to Zooloretto Würfelspiel. It adds a few different new features:
- Instead of extra points, the reward for filling an enclosure first is an expansion with three more spaces for the given animal. Other players can't use these expansions.
- Heart symbols on specific enclosure spaces mark 'parent' animals, and as soon as the second heart symbol is crossed in an enclosure, a baby is born (another cross is added). Lions with expansion may even have two babies.
- For money you can still release animals from the barn OR score them for star symbols. There are star symbols on enclosure spaces as well. The more star symbols a player collects during game, the more points they can get (1 star symbol is worth only 1 point but 5 star symbols score 8...)
- Also, in the barn only one animal (of the player's choice) can be placed in infinite amount. For further animals of other species other animals' spaces have to be used (thus scoring -2 points for each).

name: Blood & Sand: Pacific Variant for Squad Leader
description:
This is a supplement from The Wargamer #30, for Squad Leader and provides RULES, 3-Scenarios, and (3)-Mapsheets for use with other components NOT included but available with YOUR Squad Leader games.

The Mapsheets are the same size (8-1/2" by 11") as the standard Squad Leader boards, are NOT mounted and have FULL colors(in a Pacific Island Beachhead motif) printed on them. They also have a designation (P-16 Tarawa) printed on one of them maybe for some future Scenario.

The RULES detail their introduction, background information on the Japanese, a Map of where the entire Scenarios(20 of them)are taking place all over the Pacific arena, and the 3-Scenarios depicted here.
These are:
S.P-4-To the Death:Yae Take-Okinawa, April 15, 1945;
S.P-6-Airborne Samurai:Buraen, Leyte Island, Philippines, December 6, 1944;
S.P-9-Bloody Betio:Betio Island, Tarawa Atoll, November 20, 1943.
They are presented in familiar Squad Leader format with any Special Rules used included in the notes section.

There are many Special Rules included of which these are some of them: Starshells; Air Support-Napalm; Caves; Special Invasion Rules; Tunnels; Dogs; Special Infiltration Rules; Weather-Climate; Booby Traps; Dated Japanese Play(for after 1943 Scenarios)& Misc.

There are also some game counters that Players will have to produce themselves, prior to playing these. A note is made stating that in the future, MORE Scenarios and possibly, related game Counters will be provided in later editions of the Wargamer magazine.

Bill Wilder originally self published Blood & Sand as an independent publication in the following three parts:

Part I: Against the Rising Sun (1983). Contained the core rules, seven scenarios (P-1 to P-7), sheet with un-mounted color overlay and counters.

Part II: Island Ordeal (1983). Contained six scenarios (P-8 to P-13) and two color, un-mounted geo-boards (P-16 [reproduced in the Wargamer with a few errors] and P-17.

Part III: Do or Die! (n.d.). Contains seven scenarios (P-14 to P-20) and sheet of un-mounted counters and overlay P-B.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Ennea
description:
The game board for Ennea consists of nine wooden squares, each with four holes on them and each having a different pattern of grooves that connect these holes to one another and to the edges of the square. Designer Michail Antonow has created six games that can be played on this game board, each of them lasting 10-15 minutes. Four of these games – Bockspringen ("Leapfrog"), Wie du mir... ("What Goes Around..."), Berühr mich nicht! ("Don't Touch Me!") and Landung ("Stop") – start with an assembled game board, while the other two – Die vier Quellen ("The Four Springs") and Eine Insel entsteht ("An Island Forms") – create the playing area from these squares over the course of the game.


Game description from the publisher:

Neun Quadrate, vor jedem Spiel neu angeordnet, machen die Faszination dieses Spieles aus, genauso wie die unterschiedlichen Spielmöglichkeiten!

Viel Tüftelei und Überlegung war notwendig, um Ennea entstehen zu lassen. 9 Quadrate mit gänzlich verschiedenen asymmetrischen Linien sollten es sein. Diese Linien mussten dann auch fortlaufend über alle Quadrate hinweg zusammen passen.

Sechs verschiedene Spiele für 2 Personen hat Michail Antonow sich einfallen lassen. Die Spieldauer bewegt sich immer zwischen 10 und 15 Minuten, die Vielfalt ist trotzdem groß - da dank des variablen Spielbretts kein Spiel wie das andere ist.

name: Allégeance
description:
ALLEGEANCE - a turn-based majority game in which you have to rally followers to become the kingdom's most important lord.

Card Game / Strategy / Majority / Powers / Secret Allegiance

About :

King Corniak is gone... His tragic death is the end of an era of terror and misery, but it also foreshadows a bloody war. A war of power to which, you, the great lords of the Kingdom of Thelenia, will participate.

Description:

You will have to rally supporters from different guilds to your cause. Each lord plays two cards per turn, then is allowed to discard some of his hand, to fill it back to 5 at the end of his turn. The more partisans one has, the more action are open to the player, and the more chances to win the game. 10 rounds, that's all you have for becoming the most influential lord of the realm.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Taelmoor
description:
Taelmoor is a cooperative dungeon crawling and storytelling game. It ties together physical boards, cards, and standees with a smartphone app using scan-and-play technology. Each scenario typically involves a combination of exploration, puzzle solving, storytelling, and combat in a classic sword and sorcery setting.

Games of Taelmoor begin with players selecting an archetypal class (i.e wizard or rogue), and forming a party by joining the host's game with their smartphone or mobile device. Players then take turns exploring and interacting with the game world. New rooms are laid out tile by tile as they are explored, and each may include unique elements like NPCs to talk to, puzzles to solve, or combat. The story is relayed simultaneously to all players via the app, though players are encouraged to read new passages aloud as they are discovered.

Combat features simplified deck construction elements. Each class has unique strengths and weaknesses, and can build a custom combat deck as they level up throughout a scenario. Strategy between players is emphasized as many attacks become more powerful when combined with others. Attacks are played by scanning the physical card and then discarding.

Scenarios typically take 60-90 minutes to complete. Some are broken into multiple parts and are meant to be played across separate sessions.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Map Addition, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Suroboruos
description:
Suroborous is an auction game in which the items you bid on will be worth points only if you bid the amounts shown on these items in future auctions — that is, a card may be worth 10 points, but it will show two circles on it, say 30 and 50. The card will not be worth 10 points unless you bid 30 and 50 in future auctions.

The economy is relatively closed with winning bids going to the auctioneer, and the auctioneer's bids going to the bank; however, if any player bids an amount shown on the card up for auction, that card receives a coin from the bank, covering that number.

When the game ends, players earn points for their completed cards, purple cards with special scoring criteria, star symbols on cards, and a bit for leftover money. Of note, players without at least one star symbol are eliminated. Otherwise, the player with the most points wins.

name: Triumph of the Will: Wargames Rules for Revolutionary Warfare 1914 to 1936
description:
Miniature Wargame rules for revolutionary warfare 1914 to 1936
Concentrating on the revolutionary warfare of the Spartakist Revolution, and the Russian and Spanish Civil Wars, these rules emphasize the importance of willpower amongst your troops. Small numbers of highly motivated troops will outperform hordes of disinterested conscripts in these vicious and unforgiving conflicts.
Armored trains, the International Brigades, desperate men fighting for their version of the truth are all here in rules that capture the very crusading essence of these political conflicts.

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
description: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields is a supplement for the Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game containing rules for many forces present in its titular battle, including: the Haradrim, Mûmakil, the Knights of Dol Amroth and the Dúnedain
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Death Mesa (fan expansion for BANG!)
description:
Death Mesa is an unofficial expansion to BANG! the card game, designed to improve the element of player elimination by having eliminated players remain in and influence the game as ghosts.

Ghosts have no life points, no distance constraints, cannot die, and also draw from a specialized deck of cards called the Dead Men's Deck. Cards from this deck allow the ghosts to possess the living, bequeath items from their will, inspire or weaken others, reveal information on cards in player's hands, warn of impending doom, and so forth. Ghosts however, can spoil each other's plans.

With a strong thematic background, Death Mesa should add to the fun of BANG! and draw new fans to it who could not stand the player elimination.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: San Guo Yan Yi Qi
description:
This is a variant of Xiangqi based on the Three Kingdoms era, but is distinct from San Guo Qi.

The board is four sided. Three sides represents the three states of the Three Kingdoms era, i.e. Shu, Wu and Wei, and have the same complement of seeds as in Xiangqi. The fourth side contains only 5 seeds, i.e. Han Emperor, 3 Chariots and 1 Cannon.

The objective of the game is to defeat the other two states.

The Han Emperor cannot move. Players may enter into an alliance with any other player by moving one of his/her Horse onto specific spaces next to the Han Emperor seed. When that happens, the third player takes control of the Han Emperor's 3 Chariots and 1 Cannon seeds. Once allianced, the two players cannot capture each other's seeds.

The Han Emperor may also be disposed, by capturing with a Horse. When that happens, the other two players automatically enter into an alliance, and the third player takes control of the Han Emperor's 3 Chariots and 1 Cannon seeds.

The movements of the pieces remain largely the same as Xiangqi except for the following differences:
1) It is no longer possible to block the Horses or Elephants/Ministers.
2) On the first move of the game for each respective player, players cannot move the Cannon out of their own territory.
3) Witin their own territory, Soldiers can only move forward one step at a time. Upon reaching the border, Soldiers may also move 1 step sideways. Once beyond the border, Soldiers may move 1 step forward/backward/sideways, but cannot retreat behind the border.

When a player is checkmated and General seed is captured, his/her remaining seeds are taken over by the player who captured the General seed.

name: Dakapo
description: Dakapo is a board game for two players that's played on an 8x8 square board. Players alternate turns placing a colored stone — red, blue, green, or yellow — on an empty cell according to some restrictions. The first player who places a stone that forms the fourth same-colored corner of a square wins. The sides of the square formed by the four stones of the same color do not need to be parallel with the edges of the game board; in other words, the square can be angled.

name: Ah-Sitake HA!
description:
Ah-Sitake HA! The ninja battlin', card spinnin', flingin' flangin' action game of well, battling ninjas, spinning cards, and flanging flingings.

Simultaneously choose your battle focus card, then toss it out onto the table and see whether your attack attacked, your counter countered, your block blocked, your throw threw, or your weakness got punched squarely in the junk! Battle multiple opponents at the same time. But be careful! A successful attack on one opponent may leave you exposed in a very sensitive spot! With every angle there is an equal and opposite re-angle... and yours may just be your undoing!

Battle your friends until they become your enemies! If anyone is left standing after one round, special attack and block cards come into play to give those that are behind the ability to hopefully SAVE their behind, or more efficiently KICK someone else's!

Are you ready for some fast-paced, ninja animal, card battling? Oh you think so, do you? Well, you'll just have to find out. I say to you, sir (or ma'am), "Ah-Sitake HA!"
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Nations At War: Core Rules
description:
Nations At War v3.0 rules are the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Sean Druelinger, Lead Developer of the Nations At War Series.


These rules present the core rules for the game system. This new rule book has been designed to place all the rules in one book, making playing the game is easier and faster than ever.


Notable changes from previous versions of the rules (v2.0 and earlier) will be presented in BLUE text. This new edition of the rules can be used with previously published modules.


These new rules also include our new Starter Kit for those who wish to try out the system.

PLEASE NOTE: There is no difference between the Living Rules PDF Edition and the Printed Edition. This printed book was designed with the gamer in mind and those that have older editions games in the series but wanted to have a hard copy set of the new rules in their hands.

The new rules are available for anyone to download for free.

name: Codenames: Blizzard Edition
description: Codenames: Blizzard Edition is an officially licensed edition of Codenames, published by The Op Games for Blizzard Entertainment. This edition was not a retail product, only being made available to Employees of Blizzard Entertainment as a company Holiday Gift in 2019.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Video Game Theme, Word Game

name: Bad News On the Doorstep: The Battle of Kontum, May 1972
description:
“The poor display of any will to fight by the [ARVN] 22nd Division at Tan Canh is discouraging and makes the defense of Kontum City difficult to foretell… In light of this there is little basis for confidence that Hue or Kontum will be held.” –General Creighton Abrams to Secretary of Defense Melvin Laird.

Following the 1971 defeat of the ARVN (Army of the Republic of South Vietnam) in their Operation Lam Son 719 offensive in Laos it was very apparent the US policy of “Vietnamization” was in serious trouble, The North Vietnamese High Command walked away from the Paris Peace Talks during the fighting and advanced their plans for an all-out offensive against South Vietnam.

In April 1972 the North Vietnamese and their Communist allies in the South, the National Liberation Front (NLF), launched a broad offensive, code named Nguyen Hue (name of the Vietnamese leader who defeated Chinese invaders in 1789) against the ARVN in South Vietnam from their strongholds in the Central Highlands as well as from Laos and across the DMZ (de-militarized zone) that bordered North and South Vietnam. Dubbed the “Easter Offensive” by the US press, the Communist attack was the largest since those during Tet in 1968, and like that earlier offensive, the Communists hoped that the offensive would initiate insurrections throughout South Vietnam and the collapse of its government. One of the most violent battles of the Easter Offensive was fought over the town of Kontum. The central highlands town had been subject to many attacks over the years, but this was the most prolonged and unlike the earlier fights which were waged by the NLF, this was a large-scale conventional battle that included tanks and massive numbers of artillery and rocket support. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts?

Each copy of Bad News on the Doorstep is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
104 un-mounted, double-sided units
10 pages of rules

Players will need a standard deck of cards with all Ace, 2 and 3 cards removed, one six sided (D6) and one ten sided (D10) set of dice to play the game. Treat a DR of 0 on the D10 as ten, not zero.
mechanics: Area Movement, Die Icon Resolution, Open Drafting

name: Margraves of Valeria: Starters Pack
description:
A four card pack that adds one new Starter Citizen card for each player. This pack is included in the Kickstarter version of the base game but is also available on the publisher's website.

Reeve: Gain one resource of your choice, one knight, and one coin. All opponents may pay you one coin to get one knight.

name: Margraves of Valeria: Citizens Pack
description:
A eight card pack that adds one or two (depending on player count) Citizen per Guild. This pack is included in the Kickstarter version of the base game but is also available on the publisher's website.

Amazon: Gain two Strength and one Resource of your choice. All players may spend one Strength to gain one Resource of their choice. You may slay a Monster.

Cenobite - Gain one Magic or one Strength. You may take one Magic from an opponent. You may slay a Monster.

Emerald Corsair - Move your Ship one space forward. If you did not gain a Privilege tile, gain one Resource of your choice.

Moneyer - Gain seven Coins. All opponents gain one Coin.

name: Margraves of Valeria: Monsters Pack
description:
A four card pack that adds one new Monster with unique rewards per Lair. This pack is included in the Kickstarter version of the base game but is also available on the publisher's website.

Ruins: Gargoyle - 1 Magic, 5 Strength / 1 Influence, 3 resources of your choice

Hills: Gnoll Bonewitch - 2 Magic, 3 strength / 1 Influence, remove 1 level I Privilege tile from the game and gain I level one Privilege tile

Mountains: Stone Golem - 1 Magic, 8 strength / 1 Influence, gain 12 Coins or 1 level II privilege tile or 1 Gem

Forest: Viridian - 1 Magic, 7 Strength / 2 Influence, pay 1
Gold to hire any of the face-up cards in the Citizen line and remove one of those cards from the game

name: Kiss the Goblin
description:
A wealthy, but horrible, goblin has asked for your hand in marriage! How do you react? Would you react differently if you were playing a chaotic good character? What about lawful evil?

Kiss the Goblin is a party game where you describe how you would react to outrageous situations while trying to communicate a secret alignment.

For example: What kind of toppings does a chaotic evil person like on on their pizza?

You might answer "broken glass & anchovies" but the possibilities are endless!

name: Sky Team: BLQ Guglielmo Marconi
description:
An additional airport for Sky Team

Contain one postcard with two additional missions (Red and Green)

name: Master Thieves: Gem Counterfeiters
description:
Jewel Counterfeiters

From the publisher's webside:
Thanks to smugglers, green emeralds have found their way to the jewelry box.
But the finest cut diamond is counterfeit. Meanwhile, the jeweler protects their drawers filled with signet rings, which prove to be particularly valuable. And although the crooks all act extremely cautiously, this time everyone leaves its mark ...

Includes 8 fingerprints, 8 green emeralds in a diamond shape, 3 high-quality elastic jewelry rings made ​​of cast metal in an organza bag. Instructions in German and English.

Juwelenfälscher is a high quality expansion with metal rings in a special gift box.

Limited to only 500 pieces, this expansion will complete Master Thieves and call on all crooks to exercise extreme caution, creating an even more exciting gaming experience.

This expansion includes several game content only with the basic game "Master Thief" playable.
mechanics: Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Fleet Marines: Module I – Assault
description:
From the publishers website and press release:

This is the first entirely new game system from ADB, Inc., in years. It brings infantry combat in the Star Fleet Universe to life in a way that allows ground battles to be fought simultaneously with the space battles portrayed by Star Fleet Battles, Federation Commander, Starmada, or A Call to Arms SF.

Over 500 unit counters portray squads of five Marines, snipers, engineers, commandos, and heavy weapons; or individual tanks and vehicles; or special game markers.

The very simple “shoot then move” system reflects the savage horror of war at bayonet point. Fast interaction is created by rules for opportunity fire and defensive snapshots, so both players are constantly acting, reacting, planning, and making hard decisions. Do you fire at those Klingon troops attacking your right flank — or hold the fire of your weapons for the main attack that has yet to appear (and might never)?

The full-color highly artistic map portrays the terrain on a typical planet far, far away, but rules allow you to designate the colored areas as crops, forest, swamps, marshes, or any of a dozen other types of alien landscape. The map even includes an active volcano and a river of lava!

Each counter is a group of five Marines (i.e., a "Boarding Party" from SFB or a "Marine squad" from FC, facilitating interactions) or a single vehicle (tank, ground combat vehicle, shuttle, or whatever). Each hex is 100 meters. While you can stack a lot of units in one hex (more infantry than vehicles, but still a lot), only a few can fire out of that hex in each direction.

The game system is one of player turns. On your turn, each of your units can either shoot or move, not both. Shooting comes first (after which the unit is turned upside down so that you remember not to move it), then movement, then you turn all of your upside down units right side up. When you shoot at an enemy unit, you cross-index the kind of unit that is shooting with the kind of unit being shot at, adjust this for any terrain that provides protection, and roll one die. The enemy unit might be destroyed, stunned (turned upside down so it won't be able to shoot or move on its next turn), or unharmed.

The first game module, SFM: Assault!, includes Marines, other infantry (commando, heavy weapons, engineers, Prime Teams, militia), and vehicles (tanks, trucks, engineer vehicles, command vehicles, and various light-armored troop carriers).

Units will be able to dig in, call for regular artillery or transporter artillery, do assault landings with shuttles or transporters, do close assaults, use opportunity fire to shoot during the enemy turn, and conduct air strikes with fighters or gunboats.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Le Jeu des Cancres
description:
Two camps confront each other.

One camp directs the students and aim to flee the school. Every student leaving the building accounts for 1 point.
The other camp moves the teachers and tries to capture the students by closing in on them (encircling them or blocking them against the wall). Each captured student accounts for one point for the teachers.

After each turn, one card is drawn and its effects applied (generally move some students or teachers) but this can be set aside for a more strategic game.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Open Drafting

name: Superchess
description:
From the manual:

"Superchess represents a major breakthrough in four-way chess. The problems associated with other forms of four-way chess have been solved as a result of the unique board design. For instance, difficulties with pawn promotion, colliding pawns, and board congestion have been eliminated. Superchess is how four-way chess was meant to be played."

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout 3058 Upgrade
description:
From the back of the book:

"Wars past. Wars present.

In the 3050's, the discoveries of long-buried Star League records led to a plethora of new cutting-edge BattleMech and vehicle designs by the end of that decade, resurrected from the blue prints of design firms centuries old and thought lost to antiquity. Now, ten years later, these designs have moved from novelty to workhorse, as the Inner Sphere once more finds itself at war!

Fully updated to circa 3070, Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3058 Upgrade - launches these designs into the current time frame, including notable MechWarriors/crews, as well as new variants. Additionally, a battle armor section has been included, providing full Classic BattleTech stats, and updating the histories for these twenty venerable designs."

User comment:

This upgrade volume is one of a series of Upgrade titles produced to provide new material for gamers and collectors, rather than replacing the original Technical Readout upon which they're based. The Technical Readout 3058 Upgrade is a companion volume to the Technical Readout: 3058, rather than a replacement. Although the two may seem similar the 3058 Upgrade expands the detail up to 3070, adds personality entries, many new Mechs, new sections on Battle Armour and generally provides new material. Both volumes share a cover, although this volume has the word "Upgrade" marked in the lower-right hand corner of the front cover.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout – Project Phoenix
description:
