As the FedCom Civil War swung into high gear and conflict swept through the Inner Sphere, the need for additional war materials was paramount. However, unlike many companies, which produced new, but expensive, BattleMechs, a new upstart company, Vicore Industries, took a different route. By taking centuries old machines and upgrading both their physical as well as technological capabilities, Vicore almost single handedly started a revolution that provided a cheap means to bring 'new' BattleMechs to the field commanders desperate for more assets.

Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: Project Phoenix provides descriptions, game statistics and illustrations for twenty-nine classic BattleMechs that have been upgraded both in appearance and technology. Also, for the first time in any technical readout, additional illustrations representing all the variants for every design in the book are also included. This is the corrected second printing.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Sock Puppet Charades
description: In this silly twist on Charades, players take turns placing one or two sock puppets on their hands and creatively act out as many of the three items on their card that they can get through before the sand timer runs out. The puppets come with holes on the side and the thumb and pinky are used as arms. The game also comes with small props to help act out the words on the cards. All of the other players try to guess what is being acted out. Both the actor and the correct guesser score points when items are guessed. The player with the most points after the designated number of rounds is the Puppet Master!

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: X-Men Starter Set
description:
From the publisher:

This game is a small scale skirmish level game where Superheroes and Villains face off against each other in a 3D tabletop set up. It could be a city, the Wakandan desert, the Savage Lands, the blue area of the moon or anything you like. In Marvel they fight anywhere.
It is played on a 36" x 36" board so will fit on most tables without a problem.

In a game you will usually have between 4-7 characters on your team. Each of these characters act individually using their own Power to carry out different attacks and use Special Powers.
Many can help or hinder each others though with boosts and actions like a Fastball Special.

The aim of the game is to win set scenarios by completing different tasks and scoring Victory Points. These could be anything from take down / save the highest Level model in the team or rescue and keep a Cosmic Relic.

Each character comes with their own Stat Card which shows everything they can do. Attacks, Defence, Skills, Power, Damage and such.
These are then used in a 2 D8 mechanic during the game. For example, 2D8 plus Attack Stat vs Defence Stat or 2D8 against your own Agility.

Feared and hated by humans because they're different, the X-Men are heroic mutants, individuals born with special powers who've sworn to use their gifts to protect mutants as well as humans.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: As You 'Wich
description:
A delicious (and sometimes disgusting) card game that has one goal, build the best sandwich you can and convince your opponents it's the best they've ever seen. As You 'Wich is an ecstatic celebration of mankind's greatest invention: the sandwich. From hot pitas stuffed with falafel to fresh baguettes with ham and butter, every corner of the world has its sandwich, and its people have their sandwich opinions.

Each player starts with 5 cards. Players then draw cards or take from the three piles of cards in the middle (known as “The Sandwich Store”). Gameplay continues until each store is forcefully closed. Then players take turns to pitch their creation.

Once all sandwiches have been pitched, on the count of three, players point and pick the best sandwich. The best sandwich wins the round. The chef who wins the most rounds wins the game!

name: YIMBY
description:
Yes In My Backyard!

Work against your fellow real estate developers to make the city of Stockholm into a dense and tall version of its present state. Influence politics and policy to your advantage, increase population density by building crammed housing, close city airports and parks and, for all that’s holy, make sure the nightclubs are in your areas!

Each turn you play one card from your hand, either a scoring card which is secretly discarded or put aside to influence final scoring, or an event card which ads new action spaces to the map. Then you can activate action spaces on the map, move your pawn, develop new real estate projects (adding cubes to the map), take loans and finally you draw cards up to your variable hand limit.

name: ArchRavels: Special Requests Promo Pack
description:
This set of 4 promotional Special Request Cards was released in Pack B of the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

This adds the Special Request cards "The Dice Tower", "Fuzzy Math Rocks", "Everyone's Welcome", and "Tom's Hat."

name: Cold Case: End of the Line
description:
Two murders plague the small town of Pauvigny, France. On a dark night in 1961, Leonce Junot's body was found after a jewelry heist gone awry and the suspect, Henri Valentine, was arrested and convicted. Two decades later, Henri Valentine was released only to have his body discovered in the morning at the same railway he was apprehended. The whispers around town confuse the situation, and only you can solve both cold cases and figure out who the true murderer is.

Packed with realistic documents pertaining to the crime, Cold Case: End of the Line challenges you to use your best investigative skills to crack the case. The authorities couldn't figure it out, but can you?

name: 50 Clues: Down in the Depths
description:
Down in the Depths is the second episode of the story-driven escape game trilogy, Sunshine Island.

The situation has deteriorated from critical to almost impossible. An infectious and deadly fungus has spread on the island of Bornholm. A biological warfare agent that’s out of control. Will you find the results of your sister’s research located in the underground complex in time? If you succeed, then you can prevent a global catastrophe from happening, but a mysterious pharmaceutical company has other plans. Take on a difficult mission in the role of Sigrid and solve the mystery.

50 Clues is an award-winning immersive puzzle game that offers the experience of an escape room, but in a format that can be played at home. You combine objects, solve puzzles and decipher codes to complete the story. A smartphone or tablet keeps track of the solutions and provides multistep hints if the need arises.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Through the Desert: Bazaar
description:
Four modular expansions tweak the classic gameplay of Through The Desert with fun twists without diluting the elegant nature of the gameplay. Add one for a slight change, or bring out all four for experienced players looking for a challenge!

Rival Nomads:
Based on a deck of Nomad cards, players will embark on a mysterious journey as they reveal specific and intriguing scoring conditions that challenge them to adapt their strategies quickly.

Djinns:
Visiting oases awakens mischievous djinns, who use their magic to make crossing the desert more difficult.

Special Watering holes:
Take a camel piece so you can place an extra piece. In a game where the turns are so tight, this extra pace is crucial! Trading is a way of life in the desert. Buying a commercial good is worthless, but finding someone to trade with while having a pair? That's ten points!

Bazaars:
Form valuable trade routes from desert bazaars to distant villages.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Arabian, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Sapiens: Mountains
description:
Sapiens: Mountains is a set of eight landscape tiles for Sapiens with one-half of each tile being one of the eight normal landscape tiles and the other half of each tile being a mountain, which is what surrounds the valley on each individual's playing board.

During set-up, place these eight mountain tiles next to the scoreboard. During play, instead of placing a tile from your personal pool onto your player board, you can place one of these mountain tiles, with the mountain half lying outside the normal play area and the other half matching an adjacent tile (and scoring food points and a bonus) like usual; if you cover a cave with the mountain half of the tile, you earn no shelter points for this placement.
publishers: Catch Up Games, IELLO, Plato Magazine

name: Cartaventura: Les Trois Mousquetaires – L'honneur de la Reine
description:
Cartaventura is a collection of narrative card games with immersive scenarios and multiple endings!

Players build their adventure using cards that offer a variety of options. Cartaventura features games set in different eras, each faithfully and faithfully recreated. Players are immersed in history thanks to rich scenarios and watercolor illustrations, in homage to travel journals.

Cartaventura - Three Musketeers in a nutshell:

Produced under official license.
Relive the story of The Three Musketeers in a different way, as d'Artagnan.
An easy-to-learn game, with instructions that can be read directly on the cards.
A symbol-collecting mechanism (Bravery, Intrigue) that brings tension and epic excitement to the game.
3 different endings to discover on replay: the one from the film and 2 completely new ones!
A literary style reminiscent of Alexandre Dumas.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Legends of the Old West: Showdown
description:
This 48-page book expands on all the material in the first book in the series, Legends of the Old West.

Included are errata for the other 3 books in the Legends of the Old West line, new gangs, new gunfighters, tips on running a campaign, new campaign rules, new items to buy, new skills, and a slew of alternative settings--for instance gang fights in old Chicago.

As with any book from Warhammer Historical, there is plenty of 25mm eye candy, tips for painting, and for making scenery.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Ascension: Darkness Unleashed – Tower of Ascendancy
description: Ascension: Tower of Ascendancy is a promotional card given to Kickstarter backers of Ascension Online that costs 5 runes to purchase and is worth 3 honor. When this Enlightened Construct is in play, once per turn you can draw a card; if you do, each other player can give you 1 honor to draw a card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: The Cousins' War: Events
description: The Cousins' War: Events is a small expansion for The Cousins' War.

name: D-Day Omaha Beach: Beach to Bocage
description:
The D-Day folio series consists of four separate games, each portraying a portion of the Normandy campaign area. Turns represent two to three days each; the games cover the campaign from the initial landing to the breakout. Each game comes with one map covering a portion of the battlefield at 2.5 miles per hex. The playing pieces represent the regiments and special battalions taking part, plus the multitude of fire support available to them.

The series uses the Fire & Movement system rules, with exclusive rules for each folio. The folios can be combined to display the entire American or British Commonwealth sectors, or into a single giant game on the entire campaign.

Omaha Beach was anticipated to be the worst landing because of the bluffs looming over the strand. The Allied player must muscle troops onshore against the best German infantry in the region, then push forward to link up with the landings on either side. If that can be accomplished, the opposing forces will battle through the constricting bocage country for control of the road junctions in the area, particularly St. Lô.

Contents:
17"x22" terrain map
100 die-cut counters
one Eight page system rule booklet
one exclusive scenario rules
10x13 ziplock

Players: 1-3
Ages: 14+
Hex Scale: 2.5 miles
Play Time: 1-2 hours
Complexity: Low-Med
Solitaire Ability: Medium

name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Negotiator Cards
description:
The Hater and The Chief Negotiator Cards.

The Hater
A cynical veteran of the force that has seen one too many hostage situations.

The Chief
The Chief is an important character who will appear throughout your Career campaign. Now you can take on a hostage situation with her in the driver’s seat.

Decide before the game begins if you would like to use a Negotiator card. You may select one of your choice or shuffle and take one at random.
Each Negotiator card has a special ability that can only be used ONCE during the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Hostage Negotiator: The Mediator and The Mouth Dice Tower Promo Cards
description:
This is a special set of promo cards originally offered to backers of the Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.
Later available as part of the 2023 Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: uKloo
description:
uKloo is an educational "Early Reader Treasure Hunt" game to help teach young children reading basics. It is designed to help reluctant readers and is designed for younger ages (4+).

The goal of the game is to successfully navigate through a series of hidden clue cards to win a surprise.

In uKloo, an adult puts the 'picture helper' poster on the fridge, a door, or a wall and hides a selection of clue cards around the house based on reading level and game length in such a way that the clue cards will form a chain. The last clue is given to the players to begin the game.

For competitive mode, two or more chains of clues need to be created to see which child will finish first.

uKloo has been awarded Creative Child Magazine 2011 Game of the Year and is a Dr. Toy 10 Best Active Products and 100 Best Children's Products winner.

The game box includes 42 clue cards with 3 colour-coded levels of achievement, a "Picture Helper" reference poster, 12 blank "Surprise" cards, and information about the creation of the game and future releases.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Judgment
description:
Deep within the Krosan Forest, the final showdown for the Mirari begins. The forces of white and green ascend to counter the black dominance of Torment. Plus, five powerful Wish cards allow you to seek any card you own and put it into your hand—a Magic player’s dream.

This 143-card, black-bordered set includes the powerful new Wish mechanic, intriguing new creatures, and an old friend: Erhnam Djinn.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Circus Train Expansion Kit
description:
The Circus Train Expansion Kit includes everything you need to expand the game to accommodate 3, 4 or even 5 players! Strategic planning is even more important as the competition can be fierce. In addition to the new rules for scoring and supporting the new players, the game also includes a new Action card for each player, a new Event card, and lots of new Talent and Performance counters. Four new special characters are also included in the Optional Rules.

Note, the Circus Train Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Circus Train to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:
Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 5 on a 9 scale
Scale: Weekly turns; bi-monthly pay days and one performance city per turn.

Game Components:
• One color Rules sheet
• 24 Action cards
• 5 Overnight Hire cards
• 1 Event card
• 24 Performance counters
• 3 Circus Train markers
• 28 Talent counters
• 6 Victory Point counters
• 9 Best Performance Score counters
• 3 Reputation Value counters
• 3 Two Week Show markers
• 10 Event card support markers

name: Fog & Friction: Western Front
description:
In Fog & Friction, your High Command has given you a single key objective: take more ground than the enemy!

You have been given the resources to prosecute this war - but it is up to you to determine how you will use them. Will you use cunning and deception to out-fox your enemy, or rely on mighty tanks and guns to smash through enemy lines in a storm of steel and iron? One thing is certain, however: war may be unpredictable, but with careful planning and the steady application of force, your victory will be assured!

In Fog & Friction: Western Front you assume the role of either an Allied or Axis commander and wage war across numerous battlefields inspired by the historical campaigns of World War Two. You will contest bridges, towns, and rolling farmland until only one side’s force remains, leaving you in possession of the field.

—description from the publisher

name: Buds and Blooms
description:
Rival gardeners compete to see who can grow the best flowers for the annual flower show.
Will your sunflowers be spectacular or simply second-rate?
Will your marigolds be magnificent or merely mediocre?
Whoever grows the tallest and most attractive flowers will be awarded Best in Show!

Players play cards to their flower beds to increase the height of their flowers and attract bees and butterflies. The taller the flower, and the more attractive it is to insects, the more points it will be awarded. The gardener whose flowers score the highest at the end of the game wins.

An entry in the 2021 54-Card Game Design Contest

—description from the designer
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Far Space Foundry: Extra Products Expansion
description:
The Far Space Foundry: Extra Products Expansion provides 6 additional products to be manufactured and shipped out from Space Foundry Beta (the second half of a game of Far Space Foundry). Some of the new products require a credit to purchase them, and the mechs are so heavy that they require twice as much thrust to transport them!

This was included as a free stretch goal in the initial Kickstarter campaign for Far Space Foundry, but very likely will be available for purchase later.

Components

6 Product cards
36 Product tokens
1 instruction card
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune: Ultimate Weapons
description:
Description from the publisher:

Expand your command! Bolster your armies with Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune: Ultimate Weapons, an 84-card expansion for Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune. This expansion contains five copies each of sixteen different cards, plus four additional warcaster cards to bring new strategies to your Retribution of Scyrah, Convergence of Cyriss, Highborn Covenant, and Four Star Syndicate decks.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Four Clans Conflict
description: A revolution has risen in a peaceful country ruled by four clans. Players are divided into revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries, and battle for the survival of the country. Four forts between them, whoever controls them controls the battle. Sometimes it is important to withdraw from a battle. When you withdraw, take advantage of the battlefield by looting the treasure left behind in the fort. The battle that decides the fate of both sides has begun! Four Clans Conflict is a two-player trick-taking game.
publishers: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

name: Maneuver
description:
From the Box: Maneuver is a game of mobile strategy wherein a player can Maneuver his men aggressively to score points. The play of a card dictates the Maneuvering of men in a clock-wise direction, regardless of how the men are grouped or scattered. A player may also Maneuver defensively to minimize the scoring potential of his opponents. It is not necessary that each of a players men complete an equal amount of laps; a player may Maneuver his men in any manner that suits his strategy

--

Played on a circular board of 25 numbered spaces. 4 men and a scoring marker of each players color are moved around the board using a custom deck of cards, consisting of Ace(1) through 7 with three runs of hearts, two runs of clubs and spades, and one run of diamonds. Players hold six cards, and draw one each turn – a card of their choosing, either from their hand or their draw, is played to move the number of spaces equal to the number of the card. Four men can be moved simultaneously with a diamond card, three with a club, two with a heart, and one man with a spade. Scoring is accomplished buy landing all four men on a single space; the color of the space - red, yellow, or "terminal"(home) - determines the scoring. Evicting other players from a space by landing a greater amount of your men on the space, and lapping the 25 space board also score points. The players color score marker sits on the numbered space of the board. The first player to move his score marker a complete round to 25 points wins the game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zenn
description:
Zenn & 100 Related Games is a game of skill and strategy. The basic component is a hard plastic, and well made, game board. The playing pieces are different sized and colored poker chips. These chips are used in a variety of ways, depending on what variation of the game you want to play. The game has, as referenced in the title, 100 games variations.

The basic way the game is played is by flicking the chips and attempting to get them in the goal holes on your opponents side. In front of the goal holes are raised blocks that increase the difficulty of making a score.

Players alternate shots and depending on where the successful shot is made from determines the point that is scored.

name: Blitzkrieg to Moscow
description:
This is a Japanese game on "Operation Barbarossa."

This game won the 1st prize in the design competition presented by Sho-Kikaku.

A remake Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2 was published in 2016.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Sho-Kikaku

name: TaleSpin: The Card Game
description:
(Ripped from the Web Site)

Can you be the first to deliver your cargo and claim the title of Cape Suzette's fastest shipping company? Or are you planning on stealing it all to increase the wealth and legend of the Sky Pirates?

Whatever your goal, you can take it to the clouds in TaleSpin: The Card Game. A fan-created game based on the Disney animated cartoon, TaleSpin: The Card Game is only available here as an online download. It's completely free... you just have to make it yourself!

TaleSpin: The Card Game consists of over 120 cards, divided into Player cards, Location cards and deck cards. A six sided die is required to play. Up to 4 people can travel the world of Disney's TaleSpin, playing cargo, picking up passengers and starting aerial dogfights. You'll have to manage your cards carefully... or risk being shot out of the sky by your opponents!

http://www.fourhman.com/talespin/

Major game features:
- four player characters with different attributes
- secondary characters come with randomized game effects
- all cards double as dogfight maneuvers
- bluffing mechanic keeps opponents guessing
- website rules include solitaire version
- website offers "base" card set, and optional expansion set (more powerful and complicated cards)
- design and theme stays true to the source material
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Push
description:
Push comes with a wooden board with 25 holes in it and 48 round discs in 4 colors.

Players in turn shoot their discs from the edge of the board trying to land them in the holes. The holes in front of each player score different points depending on how far they are located from that player.

name: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's SSD Book #9
description:
An expansion for the Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook. This SSD book is product number TFG3023.

Contains 45 SSD (Ship System Display) sheets for Variants, War Cruisers, Mine Sweepers, New Alliance Ships and New Coalition Ships.
4-Federation, 4-Klingon, 4-Romulan, 4-Kzinti, 2-Isc, 4-Gorn, 4-Tholian, 2-Orion, 6-Hydran, 2-Andromedan, 4-Lyran, 1-Wyn, 1-Auxilary Space Control Ship, 1-Planetary Defense System and 2-Freighters

Small Mine-Laying Freighter
Large Mine-Laying Freighter
Auxiliary Space Control Ship
Planetary Defense System Defense Satellites (Plas-D)/Ground Bases
Federation DNG Dreadnought
Federation New Minesweeper
Federation Light Survey Cruiser
Federation Drone Frigate
Klingon D-5M War Minesweeper
Klingon D-5E Escort Cruiser
Klingon Transport Tug
Klingon Internal Security Forces Flagship IKV “Regulator”
Romulan Skyhawk-L Destroyer Leader
Romulan Seahawk-A Frigate
Romulan KPR PF Tender
Romulan Sparrowhwk-R Repair Cruiser
Kzinti War Destroyer
Kzinti FFK Frigate
Kzinti Medium Minesweeper
Kzinti Drone Cruiser
ISC Light Tactical Transport with Combat Pod
ISC Escort Carrier
Gorn Heavy Minesweeper
Gorn Battle Transport
Gorn Medium Cruiser
Gorn Heavy Battlecruiser
Tholian War Cruiser
Tholian War Scout
Tholian War Minesweeper
Tholian Light Tactical Transport
Orion Battlecruiser
Orion War Destroyer
Hydran New Minesweeper
Hydran Warrior DDL
Hydran Cossack Medium Carrier
Hydran Scythian Escort Carrier
Hydran Tartar Medium Cruiser
Hydran Mongol Medium Cruiser
Andromedan Infestor
Andromedan Mamba Heavy Destroyer/Andromedan Eel Scout
Lyran War Minesweeper
Lyran War Destroyer Leader
LDR Heavy Cruiser “Independence”
Lyran Democratic Republic Frigate
Wyn Pocket Battleship
Additional Rules Developed with Star Fleet Battles Commander’s SSD Book #9 (page 46)
Additional Rules Developed with Star Fleet Battles Commander’s SSD Book #9 (page 47)
Additional Rules Developed with Star Fleet Battles Commander’s SSD Book #9 (page 48)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Fast and Dirty
description:
Fast and Dirty was designed to provide a quick, uncomplicated, yet realistic game system for small unit modern day, near future and sci-fi skirmish combat.

By building upon basic military principles that have not changed much over time, such as troop morale, motivation, and experience, these rules are an attempt to create a system that will serve just as well for fire fights today as those far off into the future.

Each player will field a small force, ranging from a few squads to a reinforced platoon with support elements, including heavy weapons, artillery, even a vehicle or two. Forces can be created in one of three ways: using a simple random force generation system to get you playing quickly, a more advanced system for experienced players, and a detailed points system for the ultimate in flexibility. Though the system is easy to learn and play, this doesn’t mean the game is lacking details.

In fact, there are actually three levels of play. First you will learn the Basic Game, which provides all the core rules necessary to head off into battle. Then, as you become familiar with the system, you might want to consider using some of the Advanced Rules, which will add more depth to your gaming experience. Finally, there are a number of Optional Rules which you can incorporate into your games to add even greater detail. The choice is yours.

Fast and Dirty is a generic system, specifically designed to work with a wide array of settings and miniatures. Feel free to devise your own worlds and forces, based upon the miniatures in your collection.
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Twilight of the Sun King: Birth of the Age of Reason Wargame Rules for the Period 1680-1721
description:
These are designed to be an extremely, stripped down set of fast play rules for the period of the Great Northern War and the War of the Spanish Succession. The emphasis is on unit morale and cohesion rather than casualty generation. While this is an ideal that many rule sets acknowledge, these rules actually collapse both missile and close combat into the morale phase. Movement by units are quite limited, 'arthritic' in the designers' words. This, too, makes the games move more quickly while remaining faithful to the tactical systems used in large-scale land warfare in Europe during this period.

The rules are designed for figures at the smaller end of the scale range. Units are brigades of two elements each. Figures already based for DBx rules need not be rebased.

First version rules (2001) are available online for free.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: AE: Bounty
description: AE-Bounty is a skirmish-scale miniature wargame taking place in a far future ravaged by conflict. The game will use the core rules mechanic from AE-WWII, making it easy for players to transition from one game to the other. Bounty will have the same small model count as AE-WWII with players able to run crews of as few as two models! Though players can use just about any sci-fi models, Bounty is geared for use with our upcoming line of Darkson Designs sci-fi models.

name: Classic BattleTech: Combat Equipment
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Cutting Edge!

As wars continue to flare across the Inner Sphere and Clan homeworlds, every faction pushes forward with new military developments, fielding cutting-edge equipment, from new personal weapons to battle armor and ProtoMechs.

Combat Equipment is a companion volume to both Classic BattleTech and Classic BattleTech RPG. Providing a plethroa of new tools for the battlefield, Combat Equipment also contains a rules expansion allowing players to build non-combat vehicles from buses to trains and large atmospheric craft to super-large wet navy vessels. Also included: a full technical readout section detailing fourteen new battle armor designs in various stages of prototype development; eight new ProtoMechs; and pre-printed record sheets for the battle armor and ProtoMech designs.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Antiquity
description:
A multiplayer boardgame of ancient civilizations.

The players represent one of fifteen ancient cultures. The cultures are defined by 16 statistics. These include Agriculture Level, Population, Ideas, Resources, Military Level, and Victory Points. In addition, each culture is assigned historically flavored starting bonuses for certain statistics.

The statistics are tracked using "stockpiles" of counters. These counters may be expended in order to take Actions during a player's turn. There are 25 actions available, including Trade, Colonize, Shipbuilding, Conquest, Cultural Revolution, Urbanization, Cattle Raid, Population Explosion, and Assimilation. Actions can add to various stockpiles of your own or allow you to "steal" counters from the stockpiles of an opponent.

The winner is the player with the largest Victory Point stockpile at the end of the game. The number of turns played is predetermined according to whether the players want a short, medium, or long game.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you need to create in order to play the game. The components consist of a Culture Card Deck (15 cards), Civ Card Deck (36 cards), Event Deck (30 cards), one Action Board, five Player Mats, five sets of Player Counters, five sets of Five Count Counters, Leader Token, Turn Track, Turn Token, and six-sided die.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Talisman (Third Edition): White Dwarf UK #186/US #185 Characters
description:
In the run up to the release of the Talisman (Third Edition): Dragon's Tower, Games Workshop released two new Characters as part of an advertising feature in their house magazine, White Dwarf #186 in the UK, and White Dwarf #185 in North America.

These Characters were the Vampire and Swordsman.

The cards featured miniatures taken from GW's tabletop game, Warhammer.

The Vampire and Swordsman were released again in 2003 as part of an advertising feature for the reprinted version of Talisman (Third Edition).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Flames of War: Mid-War Monsters 1942-1943
description:
From the book back:

This is a supplement for Flames of War the World War II Miniatures Game.

Massive 100-ton super tanks, nearly impenetrable light tanks, incredibly powerful tank-hunters, heavy armoured cars, and vastly improved medium tanks.

Mid-war Monsters allows you and your friends to try out some of the scientists' more interesting and outlandish creations on the Flames of War battlefield...
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Hoplomachus: Training Grounds
description:
Hoplomachus [ha-ploh-ma-kuss], or "Hoplo" for short, is a hex-based tactical board game set inside a gladiatorial arena. One to four players, each representing an ancient city/civilization thought to have been lost to the world, are now on Rome's doorstep vying for a place in the prestigious arena games.

Players have a very clear objective: Eliminate the opponent's champion. Champions start the game in the arena but are inactive and defenseless. They will not fight until the crowd is behind them. Each player takes turns drawing, playing and moving gladiators from their "hand" and assisting them with tactic chips.

Based on opponent's moves and play style, each person will need to adjust their strategies. Defend your champ, take over and hold the crowd favor areas, assault opponent's champion, cover deployment zones, eliminate tacticians to reduce enemy options, fight beasts to gain crowd favor, the list of tactical possibilities is endless.

Hoplomachus combines combat, tactics, chip (units) management, level progression (though crowd favor system), team play, player vs board, and so much more.

Training Grounds: This is the smaller, faster version of our full, award winning Hoplomachus game. Play, teach, travel, or host tournaments with the Training Grounds if the full game is too much! The Training Grounds features one of each of the basic gladiators and a tactic or equipment. Be the last gladiator standing!

Carpe Venatus!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Mr. Card Game: Character Cards
description: These character cards were available via the Kickstarter campaign, and currently when direct-ordering, and add some variable player powers to the game. There are seven unique identity cards in the package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Warmachine: Vengeance
description:
From Privateer Press webpage

The nations of Khador and Cygnar are still reeling from their defeat at the hands of Cryx’s armies within the Thornwood. Meanwhile, the Protectorate of Menoth’s Northern Crusade seizes the opportunity to push into Umbrey while the besieged elven nation of Ios struggles to repel the skorne invaders at their gates. For Cygnar, a chance to retake the initiative emerges when an unusual Cryxian column is discovered heading south. The newly promoted Lord General Coleman Stryker marches to intercept, unaware of the true danger that awaits him.

WARMACHINE: Vengeance brings you the next thrilling chapter of the WARMACHINE saga. Answer the call to war with:

- New warcasters, including new epic versions of some of WARMACHINE’s original warcasters.
- Six new character novice warcasters who bring even more arcane support to their armies.
- New units and solos to expand WARMACHINE armies with new strategic possibilities.
- New narrative fiction picking up directly after the harrowing events of WARMACHINE: Colossals.
- A painting and modeling guide to help you prepare your forces for battle.
- Theme Force lists for each new warcaster, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces found in the WARMACHINE world.

EXACT VENGEANCE AND PUNISH YOUR FOES!

name: Warmachine: High Command – Faith & Fortune: Engines of Destruction
description: EXPAND YOUR COMMAND! Bolster your armies with Engines of Destruction, an 84-card expansion for WARMACHINE High Command Faith & Fortune! Engines of Destruction contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warcaster cards, to bring new strategies to your Retribution of Scyrah, Convergence of Cyriss, Highborn Covenant, and Four Star Syndicate decks.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Weapon Zero Expansion Pack
description:
“Before your primate brain is too badly damaged to understand, I want to thank you for helping us destroy your world.”Xindi Reptilian Commander Dolim, to Ensign Hoshi Sato.

The Xindi come to Star Trek: Attack Wing in a BIG way! The Weapon Zero Premium Figure is sure to menace all opposing ships on the tabletop as the Xindi attempt to obliterate all in their path!

The Weapon Zero Premium Figure measures 4” in diameter!

The Weapon Zero Premium Figure also contains ship cards, tokens and more for use in Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Twilight of Shogun
description:
This is a game on political conflict in the last years of Japanese Edo period (1856 to 1867). The basic game engine is based on Twilight Struggle.

Players control either pro-Tokugawa Shogunate or anti Shogunate (imperial) faction. Each turn players play historical event or common political operation cards. This mostly helps them to place their own influence points or remove the opponent's influence points. The difference of Influence points determines the control of hans (domains), and it also affects control of areas.
The winner is determined by victory points, mostly gained by area control.


Issue game of Game Journal #56
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: The Long March 1934-1935
description:
長征 (The Long March 1934-1935) is a card game based on the historical event of "the Long March" - the 1934 campaign of the Chinese Communist Party Red Army.

Players play roles of five generals of the Red Army and collect cards which represent political influences upon the party leaders such as Mao Zedong, Zhou Enlai, etc.

The artwork was drawn by the designer, working from old propaganda photographs of the period.

name: Ricochet Postcard
description: This game is an homage to the great designer Alex Randolph. Basically, it is Ricochet Robots made with a postcard. A player throws a postcard at the center of a table, all the players try to figure out what is the minimum amount of overturn on its side the postcard must do to touch the edge of the table, the player that said the smallest number must check the claim. If he/she was right the player cuts the first border of the postcard (see the image) and keep it as a token of his/her points. Otherwise the player cuts the border and crumple it up as a negative point. the postcard is now more irregular and smaller, therefore is harder to guess right. If a player collect 2 crumpled up tokens is out of the game, the game end when everybody is eliminated or the card cannot be cut anymore (end of the dotted lines. The survived player in the first case or the player with the most stars in their token in the second case is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Walker Mini and Card
description:
This Walker mini and card for The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game was released as a promo in Game Trade Magazine (GTM) Issue No. 201 November.

The unpainted mini is female, wearing a dress. The card provides the following stats:

15 points
Melee: 1 red die
Defense: 1 red die


Outnumbering: A single Walker in a combat rolls its Melee value as normal (1 red die). A second Walker in the same combat rolls 2 red dice; the third Walker rolls 3 red dice, and so on, up to a maximum of 5 red dice.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Monsters in the Elevator
description:
DON'T CRASH! Help the Monsters ride to work without breaking the Elevator!

In this cooperative math card game for kids, your Elevator is full of Monsters trying to go to work. If the Elevator gets too heavy, it breaks and everyone loses. If the Elevator reaches the 20th floor without breaking, everyone wins!

Monsters in the Elevator won "Best Family Game" at the 2016 Boston Festival of Indie Games and is currently 1 of 5 finalists in the Hasbro "Next Great family Game" contest. It is designed for 2-6 player, ages 7-to-11 (and up), takes 2 minutes to learn and 5-20 minutes to play.

There are two decks: The DRAW and the FLOORS. The Draw deck contains MONSTERS with weight numbers on their bodies. Each Floor of the Elevator is a new round of the game, where players check the new Floor card and the Monster cards in the Elevator to see if any of those Monsters exit (get discarded). Then the players each enter a Monster card from their hand into the Elevator at the same time, and finally they add up the weights of the Monsters in the Elevator. If the sum is above the Elevator Capacity (50 x the number of players), the Elevator crashes and everyone loses. Otherwise, everyone gets a new card and play continues to the next Floor!

There are also ACTIONS in the Draw deck you can choose to play instead of a Monster, including cards that Change the Floor up or down, cards that make one Monster exit to Get Exercise or take a Phone Call, or cards that completely clear the Elevator with Giant Bees or a Fire Alarm. Families can decide how much they want to keep their hand secret and how much they want to share for easier cooperation.

Finally, in the ADVANCED MODE the Floors are shuffled and played face-down, and without knowing what Floor might show up next the likelihood of crashing goes up and the game gets much more intense with every round.

name: All Hail Caesar
description:
Intrigue runs rampant in the Roman Forum as you and the other senators jockey for
power. Your colleagues pledge their support... but are they holding the olive branch or
the dagger?

In All Hail Caesar, players are senators in the roman forum trying to gain the most
political prestige through manipulation and subterfuge. Players play influence cards
(both positive and negative) on each other face down and are free to lie, threaten
or bribe to get the best cards and extort prestige points. When a player feels they
have the upper hand, they strike down their rivals secure their position of power in
the Senate.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Take That, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Guild Ball: The Blacksmith's Guild – Forged From Steel
description: Guild Ball: The Blacksmith's Guild – Forged From Steel is an expansion for Guild Ball.

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Lucky Rabbit's Foot Ale
description: Promotional card first made available as a Slug Crew Minor Reward in 2014, and later (2017) to anyone pre-ordering The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Adonis vs. the Lich King. Shuffle or replace a card in any Red Dragon Inn Drink Deck with Lucky Rabbit's Foot Ale to add a bit more excitement to your game!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Arena: For the Gods! – Henry Peddler's Protectus
description: Promotional card included with issue #98 of the Plato magazine.

name: World War III
description:
The greatest horror has begun, life does not know its fate.

Man has chosen the war of nightmares. The will of Unions and Nations advance into a global inferno, aiming for survival and supremacy.

WORLD WAR III. Don’t do it! Find another way, but first we need to battle! To see. What might World War III be like?

GOAL
2 to 7 players battle as the will of Unions and Nations to gain the most value in territories. Nukes may be launched, Technologies can be advanced, Nations may be Allied and Pacts can be made but only one player can claim Victory!

GAMEPLAY
Each player takes a one of seven major nations or unions, USA, N.A.T.O., Russian Federation, China, Arab Union, African Union, or Union of South American Nations.

Each nation/union can take one action, ranging from taxation, building military might, Diplomacy in hope of gaining the aid of other nations, Technology to further options, campaigns of War, or to Nuke opponents.

Players can create Pacts and work together against their enemies, and in advanced play involve ISIL combatants and North Korea.

Play continues in a clockwise fashion until a certain number of turns or a determined amount of time is complete.

Will we survive to see a world at all?

Blatantly inspired by the games of Larry Harris, Martin Wallace and Joseph Miranda. Blast City's World War III delivers an all night romp for friends to decide the end of the world, or see the superpowers that remain.

This is will now be our first FOLIO Game.

WAR WORLD FOLIO 1
Our Folio games are printed box-less games minimal in game components. All materials are within an folded cover (8.5"x11) at an affordable price.

World War III is the first in our WAR WORLD series.

WORLD WAR III was originally a print and play game. We enjoyed the game so much that we are making these physical copies available. The Rules and other details have been updated.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Player Elimination
publishers: Blast City Games, Emperors of Eternal Evil

name: End of the Trail: Outlaw Mini-Expansion
description:
A mini-expansion consisting of an additional face card, the Outlaw, an Outlaw meeple, and four new, optional Joker cards.

As face cards, Outlaws rank above 10 and below Jack. When an Outlaw is played while Prospecting, players place the Outlaw meeple on any tile or, if already in play, move the Outlaw to a new tile. At game end, the tile containing the Outlaw meeple scores only half its value in gold.

Each Outlaw card features an illustration based on historic outlaws of the California Gold Rush, chosen by backers of the Kickstarter Project. These include: Joaquin Murrieta, Eleanor Dumont, Black Bart, and Jack Powers. Illustrations for the Jokers were likewise selected by backers and include depictions of a card shark and a town drunk.

The mini expansion is packaged separately from the base game and will be available to non-Kickstarter backers.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Wasteland Express Delivery Service: Scout
description:
Was part of the pledge level for backing the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

An ally card.

Text says:
Take 1 damage to move an action marker to the used/pass space.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Animated Series Faction Pack
description:
The Animated Series Faction Pack is a pre-built fleet of four ships for Federation, Klingons and Romulans, based on Star Trek - The Animated Series: the U.S.S. Enterprise, two Klingon D7 battlecruisers, and a Romulan D7 battlecruiser. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 29 cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Penguin Habitat 4
description: Penguin Habitat 4: Immediately get a Dice Reward (choose any). Once per round, you can get two times dice rewards. You can choose different reward.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Imperial Settlers: Roll & Write – Halloween 2019 Promosheet
description: Imperial Settlers: Roll & Write – Halloween 2019 Promosheet gives you a fresh challenge for Imperial Settlers: Roll & Write.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Silk Road: Merchants of Silk Road
description:
In Merchants of Silk Road (絲路商人), players lay out all of the tiles in a single, snaking line, with the tiles being 1-6 squares large (in various sizes from 1x1 to 2x3). Each player has an individual game board with 24 empty squares on it in a 4x6 grid.

On a turn, the player whose camel is at the back of the line rolls a die. This player either accepts this result, moves their camel forward this many spaces on the path, and takes the tile their camel would land on and places it in their grid OR passes; if the player passes, then the player whose camel is next to last can take this die roll instead, with the original player rolling the die again.

Whoever first fills their grid wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Viper MK VII (Apollo)
description:
The Viper Mk.VII is a great improvement over the Viper Mk.II, with superior battle capabilities and better fight information for the pilot. After the Cylons infiltrated a fatal backdoor in the Command Navigation Program, most Mk.VIIs have been retrofitted, losing part of their performing features.

Most of the Mk.VIIs aboard the Galactica were destroyed when the Cylons hacked their navigation software. The surviving ones, retrofitted with older software, are still very effective when flown by skilled pilots such as Apollo.

Pilot cards for Leland Joseph Adama "Apollo" are included in this pack.

Contents:
1 Viper MK VII (Apollo)
1 Gaming Base
1 Ship Card
1 Maneuver Deck
Set of pilot Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mixtape Massacre: Lockdown Expansion
description:
Head back into town with this double-barreled blast of an expansion adding new characters, components, and mechanics to both Mixtape Massacre and Escape From Tall Oaks. Not only does the expansion offer additions to both games, but also elements for use when playing with the games together, adding multiple modes of play.

—description from the publisher

name: Doublehead Kids: White Expansion
description: Expansion to the card game Doublehead Kids. Some cards in the main game have a coloured background next to the card images. So that the children can grasp and learn certain card groups better. In the underlying Doppelkopf original game, all cards are on a white background. The expansion contains 26 replacement cards with white background. The coloured cards of the main game can be exchanged. With the expansion the game can be played even more difficult and closer to the original.

name: Us Weekly: The Game
description:
This is a team party game for anyone who has read about a celeb or two. Get ready to roll out the red carpet because two legendary teams (that’s you guys) will be going head-to-head across two very different rounds.

In Round 1 a player from each team races to name as many celebs as they can, based on a given category, against the clock. The winner from this round takes an advantage into Round 2: Triple Charades Jeopardy.

In this final round, players must get their team to guess the celebs in three different ways: by acting, using one word and describing. First team to collect a celeb from all 8 categories wins! The game plays just like the Blockbuster and MTV game.

name: The Great Barrier Reef Card Game: Scuba Diver Promo
description:
3 card KS promo. Includes Scuba Diver, instructions, and a scoring card: Symbiotic.

They came in a slim plastic baggie taped to the base game's box.

If the Reef Card you played would have you pick up the Scuba Diver, you must move the Diver to any other position in the market and take the card from that space instead.
categories: Animals, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical

name: Tac-Tik
description:
Tac-Tik is a board game similar to Pachisi or Tock. It is most popular in France.

Players have to race their four wooden pawns around the game board to be the first to finish getting them all home. Movement of the pawns is determined by dealt cards instead of by dice. Each turn, players can play a card, and the value of this card determines how can they move their pawns. Some cards have special effects (1 or 10 can be used to place a new pawn into play).
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game
publishers: (Self-Published), Bois d'Art, Ça y Est, Cadetel, GORoutage (aka GO49), Le Délirant

name: Mixtape Massacre: Scarlett Booster Pack
description:
Never ride in cars with strange boys… and never follow said boys into the caves. Sadly, Scarlett was never one for the rules and after a night in the caves of Tall Oaks, she awoke with a nasty hickey and a horrible aversion to sunlight. She should have sought help, but as night fell, she developed an insatiable hunger. So she went out for a BITE…

WHAT’S IN THE PACK?
1 New Slasher character piece
1 Character profile card
1 Special Ability Token (unique to the character)
3 New “Killer Scenes, Dude” cards themed to the character
1 Special Ability reference card"

-description from publisher's website

name: A cagar a la via
description:
A clone of "cards against humanity" adapted to Catalan culture.
—user summary

An insulting game not suitable for children, figs and thin-skinned people.
The mechanics of the game are simple. A player draws a red card and reads the question. The rest of the players have to answer with the funniest yellow card they have.

Un joc d’ofendre no apte per a nens, figaflors i gent de pell fina.
La mecànica del joc és simple. Un jugador tira una carta vermella i en llegeix la pregunta. La resta de jugadors han de respondre amb la carta groga més divertida que tinguin. I així fins al final dels dies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Divinus: Base Game Recharge Pack
description:
Thanks to this Recharge Pack, players are able to restart Divinus once they have completed its campaign. Using glue-less stickers for anything attaching to the tiles, and the board, only the player tuckboxes, the rulebook and a fresh sheet of stickers is needed to put your copy 100% back to a fresh start!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Super-Skill Pinball: 4-Cade – Promo Table 1: ‘Twas the Night Before
description:
A new promo table for you with a Christmas atmosphere called "T'Was The Night Before" in record time for download.

For Santa Claus, Christmas means one thing above all: a lot of work! There's a lot for you to do: jump down the chimney, decorate the Christmas tree and hand out presents. Luckily, the residents have provided you with milk and cookies for refreshment, because you're about to jump back on your sleigh and fly on to the next house. If only those reindeer were easier to control! Are you ready for the Christmas rush? Then give people a holiday they'll never forget.

name: What The Actual Factual
description:
Get ready for a fun and memorable night in with your friends and family with What the Actual Factual, our hilarious new party game where the fake answers win!

Super quick to learn, this brilliant game will put your bluffing and persuading skills to the test, while you use your detective skills to try and suss out which players have made up an answer and who has the actual fact.

Here's how to play:


Read the first part of the fact card aloud (the second part of the fact remains hidden). Many of these facts will make you say WTAF!?
All players receive an answer card - only one random player has the actual fact while everyone else has to think on their feet and make up a convincing fake fact.
Everyone takes turns to read their “facts” aloud.
Players place their voting tokens next to the person who they believe has the actual fact. This is the point where you need to convince people to move their tokens and vote for you.
The actual fact is revealed. Players who voted for the correct answer win 1 point each. Players win 1 point for each vote their fake answer receives. First to 20 points wins the game.


What the Actual Factual - Can you come up with an answer that's more believable than the truth?

—description from the publisher

name: Баклажаба (Eggplant)
description:
Everything is simple. Each player recive 8 cards, then 2 cards with letters are open from the deck and place on the table in the row. On their turn, a player play one card from hand in the row, so in the row now 3 cards, and say a word with two last letters in the row — they can be anywhere in this word, but the main thing is they must be exactly in that order, what they are in the row. If any player, who don't turn right now, can make up a word with all letters in the row, he do it out of turn. In any case the card on the right in the row is discarded and situation is change. In this ways players get rid of cards and the player, who will first play their last card, is the winner.

There are also effects on cards that will force players to play a special round (example: to make up a word of exactly five letters or play the word duel) or to draw new cards in their hands, what make the victory is harder.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: S.U.N.: Space United Nations
description:
S.U.N. is a strategy board game played with cards and tokens.

Each player represents one of the species of the space federation that competes with the others to be the most technologically advanced without open hostilities. The first player to reach 21 technology points wins.

It combines the obtaining of resources to build technologies and get the points to win, with an important component of negotiation with the rest of the players. The diplomatic proposals are advantages that you can obtain, but they have to be voted among the players for their approval, so you will have to negotiate to convince them. You will have the opportunity to be President, or to become a despotic Emperor.

You can keep your promises, or not. And you can play Subterfuge behind the backs of your peers...

You decide the reputation you want to have in the Federation.

—description from the designer
categories: Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Alliances, Automatic Resource Growth, Bribery, Negotiation, Race, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Trovehamburgo
description:
Trovehamburgo is a narrative and memory game. Players are immersed in a fantastic medieval world assuming the role of different minstrels (with different functions) and will have the mission of entertaining the inhabitants of the kingdom of Trovehamburg, telling funny stories to obtain coins, which will be the victory points.
But, memory plays a very important role, since as each starting player narrates the first story with different cards, they will leave them face down. The other players must be very attentive to remember and create their stories based on the cards used and in a limited time.
In addition, the game has story style cards, which will affect the different rounds and make the game more fun.
The player who gets to get $10 in coins will win!

—description from the designer

Es un juego narrativo y de memoria. Los jugadores se ven inmersos en un mundo medieval fantástico asumiendo el papel de diferentes juglares (que poseen diferentes funciones) y tendrán la misión de entretener a los habitantes del reino de Trovehamburgo, narrando historias divertidas para obtener monedas, que serán los puntos de victoria.
Pero, la memoria juega un papel muy importante, ya que a medida que cada jugador inicial narre el primer relato con diferentes cartas, las mismas la irá dejando boca abajo. Los demás jugadores deberán estar muy atentos para recordar y crear sus relatos en función de las cartas utilizadas y en un tiempo limitado.
Además, el juego cuenta con cartas de estilos de relato, que afectarán las diferentes rondas y harán más divertido al juego.
Ganará el jugador que llegue a obtener $10 en monedas!

—description from the designer (Spanish)

name: Smash Up: Teens
description:
Don't you forget about them! The Teens are here to take part in all the radical action from the 80s. Will you put together the perfect Brunch Club to stand up against the dweebies?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Cat Packs
description:
Cat Packs is a fast-paced card game mixed with tile-laying in which you'll cleverly put together the cat gang of your most whimsical dreams! The game includes over one hundred unique illustrated cats by artist Liselotte Eriksson.

On each turn, players draft a new cat from the alley and use resources to play out cards from their hand to add to their cat pack. All cats have different requirements and benefits, but not all cats fit well together, so players must carefully consider their positions. The goal of the game is to earn the most "catshine", which players receive by collecting sets of five cat types, surrounding certain cards with other cards, matching corners of four cards together in a catshine symbol, or winning the power struggle taking place after each round!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Scribbly Gum: Print at Home Edition
description:
Did you know Australia's scribbly gum trees get their beautiful scribbles from baby moths burrowing through the bark?

In Scribbly Gum: Print at Home Edition, each player has their own tree diagram and every turn gets to draw a line that leads to food for your baby moth to eat. Collect sets of food to score points. Whoever scribbles their way to the most valuable food wins!

This new edition of Scribbly Gum has been developed by designer Phil Walker-Harding to provide an accessible version of the game that can be played with two standard six-sided dice and one printable game sheet per player.
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Jambo: Nieuwe avonturen en ontmoetingen
description:
This is an expansion that combines Expansion 1 and 2 that were previously released seperately.

The expansion contains 6 separate modules, which can be combined in many ways:
•New Beginnings adds 40 new utility, people and animal cards, providing players with new elements to keep the game new and exciting.
•The Three Huts add 3 new huts for each player to use throughout the game, giving each additional options on each turn.
•The Relic adds 4 cards, which offer players an additional way to win the game.

I - NEW WARES and ENCOUNTERS

II - THE FOURTH HUT

III - THE CARPET

Contents:
- 5 new persons (2 copies each = 10)
- 5 new animals (2 copies each except 1 of the Giraffe = 9)
- 2 new utilities (2 copies each = 4)
- 3 carpets
- 1 new hut (2 copies = 2)
- 16 new ware cards (incl. 4 new kinds of ware cards) (2 copies each = 32)

60 new cards plus one sheet of rules
(and you need about 5 counters)

The cards from this expansion can be combined with all the cards from the base game.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: Magic: The Gathering – Gatecrash
description:
Description from the publisher:

Tensions build on the city-world of Ravnica, where guilds vie to outsmart their opponents and further their own agendas. Compete with five guilds, 249 black-bordered cards, and the occasional premium card.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Swiss Facts
description:
Swiss-Facts is a multilingual guessing game for 2-6 players, aged 12 years and up.

The game focuses on the cantons of Switzerland and has a playing time of 15 minutes.

Do more people live in the canton of Basel-Land or Basel-Stadt? Which has the larger surface- Valais or Grisons? Is the population density greater in the canton of Zurich or Geneva? Are there more municipalities in the canton of Glarus or in the canton of Obwalden? Does Ticino or the canton of Uri have the higher mountain peaks? What was created first- the canton of Freiburg or the canton of Schaffhausen ? And which canton actually has the highest gross domestic product per capita? These questions are similar to those that the players of Swiss-Facts will have to think about.

name: French Empire Series: Marengo
description:
This historical game simulates a battle that took place on the 14th of June, 1800, in Marengo (northern Italy) between the army of the Austrian Empire, led by General Melas, and the French Republican army, led by General Bonaparte.

The game system is designed to be of medium complexity while remaining historically accurate. The rules, the map, the combat counters and the revolutionary use of dice have all been created with these goals in mind. The game also features no stacking of regiments, an innovative loss recording system and only minimal use of markers and tables. Two challenges are proposed: the French player, who begins the game in a position of numerical inferiority, must attempt to achieve the same feat as the army of General Bonaparte, to resist until the arrival of reinforcements, and then use these troops to seize victory. The Austrian player must try to do better than General Melas, who was overconfident of victory at 15:00, only to let it slip from his grasp..

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: WIN
description:
In this micro Long Shot card game, players bet and perform actions at the track while the race unfolds. Your secret bets and clever horse moves are key to winning the most cash at the end of the race!

The Active Player reveals the 4 Run cards, flipping them over 1 at a time to form a row.

The game ends immediately after a third horse crosses the finished line (Track space 9). Players then reveal their Starting Bets and multiply them with the 3 finished horses’ Odds. Next, do the same for any Bets placed at the Bookie card and add any remaining Cash for a final total. The player with the most money wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Grid Movement, Race

name: Crime Writers
description:
Crime Writers is a unique crime game that - besides providing the exciting atmosphere of solving a murder - also challenges the writing skills of the players.
The original black and white photos evoke the mood of classical crime fiction as well as the visuality of suspense and film noir movies.
The crime element cards are really inspirational without exercising too much influence on the storytelling process.
It is a card-based cooperative creative party game with semi-competitive elements.
It contains 86 cards that represent the five basic elements of a crime story in four stacks of cards: crime scene, killer/victim, motive, cause of death.
The game has two stages. The first is the writing stage, where everyone writes a story of a crime using the elements from the cards they have drawn.
In the second stage, the player who's turn it is becomes the writer and the others become guests.
The guests try to reveal the crime story by asking and guessing and try to figure out the whole story, observing the rules of asking.
The guests must continue until they can make all the connections and tell the whole story.
The game only comes to an end once the story of every player has been found out.

An exciting card game for any party of teenagers and adults.

Playing Time: 15-20 min./player

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Capo dei Capi: Apprentices Expansion
description: This 5-card expansion pack to Capo dei Capi includes 5 "apprentices". At the start of a turn, a player chooses one of the 5 cards to use for that turn. Each card offers a unique power. After the turn, the player returns the card (face-down) to the supply. Once all 5 cards have been used, they are turned face-up and may again be chosen by the player taking a turn.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Pocket Landship: Driver C. Andrews promo card
description:
Kickstarter exclusive promo card with the following unique one time use effect:

Friendly Fire:
Any one enemy attack damages an adjacent Enemy Unit instead of a Player Unit
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Under Falling Skies: Cullompton City promo tile
description:
Additional city tile released as a Gaming Rules! promo.


Cullompton (D/G)Blue side (research 5)

"You have 2 discovery tokens. When you research, you may use up a token and cover one space on the track instead of moving your marker. The space must not cost more than the value of the research effect. Covered spaces are ignored. The top space cannot be covered."

Red side (research 5)

"You have 6 discovery tokens. When you research, you may use up a token and cover one space on the track instead of moving your marker. The space must not cost more than the value of the research effect. Covered spaces are ignored. The top space cannot be covered."

name: Eight-Minute Empire: Mountains
description:
A free, downloadable, print-and-play, mini-expansion for Eight-Minute Empire. It adds Mountain tokens and the Settlers and Builders cards.

Mountain tokens may be placed in regions to increase the difficulty of moving armies, but also provide increased control and victory points at game's end. The Settlers card will allow a player to pay an opponent for the use of that player's city, while the Builders card will provide a player an additional opportunity to build a city.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Visby: Extra Player Pack
description: The Visby: Extra Player Pack contains components allowing up to two additional players to join a game of Visby, the base game of which includes the other materials required for play. Up to two Visby: Extra Player Packs can be added to the base game, increasing the maximum player count to six.

name: Ambush Valley: Vietnam 1965-1975
description: In the 44-year long history of the Cold War, few conflicts symbolize it as fully as those in Vietnam. To contemporary observers, it was a war between the two ideological blocs of Communism and the West. From the forces of the Viet Cong and NVA and the American, South Vietnamese, Australian and other Free World forces, the wars that ravaged Indochina throughout the second half of the 20th century can be recreated with Vietnam, the latest companion volume for Force on Force. Orders of battle, scenarios and special theatre-specific rules give players an immersive experience of gaming in in the jungles, fields and towns of Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Kill Doctor Lucky: Doctor Lucky's Mansion That is Haunted
description:
Description from the publisher:

Doctor J. Robert Lucky wishes to sell his haunted house to a pair of unsuspecting newlyweds from across town — but the ghosts of Lucky Mansion have a different plan. They love Doctor Lucky so much, they want him to stay with them forever!

With the Doctor Lucky's Mansion That Is Haunted expansion board, the players are ghosts, so they can move through ceilings, walls, and floors! Any two rooms are connected as long as they share an edge, not just a corner. Players can see from their current room into all the connected rooms, but no farther. What's more, the board contains three secret portals that connect two rooms, represented by duplicate objects (the raven, globe, and portrait); you can move through these portals, but you can't see through them.

This game board can be folded in half to create different play spaces with at most 4-5 players in the game, or the entirety of it can be used for games with up to eight. Whenever the number of players is close to the upper limit of the board, you should probably play with the Cat; if the board seems too roomy, you should add the Dog instead.

name: Battle of the Boy Bands
description:
In Battle of the Boy Bands, 3 to 5 players take on the roles of producers in the pop music industry and must build boy bands to compete in special events. The player with the most points at the end of six rounds wins.

During each round, players try to win the event in play by building the boy band that will earn the most points according to the special event rules. Equipping perk cards from the "Breaking News" deck to boys can give them extra points. Players can sabotage each others' boy bands by playing attack cards from the "Breaking News" deck against them, but watch out! Players can also protect their precious boys with defend cards!

—description from the publisher

name: Builders of Babel
description:
Once upon a time, humanity gathered to construct a large tower to prove their competence as an apex being of the world. While the god disagreed with their ambition, if the tower is complete, God may be forsaken and that is unacceptable. The gods punished them with thecurse of language and various obstacles to prevent the tower from rising higher than this.

Builders of Babel is a party and puzzle game for 2-5 players where you need to erect the tower of Babel as a symbol of humankind's power. But this insolent action seems to defy the gods, so if they would build the tower over the limit or make it collapse, they will be punished.

Let’s build the tower of Babel together in this “EUREKA’ 2021 Thailand Board Game Designer Awards” winner and try not to be named as a hopeless builder in the history of mankind.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Stacking and Balancing, Take That
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Tower Tactic Games

name: ARES: Miniatures Wargaming System
description:
ARES: Miniatures Wargaming System is easily classified as a complete skirmish-level fantasy game.

It is also much more than that. The flexibility of the system allows players to use any wargaming miniatures in their collection. Over two dozen sample figures are detailed in this book, but the real strength of ARES is its figure creation system, that encourages players to use their imaginations -- which is the way it should be!

Also included is a fully-customizable magic system, providing players with the opportunity to design their own spells for their troops.

name: Deck Hockey
description:
Deck Hockey is a Co-Operative game that replicate a Street Hockey game. Team up to be the ones who finish the 3rd period with the most goals scored and win.

Played 2vs2 or in team (3vs3, 4vs4, 5vs5)Deck Hockey is a family game. Designed to be played by all member of your family and kids, you will enjoy "break sticks", play "the trap", get the "Momentum" and carefully use your Slap Shot.

Players are places around the table so they have an opponent at their right and one at their left. One full deck represent one period and the game have 3 periods.

The "ice" is represented by 5 cards places on a table. 1 neutral zone, 1 red zone, 1 blue zone, a red and a blue goalie. A puck with 2 sided coloured (Blue and red obviously) serves to mark the progression of the puck on the ice. The puck will advance from zone to zone up to the goalie where you can attempt a shot... if the opposing team do not intercept first.

As the game start each players will draw 6 cards from the deck. In this deck are the shot cards, pass cards, interception cards and save cards. The deck also contain a series of number cards from 1 to 8 (6 of each). If your team has the control of the puck, you can pass or shot by playing the right card. if not you can intercept or have to attempts saves if you opponent shoots on you.

2 piles are set for the played cards on the table. One for the action cards and on for the numbered cards. The numbered cards mostly works the same way as the action cards: If you can match from you hand the numbered card on top of the "Number pile", you create an action. If your team has the control of the puck, you create a pass or shot and if you dont you can intercept or attempts make the save if you opponent shoots on you.

A set of card in the deck serves as interaction between players to add more reality to the game and to give you an edge on your opponents. The Brocken Stick, The Trap, The Time Out, The Momentum, etc.

name: Zooloretto: Rabbits
description:
You can bring the rabbits in play by exchanging them with another animal type of your choice. All the rules of the original game apply without any changes.

The Rabbits consists of 5 fertile males, 5 fertile females and 5 bunnies, because we all know they breed like rabbits...

The rabbits were a promotional item, available on Abacusspiels homepage. They were also released as part of the Zooloretto Goodie-Box at Spiel in Essen 2017.

name: Masters of Venice: Mini-Expansion Set
description:
5 additional characters to expand the mix in the game in all new directions!

In both English and German language

New characters include:
The Carpenter - Someone to take care of all that excess lumber you lug around...
The Money Lender - A little extra bump for those volatile stock markets...
The Porter - Too much to sell? Not a problem...
