The Docks Master - Well, well, look at what fell off that last shipment...
The Minstrel - the musical key to marketing those hard to sell items...

(Also includes the revised tax collector card!)
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Renaissance
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Combat
description:
"A tactical wargame featuring American and German Infantry in the setting of the Western Front of World War II. Each unit represents one man, one support weapon, or one tank. The battles take place on terrain representing areas from France, Belgium, and beyond into the Reich."

The Combat system was later used in two other World War II wargames: Battle Cry! (set in the Pacific), and Iron Cross (set on the Eastern Front).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Zpocalypse: Aftermath – Z-Team Beta
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Z-Team Beta is a collection of miniature Survivors specifically designed to work with the board game Zpocalypse, as well as games using 25-28mm scale miniatures. New characters, scenarios and weapons cards bring a whole new set of challenges and adventures to the world of Zpocalypse. How would you like to bring Squad members back from the dead? Or use a sniper rifle that has unlimited range and can shoot through walls? That is just a taste of the exciting new content! Each miniature comes fully assembled and unpainted. Requires the main Zpocalypse game to play.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Blud Light
description:
It was the promotional card in Gen Con over 2017 and 2018 convention season.

It discards a hand card, then reduces 1 fortitude. A vampire character player gains 1 alcohol content instead of this fortitude loss.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Imaginarium: Chimera
description: This is an expansion to the game Имаджинариум (Imaginarium) which adds 98 new cards with horror and erotics.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Peanut Panic
description: Players try to move their 2 peanuts through the peanut butter factory while avoiding the Peanut Patrol Truck. On your turn you spin the spinner and check the result. If you spin a color, you advance one of your peanuts along the path to the next space of that color. If you spin "Hop to Front!", you move either of your peanuts in front of the leading peanut. If you spin "On", you start the Peanut Patrol Truck. This is an electronic truck that drives around a track, scoops up peanuts within its reach, and dumps back into the START barrel. The first player to get both of his or her peanuts through the factory and onto the FINISH space wins.

name: Wizards of the Wild: Forbidden Forest
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Wizards of the Wild ventured deeper into the forest! Exotic creatures from across the globe and strange magically charged artifacts add new special abilities to your Wizards, playing off opponents and creating a brand new experience!

The Forbidden Forest Expansion adds brand new cards including the new familiar card type, new spells and new challenges to Wizards of the Wild!

Familiars are special, double-sided cards with TWO abilities. The new FLIP mechanic lets you use one side of the card, and then activate the more powerful scoring side to rack up the points!

The Forbidden Forest expansion also includes new spells and challenges that work with the familiars and the base game to create new combos!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: The One Hundred Torii: Toku Mini-Expansion
description:
The Toku mini-expansion is a set of bonus reward cards, some of which are randomly placed on top of the large token piles each game. The first player to earn a given Large Landmark token, Geisha bonus token, or Enclosure bonus token also gains the Toku card on top.

Toku cards are worth one journey point if kept until the end of the game or they may be spent for a one-time special use - such as free landmarks, changing torii gates, or discounts when using the different game characters. In some cases, that could mean being able to use the vendor or samurai for free! You can also use several Toku cards on the same turn for a big play. The Toku mini-expansion gives another incentive to be first to accomplish certain objectives and creates dynamic plays later in the game.

There are 18 cards in this mini-expansion
publishers: Maldito Games, Pencil First Games, LLC

name: Zapotec: Quick Start
description:
The Quick Start module adds asymmetrical setup to Zapotec.

After performing all other setup steps as normal (including starting basic resources), each player is dealt 2 random Quick Start cards from which they will choose 1 card and receive its depicted benefits.

The benefits of each Quick Start card may be simple—gain an advanced resource or two, start with a building, etc.—but their impact will be immediately noticeable without disturbing the delicate balance of the actions you take in the game.

In fact, certain Quick Start benefits may enable a simple Capital action on your first turn of the game.

—description from the publsiher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Xmas Sweater
description:
In Xmas Sweater, each player “knits” their own Christmas sweaters by filling the spaces on their “sweater” with numbers.
Players all play at the same time, with everyone trying to fill the rows on their scoresheets with numbers as high as possible in order to score the most points.

To play, you will need three D12 (1 red, 1 green, and 1 white) and one black D6, one printed scoresheet for each player as well as a pencil or pen.

● On a turn, one player rolls the four dice into the middle of the play area.

● Each player chooses one D12 (without picking it up) and writes the value in any space that matches the color of that D12. Multiple players may choose the same D12.

● Once per round, players may use the Black D6 to modify the result of their chosen D12. (see "Modifying the Dice" in the rulebook).
○ The numbers in a row must remain in ascending order from left to right. (blank fields and the number 0 are okay)
○ Number 0 can be written anywhere in the respective color.
(E.g.: The dice is rolled and there’s “5” with the red die and “5” with the black die, players can write “0” anywhere in either red row.).
○ No duplicate numbers are allowed in any row or column.
Number 0 is an exception to this rule.
○ You may only write the values inside the icons (Hearts and Xmas Icons).

● If the players can’t or won’t enter a number, they mark (X) the leftmost Gift Box on their scoresheet. These are considered as penalties.

When any player has all the Gift Boxes marked or has filled four rows on their scoresheet, the game ends at the end of that round. Players then tally their points:
○ Each Fully Complete Row:
Points equal to the number in the rightmost heart.
○ Each Incomplete Row: One point per entered number.
○ Xmas Icons: Sum of the numbers in all three matching icons.
(E.g.: A player has “18” in one of the trees, “2” in another trees, but he doesn’t have a number in the third tree, he scores “0”.)
(E.g.: A player has “4” in one of the hats, “10” in other hats and “6” in the third one, he scores “20”.)
○ Gingerbread Man Bonus: If you managed to write the number “10” five times, you get +10 points.
○ Each Gift Box: Sum of the marked points from left to right (max -30)

Whoever has the highest score wins. In case of tie, the player who has the least number of marked Gift Boxes wins the game. If there’s still a tie, the player who has the least empty hearts wins the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Zerzura: The Oasis of Marvels
description:
Every year, the birds of the Mediterranean migrate to Zerzura. This mysterious oasis also hosts from time to time a market where fantastic objects are exchanged. Traders meet there in the hope of bringing back marvels for their customers and patrons. They consider the birds of Zerzura to be sacred. When one of these migrating birds lands on any Goods, no trader will try to drive it away. Although many of the objects assure glory and fortune, some of them hold surprises in store. Will you be the most clever trader at Zerzura?

Object of the game :
The players acquire Goods cards representing 1 to 3 Objects (genie’s turban, alchemical zither, cursed peppers, magic ring, enchanted lamp). The value of each collection of Objects in terms of victory points varies according to the number of Objects (and not the number of cards) possessed. At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points is the winner.

name: Pipe Work Duo
description:
Pipe Work Duo is a 2-player(or team) version of Pipe Work.
The game rule is almost same with Pipe Work. However, the player who makes the right connection on his game board will take the puzzle card as a point. The one who collects 5 cards wins the game!

Pipe Work is a simultaneous-play, tile placement game with the tiles actually being pipes that connect colored tokens on your 5x5 playing area.

In each of the eight rounds, players start by revealing a card that shows where the pairs of colored tokens are placed on their individual 5x5 game board. As soon as everyone's done this, all players race simultaneously to place pipes in their game board to create connections between matching tokens.

name: Férias em Dupla
description:
Férias em Dupla (Double On Vacation!) is a card game as light and fun as travelling with best friends.

A fast game for all the family, from 2 to 4 players. It has two modes of playing: with or without the special effects.

Play a card on the table to join two halves of a beetle, you don't even need to match colors!

But if you do, gain one trip point if the car has both driver and a best friend riding shotgun. And gain two trip points if you match two Beetles correctly.

At the end, check your secret plans dealt on the beginning:
What is your luggage? Gain two points for each valid Beetle with it.
Do you have a driver or a friend riding shotgun? Gain one point for each valid Beetle with them.
What is your secret Beetle´s color? Gain one point for each valid Beetle on that color.

Have a nice trip!

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Matching, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Fish, Farewell, Forever
description:
According to the rules, Fish, Farewell, Forever, is a "single-player card game designed to free the masses of their suffering from earthly desires." The game is made up of a deck of 30 cards, with virtue cards, desire cards, and understanding cards.

Players play through a deck of cards hoping to liberate cards to The Beyond. Once the deck runs out, the player loses unless they can move 2 cards from The Beyond over the Styx and onto The Far Shore.

A player wins if they can liberate all cards. "Elevated" wins are also possible, which allow the play to liberate non-card components, such as the rule book and box insert.
publishers: Adventure Planning Service (冒険企画局 / Bouken)

name: Richthofen's Flying Circus
description:
From publisher's website.

In the years leading up to 1917 the ground conflict of the Great War was proving costly to both sides, and the battles fought in the air were equally as intense as technological advances and better tactics were developed.

The air war reached its peak between 1917 and 1918 as aircraft became fast, highly manoeuvrable machines; each pilot determined to attain a superior position for the fleeting seconds in which a target might pass through a gun sight.

Richthofen's Flying Circus, written by Owen Branham, is a detailed rules set that allows players to recreate this fast-paced aerial combat with one or more miniature aircraft. Each game turn represents a snapshot of the action as the machines move across the aerial battlefield and fire upon their opponent.

This full-colour, 80-page soft back rulebook contains rules for playing aerial combat games with 1/72 scale model aircraft, and can also be used with 1/144 to 1/32 scale models. Scenarios are provided for such missions as Dogfights, Balloon Bursting and Bombing, as well as rules for playing both narrative campaigns or 'top gun'-style leagues. Also included is a technical gallery and aircraft background information.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Botticelli and Beyond: Over 100 of the World's Best Word Games
description: A unique collection of word games by game designer David Parlett. Both oral and written word games are represented and old classics are mixed in with games by modern puzzlers and game designers.

name: Crypto Collector
description:
Crypto Collector is a 2-4 player competitive game. In this game, players participate in auctions as collectors of digital art, aiming to own more valuable art than anyone else.

To win:
The Player who gets the most points is the winner.

How to Play:
The game is played over 7 rounds, with 2 phases in each round.
Auction Phase:

An auction is held to acquire the Owner Cards needed to purchase Art Cards. At the beginning of the game, six Art Cards are lined up in a row. Also, at the beginning of the round, the number of Owner Cards corresponding to the number of players is arranged in a horizontal row, face down.
The auction markers held by the first player in turn are used. Each player can perform one of the following actions by using one Marker in turn in ascending order from 1.


[Bidding]
Bid on one Owner Card on the field.
[Buy]
Buy an art card in the lineup. The cost of the Art Card will be paid.
[Sell]
Discard an Owner Card you are holding and immediately earn the revenue indicated on the card's icon.

Revenue Phase:
In this phase (only in certain rounds), each player earns the total amount of revenue indicated on the icons of all Owner Cards held by the player.

name: Sevastopol: The First Modern Siege, 1854-55
description:
A regimental-level simulation of the British/French siege of the Russian city of Sevastopol during the Crimean War of 1854-1855. Like Lille, it is played on a hexless period map of the fortress and surrounding area, using a provided ruler to determine movement distances.

Part of the Art of Siege quad.

name: The Siege of Port Arthur
description:
The Siege of Port Arthur, just before midnight on February 8, 1904, the Russian fleet based at Port Arthur, on the southern tip of the Kwantung Peninsula, was attacked by Japanese torpedo boats, elements of Admiral Togo's fleet. The attack having been made prior to a declaration of war, the Russians were taken by surprise. Thirty - seven years later, Pearl Harbor became the focal point of the same type of treachery.

General Nogi, Commander of the Japanese Third Army, was sent reeling back with 15,000 casualties after his first headlong assault on the newly constructed, although archaically designed fortresses...a tragic surprise for the man who had easily taken the town from the Chinese in 1894. Five long months of trench fighting finally delivered the costly prize.

The capture of Port Arthur was of urgent need for the fulfillment of the Japanese "grand plan". First, it would deny an ice - free port to the Russian fleet. Second, it would keep lines of communication free between Japan and Manchuria. Third, a quick victory without excessive losses would give the Third Army to Marshal Oyama in the field to crush the Russian Army before it could build up to an overwhelming strength. All this had to be done before Japan ran out of soldiers, and, more important, money!

The Siege of Port Arthur was chosen as the topic of this game for two main reasons. First, it expressed a desire to see a game equipped with an in - depth prepared defense system in which one side is totally defensive and the other totally offensive. Second, the Russo-Japanese War was a sneak preview of things to come.

The American Civil War and the Crimean War have been billed as the dawn of modern warfare, but the Russo-Japanese War took this one step farther and showed the world the devastation accompanying such warfare. The use of heavy artillery, hand grenade, electrified fence, barbed wire, trenches and, a new twist, gas, was on display for the military leaders of Europe to observe, evaluate, and use nine years later in Flanders and along the Marne. The German observation team at Port Arthur recognized the benefit of heavy artillery and encouraged its development much to the dissatisfaction of the French Army in 1915.

Game comes in a zip-lock bag. Features killing zones for hand-to-hand combat, Russian naval gunfire and Japanese siege guns, counter-battery fire. The blue dots on the map are the objective hexes and features Fort Cha Kua Tzu.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: undefined
Hex: approximately .25 miles / 402 meters
Units: Company to Battalion

Game Inventory:
One 17 x 22" three color map
One single-side printed countersheet (255 1/2" counters - 60 of which are blank)
One 12-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2-3 hours

name: Pizza Box Football 2008 Expansion Game Booster
description:
How will you shut down New England's powerful passing? Penetrate Pittsburgh's stalwart defense? Slow Tennessee's running QB?

We've also included the original 3 additional expansion game play calls for the offense and the 3 additional play calls for the defense. Beware of the defense's blitz! Watch out for the screen pass!

Pizza Box Football's 2008 Expansion Game Booster contains 32 team cards, so you can play for your favorite. The teams have been updated for their strengths and weaknesses on offense and on defense.

For 2008 we've added team ratings for Special Teams returns (available as a free download from www.PizzaBoxFootball.com).

You can use these teams with your existing Pizza Box Football game whether or not you own the original Pizza Box Football Expansion Game. We offer updated teams every year!
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Talisman (Third Edition): Game Trade Magazine #37 Characters
description:
As part of an advertising feature for the reprinted version of Talisman (Third Edition) in 2003, Games Trade Magazine (a publication of Alliance Distributors) published two Characters for the game.

These Characters were the Vampire and Swordsman.

The cards featured miniatures taken from GW's tabletop game, Mordheim: City of the Damned.

The Vampire and Swordsman had previously been released in GW's house magazine, White Dwarf #186.

The Thief from White Dwarf #177 and the Dark Elf from White Dwarf #179 were due to printed in the next issue of Games Trade Magazine, but due to constraints of space this did not happen.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Maximum Tech
description:
From the back cover of the second printing:

"Rediscovered Star League technology gives the Inner Sphere a new edge on the battlefield! But new weapons require new tactics; now as never before, ingenuity counts more than tougher 'Mechs and bigger guns. Maximum Tech brings BattleTech players into this brave new world of warfare, where thinking on your feet can win the day.

Take your BattleTech games to the max with Maximum Tech, the ultimate expansion rulebook for BattleTech players. Maximum Tech is packed with dozens of new Level Three optional rules designed to expand and enhance game play, including new weapons and equipment for Inner Sphere and Clan forces; detailed rules for salvage, repair and customizing 'Mechs and vehicles; expanded rules for vehicles and infantry; double-blind rules; revised and expanded artiller rules; the Battle Value rating system for building balanced forces; and much more!"

Note: This expansion included material adapted from:

BattleTech: Tactical Handbook
BattleTech: Explorer Corps
MechWarrior Companion
Field Manual: Draconis Combine
Field Manual: Free Worlds League
BattleTech: The Periphery

Many of the rules from this expansion were made tournament leagl in BattleTech: Total Warfare.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Flames of War: Know Your Enemy – Late War
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Complete late war arsenals, warriors, Divisional and National rules for German, British, US, Soviet, Finnish, Hungarian, Polish, and Romanian forces with rules clarifications.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Cubist: Additional Installation Cards
description:
Eight extra installation cards to add to your Cubist experience. This mini expansion includes:

- two standard installation cards (worth 2 & 3 points each)
- six difficult installation cards (worth 4 & 5 points each)

name: Black Card Revoked
description:
A fun and nostalgia-filled game celebrating American black popular culture. It's bound to invoke hilarious debates among young and old alike. Don't get your black card revoked!

Plays up to 6 people
Includes 81 question cards
24 response cards.
Safe for family play (Yes, you can play with grandma!)

One player reads a question with multiple choice questions, A-D. The others put down a card indicating the choice they believe is correct. Players start with 10 points and lose a point for every incorrect answer.

Expansions: Jollof and Fufu, Our First Family, Old School, Old School 2, Girls Night Out, Saved & Sanctified (purple), Saved & Sanctified II (orange), Black History, Petty, Still Petty, Extra player response cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Chamber of Wonders: Fair of Wonders
description:
This expansion does NOT simply add extra materials to play with more people, but it adds 3 new game mechanics, required to play with 5-6 friends, but they can also be used in standard games with less players on the table!!

All these new mechanics have been studied as separate modules, so you will be free to choose which one you will want to add in each of your games.

The first module involves interactive cards, they allow you to carry out special actions, such as reopen an already filled Showcase to replace its content or expand it (for example a strategy could be to put a Precious in a Showcase to immediately earn £ 5 and then replace it with a Wonder of higher value), or it will simply guarantee you the option of adding missing books to a collection already placed in a Display Cabinet.

Other cards serve to embellish your Showcase, providing more Fame points, some other let you hinder your opponents by sabotaging their Display Cabinets.

The second module involves ships for foreign exhibitions! These ships are randomly drawn at the beginning of the game. Each ship board guarantee 3 additional Showcases for each player, with a special score calculated on the number of spaces filled regardless of the content. But each board assigns an additional bonus to a single space based on a specific content, so you will need to decide carefully how to use your ship!.

The last module involves freight wagons! These wagons have 3 Showcases each, they are placed between the players. Each player can interact with the wagon to his right and left, by filling them with Wonders as he sees fit.

Each wagon is shared between the two adjacent players and, at the end of the game, it will give Fame points to both, so you will need to decide carefully if it's the case to use those spaces and which one to use!

Last but not least, the expansion contains 6 meeples, to provide enough agents for each player. As we all love beautiful meeples, we decided to add 2 new characters to have more variety, we will include these new characters also within the core game box! Extra coin and banknotes token will be included as well.

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Variable Player Powers

name: Hornet's Nest: Buying Time at Shiloh 6 April 1862
description: Hex and counter wargame using the Musket & Saber Quickplay system, to portray the battle of Shiloh in the American Civil War.

name: Bubble Stories Holidays
description:
Discover new worlds in Bubble Stories Holidays by exploring, card after card, all the places you can visit! Enjoy each place along the way, and discover what is hidden at the end of each three adventures.


Choose the different places you wish to explore.
Turn each card over one after another.
Successfully reach your goal!
publishers: Blue Orange (EU), Broadway Toys LTD, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, TWOPLUS Games

name: K.O. Corral: The Game of Aim and Fame
description:
The K.O. Corral has been overrun by legendary outlaws! As one of the frontier’s best bounty hunters its up to you to stop them. Be the first player to collect all the gold, gain all the fame and ride your trusty horse off into the sunset to win! Roll dice to gain bullets and populate the town with outlaws. Flick bullet dice at outlaws to try and knock them over and gain their rewards. As you ride off into the sunset, the dice launcher gets further back making your shots harder.

In K.O. Corral each player takes the role of one of the 4 Bounty Hunters. During each turn players will roll the black Outlaw dice, and choose which dice to keep and which to preroll. Outlaw dice can send outlaws or enemy bounty hunters into town, and give players ammo to fire at targets in the town. Once loaded up on ammo, players will take Gold Bullet Dice, place them into the dice launcher and flick them at the stand-up targets in town. Fire away! Successfully knocked down Outlaws will give that player rewards in gold and fame. Knock down an opponent, and you can steal some of their gold.

The first player to hit 10 gold, 10 fame, and move their trusty horse into the 10 space, wins the game!

–description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Dice, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Flicking, Race, Re-rolling and Locking, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Bid & Bluff
description:
Rarer 3M crackerbox game. In play, there is card dealing, bidding, card playing, and movement of the giant wood dice around the big fold-up vinyl board. Tricks are won, and the player advances his die around the board to the finish. "Keen Competition for 2 to 6 players." Board also features a "Do or Die Zone" where movement becomes more difficult.

Re-implemented by:

Canyon

name: Xi Cards
description:
A fantasy based CCG set in a chinese/medieval universe.

From the Xi Cards website:

"Set in the 'World of Xi', Xi cards lets you battle with four factions and two ancient powers to determine the fate of the planet."
The game uses "time" units as a resource which allows players to draw cards, play spells and save time for future turns.

Players win by reducing their opponents from 40 "life points" to 0.
Xi Cards has four card types, "units", "point spells", "lasting spells" and "statements".

The game is shown and explained as a two player game although the rules say that a multiplayer game is possible.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Trading

name: The Little Flower Shop: The Mini-Pack
description: A 4-card expansion pack for the Little Flower Shop. These cards are shuffled in with the game cards and can be drafted as normal. The 4 cards are all the same. When drafted, they give the power to draw a random card. Thus, if a player is faced with a hand of mediocre cards that has one of these cards, the player can choose the card and draw a random card instead.

name: Out Style
description:
The third in a trilogy series of sports titles by Medieval Lords, this is a crazy fast game of streetball. It is basically basketball but focused heavily on pure showmanship and individual skill display.

In Out Style, you win the game by scoring 2 Baskets. Alas, this is Streetball, not basketball. On the street, style is just as important as scoring, if not more. You can actually win without getting a Basket in, simply by achieving 42 Style points first - after which you would have won the heart of the audience which then proceeds to jeer your opponents off the court and you win in style.

Players will take turns taking on the Offensive and Defensive roles. The Offense player plays one card at a time, getting closer to the net with each successful play. The Defense player decides if he wishes to play a Defense card to steal the ball, and if so, which one from his hand. Even if Defense fails to snatch the ball, there is accumulating defensive pressure building up each time as the Offense player goes deeper into the arc until eventually the Offense gets overwhelmed by Defence. This is where the Offense can decide to pass the ball, which resets all cumulative defensive pressure back to zero. Then again, passing should not be something you do often since it gives the Defensive player Style points for pressuring you into passing!

When you get close enough, you play a Shoot card and hope your opponent does not block it.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: The Hydrologically-Challenged Haunted Hayride at Hank's Hen Hatchery
description:
Hank’s Hen Hatchery in known for the best fresh eggs in the county! But in the fall, the thing that Hank is known for is his haunted hayride. But this year…YOU ARE IN CHARGE of creating it! Of course, when you took the job, no one warned you about the upcoming monsoon season…

You will need to purchase and place various haunted hayride attractions on Hank’s property. Then you will draw the path for the tractor to pull guests around in the hopes of delightfully scaring them. Unfortunately, while you are planning your tractor route, the yearly monsoon hits, and you will need to contend with ever-growing flooded areas of the farm. Not only that, but you have to contend with Marcie’s Teenage Troublemakers on the night of the hayride, who love to egg the guests as they ride by.

Haunted Hayride is a roll-and-write where all you need is a few dice and pencil. In stage one, you are placing your attractions on the map. In stage two, you are drawing a path that you will take your guests on to visit those attractions while your property slowly floods.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Maze, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Identity Crisis
description: IDENTITY CRISIS! takes the well known Rizla game to a new audience and a new level. This identity discovery board game that will appeal to a wide range of people is informative, educational, miles of fun to play, and cleverly fills the gap between Trivial Pursuit and Cluedo.

name: Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Scarlet
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In the early decades of the 20th century, the U.S. Navy made plans to fight many potential enemies. Plan Red, the strategy for war with Britain, included sub-plans for conflict with British Dominions. War with Australia, code-named Plan Scarlet, would be a purely naval affair.

U.S. Navy Plan Scarlet is a 64-page book supplement to the Great War at Sea series, focusing on the battles that could have taken place in the Central Pacific.

There are 25 scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that could have taken place under various nations' war plans: Australian raiders threatening American supply lines, Japanese moves against Australian-held ports, a Japanese forward strategy, and much more. And of course the thorough background articles you've come to expect from our supplements.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Pacific Crossroads, Jutland, Cruiser Warfare, Black Waters and Sea of Troubles or U.S. Navy Plan Red to play most of the scenarios, and U.S. Navy Plan Gold and 1898 or Remember the Maine to enjoy them all.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Raid & Riposte
description:
The Battle for Tannenbruck, West Germany 1985

Raid and Riposte Second Edition is an area-combat system of the Cold War in 1985 turning hot. The Soviets have invaded West Germany, and the ferocious battle for the crucial city of Tannenbruck, West Germany. The battle depicts the Soviet defense by the Soviet 1st Paratroop Regiment in its attempt to hold off repeated assaults by Bundeswehr and U.S. Army forces.

Raid and Riposte Second Edition is a quick-playing game with easy-to-learn rules and low counter density. The second edition has been made into a stand-alone game (First Edition is still available in Line of Fire magazine issue 12. Raid and Riposte Second Edition has been updated to include a new map and counter design and updated game manual. This seven-turn game is played on a lush area movement map. Units represent companies, platoons, leaders, and ATGM and artillery batteries. The Soviets had the element of surprise, but NATO has plenty of armor and determination. Tannenbruck and its key river crossing are at stake. Infantry, tanks, helicopters, snipers, leaders and special-forces units are all involved. Here a unique look at a deadly “What-if” scenario, will the Soviets hold on until their reinforcements arrive or will the West Germans and Americans have the fortitude to retake the city?

Complexity: 5 out of 10

Solitaire: 7 out of 10

Ages: 12+

Players: 1-2

Time: 45-90 Minutes

name: Romolo o Remo? Hidden Terrain Expansion
description:
This expansion contains 3 special tiles and 6 silver resource cubes. They are: the Silver mine, the Swamp, and the Heremit Cottage. These tiles can be mixed with other Terrain Tiles to add more variability and fun to the game: the silver mine provides silver resources, the swamp hold Military Units and block farm feed, the Heremit Cottage contains a special character.

This expansion is in a limited edition available only for preorders and for the Essen Fair game launch.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Circle of Jerks
description:
Circle of Jerks is a fast-paced, sensational party game that requires players to compete while yelling the most-inappropriate sexual terms you can imagine!

Incredibly easy to learn! Each round lasts only 15-60 seconds.

Race your friends to identify the matching symbol between cards. You can only place a card if you shout out its ridiculous name out loud!

You can take Circle of Jerks anywhere! Play it at a bar, a pregame or a basic sorority social. Pull it out at a quiet coffee shop or during a boring lecture. Are you dreading going to that funeral for a great-uncle you've never met?

Bring life to the party with Circle of Jerks!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Cooperative Game, Memory, Take That

name: Murder Party Pocket: Deadly Sin
description:
Naples, 1932. One person was killed, and each of you is one of the 6 suspects. The case was entrusted to Commissioner Luigi Alfredo Ricciardi of the Royal Police Headquarters of Naples, supported as usual by the faithful sergeant Raffaele Maione. The murderer may be hiding among you, and it is up to you to help the Commissioner find out who is. Will you be able to do this before the time is over?

At the beginning of the game, each player will be assigned, through a Character card, the role of one of the suspects that they will have to play. All the Clues are contained in cards that will be revealed to you at three different moments in the game and each of you will have access to only some of these: some cards in the center of the table will be available to everyone, while others will be in hand and visible only by those who hold them.

Players will have to reflect, collaborate, share the information in their possession without compromising themselves too much, and try to understand what, beyond appearances, really happened.

When all the clues will be revealed the players together have to give the solution. Unfortunately among them, there could be also the murderer who will do anything to divert the investigation and get away clean.
Will they be able to discover the real culprit or will the murder remain unsolved? Or worse still, will they let an innocent be wrongfully accused?
Murder party pocket is a game of crime investigation, mixing a card game, a role-playing game, and an app that guides in the game and dictates the timing and methods of the investigation.

All the investigative cases are written by well-known crime writers. The first series of cases is the work of the famous Italian writer Maurizio De Giovanni, creator of the novels of Commissioner Ricciardi as well as I Bastardi di Pizzofalcone, translated into many languages and also became television series.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Albi, Cranio Creations, GaGa Games, Pixie Games, WoodCat

name: High Heavens: Valkyrie & Medusa Expansion
description:
Add variety to your games by bringing these new gods to the battle. Turn fallen gods into stone statues with Greek goddess Medusa, or escort fallen Norse gods back to field with the help of the Valkyrie. This expansion comes with two God Cards and two miniatures.

High Heavens: Valkyrie & Medusa includes:


Medusa Plastic figure (unpainted)
Valkyrie Plastic figure (unpainted)
2 god Cards
Rules
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: くだものがたり (Fruitale)
description:
In the flip-and-write game Fruitale, a.k.a. くだものがたり, the players, as fruit farm owners, grow tasty fruits and deliver them to market along with jam and honey to establish their farms.

First, two cards are flipped in the cultivation phase. Players can choose to either take the fruits shown, or take honey instead. This process continues until the full 12 weeks have been played.

In the harvest phase, players deliver their honey, sell their surplus fruits, and find out which fruits grew well enough to sell.

Finally, in the sales calculation phase, players add their scores. Whoever has sold the highest value of produce wins.

—user summary

name: SetBack
description:
SetBack is the Buildable Board Game of strategy and chance that never plays the same way twice.

Shuffle the cards. Build the board. Deal each player a hand. Put your tokens on START and get ready — you’ve never played a game quite like this one.

The goal of SetBack is simple: be the first player to cross the FINISH line. To get there, you follow the cards. Each turn you’ll play a Board Action (the mandatory action of the card your token sits on), a Hand Action (one or more available options from the cards in your hand), and a Draw Action (replenish your hand from the draw pile).

Some cards are straightforward; they tell you exactly what to do. But most cards have options. Do you use the card to help yourself? Or burn your opponents? Wait – is there a way to do both? Of such is SetBack strategy born.

SetBack combines the portability of a card game with the playability of a board game to give it a fast-paced style where strategy shifts on the fly and the whole game can turn on the play of each card. Using the same cards to build the board AND your hand simplifies mastery of basic game mechanics while also resulting in millions of possible board configurations and unlimited replayability.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Assault on Mt. Everest
description: A strategy/simulation game that involves all the basic elements of the first conquest of Everest by a British organized team of climbers in 1954. The object of the game is to reach as high on the mountain as possible within the time allowed (47 day long turns beginning on April 12, 1953 and ending on May 29th. You must have and use the correct equipment, choose the best team of climbers that you can, set up camps along the way and assault the summit at the proper time.
mechanics: Events, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Seize the Bean: 5-6 Player Expansion
description: This expansion includes two more dual-layer player boards (with unique artwork), an extra 6 Founder cards, 20 extra resources (resin milk cartons and sugar cubes), and 4 extra barista meeples.

name: Sky Towers
description:
Sky Towers is a family-friendly competitive card game for 2 to 4 players about building towers that add up to 21 with cards numbered from 1 to 10. Each card has an effect or placement restriction that will help you gain cards from other players, speed up construction, add to your neighbor's towers, peek at the deck, allow you to build any card, etc. In team mode, the effects are useful for exchanging cards between team members.

The only building restriction is that cards cannot go over 21 and you cannot build tower cards that match your neighbors' topmost card on their nearest towers to you. Nobody in your city wants to be a copycat.

Completed towers gain you points based on the number of kites on the card, with lower-value cards scoring more points. Completed towers and other actions may award you a bonus worth points at the end of the game. Cards in your hand and unfinished towers do not score.

Race to build the perfect city until the deck runs out, and enjoy building towers from around the world on top of other towers from around the world.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Math, Number, Print & Play

name: UNO Ultimate Marvel: Add-on Pack – Scarlet Witch
description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Scarlet Witch Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Scarlet Witch Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Scarlet Witch!

—description from the publisher

Scarlet Witch
Control Chaos Magic at the hands of the Scarlet Witch. What she lacks in card burning and skips she makes up with controlling what cards people play. Use her bast array of Reverse Cards to control the direction of the game. You might want to hold onto some reverses to recover burned cards.

Included in this add-on pack:

One Uno Ultimate Scarlet Witch Deck
Character specific Wild Cards
Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
2 Chase Foil Cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Treasures & Traps: Random Encounters
description:
In the vast wilderness exotic travelers, mystic relics, legandary lands, and fabled heros have been found. Now, with Treasures and Traps: Random Encounters you can wield these forces and bring glory to your realm — but be quick or your opponent may seize these findings of good fortune first!

The Random Encounters expansion contains thirteen powerful cards introducing a new class, two custom dice for use with the cards, a set of rules explaining how to use them, and a large box to hold the T&T base game and all existing expansions.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Times Square
description:
The Zombies are multiplying…

Team up, battle Zombies, and save Heroes in this times tables game designed to help children (and adults) learn their 12 Times Tables in a fun and engaging way.

Times Square involves lots of multiplication and squaring, but players can also add, subtract and divide dice in any way they can think of.

Shuffle and deal out Zombie cards onto a flat surface (no board required). Players then take turns to roll the four Battle Dice, working together to find the best dice combinations to exactly reach one or more Zombie’s strength to defeat it. For each unused dice more Zombies appear! Defeat all the Zombies in play to win.

Times Square is designed to be flexible with multiple ways to play and rules that can be changed to suit the way you want to play.

Team up with City of Zombies

The cards that you get in Times Square can also be used to expand the City of Zombies board game.

name: India (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description: A print-and-play map for Age of Steam, designed by Claude Parenteau and made available for free on his website.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation

name: Glaisher
description: In the two-player game Glaisher, players separate and move their stacks in order to connect the opposite sides of the board. The mechanisms for separation and movement of stacks are dictated by integer partitions with distinct parts, i.e., splitting numbers into sets of different smaller numbers. Players might recognize this mechanism from Kakuro puzzles. The game is therefore named after mathematician James Glaisher, who devised a theorem about integer partitions.

name: Thera
description:
In 1646 BC, the island of Thera (present day Santorini) was the site of a volcanic eruption one hundred times more powerful than Pompeii. This eruption coincided with the decline of the Minoan civilization and the rise of the Mycenaean civilization. Due to Thera's strategic location, the Mycanaean wanax (king) has decided that it is time to rebuild Thera and has tasked you, one of his koreters (governors) with this responsibility. The koreter who best rebuilds Thera to its prior glory will be victorious.

In the role-selection and resource-management game Thera, each player has a map of the island where they will engage in trade, clear ash, generate resources, move those resources to building sites across the island, and construct economic and luxury buildings. On a player's turn, they select one of five roles from the rondel. Every player can benefit from this role, and the one who chose it gets benefits that scale with the amount of favor on the role. Favor accumulates on roles over the course of the game and is redistributed every time a role is chosen. Here's an overview of the five roles:


The Priestess prays for rain, bringing the life-giving resource to the island.
The Worker consumes that water and produces resources.
The Planner moves those resources around Thera so that they can be used for construction or trade.
The Builder uses those resources to construct buildings on undeveloped sites across the island.
The Trader buys and sells resources at the port.


Players earn points by constructing buildings. You must get the needed resources to the desired building site, then acquire the building plans (which are available to all from a common building tableau). Should you build another quarry (a resource-generating building), or are you worried one of your competitors will take that temple (a luxury building) that aligns with your strategy? Time is of the essence in Thera, so efficient planning and resource management are important in winning the day.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Rondel, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Hurricane: The Game of the Tropics
description:
2-4 players brave the storm as they buy and sell exotic resorts in hurricane prone areas. They must buy insurance and take advantage of opportunities to prepare their resorts, or face the imminent threat of the hurricane! There are many different hurricane tracks based on real historical data, which are written on hurricane program cards that are moved through a sleeve. The players never know where the hurricane will move next. There is also an advanced play option, where players cruise their yachts through the inner game board from one resort to the next, while trying to avoid the inevitable hurricanes. But players must also beware of another threat... The Bermuda Triangle! The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner, and therefore the best prepared player.

The game was designed and produced by Stan Strickland, a retired science teacher and meteorologist who now owns Outer Limit Games. Visit the website for more information - http://www.outerlimitgames.com
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Middleman
description:
A paper and pencil game where players take the part of traders dealing in tins of some worthy commodity, say tuna. Each starts with a fixed sum of money and then buys and sells tins of the product with the object of ending the game with more money than his or her competitors.
Published in the book "Games with pencil and paper".

name: Man of War
description: Man of War is a tactical study of the height of the Age of Sail. The game uses 4 minute turns and 250 yard hexes. Counters representing individual ships cover the forces of England, France, Holland, Spain, and the United States. The game system accurately depicts fleet level actions in a playable manner. Command, combat, maneuvers, sailing qualities, and crew training are covered in easy but realistic rules. Movement is sequential and impulsed, thus requiring no record keeping. The scenarios cover the highlight actions of the period: Ushant, The Glorious 1st of June, Cape St. Vincent, Camperdown, Trafalgar, and more.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Bias, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Cowgirls
description: A trivia-oriented game targeted at teen-age and young women (guessing ages 16-25 or so) with a western theme. You roll and move your plastic horses that are used by the players as markers, then answer questions on the cards regarding different categories of question: Sex and Body, Experience and History, Family and Friends, Spirit, Shadow, and Taste. Also, there is a small bag full of metal charms: boots, guns, long horn steer, saddles and spurs used as markers.
categories: American West, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: GobCon
description: You're leaving for GobCon, the Goblin Convention, with money, food, drink, games and more. This will be your chance to draw attention, and maybe you'll become a proud member of The Goblin's Lair! Participate in games, buy noticeable items, play tricks on your opponents and use your friendship with members of the Lair to gain Goblin Points... At the end, the player with the most Goblin Points will be the only winner.

name: Shahmot
description:
Shahmot is a chess-variant. It uses the same moves and pieces as does standard chess, it differs in the configuration of the board, and the pieces on it.
The Shahmot board is diamond shaped with a standard chess board in the middle. A triangular corner space (switches black o white), creates many new checkmate possibilities.

The package contains three games (and many variations).
1) Shahmot (2 players) using 10 pawns, 2 knights, 2 bishops, 2 rooks, 2 queens and a king.
2) Alliance a (2,3 or 4 players) team game
3) Feudalism 4 player game

name: Missing Link
description:
Ages 12 and up
No. of Players: 2 teams
Game Concept: Every list is missing something. Uncover the Missing Link and you're on your way to winning the game. Two teams compete to see who can find the most Missing Links. If a team answers correctly before time runs out they collect links to a chain. The team that answers the most questions correctly (and has the longest chain) by the end of the game wins.

Special Features:

Over 590 questions from a variety of topics including music, literature, geography, sports, movies, television, history and more.
Time limit makes even easy questions more challenging
Fun score-keeping device with the links

name: Fleet Admiral
description:
Fleet Admiral is a tactical naval game simulating the battles that were fought in WWI and that era. It includes portions of German, Russian, British, French, Turkish, Austro-Hungarian, Japanese, Spanish, Dutch, Italian, and US navies.

The system is similar to Tsushima published in Strategy & Tactics magazine (#130) although Fleet Admiral predates Tsushima. It includes 22 sheets of ship logs and 15 scenarios. The logs include ships not in the scenarios.

Fleet Admiral is an early example of DTP. Only 135 copies were made. It was laser printed with cardstock countersheets.

name: Elcanto
description: In this game, players have a set of U-shaped pieces that they are trying to maneuver into a line of 5 in a row (each having a flat side on top). Once the pieces are placed on the board, they can be rolled along the board along the U-shaped spine. Another intriguing abstract from the master.

name: Shenandoah: Valley of Fire
description:
Division-Brigade level. Both 1862 and 1864 campaigns. System uses rosters to allow for fog-of-war and leader ratings to show varying levels of command skill.

Can be mated with Lee Invades the North from Counter Attack Magazine 2.

200 counters, 22 x 34 map, 16 pages of rules, charts

name: Astérix en Egypte
description:
Astérix en Égypte is a racing game set in the world of Asterix, the tenacious "Gaulois" with a habit of beating up Romans and Pirates.

Players must race across the grid-based board from the Gallic Village to Cleopatra's Palace, deposit their Palace card, and then return to the Village. The first player to return is the winner. The board is divided into two halves, one sea and one desert.

Movement is card based, and each card has two possible uses. Pirate cards can be used to move the indicated number of spaces on either half of the board, or they can be used to place a Pirate Sword across any three squares of the sea half. Roman cards can be used to move on either half of the board or to place a Roman pilum (spear) on the desert half of the board and Magic potion cards can be used to move the player pawn or to remove any one sword or pilum.

The board has many choke points that can be blocked by swords or spears, though it is forbidden to totally block access to Cleopatra's palace or the Gallic Village.

Players may also gain Papyrus cards by passing over certain spaces on the board, and these cards generally allow the player to move one of the opposing players up to three spaces in any direction.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Maze, Racing
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Munro Tabletop Hockey Game
description: In December 1932, during the great depression, Don Munro had no money to buy his children Christmas gifts. Instead Munro went into his basement and transformed his wife`s ironing board into a hockey game. This game is a variation of a modern table-top hockey game. Made by Munro Games Ltd. of Toronto, Canada. It uses spring action players and a pinball type release for puck (which is a small ball bearing). 36" long x 14" wide x 5" high at the center. Nets were made of cotton. The players were represented using a wood top and a wire for the hockey stick. The playing surface is made of veneer, sideboards were made of Masonite. A true collectible for fans of dexterity sports games.

name: Nobunaga: A Dangerous Time
description:
This is a Japanese wargame of the campaigns of Oda Nobunaga in Central Honshu.

A very well regarded game, it is considered one of the best if not the best games that Mr. Tetsuya Nakamura has ever designed.
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Bonnie Blue
description:
Between 1861 and 1865 the American Civil War was fought. A bloody war in which over 600.000 soldiers lost their lives.

In Bonnie Blue it's your decisions that will tell if the soldiers in your squad will die or live.

Bonnie Blue is a miniature game where 2-6 players control 4-10 soldiers each.

Expanded by:


Bonnie Blue vid fronten
Bonnie Blue och Indianerna

name: Beat to Quarters
description: Miniature naval rules for the Age of Sail, 1775-1815. Includes die-cut 1/1200 ship counters, compass, turning and wind direction gauges, charts and battle logs. The rules include a detailed tactical ship-to-ship combat system and a simpler Fleet Engagement combat system. Ship statistics are included for America, Denmark, England, France, Russia and Spain - over 20 nationalities for the period.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Bias, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Impulse Movement, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Game of Dragnet
description:
The object of the game is to collect three Police File cards which solve a crime by indicating the crime, location and evidence. The number in the lower right hand corner of each card are added to indicate which of the seven pawns the player must find and bring back to Headquarters to win the game.

The game is based on the Dragnet television series. Jack Webb, star and producer of the series, is pictured on the box.
categories: Deduction, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: ¡No Pasaran!: La Quinta del Biberon – Balaguer 1938
description:
Alea Magazine issue 27, along with Gamonal 1808.

Another scenario for Ludopress' ¡No Pasaran!: Las Batallas por Madrid 1936-37 system on the Spanish Civil War.
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Murder à la carte: Chinese Takeout
description:
"The scene is a San Francisco townhouse filled with mementoes of Emily Boggs' days in China. The past has become present in the person of Anita Mumm. A long lost daughter? Or is she an impostor? Dinner turns deadly when Mrs Boggs' fortune cookie predicts no future.... for her."

The suspects :-

Chew Chow - Ms. Emily's cook and loyal servant for 25 years. His only humble request is to return to his homeland rich... and maybe at any cost.

Penny Sylan - A live-in nurse hired to care for Ms. Emily. Though she has a wonderful bedside manner, Penny has a history of losing her patients.

Axel Dent - Ms. Emily's chauffeur was driven crazy by her back seat driving. Did she push him to take the wrong turn on the road to life?

Lai Low - A young traditional Chinese maiden staying with Ms. Emily to learn western way. Lai has the face of innocence and purity but a heart filled with scorn.

Him Wong - A retired police detective from China who claims to have spent years searching for Ms. Emily's daughter. Has he accomplished the impossible or is he a master of illusion?

Anita Mumm - Ms. Emily's long-lost daughter... or is she? Anita bears a resemblance to the late Mr. Boggs, but is she really their missing heir or a clever con?

Contents:-

6 Invitations and envelopes to be sent to your guests
Character booklets for all 6 suspects, includes their roles and background information.
Cassette tape with an introduction, summary of events and the solution to the crime
Party planner booklet
6 secret clues
6 place cards

For six players Ages 12 and up.

name: PersonaliTease
description:
From the back of the box:

"This is a party game... not a board game.

You don't have to sit around a table in uncomfortable chairs so you can just sit back and relax.

You never have to answer uncomfortable questions so you won't end up in divorce court.

You don't have to know tons of trivia or how to spell or how to draw or how to act or how to do anything.

You never have to roll dice, move markers, count change, or jam annoying little plastic pieces together.

You simply need to hang out and have fun.

Want to show your friends how well you know them? Take out the PersonaliTease party game and have everyone guessing who answered questions like What do you enjoy doing, even though you know it's wrong? One player—the emcee—collects personality answers from the group, reads them out loud once or twice, and waits for everyone to guess which answer belongs to which player. There's plenty of bluffing and second-guessing involved here, and (fortunately) little opportunity for hard feelings to develop, as can sometime be the case with other games of this kind. The game can go as quickly as you like, or linger for a long evening of discovery if you want to really explore the mysteries of your friends' minds. What kind of vegetable does the person on your left remind you of? Wild personalities questions... with even wilder answers!"

name: Speculation
description: Stock market game in which players try to grow an initial nest egg into a fortune. Each player begins with the same amount of money to invest in companies from 8 different economic sectors - utilities, insurance, banks, automobiles, manufacturing, oil, airlines, and electronics. Players take turns buying companies one at a time until no one can or wishes to buy any more. This is the only opportunity players have to invest their money. After all buying has ended, players take turns rolling dice and moving around a board. Upon landing on a space a player executes the action listed there. These include capital gains and losses, in which the player gains or loses money if he owns a company in the sector listed in the space. The more you paid for a company at the beginning of the game, you more you gain or lose when landing on these spaces. Some spaces result in the player drawing a random event "Broker" card; others pay dividends or direct the player to advance or retreat several spaces. The game ends when all players have made a single circuit of the board and land on the final space with an exact roll of the dice. The player with the most money at that time wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Las Dunas 1658
description:
Game found in Alea Magazine #25. Uses Thirty Year War Quad rules to simulate the battles of Las Dunas (Spanish Tercios against a Franco-English army).

Expands

Thirty Years War
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Card Football
description:
This is a game that uses a regular deck of cards to simulate offensive play-calling in (American) football. Combinations of colors, suits and pips determine the amount of yardage gained, or lost, when they are drawn from the deck. (For instance, clubs often indicate a botched offensive play.)

Players must choose whether to call a running, passing or kicking play before drawing the cards and this choice effects how the cards are interpreted.

Card Football was published in the book Card Games Around the World.

name: Legemax
description:
One of Wolfgang Kramer's first published games - completely un-themed. He goes uncredited here - the mechanisms - connecting targets on the board with plastic sticks, the targets are determined by drawing cards - were reused in some of his later games (Spuren im Busch, Expedition, Auf Achse/Convoy).

Re-implemented by:

Schatzsucher

name: Ultima
description: ULTIMA is the lone non-card game included in Robert Abbott's excellent book "Abbott's New Card Games". It uses a chessboard & chess pieces, and is one of the more aberrant chess variants.

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module C5 – The Magellanic Cloud
description:
This module formally introduces the Lesser Magellanic Cloud as a new setting for the Star Fleet Battles game system.

It includes a look at the history of the LMC through to the immediate aftermath of Operation Unity in Y202, a basic hex map of the LMC (which does not include the kind of planet and province data shown for the Alpha Octant in Federation and Empire), a series of rules governing the operation of numerous unique weapons and support systems found in this island galaxy, and backgound material and playtest ships for three major and two minor Magellanic factions: the Baduvai Imperium, the Eneen Protectorates, and the Maghadim Hives (collectively known as the Magellanic Powers, or the Triple Pact in the wake of the Andromedan invasion), plus the Uthiki Harmony, and the Jumokian Resistance/Pirates.

ADB have have listed an updated errata file covering all five currently-available playtest empires.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Senterej
description: Senterej is the form of chess played in and around Ethiopia. It is sometimes simply called Ethiopian chess. As in international chess, Senterej is played on an 8x8 (but non-checkered) board, and each player has an army of 16 pieces: 8 Medeq (pawns), 1 Nagus (king), 1 Fers (counselor), 2 Saba (elephants), 2 Ferese (horses), and 2 Der (castles). Except for the Fers and Saba, all pieces move and capture as in international chess. The Fers moves one square diagonally; the Saba jumps two squares diagonally. In addition, pawns do not make initial two-square moves, castling is permitted only on the right side, and promotion is limited to previously captured pieces. Ethiopian chess has a unique Ta'biyat (mobilization) phase, in which players simultaneously make moves at high speed until the first capture. After the first capture, the mobilization phase ends, and players begin to move alternately.

name: Chain Reaction 2.0: Fully Loaded
description:
ZOMBIES, AND GANGSTERS, AND MORE, OH MY!

"World War II, "Bug Hunts", Colonial Wars, Vietnam, "B" movies, and Al Capone. What do all these things have in common? Heavy firepower." With these words Chain Reaction burst onto the scene. Now two years later we've taken it even farther. It's a whole new ball game as Chain Reaction 2.0 Fully Loaded delivers unparalleled realism.

Now you have detailed rules for vehicles from motorcycles to heavy tanks. New weapon systems have been added as well as rules for incorporating aircraft into your games. Where once ten figures could be used now thirty or more can easily be played.

The campaign system has been enlarged to include character advancement and the addition of Skills to personalize your force. Chain Reaction 2.0 can be played solo or with others and as always WITH ANY FIGURES YOU ALREADY HAVE! So pull out those favorite figures, get ready to have some fun, and ... JUST PLAY THE GAME!
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War II

name: Dilbert C.E.O.
description:
The game board represents a company once ruled by an evil C.E.O. He is now dead and his job has yet to be filled. Those who reach the top will receive great power and wealth.

You are one of the employees who seek this position. You will meet difficult tasks, make friends and collect stuff on your way. It does not matter how good you get at your job, as it will all be in vain if you are not the first to replace the C.E.O.

This game is a clone of the Games Workshop game Talisman, set in the Dilbert universe.

The designer thanks Bob Harris for creating Talisman for all of us to enjoy.

The designer thanks Scott Adams for creating the Dilbert universe we all love to read.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Exploration, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hannibal and the Punic Wars
description:
From the publisher:
Hannibal Barca was the most famous general of his age. At the Start of the 2nd Punic War, against all odds, he marched his army over two mountain ranges and took on the Roman Republic; the mightiest empire of the ancient world. He won famous victory after famous victory and campaigned in his enemies homeland for 15 years. Not for half a millennia would Rome be challenged by an external threat of the same magnitude.

This source book contains a complete historical overview of the period taking in the three wars that Rome fought with the North African City state of Carthage (264 BC to 148 BC) with a description of the forces involved.

Featured with in this book are detailed army lists for all the key protagonists:


Punic Army (Wars 1-3)
Republican Roman Army
Spanish
Numidians
Early Gauls
Ligurians


Also included are maps and diagrams of key engagements such as Cannae, Lake Trasimene, and Zama the last battle of the 2nd Punic war.

The 112-page sourcebook also contains pages of color photographs depicting the armies of this period.

Expands

Warhammer Ancient Battles
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Taliesin Master Game
description:
The advanced version of Taliesin Starter Game, Taliesin Master Game is played on 3 circular boards, one on top of the other. There are nine different types of player piece, in gold or silver, each with unique movement. The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Life Force piece.

The core of the 3 boards is a "black hole" and this is the means of transferring pieces between boards.

name: Nimmar
description:
Nimmar is a 2-4 player 'chess like' abstract strategy game produced in limited edition (500 copies) and played on a multi level 11 x 11 square checkerboard. The outside rows are level one, with levels increasing to the center of the board (6 levels in all)

Players use 5 types of pieces: President, Senator, Temple, Duke and Admiral. Each type has a different movement characteristic either on level or up/down level.

From the publisher:

Nimmar is an intriguing and challenging game for the strategy minded individual. The rules are simple and easy to learn, but in order to achieve victory, the complexity of the piece positioning must be mastered. One must be adept in positioning his/her own pieces, as well as being aware of the positions and possible positioning of your partner's and opponents playing pieces.
